review_body: The Box In Times Square - Stay anywhere but here. Its SMALLER THAN SMALL... Can't even take a bath in the tub, its SMALL... Its old, dingy, dusty, run down, definitely has an old timey smell and all that in the carpet, walls and curtains.

Although the room being small and coffee space is limited, they do not charge the resort fee which helps a lot in a trip to the United States and is a block from the Times Square. We loved our stay and we will come back for sure.

On check in we were informed that their elevator did not extend past the 6th floor. Our room was on the 7th, after explaining to the clerk that health conditions could be exasperated(artificial knees, cardiac bypass and stents, hypertension) management would not change our room. Additionally, the next day, the elevator was out of order, as was the ice machine for our entire stay. Sofa bed was broken, thermostat set on 80 degrees brought the room temperature to 60. The emergency door outside of our room was broken, no alarm, and left open, frigid air blowing 24/7, a legal issue as well. Electrical cords abound, a serious safety issue. We left a message for the manager, no one EVER returned our call. We informed the desk clerk on 4 different occasions regarding our concerns, nothing was addressed.

The Econolodge in Time Square was clean , but definitely small. It was perfect for an overnight stay, when all you were looking for was a clean & safe place to sleep. It was a good value and very close to time square & the theater district.

Tiny and they could use some updating of bed materials but overall pleasant to stay at and very central to time square activities. Service was great but they need to make it more clear about their debt card policy that holds an amount equal to the total amount of stay.

This is the perfect place to stay in New York City. This was my second time visiting and I was just as happy with it both times. they are friendly clean and they always have cookies and coffie in the lobby. the rooms are quaint and comfortable. the location is ideal for everything you want to see and the price was just unbeatable.

My granddaughter and I gasped when we opened the door to the room. I wish I could post a photo. It was so tiny we had to move the desk chair in front of the door to get to the bed. There wasn’t room at the foot of the bed to walk around to the other side so she had to crawl over me. Thin walls made the complimentary ear plugs necessary. A creepy looking old man seemed to be living in the lobby, as he was sleeping in a chair every night when we returned to the hotel and still there when we came down for continental breakfast in the mornings. On the plus side, the location is walking distance to the Gershwin Theatre and others, as well as good places to eat. Also, housekeeping and maintenance responded quickly and were very nice.

This hotel is ideal for a very short stay. We booked in here to get some sleep for a few hours after a long bus trip from Niagara Falls before heading out to another day of sight seeing. Room is tiny but was adequate for our purposes. The free breakfast was good. Very good location in the city.

We just returned from a trip to the city. We stayed 3 nights and to be honest no real complaints. Perfect location, clean rooms, breakfast, helpful staff, and within the hotel it was very quiet. Yes the rooms are small, but for just my mother and I it was fine and we didn't spend time there other than to sleep...we were there to explore the city! Walking distance to many places yet just around the corner from 7th Ave on a side street. The only complaint I would have would be that the room was quite warm and no way to regulate the temperature. We were on the 6th floor. Do your research ...for the price and location you really can't beat it! I definitely plan to stay again on our next trip to the big apple!

It was gross. The service was slow and curt, the rooms were tiny and outdated, with stains, rust, and worn furniture. The bed was hard and there was hair on the “fresh” linens. You’re better off buying a $5 breakfast at Dunkin down the road. Literally, the ONLY thing going for it is the location, but it’s not worth it. I will not be back.

The employees were great. Housekeeping were very accommodation and nice. The hotel couldn't have been in a better location. The rooms with two bed were way to small. Did not leave any walking room not room for luggage.

For the price...it’s great. Little loud Saturday....it’s New York. Staff was very attentive. Great location. Small, functional rooms. If you want a basic place to stay...this is it. 5 stars because it fulfilled its description

Econolodge Times Square is situated at the heart of NY's theatre district and is the perfect place to stay for just about everything.Rooms are small to say the least, but if you are friends you can move around without too much hassle.Breakfast and all day free coffee is included, which is good, go down to reception load up your tray and enjoy breakfast in bed.They will let you leave cases etc. behind reception if you arrive early or have a late flight.One word of warning - it's by a very noisy 8th Avenue. But - they supply earplugs!Best value in New York, after all, who wants to sit in their room when the Big Apple beckons?

Shame on you Econolodge Times Square! There are plenty of honest ways to make money, deceiving tourists isn’t one of them! When I booked I paid USD 19 extra per night to have a queen bed instead of a regular double bed. According to American standards a queen bed is at least 60" width. I received a bed that was narrower than 60" width, so it wasn’t a queen bed, it was a regular double bed. I spoke with the front desk about this issue and they told me that “for them” and “in Times Square” that narrow bed is a queen bed. A queen bed is 60" width and that is a fact. It doesn’t change between one city and the other. I contacted Hotwire (Expedia) to ask for a refund of the amount paid for a bed that wasn’t provided by the Econolodge and they told me that to give me the refund they needed the approval of the hotel. Hotwire and I tried to contact BIBI HANIFF, the hotel manager but all we got was a voicemail message and no reply to our emails. After trying several times, DEVENDA NARINE picked up the phone and told Expedia not to give me the refund.

Nice hotel, clean, friendly, affordable, and always free coffee :). Cozy room, and comfy bed! Best part though was the proximity to Times Square! Maybe a two min walk! Fantastic! Right in the heart of all the activity!

Can’t beat the location. Breakfast was ok. Room is very, very small. If you arrive early, they will stored Two bags before the 3:00 pm check-in. We had paid for an additional person in our room, but Charged us 5.00 to store the extra bag. “Nickel and diming” in my opinion.

Location was perfect for us. It was a fairly clean room with all you need but small. Small breakfast area with limited options or room to sit, but good enough to start the day with something. It was my young daughter and me and we walk about 20K a day and took the subway(5min walk to nearest) to most sites. I didn't want to spend money on hotel because it was just to have a place that was close to everything.

This hotel was so disappointing that we checked out 20 minutes after we checked in. I am wondering if prior reviewers stayed in a different type of room. It started off bad when, after many hours of travelling, we showed up to store our luggage. We were unable to even get in the front door because breakfast is served in the very tiny lobby. Also when we asked to use the restroom we were told there isn't one in the lobby and the clerk had no suggestions for me. So after you have traveled for hours there is no way to use the restroom, change or freshen up. We came back at check in time and were directed to our room. I was prepared for the size but not the condition of the room. Very dark and dated. No chair to relax on and no closet to hang our clothes. The carpet was in such bad condition and was so stained it was alarming. There were holes/ripped wallpaper on the wall. The window looked like it had never been cleaned and you could not see out of it. I walked in and turned around. There was no way I could stay in that room. I looked on TripAdvisor and found another hotel within 1 block that was much better for less cost. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you

Just got back from another wonderful stay at the Econo Lodge. This is my sixth time staying here. I usually stay using my Choice Privileges points or a combination of points and cash. This hotel really works to make you feel like a valued customer and I look forward to returning.

If you’re wanting a low budget hotel but with great location then you can’t fault this place really. It’s approx 5 mins walk (max) to the centre of Times Square and with that means it’s noisy at night (although the hotel provides ear buds which are useful). Breakfast is included in the morning which is average...bread and toaster, selection of pastries, boiled eggs and juices. They also provide 24hr tea and coffee and cookies late afternoon/early evening The rooms themselves are small! And the bed is pretty small too...maybe just a bit smaller than an average English size double bed?! Bathroom again was small but clean! Excellent service of leaving luggage for an early arrival before check in and after check out time and the wi-fi access / speed is very good! I only stayed 1 night, would most probably stay again if I just wanted somewhere cheap to sleep with a great location!

We had had a cancellation with the property we had to spend the night at 1am and we desperately needed a hotel. It was bank holiday and NY was full. All hotels were sold out and the ones which offered a room cost from $1000 to $2000. After time searching in Times Square we found a room for two in Econo Lodge. We were three but they let us stay in the room for $380, which at the moment sound very cheap!!! They were fantastic!!

This hotel is in a good location and serves a continental breakfast. The room we had was extremely small. So small in fact that there was less than a foot to walk to the other side of the bed. The good thing is since it is NYC, you don't spend a lot of time in hotel room. It was clean. We used points to get a fairly steep discount on the room. If I had to pay full price for the room, I would have been extremely disappointed. The staff was friendly and I did like that you could leave your luggage at no charge before check in time. If I go back to NY I would probably not stay here again. The room was just waayyy to small for two people. There was hardly room to walk.

The best thing about this hotel is the location near Times Square. However, the facilities and service are bad. I stayed for two nights, and both nights I did not get much sleep. During the first night, the air conditioner was clacking all night and not getting cold, so I could not sleep. I complained about it in the morning, and the reception said they will attend to it in the afternoon. When I passed by early evening, the reception said the air conditioner was already repaired, so I went out to watch a show. When I got back around 3am, it turns out the air conditioner was NOT repaired, and it was STILL not getting cold. Even though I was already sleepy, I had to wait for an hour for it to defrost, before the maintenance could do a temporary fix. They said they cannot transfer me to another room, because they were fully booked. The manager was not in during the weekend, so I got her email address and I wrote her. But even up to now, I have not gotten any response.

About 12 inches between the queen bed and the wall. Not for two people with big suitcases. The shower has very very little pressure. Nice and friendly employees. Not your typical Choice Hotel free breakfast - very minimal. Overlooking 8th avenue so quite noisy. Overall, just for the budget conscious.

A good hotel, with great service and helpful and kindness staff. The Breakfast was good and taste well, but they should need to get more tables and chairs at the breakfast. The room was small but just fine. clean and fresh.

*The room is very very small.*The room has bad smell.*Towels have a bad smell and are worn out because they are old.*The blankets are old and worn and some are torn.*The windows are not soundproofed*Breakfast is not as expected, only (boiled eggs, toast, jam, cheese, cereal, small cupcake)*The breakfast place next to the reception and it is very narrow and there are only 4 tables.

In a city where you could easily spend at **least** $200 a night on just a room then find yourself paying extra for Wi-Fi, breakfast and having a mini bar in your hotel room you daren't even open, what's not to like about this place? Answer is nothing!Seriously, you're one block from Times Square! The staff were excellant, our room was clean and tidy, free Wi-Fi and a free buffet breakfast each day. Breakfast is served in the small reception area every morning and consists of fresh fruit, cereals, cereal bars, bread for toast, bagels, juices and more. My tip would be to get there early.Honestly a fabulous stay and not one complaint from me...not ever for this price, in this city, in this location. Thanks to all staff for a great stay!

It's a nice hotel with their fresh decorations nice environment.. the front office member are so helpful..the food of this hotel was delicious.. this place are very much comfortable for meeting. I love this hotel and hopefully come back again.

Small, clean rooms Tight quarters but comfortable beds Pleasent helpful and cheerful staff Availability of luggage storage made it convient fir our early arrival Great location!! Close to great restaurants and theaters!Limited TV channels though. I'd appreciate more available channels

Ok, so this is a budget hotel, but it does have a lot of extras that would make me recommend it. There is a continental breakfast with bagels, bread, American muffins, breakfast bars, cereal & juice. There's fruit and coffee, both regular and decaff available in reception 24/7. There are cookies available too in the afternoon.Rooms are typically small for NYC, but do contain a safe. There are useful usb sockets both in the room and in reception and a tablet that can be used in reception too if needed.The WiFi is fine for average use but not good enough to stream with.Given the sterling to dollar exchange rate, having those extras available certainly helps.

Two good things: location and check in desk personal !Double charged in my card, and manager (“BIBI”) even answer my mailsNo water pressure in pipesNo room space even for walkingDin’t clean room two days before living
user_name:
YamiletSocasCorujo
New York City, New York

review_body: After staying at the hotel I gave them a great review but it’s been almost 2 weeks without getting my deposit back!! It’s been a run around from front desk to management!! Due to this I wouldn’t give them your card give cash

This hotel is not even worth the 1 star that I have given it. I have had an awful experience with this hotel. Yes it is in a great location but that is all it has going for it. The rooms are the most compact hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. It’s as if the room has been built around the dilapidated furniture - there is barely room to walk around the bed and my family and I booked a so called “deluxe” room on the top floor! We were only staying for 1 night and we didn’t expect luxury. I was changed $289 however £320 was taken from my credit card a full week prior to arrival. I didn’t mind this because we were going on a US road trip and I thought it was one less hotel to pay because it was prepaid before we arrived. BUT on checkin not only did they take an additional $100 from another of my credit cards (an incidental fee, supposedly), they charged me the full amount again for the room. So, a one night stay in NYC cost me £534. I queried this 2 days later with my credit card company to make sure the missing amount was pending against the Econolodge and they confirmed this was the case.We returned to NYC at the end of our 2 week holiday and needless to say, we didn’t stay in this hotel a second time but I did go back to query the double charge, to which I have yet to receive a satisfactory answer and the amount still hasn’t been put back onto my credit card - over 2 weeks after our stay!Take my advice and give this hotel a very wide berth. There are plenty of nice, clean, affordable hotels in NYC whose treatment of guests is far, far better. £534 for one night is definitely NOT acceptable - in fact we paid £600 for 3 nights in NYC at the end of our trip. We had a great time on our US road trip but having to deal with this hotel and the overcharge was a big annoyance as it meant I didn’t have the spending money I had hoped to spend on my kids. Econolodge NYC should be ashamed of themselves for their customer service.

We went to Paris, Rome, Geneva and Iceland and capped off the trip with a night in Times Square, I wanted a place close, and this was. I did the last minute deals and of all the options hoped for anything but Econolodge, but its what we got. I researched reviews once i has the location, while on a train in Geneva. I was worried, there was mention of bed bugs and unsanitary conditions. When we arrived, i was a little surprised by additional fees, taxes etc--it ended up being our most expensive per night stay, and we stayed in some incredible places. The staff was friendly and assured us no bed bugs, the room was clean, but dated, beds comfortable and a/c cold. We got a great nights sleep and were grateful for the close proximity to enjoy times square. Also, the staff let us keep bags behind front desk after checkout, which was priceless after dragging everythign through the streets of paris and subway in paris and NYC.

Room so, so small and not very clean. Carpet screwed to wall and hair in bath fell from ‘clean’ towel. Room was literally the size of the length of the bed, had to climb over bed to get to other side. No room for one suitcase let alone two. Asked if we could change to a better/larger room, none available. We couldn’t stay there, we had to change hotels. Cost us quite a lot more money but just had to go...

Like most hotels in Manhattan, the rooms are very small. The room and bathroom were older but clean. The street noise is very loud in the room. The hotel was nice enough to supply ear plugs to help decrease the noise while you sleep. The breakfast was convenient but does stop at 9AM during the week.

This is a very basic hotel but has everything you need. Pros: Fairly comfortable bedsClean rooms (but looking a little run down)Friendly staffFree breakfast (though very limited Choice)Free small bottles of waterIn the heart of the cityGrocery store very close by.Cons:No tea or coffee facilities in rooms.Can be noisy as fire station is nearby (Noise is an issue in all NYC hotels & they provide 2 sets of earplugs.In room TV couldn't get most channels.All in all, this is a budget hotel in the heart of one of the worlds most well known cities so the few cons are not a major issue unless you constantly need coffee. As a place to just crash after a busy day in the city you can't beat it for price and location. I'd stay again and have recommended this place to friends.

Priceworthy hotel with a central location colse to about everything in the city. Clean and functional room on the small side with the street life noticeable. Brekfastbuffe with a good selection. Helpful personnel to book shuttle bus to the Airport.

I was not happy that my credit card was pre-authorized a week before arrival. I understand hotels need to pre-authorized cards, but never heard a hotel do it a week in advance. Also every time I called hotel it was really hard to understand the front desk agent. The language barrier was very difficult. The rooms was super small. Also did not like that I was not honored my 2pm c/o being a Choice Member. The building was old, but worse was that it did not look clean. TV in room was mounted really high and off center of the bed.

We were in a bad spot when the Big Name Hotel gave away our room because they were over booked but Econo Lodge saved our trip. The staff was amazing and really helped us to be able to enjoy the rest of our trip. We will now be booking direct with them for next time. As a bonus we saw a company filming outside the hotel the next morning. The kids loved that. Thanks again for everything you all did.

Great trip with very good accommodations. Enjoyed the sites, ball games and dining experiences. Econo Lodge in Times Square was a prefect location with close proximity to play houses, subways, bars and dining.

They went above and beyond to help me even after I was checked out. I was worried about getting lost in my way to the bus station which was 25 minutes away on foot. The gentleman behind the desk called an uber and covered the cost for me. It was very hot and I had a heavy backpack so his kind gesture made my life so much easier. He made me feel important even though I had already checked out.

Great location. Close to all of the action. Had a wonderful time. The breakfast was great. Just hit the spot. Family enjoyed the conveniences of the location to Times Square. Will come again and stay here.

Small rooms. Continental breakfast stinks. Promised one thing and got the other. Only good thing was the location. Try hotel Edison I hear that’s much better. Lots of siren noise and homeless sleep right across the street

Our room was so so small but I did feel that it was clean. I stayed here 2 nights with my teenage granddaughter before we took a cruise. The Time Square location and price was the primary reason, I chose it. ($250/nt) Our room location was near the intersection and on the second floor. I didn't get much sleep with the horns honking and the police and fire engine sirens. (across the street from the fire dept) Second night, I found some earplugs that helped..Choice Hotels advertise "Lowest Price Guaranteed" but when I spoke to the front desk on Friday about the price I saw on the internet for our Thursday stay($169 plus tax), he said he didn't know anything and I should have taken a screen shot of it. The breakfast was minimal.

The title to our review pretty much sums it up. To expand on that - it's a nice smaller hotel. Clean room. Bed was comfy, pillows were not. The room rate was good. Location is great, close to everything in Times Square. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are very small but we didn't care about that since we were out all day and basically just needed the room to change clothes and sleep. However we didn't get any sleep. The street noise was intense all night long. I obviously expect to hear some street noise as we were in the middle of NYC. However our bed could have been in the middle of the road it was so noisy. You'd swear the windows were wide open but they were not. It was loud. When I made the reservation a couple of months ago I specifically asked for a room on one of the upper floors away from the intersection to minimize the noise. We were on a higher floor when we stayed there 5 years ago and the noise wasn't as bad. But despite my request we were put in a room on the 3rd floor close to the intersection and the noise was horrible. If we were staying for more than 2 nights I would have insisted on being moved to another room up higher. If you don't get a room on an upper floor you'll need ear plugs. The rates are good at this hotel but I'm not sure I will stay here again solely due to the noise which is unfortunate because I like the hotel otherwise.

This was my 5th time to the city. We checked in and they held our luggage. As we checked out at 7:30am we wanted our luggage to be held and they charged us for that, I could not find anywhere that their would be a charge. I find it poor customer service when their is no information about this. I have asked to speak to a manager and I have called Choice and no one has looked into this. If this man is charging he is making out good on a side business. I was not happy about this at all.

Was really in a good prime location near timesquare with warm staff and a decent breakfast that is all the good I can say.To start with we are travelling with 2 kids and booked for the same . When we checked in we are give a single bed at first and it is one of the smallest hotels I have seen and that too for the price , it is more like an extended closet difficult even for people to move around. The walls paper , bathroom and AC are all in a sad state .On a hot summer days/nights AC is not sufficient. Not what I expected for the price we are paying . Please be aware of the size of the room , state of the room before you book . Not the greatest of experiences of Newyork with family.RegardsSarath

The staff was very friendly and accommodating--well especially the nice ladies on the front end of our stay. I can't remember their names, but one was Columbian and the other Asian and they were super helpful when we needed an upgrade. However, I will say that throughout the stay the staff kept giving different price quotes for different things, but in the end it was a great location and staff. The gentleman who helped check us out at the end was a bit rude, but other than that, we loved it! Thanks so much!

Location, location, location. Perfect location on West 47th and 8th Avenue. The rooms are a bit small, but who stays in the hotel room in NYC? The staff is very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed our stay and their hospitality.

A block away from Times Square.Staff are helpful.A modest breakfast is included in the daily rate. Bagels, yoghurt, bread, hard boiled eggs apples and oranges.The room we had on the top floor level6 was small but it had a safe and the bathroom was adequate.Some street noise from emergency vehicles at night.

extremely small rooms, honestly have NEVER seen such a small room. Elevator, halls, lobby were very warm temps. NO bellboy, NO luggage carts to help get luggage from car to room, a young man did help us bring in luggage after asking about it however it is clearly not something normally done by the employees. Check in was somewhat difficult due to help speaking broken English. They do NOT park your vehicle nor have service on sight for it, you have to drive to a garage around the block to get your car parked. The rooms were clean. It is extremely noisy in room at night.

Awesome location. This place is not fancy, but is adequate. Breakfast is alright. Much less expensive than any other place in the area. Bed was comfy. Room very very small. A bit noisy. So close to everything. I would stay here again.

I am very disappointed with the Econolodge Time Square, in June 2019, my son and I were locked out of our room. The door key malfunctioned, the staff attempted to break the lock, with no success. The owner, who was on property never addressed me and the manager had a desk agent give me a generic card and I was asked to contact her! Early that day when we returned did get another room but I explained our inconvenience not having access to money, camera and chargers. I was upset from the inaction by the manager and owner and will never go back to that hotel. I would've never thought a Choice hotel brand would be so hands off when a guests are in distress. After 7pm, the houseman was able to enter the room and we were able to get our personal items. I was amazed to have lost a day from enjoying the city and still be charged my full rate or an apology from the manage.

This hotel offers a perfect economic location a couple blocks from time square. It is located on a quiet side street with everything within walking distance. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. We are so glad we were able to stay here and save money so we could enjoy NYC.

1. Told that I would be given a AAA rate if I presented my AAA card. Presented my card, didn't get rate.2. Never provided a copy of what they did charge me.3. Shower tub would not drain.4. Hairdryer was broken.5. Waited 45 minutes for a new hairdryer until had to go down to front desk to demand one that worked. 6. When I called the front desk from outside the hotel, they never picked up, I would wait on hold and then the called was dropped. Happened 2 days in a row.

I know you get what you pay for, and I realize this place has “econo” in the name, but it really was in bad shape. The good: excellent location, front desk staff was somewhat helpful and nice, they kept our bags behind the desk until check in, okay breakfast included, and sheets and towels were clean. The bad: the room was rusty, had peeling wallpaper, a window that wouldn’t shut completely (around window air conditioning unit), and the air conditioner did not work. It was on (cold) when we arrived, and froze up through the first night. We let the front desk person know, and when we got back to the room later that day, it was on again. It froze up again that night, we let them know, and it was never fixed or addressed again. We told the front desk, but our last three days were SO HOT. I think it is unacceptable to have a steamy hot hotel room in June and not even attempt to address this issue. We will not stay here again.

great location and price for NYC. Walking distance is good for surrounding areas. Close to places to eat for good prices and food. Room was a little small but you are there to sightsee and do things. Close to theaters and shopping. Also, I would like to mention the front desk staff that was super friendly, upon check-in Shiwangi recommended us a place for dinner as we wanted to eat ITALIAN FOOD and we tried Carmine's restaurant near Times Square that serves delicious food and would like to thank her for that. Would love to stay again!!!

If you can avoid staying here, PLEASE DO. The positive-1) Great location - just between bustling Times Square and Hell's Kitchen, where great restaurants abound on 9th avenue, a short walk away.Ok, now the bad - and there was lots of bad. We paid for a 'deluxe room' but:1) The room was so tiny we had to shimmy around the bed to get to the other side. More like a closet2) Peeling paint3) The 'flat screen tv' (cheap small flat screen on a swivel) got about 7 stations - all grainy. They said they would send someone up to fix it - that never happened.4) The toilet seat was not secured.5) The lampshade looked like it was punched in.6) The room was supposed to have a fridge. Did it? No.7) The dressers were old and dirty, and the bottom drawer of the tall dresser would not close (it kept rolling open about 6"). The dressers looked like Goodwill rejects.7) The tub did not drain at all when we went to shower in the morning. The manager came up with a plunger, no luck. I asked if we could shower in another (unoccupied) room since we had to leave soon, and he agreed, but unfortunately that tub (think 1970's style tubs, folks) had the same issue. We never did get to shower. :(8) The place was the type of place that just felt deep-down filthy. I am no primadonna, but I didn't even want to walk around in our room in my bare feet. It was that bad. It's sad, because the place has such potential due to it's location, if the owner(s) would just invest in some sorely needed upgrades.

Horrible decrepit. The room and hallways stink. Ceiling in bathroom was literally falling down. Ripped wallpaper and drapes were dirty and falling down. This was nothing like what was advertised. Never been so disgusted with an on line booking ever before. Beware and stay away from this rat hole.

We had a double room with a double bed. The room was so small that you had to climb over the bed to get to the other side. Shower and toilet were adequate. Reception staff were pleasant and helpful. There is an all you can eat continental breakfast, coffee and tea available all day. Well situated for eating places and close to theatres and Times SquareThey charge $5 to store more than 2 bags after check out.One comment I would make is that when I stay in an hotel I expect my room to be cleaned and the bed made on a daily basis without tipping those involved in the task. A printed note was left in the room suggesting I should leave a tip for the room staff. I can only assume that 1. Wages are low and customers are expected to make this up. 2. To get people to work to a high level tips are expected as an encouragement. I find this very strange in a country that holds itself up as a world leader.

The hotel is very good located. Times Square is just about 2 blocks from the hotel. The roomIs small but ok. The hit was on very high but I connect de AC and it was ok. The breakfast was very ok but they don’t have enough space. I recommend this place El hotel está muy bien ubicado, solo a dos cuadras de Times Square. La habitación es pequeña pero está ok, la calefacción estaba un poco alta que me llevo a prender el aire acondicionado. El desayuno estuvo bien aunque el lugar para desayunar es un poco limitado

This is a nice hotel near Times Square. It is not New and the roooms are small. But the location is great for theater going. We were only 1 block from the theater we saw a show at. And only 2 blocks from the TkTS booth

The Econo Lodge is certainly a budget hotel, but it is very clean, the staff is very friendly, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The location is terrific. Definitely a place to stay if you are looking for a no-frills inexpensive hotel. There is a lot of traffic noise at night, but I'm not sure if it was anything out of the ordinary for one block off of Times Square.
user_name:
Lorna B
Mount Pleasant, South Carolina

review_body: THE BEST LOCATION!!! One street from Time Square .. steps from a pharmacy, souvenir shop , tourist center and restaurants.Everything you need !All the hotel staff so friendly and the best attitude to help always . The breakfast is 100% good quality and variety .The only I didn't like is the room is very very small.Not even this... Is worth it the money you spend on your stay. I really recommend it 100000%

This is not a AAA facility but it is a great location and central to most everything. The rooms are very tiny but clean . There are the essentials such as a comfortable bed and bathroom. There is no place to sit in the room except a chair at the desk. The breakfast is coffee, tea, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs and bagels and muffins. There are cookies in the evening and the staff are very friendly. We stayed for 2 nights after a cruise. It is walking distance to the Cruiseport, subway and Times Square. Don’t expect royal treatment. Just the essentials and a clean room. Very noisy I might add. They supply earplugs in the room which are essential. For the price, this is a very nice place.

The hotel was a great deal, especially in New York City. It was clean, the staff was very welcoming. The rooms were a little small but then again we were in New York City and did not want to pay too much for a fancy hotel. We had a good time.

Tiny tiny rooms, if you are planning to stay here don't bring a lot of luggage cause you won't have any room for it. Our room was freezing cold, after complaining we got a space heater and they hanged a towel in the window to block the draft. Due to the small rooms our stay became some what cumbersome but on the other hand it is really cheap.

Great night sleep in fabulous location for cheap!! The staff couldn't be kinder or more welcoming and ready to help. The parking garage was super deal and very safely stored my Genesis car for 3 days (yet let me get items out still.) Yes: you will hear street noise and there is a fire station one block away (by bus where room light reflected off window when taking photo.) So we put earplugs in (provided by hotel.) But who stays in NYC to stay in hotel all day? (It eventually quiets down at night.) The location is one block from Times Square and steps from Theaters. Can't beat it for under $85/night.The breakfast had hard boiled eggs, bagels, cereal and fruit in plentiful supply (and they even left a few things out past deadline.) The only complaint is that our room was too warm but during freak cold spell of single digits outside, that's ok!

I gave one star because 0 stars isn’t an option. We booked this hotel for one night. A winter storm came and couldn’t make it for our reservation. We talked to the hotel and the manager refused to do anything. I would NEVER book this hotel. They don’t care about their customers and aren’t willing to work with the when emergencies happen. The front desk workers were very rude as well. It’s sad. We called corporate and they said they couldn’t help because this hotel is privately owned. Shame on the owner.Like

Toilet did not flush, heater did not work, no elevator or room key access to this room, gave my specific reserved and booked room to someone else, safe did not work, dead bolt did not work, difficulty for front PM front desk staff to communicate in or comprehend English, mold in room, not told about putting parking garage sticker on back of parking garage ticket in order to get discount to pay $30.00, was told hotel does not have an agreement with the parking garage, which was a lie

Decent price for the location. Coffee, tea and ice water are available 24/7 in the lobby.The breakfast includes a good orange juice, milk, cold cereals, muffins, donuts, bagels, bread for toasting, granola bars, oranges and apples, yogurt and hard boiled eggs. The eggs are cold but just ask and they will heat them for you in a microwave. Big fresh cookies are put out in the late afternoon. There is noise from outside but you are Street front, downtown New York. We slept just fine both nights we were there.The rooms are very small. It's a good place for a couple of nights but not a long stay. The main bus terminal is close by. A three block walk will take you to the hop on hop off city tour bus. Remember to book a restaurant for dinner or you will wait in very long lines.

Decided to try and save a few bucks, but the small amount of money I saved was not worth the poor quality of this hotel.My room had absolutely no heat in it, and the overnight temperature dropped, meaning it was very cold all night long. When I told the front desk that the heater in my room was not working (there was also no thermostat), they basically blew me off. If I had stayed for more than one night, I would have found another hotel. Additionally, the hotel is a bit down, the rooms are extremely cramped, and the noise from the street is almost unbearable. There are complimentary earplugs in the room, but that's small comfort.Needless to say, I will not be booking at this hotel again. Overpriced and extremely underwhelming.

Had a horrible experience this weekend. We couldn’t make it to NYC because we were snowed in. But the Econo Lodge didn’t seem to care. The concierge was very rude saying their policy is no refunds no matter what if you book third party. I understand they have a policy but the fact they didn’t seem to care or even apologize for our weekend being ruined was careless. They weren’t willing to bend the policy at all or even attempt to help by refunding me or even rescheduling our trip for another time. I even called Travelocity who attempted to call to cancel for us but to no avail. I asked to speak with a manager who wasn’t in because it was the weekend and the concierge said that even if they were there they wouldn’t help me. That was incredibly rude and couldn’t believe he said this, plus he kept interrupting me when I tried to speak. They clearly don’t care about their customers safety, given we feared for our lives traveling there. DON’T book here. Be careful with who you talk to at the desk too. I’ll be calling corporate to give a scathing review. Too bad it’s come to that. I would love to actually speak to a manager to help me but no one seems to ever be available. We lost nearly $200 due to this hotels horrible policy that apparently can’t even have exceptions? And to top it all off, the concierge was so rude.

The worst service I could have gotten. First of all not only was the lady at the desk incredibly rude but my card had gotten mischarged for over double the amount of my room price and while she canceled the transaction she did nothing to help accommodate for the fact that th money was still taken off of my card and I was shorted a little over 200 dollars and told me word for word “I’m not your bank” and I had to deal with it on my own. Also while I tried asking questions about the purchase I made on MY card she ignored me and continued talking to whomever. The whole situation of trying to reserve a room took over an hour because of this. She didn’t even apologize let alone make eye contact. The room was ridiculously tiny and there was a ton of hair left in the bathroom which was gross and I mean I knew we weren’t going to some 5 star hotel since It was a last minute decision but we were accomdated in any way especially for the whole situation when we arrived so I don’t think I’ll be going back.

send me to a 7-floor room elevator up to the six floor and stairs to 7th floor with luggage, the door was like forced to open, etc. felt unsafety, breakfast ok, good to sleep and save money, not for pleasure

Me and my friend spent our first time in New York in this place due to the fact it was close by Times Square. So just for the position. Since we’re travellers we have been in many hotels before but this time I got really impressed. Most of the employees of the front door weren’t saying Hi/Bye like in all the hotels we’ve been. Everytime I was going to them they looked they were pissed off and frustrated. I was quite scared to go and ask them something. Ok. We got on the check out day the chambermaid screaming check out at 12.00 and she keeps knocking on the door at 12.00: “check out at 12” and I was like “we are just using the toilet can we have 5more min” she keeps saying “check out at 12”. It looks like she was kicking us off. Come on! I know what hospitality means and this is not the case. Breakfast was good cause we didn’t have it cause we rathered going out for it cause the coffee wasn’t the best. In the room the temperature was so hot and we tried to switch it off but it didn’t so we tried to open the window to get fresh air but as soon as I did it we found out it that close by there was this Fireman Center so every 10/5 min so if you breath you’re not gonna fall asleep. Seriously to noisy. When we arrived there were no towels in the room to have a shower and we went downstairs to ask the guy he said I’m gonna bring it upstairs right now. 1h we went down and we grabbed the towels. I’m sorry that I can’t leave a nice review as I do everytime. And I think is my first bad review and I felt it. No, I’m not going back there.

The staff was nice and helpful, and the location can't get much better. BUT the rooms don't feel very clean (my room had peeling wallpaper behind the curtains). I stayed in the suite on the top floor, which apparently could only be accessed by staircase (I had to take the elevator to the 5th floor, then walk up to the 6th). And the suite was the only room on the floor (which had a broken window) - kind of a creepy vibe for a woman traveling alone.

I've traveled a little and have stayed at several 2 to 3 star hotels. This one isn't terrible but it has its pros and cons. CONS: First the noise. Although not as much an issue for me, my 64-year old mother wasn't thrilled about hearing the sirens (there is a fire station a block away) at all time of day and night. Second the room temperature. Since it is winter, the hotel handles the heat centrally which is a nightmare as the only way to make the room somewhat bearable is to turn on the window AC which goes back to point #1...noise. Third the staff. Although the men were very attentive and nice, there was one younger lady that refused to take clean extra linens from us and made us go back to our room and wait for someone to pick them up. This was pure non-sense for me. Fourth the breakfast. If you are debating between this and another hotel because of breakfast just pretend it is non-existent. It is basically boiled eggs, plain (not so great) bagels, little muffins and couple of cereals. Go walk a few blocks and look for egg on a roll from a food truck (at $2.50 they are a great deal). PROS: First the location. This hotel is literally 2 blocks from time square and a block from great places to eat. I would strongly recommend Union Square Burger which is right around the corner and Margon (a cuban place most locals go to) which is also a couple of blocks away.

OK room for a short visit to the city, very small room with an attached bathroom, window ac's allow for street noise, but, ear plugs are provided in the bathroom with other amenities, what does that tell you? So so internet and not much of a continental breakfast, single elevator and small lobby. On the plus side, friendly, knowledgeable staff, one bock away from Times Square, fifteen minute walk from Penn Station, Restaurant Row is one street away, Theatre District is very close, Hop on Hop off bus tour is across the street. If you're looking for a place to sleep and shower while visiting the city, this is not a bad choice for the money.

Dirty, small rooms, disgusting bathrooms and the RUDEST front desk people you can imagine. Elevator always so full of laundry in garbage bags that you can barely get in it, wifi is slow if you can connect at all & TV doesn't work! Parking garage is a block behind the hotel, on a one way street!! Be prepared to drive around a few blocks to get back there , in traffic...took nearly 45 minutes! Not a flat $20 a night as the site says, it depends on vehicle size!!! RUN AWAY, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

My partner and I stayed here for 7 nights and for us, it was perfect. The room was quite small (even though labeled a “queen room”) where there was maybe a foot of room between the wall and the end of the bed, Not a lot of room to put our suitcases either but there was a small wardrobe with some hanging space and a couple of drawers as well as a safe - we made it work. Most rooms in New York City are small, we simply accepted it (how much time are you really going to spend in the room anyway). Although the hotel is clearly old, the room and bathroom were clean and we couldn’t complain - there was also free WiFi that worked well which was a bonus. The hotel staff were all very helpful and there was someone at the reception desk 24/7. There was also a 24/7 supply of teas and coffee in the reception area as well as cookies, fruit and iced water with lemon. The breakfast selection was wide - bagels, bread, pastries, boiled eggs, orange juice, cereals etc. The only downside was that we were told breakfast was available until 10am, however when going down around 9am or later there was no food left. The hotel is in the absolute perfect location if the Times Square/Hell’s Kitchen/ theatre district is where you want to be! Not even a 5 minute walk to Times Square and it’s surrounded by so many beautiful restaurants and bars. In saying that, this also means there is quite a lot of traffic noise at night time (ear plugs were already provided and in the room when we got there). If noise is something that bothers you then good luck finding somewhere central that isn’t noisy. Checkout was at 12pm which was nice considering most other places is 10am. However this did mean that check-in was 3pm although this wasn’t a problem for us. I would definitely stay here again - long or short stay. Overall a really great hotel.

The hotel was in the center of New York. Has great amenities, great breakfast and has free unlimited coffee. The staff were very welcoming and kind to us on our stay. The room was small but we were never in our room anyway!

I was here with my sister. Room is small and old as nyc style. The room has color smell which we dont like and bare breathe. However they have fruits, cookies, and juices , tea and coffee for your to drink all day. Good breakfast. Staffs are nice. Recommend just only 1-2 nights. But location is the best.

Hotel is brilliantly sited, just one block west of Times Square and 49th Street subway station. It’s also only 6 blocks north of the Port Authority Bus Station, so, you couldn’t ask for a better location. Check in was quick and the staff were very friendly. The room was small but was clean and had everything we needed in it. We were on the top floor and the noise from the street was audible but didn’t trouble us at all. Breakfast seemed to be busy but we just grabbed a few items and ate them on the go. The cost of the hotel makes the small rooms acceptable (and plenty of NYC hotel rooms are little bigger). Would definitely stay again.

Relaxing, nice hotel. All the staff are courteous, polite and helpful. The door men always had a smile and were two steps ahead of us. People are nice and are willing to help / provide items requested.

This hotel is in an excellent location. I visited to attend RuPauls Drag Con at the Javits Center and it was not a far walk at all. Times Square is only minutes away and there’s a Duane Read next door for all your last minute needs. The room was clean and the size was to be expected for an NYC hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful & helped recommend places to eat. The breakfast had pastries, cereal, juice, fruit, coffee and I believe hard boiled eggs. It’s good options for a free breakfast. Can’t complain about anything. Thank you to your staff, we will be back for sure!

Just spent 3 and a half weeks in the USA . And Im extremely disappointed with our stay here , we arrived on the 1st September for a 4 night stay. We arrived at approximately 18.30 to check in to be told our room still needed to be cleaned . Roughly 40 minutes later we were told our room was ready, to go upstairs to find an extremely rude cleaner still in there . When I entered the room he proceeded to tell me it wasn’t ready, I told him we had been given a key and sent up , he sighed and radioed the receptionist, I overheard the receptionist say we could wait in the corridor or go back downstairs , he then said room not ready to us and slammed the door in my face. A further 20 to 25 minutes we had our room. (Which by this point we didn’t want to stay but being New York all the other hotels were full )  We were expecting small rooms due to reviews read previously but they really are miniature , picture a double bed sideways and add 30 centimetres around the bed and a wardrobe as a bathroom and you will see just how tiny they are. we coped as being in New York we only used the room for sleeping and were out a mojority of the time . I would never recommend this hotel to anyone - they say there check in time is from 15.00 this is a major lie. Why they couldn’t change us to a room that was already ready I do not understand.

I agree with just about everything Jason M said in his review of three weeks ago, posted below this review. His description of the room, the property, it's location and the amenities is accurate so I won't repeat everything he said. Two thumbs up for his review.Two things I would add. We knew this was an Econolodge and our expectations were for an Econolodge. It was a perfectly acceptable property for a one night stay - I'm not sure if I would feel the same if we were there multiple nights. For a one night stay I would stay there again.We stayed with points and I chose the "Queen bed efficiency" top floor room as it was the same number of points as all the other options. This room was on the 7th floor; to get there we took the elevator to the 6th floor and had to walk up one flight of stairs. It was the only room on the 7th floor.So that anyone booking this room in the future will know, "Efficiency" does not mean there is anyplace to cook or prepare food. The room is slightly larger, has a sofabed that opens (although it must be a really tight squeeze if you do), and has a small, dorm sized refrigerator. A family could make do but I'd really hate to be one of two couples staying in this room.I rate the property 4 stars because, well, it is an Econolodge. Great location, great value, I slept well, there was hot water and clean towels, the morning coffee in the lobby was passable and all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. I've stayed at several other, nicer properties in midtown, and they all cost a whole lot more. If what you are looking for is an economical, functional property, this will do. Just remember, it not a Hilton; it's an Econolodge.

This hotel is a great location if you want to be in the middle of everything. It is not our first time to NY and I would stay here again. The room is small but clean, air conditioning worked well and breakfast is included. Staff are very friendly.

Dirty, poorly maintained. Other ratings must be falsified. This place is really a dump. The room is so small that you can barely walk around the bed. Carpet stained, and desk is in poor condition. Worst hotel I have stayed at in 30 years.

Good relatively cheap accommodation. Quick check in, helpful staff, small room but clean with towels regularly changed. Lobby quite crowded at breakfast but we always managed to get a seat. Reasonable choice for breakfast. Close to Times Square, just one block away. Would stay here again. Good value for money in a major city.

I booked a standard room with one double bed for a single night stay in mid August of 2018. I stayed in room 200 which is on the second floor right next to the stairs and elevator. The room contained a small cabinet for hanging clothing (small drawers as well as a safe in this cabinet. There was a desk with a chair, an iron, an ironing board, and a small refrigerator. Smaller flat screen TV was mounted on the wall above the desk. The bathroom was a decent size and was stocked with an adequate number of towels. Two packs of foam ear plugs were provided as well. The bed was comfortable and plenty of pillows were supplied.The room was clean and well maintained. The air conditioner in this room was actually a window unit but it was new and worked very well (I like the room cold). I didn't hear any sounds from other guests. No noise from the elevator either. There was however noise from the street which is why the hotel supplies you with ear plugs (I used them and slept through the night without a problem). Internet is available and seemed to work fine (sent an email, checked social media before bed).The lobby was clean hand had seating available. There is also an ATM in the lobby so you can get cash from the safety of the hotel. The front desk staff was polite and professional.There are several parking garages within walking distance of this hotel. A drug store is right across the street if you need beverages, toiletries or other such items. Of course there are plenty of places to eat as well. Yes, the room was small. Since I was traveling alone that wasn't a problem but even if my wife had been traveling with me I feel we would have been comfortable in this room. Last year we stayed in a much larger hotel in the same area. That hotel room was bigger than my first apartment. It also cost $200 a night more than the rooms at the Econo Lodge. I plan to stay here the next time I travel to New York for a show. This hotel is an incredible bargain.

My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in early August, and the location really is perfect. Less than a 5 minute walk to the theater district for our musical, steps to the heart of Times Square, easy walk to Central Park, and a drug store and lots of food options nearby. We were lucky enough to be there for the street festival on August 4th and loved that it was so close (30 second walk). The front desk clerk who checked us in and out was very friendly and efficient (we appreciated the offer of assistance with arranging transportation).There are some cons: the room was dated and the window could use a scrub. Our television also had poor reception (but we weren't in NYC to stay in the room, so that didn't really bother us). And yes, the room was small. But again, we used the room to sleep and bathe, so this wasn't a huge issue for us. We could also understand the complaints from other reviewers of the street noise. We were lucky enough to be on the 6th floor and had a loud window AC unit (which we loved because we usually sleep with a fan), so we didn't hear much noise, but occasionally it would filter through. Not enough to bother us, and we did appreciate the ear plugs. It's NYC, though, this isn't a huge hotel, and it is VERY close to everything, so some noise is to be expected.Overall, we really liked our stay. Our room and bathroom were clean, the bed was comfortable, the price was great, the staff was friendly, and the location was amazing. We will definitely be back. :)

Three stars rating is what I would give this hotel. The hotel itself isn't bad at all. It is located in a prime spot near Times Square . HOtel was quite clean and you can also find paid parking close to the hotel. Lot of positives with this hotel. But the night can be quite an ordeal. the constant movement of traffic and music on streets will keep you up all at night. (Not the fault of hotel).

The location is phenomenal. I agree with the other reviews that the room is small, but if you are one that doesn't spend much time in the room it works. It is also a bit noisy, but it is NY close to Times Square. I did not find the noise to be a problem. The distance to a lot of the Broadway theatres and times square is perfect. For that location the price is amazing as well. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. It's not a luxury hotel, but if you're looking for an affordable place close to the action, this checks off those boxes. I would definitely stay here again.

The location was perfect for me for a July 4th trip. Time Square, theater district, central park all a walk away; among various restaurant choices.The rooms are tiny but enough if your just sleeping and bathing...bed is so comfortable. Most of all it was clean, clean, no smells, bugs or spider webs. Double locks on the room doors. It was a little loud at night so they even provide ear plugs...but who sleeps in NYC on vacation! If you want bells and whistles of a 4 star hotel and plan to spend of your time in the room this is not the hotel for you. I also want to add the staff was so accommodating and professional.

Pros: Extremely central and handy for the subway, theatres, Hell's Kitchen, Port Authority bus station; good breakfast, served nice and early (ideal for jet-lagged early risers!); reasonably priced by NY standards; friendly and helpful staff.Cons: Very noisy, especially at night; TINY room; wifi slow and flaky; windows too dirty to see out of.

I travel to NYC about 10 nights a year and know the rooms are small in all hotels. This room was slight bigger than a Queen sized bed which run 60 by 80 inches. You had to crawl over the bed to get to the other side. There were tiny night stands and a closet enough for four hanging items. I used tie window sills got my clothes. They have a cold breakfast of yogurt, boiled eggs,and toast and packaged oatmeal. The rooms are clean and fairly quiet got New York. It is located between 8 and .9th avenue where there are a lot of reasonable restaurants

We stayed at the Econolodge primarily for a good location. So let's start with the few negatives. The hotel is quite small and dated and the rooms are quite tight for space too. There is not much sound insulation from the traffic below so take some ear plugs! Right onto the positives. There's a small but very tasty breakfast on offer every morning but this has to be eaten in the lobby area. The staff are brilliant, helpful and happy. The rooms are clean and tidy and the location is good for accessing all of central Manhattan.Worth a try!

This hotel is in a great location very near to Times Square & the Grey line tourist center- big plus when u r touring with fmly . Proximity to tourist centre was awesome as u save on cab & time . Very small rooms but u spend only a night when touring

We just stayed at the Times Square Econo Lodge. What a find! We were steps away from the theater district and Times Square. The rooms may be on the small size, but the staff is friendly and the rooms are very clean. The queen sized bed was comfortable and the free breakfast was sufficient for some and a quick snack for others. The most important thing is that this is a convenient, reasonably priced option for someone who wants to enjoy the heart of NYC. We expect to come back again.

We loved our stay here. Our room was very clean, beds were comfortable and sheets and pillows were nice. The room and bathroom was small but what do you expect in New York City. Great place to stay. Staff was very friendly and check in was quick. You can hear lots of street noise from our room but they do provide ear plugs. Free breakfast Had a great first time ever in NYC stay here!

We originally book at a different hotel but our reservation were apparently lost! So we found them that very night we arrived in NYC! The room was clean, the staff was GREAT! Love that it was in the middle of everything! Wish the rooms was a little bigger, but could have been that we got the room last minute. I would stay again!

Hotel was the dirtiest hotel I have ever experienced.Employees were not friendly or helpful.Feces on toilet seatStained bedspread Exposed pipesMoldCurtains stained and to short to cover window Torn wallpaper

My room, and I imagine most or all of the rooms, have window air conditioners. Mine was very loud. When I first arrived it was a very warm day and the cool felt good. By evening the temperature outside had dropped significantly but the room was still warm so I still had the air conditioning on. In the morning the air conditioning was spewing water all over the ledge and the bed and no cool air was coming out. I turned it off and waited a bit before turning it back on and it started working properly. However, by the following morning it was spewing even more water than it had before. Between the noise and the lack of proper cooling it was difficult to get a good night's sleep.The room could be cleaner. It definitely needs updated as there are cracks in the walls and ceiling. At least one electrical outlet was cracked.I kept the Do Not Disturb card on the outside door for my entire stay and this is what I do every time I stay in a hotel. Despite this someone came into my room on 2 separate occasions while I was out. I know this because I had turned all the lights off and returned to find a light on each time. I assume they use satellite for the TV and Internet service because it is not reliable.Most disappointing is that if I had made this reservation 2 weeks earlier I would have paid a lot less and even that price was way too much for this hotel.The only good thing I can say about it is that it's in a great location and one of the receptionist (Jasmine) was very nice.

I normally stay at Hilton Hotels however I wanted to save some money and given that I only needed a room for a single night I thought I would check out the Econo lodge. Prior to arriving I asked Choice hotels to match my status as a Hilton Gold which they did- Choice Platinum until the end of the year. I also paid a little extra for a Superior room on the top floor and given the room rate I was very happy with my room. The bathroom was huge and the bed room was the typical size for a hotel in Time square. When I checked in I my status as a Choice Platinum was acknowledged and I was offered a late check out. The negatives would be the carpet which is old and there only a small narrow window however the room rate for a hotel in times square cannot be beat so I will be back.

We just stayed here for 5 night.... The location was perfect, just off Times Square, the staff were helpful and friendly and our room was cleaned and made up everyday. The idea of the breakfast in the lobby is a fantastic idea and was basic but we enjoyed it every morning and saves us so much time looking for somewhere for breakfast. When we return to New York we would stay here again.

I had read lots of reviews prior to booking....both good and bad....so I went in with low expectations and was pleasantly surprised!! We got there before rooms were ready so the receptionist kept our bags behind the desk for us so we could go explore. We got back and checked into our room. Room was definitely compact but had all of the amenities needed for what we needed. We definitely don't go to NYC to hang out in the room! Wifi worked (once we figured out how to get on) and, when we encountered issues with the TV, they immediately sent someone to fix it. Bed was comfortable, there were plenty of plugs, there was rarely a long wait for the elevator. The lobby always had coffee and some sort of snack and the morning continental breakfast had lots of selection. For the money, you won't find somewhere with a better location...we were one block from Times Square....it was awesome!! Service was great and the price was good. There definitely isn't any kind of view from the rooms but, again, we were in the room only to sleep. My one complaint would be that we didn't have any control over the heater in the room and it was PUMPING so we ended up having to turn on the air to combat it....which was fine. We will definitely stay here again.

I’m here because my first 3 choices were booked. There is no TV! This is the first time in 3 hours I can actually get a signal.It’s clean. They leave a nice snack!It’s noisy, and I can’t drown out the noise since the TV doesn’t get a signal.I have the pillows up against the window to break the draft.Never again!

If you work in hospitality you must have a great attitude. There are people that just look miserable at work and force a smile. NOT HERE! Everyone I interacted with was genuinely nice and extremely hospitable. They assisted with all my questions and addressed all my concerns. The breakfast is pretty good. They have options so I tried something different each day. The location is unbeatable. It is near all the main attractions. Any question I had the receptionist always helped. They were all very knowledgeable about the area and had great recommendations. I must say they are some things that can be improved. It is an older building so the heating is not controlled within the room. Luckily they modified the temperature once I called the desk. Also, if they change the carpeting it will have a nice chic look. These are doable things that would make this already great hotel, better. You really do forget this is just a 2 star hotel. It truly exceeds all expectations. I had a great experience and can't wait to see the promised changes I read on some responses.

Having read about the small room size, I booked a superior room. Although it was snug, the bathroom was certainly bigger than the regular rooms, and there was adequate room to walk around the bed. I could compare this because after I'd checked out and left my bags with reception, we asked to use a restroom before we left for the airport and the helpful reception staff allowed us the use of a regular room. I'd also asked for a quiet room and I was allocated room 500 which was furthest away from 8th Ave but next to the elevator. Despite the "warning" indicated by the ear plugs provided, we were never disturbed by the elevator, nor by street traffic and noise except for the night of St Patrick's Day! The room itself had clean linen and towels, and housekeeping did a good job. The breakfast is more than adequate; the only downside is that because it uses all disposables, it's not particularly environmentally friendly. But coffee is available all day, and cookies in the afternoon. Special mention must go to Jay on reception who was incredibly helpful throughout our stay, even printed our boarding passes for us, I'd definitely stay here again. Why pay more? It's in an excellent location, 20-30 mins walk from Penn Station (we came via Airtrain and LIRR) , about an hours journey in total from JFK.

I CANCELED RESERVATION.$ketchy behaviour like this, is specifically why i reserved with a card not intended for the day of billing..my notations were VERY CLEAR /ignored.don't bother as they seem overly interested in vacuuming your accounts.meh.

Currently still here on the 5th floor of 6. 1 block over from Times Square the hotel is in the perfect location. It takes no more than 3 minutes to walk to the centre of Times Square. The hotel is clean, friendly staff, room is small but double bed, tv, great view, power shower, dresser, mini wardrobe and safe. Yes the rooms are small but big enough. We’re here for 9 nights and so far 4 nights in and have no problems with the size. There’s free WiFi anywhere in hotel and have always got a decent signal good enough to FaceTime back to England. 9 nights for 2 people for under £800 compared to well over double that for the hotels just round the corner. A lot of the bigger hotels haven’t got good reviews and say that staff rude, place dirty etc. No problems like that here. Breakfast is simple but great. Toast, eggs, yoghurt, fruit, bagels, doughnuts, cereals, nut and honey cereal bars, porridge, tea, coffee, orange juice etc. I really cannot fault this place. If you want fancy then don’t stay here, if you want simple, comfy, clean and great location on a lower budget this is a must. For the little time you spend in your hotel why spend over double. I will definitely come again.

Was in this place for four nights, while attending seminars at the nearby American Management Association building. They deliver what they promise - a clean room, limited breakfast, no frills. I had to study each night for exams the next day, and there was a desk. Everything in miniature, yes the rooms are the size of a closet. The staff - all jobs, all shifts - was so nice, it clearly comes down from management that this is a priority, which is appreciated.
user_name:
sociallyliving
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great location, three blocks from Time Square. Average hotel, very small room, basically the size of the bed with a small desk. The hotel could use some updating. The breakfast was acceptable, cereal, fruit, bagels.

The room is the size of a closet. I hear that's common in NYC but do yourself a favor, go one street over to the comfort inn and pay less for a normal sized room. It's about the same cleanliness level and the location isn't all that different. This place (the econo lodge) has very judemental evening/night staff and you're going to feel like the biggest inconvenience to them every time you just walk out the front door to smoke.

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights and our stay was really great. It was my first trip in New York and the location of this hotel has made our vacation very convenient. The breakfast was good and the room we got was clean and just perfect for a couple. The staff at the reception was nice as he even lent me (for our whole stay) the adapter for my camera battery charger. The location is perfect as only walking distance away from the Times Square, Broadway, subwat stattions and other popular places in NY. We are planning to visit New York again this year and maybe we'll stay here again.

I'm used to the size of hotel rooms in older European hotels so the tiny size of my room didn't bother me. It was spotlessly clean. Could do with some updates but at this price, it's a great deal. Staff and location were great.

First I have to say the staff was very friendly and helpful. However this place needs cleaning and updating in the worst way. The rooms are extremely small. In order for my husband to walk around the bed he had to turn sideways and he is not a big man. The bathroom could have been a lot cleaner. Also the bathroom is cramped so much so that I smacked my head on the towel rack while trying to sit down on the toilet. I ended up with a black eye. Every day we would put our towels back on the rack so that we could use them again and every day the cleaning staff gave us new, clean towels. So much for being environmentally conscious. We initially going to stay here all week but ended up changing to a different hotel for the end of our stay. The location is fantastic and the price is probably reasonable for this area. Just so you aware the rooms are very small, not too clean the whole place should be updated.

Chose this hotel over the usual brand we stay at (Marriott) because of the price & location. Now, if you go over other reviews here you'll see that three things in common, location, noise level & price. The location was probably the best part of this hotel, you're gonna be within steps of times square & the Port Authority. The noise level, is loud! But ear plugs were provided in our room upon checking in. Consider the fact that most of your vacation you'll be outside exploring & by the time you return to your hotel, you'll be too tired to really notice the outside noise. If you're a light sleeper however, this may not be the place for you.The price is a great bargain considering where you're at. Steps away from major attractions & train stations to go out further. This is NYC and with that, space is at a premium. If you want a bigger room, you're gonna have to pay more.I do feel that the decor in the hotel is in need of a major overhaul, it's outdated & it shows throughout. Furniture had stains from previous guests, tile grout showing age and decay.With all that said, if location is all you're worried about & are willing to overlook the flaws this is a good place to stay. An updating of decor would do this place wonders.

The good: 1. great location, two blocks from Time Square and in the middle of theater district. 2. Staff was very friendly and helpful. 3. Military discount.The bad: 1. We were on 2nd floor and a bar was across the street. You can imagine the noise. The room came with earplugs, provided free of charge in the bathroom. 2. The room was literally 7' by 14' for a total area of 98 square feet, including the bathroom. It was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. No more than two people could be in the room at a time. I have stayed in military tents many times larger than this room. 3. The air condition unit was a window unit, with a broken vent.

As positive: the staff was very nice and I noticed they helping other people with directions. They keep your bags at no charge and you can order online and it can be delivered at the hotel at no cost (I asked that). The location of the hotel is great and one of the things that made us choose this hotel was breakfast included. It was not a luxury breakfast, but had coffee, tea, pastry, some bread, jelly, peanut butter, cream cheese, and apples and bananas. It was worth it. Besides, they keep the coffee machine available 24h and in the afternoon there were cookies in the front desk and also water with lemon to refresh. They have newspaper available and a ATM machine. There was also a large TV screen with a few features like flighttracker and you can take your selfie on it!On the negative side: The sink hole cover in the bathroom did not work properly and I called housekeeping. The lady stuck her hand in the sink to release the cover, which I did not considered practical. Once I´ve seen that, I kept it open 100% of the time. The bed sheets had some stains - they were not dirty, just stains. The wifi was kind of slow, but it was free, so... just a comment.

Just returned from NYC again :-) as we are frequent visitors, love the city and people. Chose to stay at this hotel based on reviews and feedback looked largely positive. And breakfast was included. Arrived having previously sent an email asking about a quieter room on an upper floor. Got allocated a tiny room on the 3rd floor which you could touch one wall with your hand and the other wall with your foot. Room was fairly run down and the safe was broken in the tiny wardrobe.We went to complain and got told we would have to stay in the room for at least a night and check back the next day, if a room was available as we were told the hotel was full. We went back, started to unpack and then about 15 minutes went back to reception and a different receptionist who said there was a room available on the 5th floor. We checked it out. It was slightly better laid out and a bit bigger so we opted to switch rooms.If we hadn't we would have checked out and gone elsewhere!The 5th floor room was a bit better but was tired and dated. Not cleaned to the best standard, worn chipped furniture, scuffed walls, stuff (???) stuck on the dated carpets in places and splashed paint elsewhere on the floors and walls as there had been some DIY done to try and patch up the room. The bathroom was really dated, tiled floor was not exactly clean and cracked in places which could have cut your feet. Shower was really of a poor standard and you could not really adjust the shower-head so the water almost came out and hit the far wall. Bath and tiles were tired and there was lots of mould which as not pleasant. You also have no control of the heating in the room which is an antiquated old hot air heating system. So the room gets really warm and not pleasant if you've just been for a shower. We're we're not here in Spring or Summer so can imagine the heat in these rooms could be an issue as the fan system built into the window is fairly useless. The room does get really noisy! Partly because there is a Fire Station just across the junction at 47th and 8th. But even 5 flights up you can hear people in the street as there is an inner window, and a different outer window. Why the whole window could have not been replaced at some point is just cheap! Lots of drafts coming in around the window which you do have to open to vent the room.Other things we could mention was work getting done in adjoining rooms, emergency exits certainly on 3rd and 5th were partially blocked with paint tins, lights, tools, rubbish and other obstructions. At least there were no emergencies when we stayed.Generally staff were friendly and breakfast although okay was fairly basic.We have stayed at other Choice Hotels but found this one somewhat over-rated and in need of a general over haul, "refurb", and spring clean.

Hotel room is what you pay for ..... no thrills however overall I was happy with this place the location is brilliant the staff seemed friendly. Breakfeast again is basic but it fills you up. If your going to NY in a budget I would recommend

The staff was very inviting and knowledgeable. Great location. Hotel and room was clean. Room was very small. But beds are comfy. A lot of traffic noise (horns and sirens)But hey it’s New York City and they do supply ear plugs.

The staff were very accommodating and welcoming, giving us a very good impression of the city. The hotel was excellently located very close to Times Square, so it was ideal for us as avid theater-goers. The room was very small, but when we travel, we spend very little time in the room, so it was of no consequence to us. It was always clean and well tended, great housekeeping staff, good water pressure and hot water in the shower. The breakfasts were simple, but that was understood from the start: bagels, toast, cakes, muffins, turkey and cheese slices. Coffee was available all day. We were very pleased and have suggested this hotel to friends who are considering a trip to NYC. Thanks to the staff!!
