I went to New York to see Springstteen on Broadway and since i had not been here in 25 years, i wanted a hotel close to where i would be going. What a nice surprise, that this place, was reasonably priced, the bed was very very comfortable, and Location location location, not far from any theater i wanted to eventually go to. Jazmine Britton was fantastic to get information from and her helpfulness, also, while i was getting pound cake i heard her giving great advice to some other travelers. I think this is the only place i would stay at in New York again.

This little hotel was perfect for our trip. It was 2 blocks from Time Sq. There is a Duane Reade and Starbucks across the street for necessities. The staff was polite and I️ really gave no complaints except that the room was really small but if small spaces don’t bother you then the price and location are perfect. Would recommend and stay here again.

This hotel is situated at a very close proximity from times square like 250 mts. But the room sizes are really small. The staff are helpful. The breakfast is standard but too cramped for any type of variety. Everyday the same. Even though it claims to be a budget hotel the rates were very high in comparison and keeps on changing everyday. The house keeping etc are much to be desired. Our toilet flush was malfunctioning and we had to wait for 3-4 hours to get someone to attend to that. Again when it malfunctioned, I did not bother the guys and repaired it myself, with some effort. Also being near a busy intersection makes it very loud, with sirens being heard every now and then.

We stayed there for 2 nights and it has one of the best location with Times Square just 5 minutes walk also also the underground station very near by. The price is reasonable considering the location. The staff very nice and helpful. Rooms also are neat and clean. However room size is very small which I suppose goes with the reasonable tariff. However they do not even permit early check in and ask extra money even if you are only 2 hours early. No waiting area except for 2-3 people which can sit in the corridor near the entrance. What was more annoying was very small breakfast area and if there is are even 8 people having breakfast when you arrive you will have to wait for a table to get vacant. I suppose at least they should provide a decent breakfast area which can also serve as waiting area for rest of the day.

Visited NY and stayed in this hotel from Oct 21 to 27 2017. I was impressed that once you arrived the hotel coffee and cookies are ready and are available 24hours. The rate is reasonable for a very good location in NY. Linens and room are clean. My room was not provided with a refrigerator but since i need to keep my insulin, Ms Jasmin was kind enough to keep them in the ref of the kitchen. I travelled alone and yet i feel so comfortably safe. Everyday , Ms Jasmin always reminds me if i had my insulin shot already. A home away from my home. I plan to be back again with my family. Thank you Econo Lodge.Rustico "LitoFlery" JimenezRm 416

NYC is famous for hotel rooms that are relatively low cost but small. The Econo Lodge Times square takes it to a whole new level. One side of the queen bed in our room was only about 13 inches from the radiator projecting from the wall. The end of the bed was about 9 or 10 inches from another wall. You had to inch sideways to get past the end of the bed to the far side. A small wardrobe took up most of the space on the other side of the bed. The narrow entryway was partially obstructed by a desk and chair which couldn’t be used without blocking access to the room door. Another odd feature of the room was a window air conditioner positioned behind the curtain so that you had the choice of a dark hot room or a cooler room brightly lit by outdoor lighting. The overall feeling of the room was uncomfortable and possibly dangerous. In our room, the air conditioner emitted a frequent spray of tiny water droplets. The bathroom door hinge made a squeal that was loud and sounded like a human cry – not so nice to hear in the middle of the night. The hot water would sometimes run cold briefly. Even on the upper floors, the street noise was more than is common in other NYC hotels. The staff were nice, the room and hotel were reasonably clean and the bed was semi comfortable but the size of the room and issue with the layout of the curtain and air conditioner made it a poor choice for a stay in NYC. We stay in NYC a lot and would avoid staying at the Econo Lodge Times Square in the future.

I was very disappointed with our recent stay at the Econo Lodge, Times Square. There was a huge problem when checking in despite re-confirming our reservation that morning. The final bill resolution was wrong and had to be re-done twice. There was no manager on duty in the evenings or weekends to help resolve issues. We were told that there would be no additional charge for parking but it was $30 a day. The room was very small. The room was clean but in need of updating. The breakfast was adequate and I must say that the man tending it was very attentive. He was the best part of our stay. When I emailed Choice Hotels that we were having a problem, they emailed back that there was nothing they could do while we were still staying at the hotel! Couldn't believe it! This was their response: "In this instance we may not be able to file a complaint with the hotel since you're still checked in. Right now I have documented your concern." The safe was broken. I would not recommend this hotel. When everything settled out, we could have stayed somewhere much nicer for about the same price.

Staff was super friendly, great location, clean, and decent price! Multiple parking garages nearby, so bringing the car into the city was no hassle at all! Coffee and light breakfast in the lobby, and they held our bags for us so we could walk around before check in time. Would definitely stay here again!

I booked this hotel by mistake and they wouldn't let me correct the human error. The management could care less as I was just a number to them. On top of that, it was the most expensive hotel (@ $325/night) for such a small, noisy place to stay. Even the electric circuit was a problem as the TV reacted to one of the lights I would switch on and off. The worst hotel experience and I travel for work a great deal. Stay away.
user_name:
yaredny
New York City, New York

review_body: So, it is awesome hotel and with good service. With really cool people, espesialy Sivagi who was working on the reception, she is awesome, polite, positive, intelligent. I left my luggage in this hotel after I make check out coz my fly was njght, they not change anything and help. This guys beat, really positive and cool. I will be defenitly in this hotel next time.

I stayed here with my boyfriend for 7 nights and our first trip to New York and the USA. We booked this hotel due to its location in relation to Times Square which is close by. Throughout our stay the Front of House staff were extremely friendly and helpful with information about the city. The room was small but suited our needs and budget. Overall we had a lovely stay.

We visited NYC for only three nights. Previously we've done AirBNB in Brooklyn but for this quick stop, we wanted to be in the heart of it all. Every thing is nearby. I wore 4 inch heels to Hamilton and then walked back to change into walking shoes. All for less than $200 a night. Love! Who cares how small it is? The bed was comfy and clean. We'll be back.

On the plus side:* Location is unbeatable* Nice small touches with cookies at counter and better-than-average shower gel* Rates are competitiveOn the down side:* Can be noisy* Room is very small but adequate* Overall could use a bit of sprucing upOn the whole, for the location and rates you give up some higher-end amenities but probably a good tradeoff
user_name:
Chris M
Pocono Mountains Region, Pennsylvania

review_body: Wow. We wanted to stay at a less expensive chain hotel, being summer and the prices were higher. Big mistake. This place is just awful. Tiny rooms, stained bedding, holes in the walls, blood on the doorway, sticky mouse traps in the hallways, old, basically like a YMCA for $145 a night. Black spots on the sheets, likely bed bugs. They gave us a handicapped room (we are not handicapped), so the shower was impossible. Breakfast is a joke. Spend an extra $20 and go to a real hotel, or your weekend will be ruined like mine was.

Central and convenient, one block from Time Square. Included continental breakfast. Friendly, helpful staff. Hotel itself was quiet, fire station close by which is noisy. Small rooms but have everything needed.

I had made a reservation for my boss that I had to cancel right away because of a family emergency, no later than 10 mins after making the reservation.I called to cancel it, they said it was no problem and then what shows up on my credit card statement? You guessed right, both nights were charged.FRAUD. Do not stay here.

We normally don't stay near Time Square when we come to New York. But on this trip we had eater tickets to sue shows in one day. The Econolodge was surprisingly great. The location is near the Theater District, but not the heart of Times Square which is always crazy. Just being a block or two off helps the location me a little quieter. The bed was full size and comfortable. The hotel appears dated and all, but it was comfortable. The bathroom and room was small but adequate. The front desk staff was friendly you can leave your bags prior to check in and after you leave if you want to come back later for a bag. They have water in the lobby all the time and breakfast in the morning coffee tea available and cookies in the afternoon. We were here in the heart of summer season and paid $229 a night, but I guess for the location it was all good.

This hotel superseded my expectations. Great location and good value for New York. Ok the room was small but more than adequate Bed comfortable. Friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast was better than I was expecting. Top tip is to go down early e.g. 7:30am for a quiet breakfast. A little chaotic after that. Would recommend this hotel for its location and value. Easy to take train and subway from JFK. Buy a metro card and you have freedom to travel round NY sights.

Considering the location, I think this is a bargain. So close to Times Square, anything at your door step. The room was nice and clean. Smallish, but it was a room with a queen bed, not much room either side, but certainly better than the closets masquerading as rooms (cabin style rooms), with it's own bathroom, and for basically the same price. It might be a bit small for a couple, but for a couple days should suffice. The staff were great, very helpful. I would absolutely stay here again if I go to NY again.

The rooms and bathroom are very small but we could lay in bed and look directly into time square. The beds were wonderful. The staff is incredibly helpful and kind. Our room was kept extremely clean and we had fresh towels and sheets each day. The bus stop for the Gray Line tours was directly across the street which made sight seeing very convenient. The location of the hotel is perfect for the 1 block walk to the middle of time squares as well as lots of great places to eat. We expected to hear traffic and other noise but there was never anything that kept us from going to sleep or staying asleep. The price was right, the room was perfect, the location was excellent, and the staff was priceless. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone else too.

I recently took my daughter to NYC to see Hamilton. I chose the econo lodge Times Square because of its great location, which is fantastic!! Walking distance to so much in Times Square. It was clean for the most part. The rooms are super small!!! But we only needed a place to sleep & shower so we didn't mind. We had an issue with the toilet the first night, we went to a Broadway show came back and the toilet had overflown all over!! They switched us to another room. Staff was pleasant and helpful. The big negative is the $100 non smoking deposit they hit you with when you check in. Had no idea before we got there they required it!! So beware if you stay there bring an extra $100.

The staff was very polite and knowledgeable about the area. Having the option for breakfast was very nice, we got there early and didn't have a problem finding seats, though later in the day we saw it was busier. The rooms were clean and well maintained, but there wasn't much extra room for moving about. We didn't spend much time in our room other than sleeping, so it wasn't too much of a problem. The view from our room was beautiful, we were on the top floor and were able to see out a fair way into the city. The street itself was pretty quiet, but the Avenue out front was fairly busy. The complimentary ear plugs were apprecitated.

The rooms are very small and could be redesigned to make more space. It was really noisy so we ran the aircon to drown out the street noise. The location is really great and the restaurants on 8 th avenue give you plenty of choices in food. The complimentary breakfast is a great idea but eating it in the hotel foyer was not very comfortable given the small area and the amount of people all wanting to get their breakfast at the same time. This hotel is relatively cheap compared to other hotels in NY but you have to be prepared for such a small room and it's tough if you have a lot of luggage.

A wonderful location - SO close to Broadway and all that the area has to offer. You could almost fall out of bed into a theatre seat!! It was very clean and the staff were efficient and friendly. I highly recommend it.

Cozy hotel in an excellent location. Two blocks from Times Square. The room was great, a little small but with a big bed. Yo can get there by subway from JFK. Its easy to find. A little expensive but considering staying in Lower Manhattan, its ok.

It was very clean. There was a variety of al a carte items for breakfast in a tiny lobby/breakast/passage way. The coffee was always available but not good. Lemon water is always available too. We stayed on the 6th floor and had great water pressure. The water drains are extremely slow. The elevator is extremely slow. At 6:00 00pm home made cookies are available. The staff was very friendly and eager to please. The location is a hop, skip, &a jump to Time Square. It is a mile from Penn Station.

Just a block from Broadway and the excitement of Times Square. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Everyone on the staff we had the opportunity to meet was very helpful and hospitable. Very close to subways to everywhere or short cab rides to many sights and attractions in the city. The noise level was a little high with normal city sounds we were not accustomed to in suburban Atlanta.

The room is super, super tiny, but it was clean & had everything you needed for resting after big days/night out in the city. The location is PERFECT!! You're so close to everything you need & it's the best location as a tourist visiting for the first time. The staff were great, one receptionist in particular was amazing, & I'm sorry that I can't remember his name, but he was incredibly welcoming & gave us his personal list of favorite restaurants/places to eat, it was awesome to get a locals perspective & try to adventure out of the common touristy areas to taste something new. It's relatively cheap and definitely worth it, I'd stay here again for sure.

My daughter & I spent one night here on a very mild April evening in the city. Yes this was a small room..but its NYC! Literally a block from Times Square. We could easily walk back & forth to drop bags off, use the bathroom, etc...The room was very clean & the continental breakfast a nice perk. The staff was super friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations. The parking was at a garage down the street at a discounted rate of $30 per 24 hours.Would absolutely stay here again!

The hotel is reasonably priced and located a block away from Times Square. I am a New Yorker so visiting Times Square is not on my list of things to do. However, it is a must visit for everyone coming to NYC so this hotel is very good if you want to make this area your home based while visiting. It is also, near the NYC subway lines mostly used go visit most the areas with touristic interest. The hotel staff is friendly and pleasant.

Basic Accommodations. Front desk personal was very informative and helpful. You are about two blocks from the heart of Times Square and just a short walk to Central Park and Trump Tower. Subway entry is also very close to this location. Would Stay here again.

I spend 4 Days in aug. 2016. Me and my co worker were very satisfied. It was very hot then but the no smoking room has aircondition. Breakfirst and wifi was free. I have som problem with my TV. And a very nice staff helped me. I recomend this hotel strongly.

Basic, no frill accommodation for one night sleepover.Don't expect too much as it costs much lower than surrounding hotel.Arrived in NYC at JFK on Good Friday noon, and traveling out early next morning.Hotel was able to provide for early check in. Staff was friendly and nice.Room was basic and no-frill. A little cramped, but okay for one-night sleepover.Location is convenient for me. A little noisy at night becomes the street and nearby bars. Glad that earplugs are provided in the room.

I just spent 3 days in NYC with my 80-something year old parents. I chose this location because of its proximity to Times Square, where we could access the Big Bus Tour, and the subway. When every tenth of a mile counts when it comes to being on your feet, this spot was it. Perfect location, clean rooms, free breakfast, a cheaper alternative to other hotels in the area, and solicitous personnel. Previous reviews warned about the small rooms, so we were prepared. But honestly, when the purpose of your visit is other than the hotel room, you just want clean convenience at a reasonable price. This hotel hit the spot.

I have stayed the past 8 nights here and have not been disappointed. Yes, it's noisy at night, but it's midtown NYC and two blocks from Times Square. I was after somewhere clean with a comfortable bed to stay, as you don't spend too much time in your room (unless it's raining!). The room ticked all the boxes for what I needed. The staff here are amazing. They are able to answer any questions and are helpful when it comes to booking airport shuttles and other activities. A call out to one particular staff member, who from day one has been really helpful. Pranay gave me a 3 page listing of his recommended eateries, bars and restaurants. I found this extremely useful for when I was going out - also used his recommendations when going out with friends. Overall, a good place to stay and reasonably priced.

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you are visiting from overseas.Upon arrival, they charge a $150 deposit to your credit card in case you "damage the hotel room or smoke in it".The simple and obvious next step is to refund your credit card upon check out but no, the receptionist advised that this takes 5-7 days to process. Ridiculous!It is now over 2 weeks since I stayed at this hotel and still no sign of the refund.I called the hotel today and was told that they need my bank details. I told this person to refund it back onto the same card but she said they cannot do this. The other thing is they are "not allowed to make overseas calls". Quite unbelievable.

I've just got back from staying at the Econo Lodge. The room 502 was very small but was very clean. The location 47st was great. As a base for just sleeping I would recommend staying here. It's not fancy but it's clean. The staff were all nice and happy to help.

My first time in NYC, and I've couldn't stop patting myself on the back for selecting this place. Location, location, location. Yeah, room are small, but who stays in their room all day when ur in NYC? The staff and service makes up for the little extra space. 1 block away from Time Square....Definitely will stay here again.

We arrived at the Econo Lodge with an open mind bearing in mind what we had paid. We were pleasantly surprised. Despite the room being small and in need of some modernisation the bed was comfortable. There was an Iron, Ironing board, TV, hairdryer and plenty of wardrobe space. Bathroom was modern. Hotel was located next to Times Square, close to the metro and easy walking distance of the cruise terminal. The staff are extremely friendly, knowledgeable and very polite. The customer service was beyond reproach. We were unhappy with our first room and they moved us with no fuss. We had a late flight home and we left our suitcases free of charge at the hotel for several hours. Even after checkout we could use a guest room for the toilet etc. Breakfast was continental and very nice. We would definitely stay here again.

Great place for our trip to New York! The rooms are super tiny, but that's standard for New York and it feels pretty cozy. The room was clean and had no maintenance issues. Staff was professional and we were able to walk to Central Park, the Empire State building and Times Square. They also have breakfast and 24 hour beverages. Hotel itself is great, but if you use the parking garage that they partner with, beware. Get the rate and departure time in writing. When we dropped our car off they said we'd get the discount rate from staying at the hotel. When we picked it up, a different guy was working. He charged us $40 more than the other guy said and claimed he knew nothing about the charges because he only works one day a week.

We stayed here for 7 nights and was really impressed by everything here.We basically wanted somewhere to sleep and shower and relax as most of the day we would be out sightseeing.This hotel hit the spot . To start of with it's only a 3 minutes walk to Times Square, and this is where all the sightseeing buses leave. Or the subway station is a 5 minute walk, maximum.The hotel itself isn't the newest or the smartest, but it's very cheap and clean. For the price it is an amazing hotel. The staff were all so friendly and helpful. We had lots of questions as tourist do!!! And the staff were always more than happy to help.There was one guy on reception called pranay who was amazing.We asked him if he knew of any local restaurants away from the tourist parts , the next thing we knew he had printed 3 pages off of all good local restaurants. We visited 3 of them and they were great. ( a little advice if you go there, head towards 9th avenue for a lot better, choice, price and quality food)The breakfast at the hotel is just what you need to set yourself up for the day , light but filling. There is always coffee, tea, water etc available at reception to take away or drink there , and cookies in the afternoon.There's only one "bad" thing at the hotel and that's nothing to do with hotel. But expect a lot of noise 24 hours a day. Police, fire engines, taxi etc.... all day long. But it's central New York so that goes without saying really.I would totally recommend this hotel for anyone going sightseeing. Great and cheap and central for everything. And don't forget the great staff.Thanks for making our trip amazing

We had a room above the side door looking at 47th street it was a quiet room to us but one of the other guest did mention they could hear time square from their room But hay we are in New York within 5 minutes walk what more does one want, we lived near London Uk .

I wouldn't waste your money on this hotel. Highly disappointing. We picked this place because breakfast was included along with free wi fi; however, they were both fails. Apparently because it is "windy" outside, the hotel has bad wire connections so they tv channels don't work and neither does the wifi. I asked for some type of discount since I wasn't getting what I paid for and the girl at the front desk said, "sorry we don't do that because we can't control the weather". I then asked to speak to the manager, but she happened to be busy for the rest of the night. The breakfast sucks. I called before we arrived to see if the hotel provided for free a shuttle ride back to the airport and the guy said yes. I was just told by someone at they front desk that it would cost $22 which is NOT free, so they don't really know what they are talking about. Oh and the rooms are super small and outdated.

We stayed at this Econolodge for three nights. It was centrally located to everything in Time Square. We felt safe walking all around this area after dark. Our room was small but pretty standard for New York. We had a problem adjusting our heat in the room but once we brought it to the attention of the office, it was immediately taken care of. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. It had a very adequate breakfast every morning. We would definitely stay here again if in the area.

Located 5 minutes walk from Times Square. Felt very safe in the vicinity, despite being in the center of New York. On initial arrival in the room, I was apprehensive regarding the size and lack of space to keep my luggage. I had to climb over the bed to get to the other side, the gap between the bottom of the bed and wall was only 4 inches! I did consider if an upgrade would be possible but they had no alternative. After our first night sleep, I was more than happy, the bed including bedding very comfortable. All spotlessly clean. Room was quiet and I had no further reason for concern, bearing in mind I was only in the room for washing and sleeping! The breakfast was ample, only downside was the Tea and Coffee was always only lukewarm, I did mention to the staff as did other residents but it did not improve. Despite this, I would return and can also confidently recommend to others, bearing in mind the value, ideal central location, cleanliness and knowledgeable and helpful staff.

This was a great deal! Room was very clean. Staff was super friendly and very helpful with arranging transportation and suggesting restaurants. Breakfast options were varied and provided the perfect start to the day! Room size was tight, but location, cleanliness, and staff made it all worth while!

Very well located, staff was very kind at all times, always willing to help. Room was also spotless, excellent room service.The rooms were ridiculously small though, when I read the comments I thought people might have been exaggerating but they really weren't. It isn't that bad if you don't spend time there other than sleeping.

1. We prepaid this hotel stay for ourselves and for my inlaws. We got to the hotel, checked in they added another $100 per room deposit. 2. bed had HAIRS AND STAINS, mattress pad also, they were quick to change the sheets, but they were just as bad, I recommend you check the sheets and under the sheets here, the management sent someone up quickly to change the sheets, but they were just as bad. BEWARE and CHECK to make sure the bed is clean BEFORE getting into it. 3. They adjusted our bill, said we would get a %20 discount but we booked it through southwest.com so they had to send it to a 3rd party. 2 month later and we still have not received anything. I dont know who they sent the money back to but it wasnt southwest.com or us. 4. we have called several times to find this missing money. No one seems to know where it went. 5. Just make sure you check the bedding, that is my final warning. You will not be compensated. You will not know whos hairs and whatnots are on the bed. They do have free airport transfer to their hotel, although they DONT TELL YOU anywhere.
user_name:
Julie D
Tampa, Florida, United States

review_body: Clean, cosy, and ideal as a cheap alternative, does need a lick of paint but apart from that it's fine, staff were great most accommodating, bit noisy outside on a Friday and Saturday night, guess the locals living it up lol, but all other nights were fine, ideally located 5 mins from Times Square, the free WiFi and breakfast were great, would definitely consider using again

Hotel is more of budget type. Rooms are very small, but have everything you need. Staff is helpsam. Very good thing is that they serve breakfast as I am used in Europe. Breakfast has a good quality and is aincluded in praise.

The rooms are small (as to be expected) and a little noisy (again should be expected, but bring a long white noise and it's easily fixed).The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff made the experience amazing. We expected the rooms to be small because it was so close to Time Square but the staff far exceeded any expectations. We arrived before check in and staff held our luggage securely so we could go grab lunch which was helpful. Also the night before our last day both my toddler and I became ill Anita the housekeeper helped to clean up the mess from our daughter and did so with a genuine and caring attitude, she was so sweet to our toddler the entire time we were there but even more so after our daughter got sick. The front desk staff Pranay and Jasmine were also helpful the entire stay and were more than willing to give suggestions and help. The staff at this location were all excellent!! We are a military family and the military discount is what originally drew us to this hotel but the staff is the reason we will make sure to suggest this location to any of our friends who plan to visit NYC.

Stayed here with three friends around Christmas time. There were four of us in total, with two rooms. Upon returning from dinner, the extremely rude front desk employee stopped us from going up to our room. Apparently she had been watching us on the security cameras and noticed that we would all get together in one of the rooms to hang out. She said only two people could ever be in a room at any given time, and if she ever saw more than two people enter one of the rooms, she would call the police (!!!)We were a very quiet and friendly group of people. We even asked if we could upgrade to a bigger room but she said all the bigger rooms were sold out. I've never experienced this kind of absolutely unforgivable attitude from any of the hundreds of hotel employees I've interacted with over the years. Avoid this hotel like the plague. No hotel should threaten to call the police because you want to spend time with the people you're staying with.

A last minute decision to visit the city for Christmas brought me back to Econo Lodge again. The location and price can't be beat. The rooms may be extremely small and basic but the bed is comfortable. The bathroom is also small but serviceable and CLEAN. Thank you to Jazmine at reception for her friendly welcome.

Absolutely brilliant hotel, in the heart of Times Square. It was very clean and the bedroom although very small was cosy and had a very comfortable bed and pillows great night sleep! Staff were fantastic, very friendly and attentive. When I next visit New York I'll definitely be staying here again!

This is a fantastic small hotel in a great location. Jasmine and Agi are so helpful as were all the 'guys' (staff)which made our stay delightful, they all make you feel you are the only guest their. Breakfast was perfect. I cannot praise everything enough. The only downside is the size of the room and standard of décor. For the price you will not find a better hotel/location. To put this in perspective Christmas 2015 we stayed at The Plaza, New York, a totally different hotel but the next time we come to New York we will be booking Econo Lodge again. Thank you for making our stay enjoyable and special. Debbie & Steve Smith. 3rd December - 9th December 2016.

We stayed at this hotel 5/12 till 9/12 with my sister The hotel is a small central hotel with friendly staff who will do anything for you Rooms are small and basic but very clean and the bed is very comfy which you need after a long day shopping.We will definitely stay here again

The staff at this hotel were lovely. The hotel is clean with fresh towels when requested! The rooms are absolutely tiny. 2 suitcases and 2 adults made the room feel even smaller. It was a great base for New York! The breakfast in the morning does though there isn't enough

Camere piccolissime, sporche, entrando nel bagno troverete dei tappi per le orecchie.. poi capirete il perché.. da evitareRooms very small, dirty, entering the bathroom you will find the earplugs .. then you'll understand why .. to avoid

Location is excellent and easy walking distance to theater district. Hotel is clean but small. Rooms are very small with about 18" between end of bed and wall. Rooms and bath are clean. If you're visiting during the heating season, there is no individual heat control in any room - temperature is central controlled. Hotel is adjacent to 8th Avenue and lots of traffic and emergency vehicles which equals noise. Staff is very friendly and continental breakfast provided. Price is right for NY, especially if you're not spending much time in your room. Needs updating.

Let's cover the good things first. Location is hard to beat, tons of things to do within easy walking distance. The staff is friendly as others have pointed out. The beds are comfortable and the shower was powerful. However, I have stayed here twice now and I never plan to return. When people say the rooms are small they are actually being generous. Imagine a bed that extends nearly from wall to wall. It is actually impossible to walk around the bottom of the bed from the far side to reach the bathroom. You can see the floor, but the gap is only about 8 inches so a sideways shuffle is required. To make a little room on the near side, we moved the chair from the table and set it by the entry door so we wouldn't hit it every time we moved. We were only spending one night so we elected to live out of our suitcase (overhead carryon size) and having it open used about one-third of the available floor space. But the problem that really made it impossible to return again was the heat. There does not appear to be any available temperature control. There is an air conditioner with a remote control that might be useful in the summer, but nothing for the winter to allow us some control. And the room gets HOT. In the morning, we propped open our door to get cool air in from the hallway so that we could stand it. Overall, the shortcomings are just too large for me to return, the real geographic advantages just don't compensate for what seems like living in a hot jail cell, albeit one with a comfortable bed.

A friend and I stay at this hotel for four nights last week. The hotel rooms are very small but the property is immaculate. The location is great, the staff is the most friendliest and helpful of any hotel I have ever stayed in. Breakfast is included and there is always tea, coffee available plus cookies in the evening. Wonderful place to stay.

I live across the street from this small hotel and needed a place to stay while my apartment was being fumigated. I booked at the last minute so the price was high. If possible book it in advance to get a good deal. The bed was comfy (I had two beds actually!) and the room was clean. There's a bit of street noise but I'm used to that and they also provide ear plugs! It's a block from Times Square in the heart of the theater district. It is very close to a number of midtown attractions and so many subways stop nearby. This is a perfect little hotel for tourists. You will be right in the thick of New York life.

This hotel is incredibly good located, near times square without all that noise, you have a lot of restaurants and shops, actually just one block will take you to bus stop (hop on hop off) Price is not that high and it included a reasonable breakfast

Rooms are small but very clean. When we got to our room, it was really hot and the staff worked to get it cooled down. Limited space but we were never in the room but to sleep and shower. The staff was really nice, greeted us every time they saw us. The breakfast was good and included. terrific location, close to everything. Only con: the street noise. They are located a block from a firehouse and across the street from a bar. They provide you with ear plugs, however, it is still loud. I plugged in the air cond. fan and that helped block out some of the noise.

stayed here with my sister and two nices great places to stay could not be be more helpfull were great rooms are small but clean and near to every thing breakfast was good yes limited space to eat but ok sorted a taxi out to take us to airport great staff all of them yes i would stay here again

We have just returned from a 5 night trip to New York we stayed at econolodge and really enjoyed our stay. Clean rooms (yes on the small side but it's New York who wants to be in the room), red hot shower, great free wifi. Very Central location to Times Square, and broadway. We stayed on the top floor to be honest we were so tired from trying to cram everything in we slept like logs. Beds very comfortable and staff friendly especially jasmine on reception, Starbucks right across the street and lots of restaurants near. Would definitely book to stay here again.

Just back from a 5 day stay in the econo lodge. The rooms are small but all we needed was somewhere to shower and sleep for a few hours, the location is fantastic and just a stone throw away from all the major attractions. I was expecting to find it hard to sleep after reading the other reviews but we honestly we had no problem sleeping. Nice touch was the water in the lobby at all times as well as some coffee. The only complaint I have is on check out we left our bags there for a few hours and upon our return asked the same lady at reception how to get to the airport and she told us we needed to book it at least 1 hour before hand, she could have asked us earlier on in the morning if we needed to sort transfers anyway we were able to get a taxi for more or less the same price.All in all I would stay here again, it's got all the basic needs for a few nights stay and the location could not be any better.

Just got home from a trip to NYC. We slept or tried to at the Econo Lodge. The hotel is a few steps from Times Square, clean, rooms are very small. During the night there was lots going on outside, police, ambulance, so we couldn't get any sleep. But in the morning I understood why they're were earplugs in the bathroom.

We had wonderful time at the Econo Lodge. The hotel is perfectly situated in the heart of the Time Square and we got the best service from the hotel staff.They were very helpful before our arrive to answer us a questions. When we arrived they surprised us for our honeymoon and were very professional.We liked the room, even if it's small it's very functional.The breakfast was more than enough with large selection and great quality. They also provided coffee and cookies along the day which was a very nice touch.It felt really like a home more than an hotel and I think it's the greatest compliment an hotel can get from a customer

My husband and I stayed for three nights on a last minute trip before baby #3 arrives. Our first trip alone in 10 years! Location was excellent in regards to Times Square, 5th Ave shopping and Broadway shows. We didn't have time to do any sightseeing, as we went to a hockey game at Madison Square Garden (still not too far of a walk for being 7 months pregnant!), three Broadway shows and shopped the rest of the time. They gave me the room on the highest floor they had, provided ear plugs (which are actually quite helpful for the noise--can't be helped being so close to all the action--but not too close that we were right within all the noise), the room and bathroom were clean and the staff were genuinely kind and excellent. Upon check-in, we had Jazmine and she was the sweetest and kindest person who's ever served me. We had another guy the next morning who helped us with restaurant suggestions, but I can't remember his name (started with P) and he was very nice, too. The girl we had when we left was also very sweet. Even though the room didn't have a fridge, Jazmine told me that we could have just called the hotel directly to request that one be put in our room and that we could still do that at anytime for no charge. We didn't end up needing one, but good to know for the future in case we come back and need to store baby food or milk. There's a convenience store "Duane Reade" right across the street on the corner for any late night needs (we got a 3L bottle of water for $1.79 and yogurt twice). The fresh fruit (all day) and cookies were a nice late night treat (one night--we missed the other nights). I had originally picked this place due to price, location and the fact it included breakfast, but I slept in everyday past 9am (a real treat after all the walking) and breakfast is over at 9am during the week (10am in weekends, but we were there during the week.). I usually had a piece of fruit in the room with me, so it wasn't a big deal, but it was a great option to at least know there was food there if we got up in time. Many hotels don't have breakfast included. Wi-fi worked great (some hotels don't have wireless wi-fi). Phone calls to the US and Canada were free from our room, so the first night we actually called home to Canada from the room. We left our luggage to be stored for a couple hours the day we checked out so we could take in more of Times Square before we left. We would definitely stay there again! Thanks Econo Lodge Times Square

In general the hotel was very good, great location, near to go anywhere, the WiFi and the breakfast are included and were very good. The room, it's true that is a bit small, specially to open the luggage, but the bed was great and big, the bathroom very clean. The staff is very kind, they help you with anything you need. The only thing that I didn't like was the noise of the street, it's a bit noisy, the hotel should improve the anti-noise window system.

My daughter and I just got home we spent 5nights here and had an amazing time the hotel was so lovely very friendly and helpful staff our room was made up beautifully every day very clean really nice breakfast and hot chocolate every evening just loved staying here so close to Times Square it made our trip memorable. Rooms are small but plenty of room for us two and we were out most of the time and I must say very comfortable bed I really slept well and that doesn't come easy for me normally. Definitely going to come back to New York and especially want to book this hotel. Excellent wifi. Thank you econo lodge very pleased we chose you.

Just spent 2 nights in this hotel. Very simply put - if you understand where you'll be staying and what you'll be getting - you'll be happy with this hotel.Location - 8th Ave and 47th street. Right in the heart of city, literally 2 minute walk from Times sq.Rooms - We had a room with a king bed, and as you'll see in other reviews - tiny small rooms. There is a space of about half a meter between the bed and the wall. We had to be a bit creative with where we placed and opened our suitcases. BUT - when you come to NYC it is not to hang around your hotel room, right?Wifi - excellent.Breakfast - very simple and fresh. Bagels of all sorts, cereal, coffee & juice. You don't need more to start your day. In addition, they have fruit out all day, and at evening fresh chocolate chip cookies. Awesome.Service - Fantastic. The staff is super friendly, Checkout time is 12 and you can leave your suitcase in their office and hang around the city as long as you want.In short - if what you need is a spot from which you can literally get anywhere (10-12 minute walk to Central park, a subway station 1 block and 3 blocks away, times sq just around the corner) and you're not spoiled - go for it. You won't regret it.
user_name:
Liat G
Tel Aviv, Tel Aviv, Israel

review_body: The hotel was nice staff and easy too help breakfast was ok cereal cakes bagels coffee on hand all day you have your breakfast in the foyer near the reception desk bedroom was small toilet and bathroom clean television on the wall was hanging down not a lot to watch location was near to Times Square can be noisy at night with traffic and people going by overall not a bad way to spend in New York the encono is a popular hotel has so many people from around the world staying there

Booked this place last minute as my Airbnb host cancelled a 16 day booking 12 hrs before I was due to arrive. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. Yes, the rooms are very small, but the service more than makes up for it. Bottled water and fruit everyday, continental breakfast each morning, and cookies at night, it's the little touches that make this place great. Special thanks to all of the front desk staff, and Anita in housekeeping.

Location is key when staying new york and you cant get better than 2 blocks from the big red stairs in times Square. Rooms are absolutely tiny but if you are busy enough In new york then no more is needed as only in the room for sleeping. WiFi is great, breakfast was alright and served the job. I mean if you are looking for a bed to stay in for the night and very central then can't say 1 single bad word about this place.

Very satisfied with this hotel! The Econo Lodge is situated in a great location in New York. Every morning we had a lovely continental breakfast to get our day started. Rooms a little small but very clean and had excellent wifi service. The staff were very helpful especially Mr.Willie Howard III who was a perfect gentleman to us. Would definitely go back again!

Arrived on a Friday afternoon to see a show in NYC. I had booked a double deluxe room. It was so small that when you tried to walk past the first bed to reach the second bed, you hit your leg on a fitting on the wall. The window was tiny and the curtain did not stretch across to block out the street lights. The a/c did not work and it was much too hot to sleep. Then after I tried to cancel the second nights stay, the elevator broke down and wasn't repaired even when we finally checked out the following day. Our room was on the sixth floor and we had to walk up and down six flights of stairs. These two nights cost just under a thousand dollars and I just cannot understand how this hotel warrants such a huge amount ...needless to say, I would never stay there again!

The website described this hotel so nice and clean but when you actualy stay there for a night you see the difference. This place is not too far from time suare and not too hard to find. Outside there is a very small sign you can see it display econo lodge. The main lobby is tiny small space. The elevator is average speed. The room is extremely small, with double bed can hold 2 average size people, a small table. Bathroom is clean but tiny small. wifi is very slow too. The price is this average quality place is high only because 'location, location, location.

The rooms are extremely small, but clean. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. When we arrived there was a small problem with our booking, but they sort it out within a few minutes. Breakfast is basic. Tee/coffee/cold water and fruit are available 24/7 in the reception area The hotel is within easy walking distance from the metro (direct line to 9/11 Memorial), Port Authority (arrived from the airport with a shuttle bus), Broadway and Time Square. The name says it all: "econo lodge" - you get what you pay for. But remember you are in New York. Tourists should spend as little time as possible in their hotel room and enjoy this amazing city.

This experience was beyond disappointing. I understood that the hotel is small, the rooms are small, and I definitely didn't expect luxury, but I couldn't even imagine it being so bad! The sheets were stained, the pillow cases were yellow, I actually thought that they just didn't change the linens since the last people checked out. The carpet was dirty, moist, and the room smelled like an old basement. There was nobody to help us with our four suitcases, and we would've paid for that kind of service. I am usually very laid back, and try to look for good in everything, but the only good thing about this hotel is very polite and attentive staff . Anyway, very disappointed, and would never come back or recommend this place to anybody.

Slow elevator, extremely small room with a double bed, small window, desk and small dresser (very very small) but you can hang a few shirts...nothing more. But, you do not spend much time in there. Bathroom...small. The thing about here is the location. Great location and wonderful staff. Friendly, information and ready to help. You walk out the door to all New York has to offer. You are a 5 min walk to shops, restaurants and much more. Breakfast, enough to keep you going till lunch. Coffee, tea all day long and cookies for an evening snack. Great stay and would stay again.

Visited New York City for our first time, just my wife and I. Stayed in this hotel for three nights. It is right by Times Square, the location is literally right on top of everything. No distance to walk to TOTR or Broadway shows, we walked to Circle line cruises pier too. The room is very small, we knew it would be as we had already seen the reviews before booking. But it is clean and has everything you might need incl a safe and iron/board. Air con works well and is a little noisy but we turned it off at night. There is noise from the street at night but it's part of living in the City and didn't worry us. The staff were helpful and friendly, housekeeping came each day. I would certainly recommend a stay in this hotel, its location is fantastic, though if you are staying for a week or more the room size may get on your nerves

Pleasant staff. Very clean hotel and room. Comfortable bed. Very small room. We were there for one night with one small bag. If we had suitcases we'd have no place to put them. No counter space in bathroom for toiletries.

Upon check on at midnight, Willie was very accommodating after what seemed like an endless flight from Sydney to LAX and then on to NY. Willie made us fee welcome, answered all our questions and just made us feel at home. The room was very small but that was OK as we were only there to sleep. The room was very clean, the beds and pillows clean. Breakfast was a great way to start the day and afternoon tea was a nice way to come back and relax after being out all day. DJ was also very helpful in pointing us in the direction for theater tickets. Overall, if it were not for Willie out stay may have been a different outcome. Thank you Willie for making us feel welcome.

LOL – the smallest room I’ve ever stayed in however our room was clean, the bed & pillows were very comfortable, sheets were clean. The Lodge was very central to Time Square and it suited our needs to a Tee. We checked into the hotel bang on midnight, so a special shout out to Willie who saw to our every need, he made our night with how friendly and accommodating he was. Also another shout out to DJ who answered our neverending questions…he made our travelling through NY much easier. On the whole the staff were fantastic.Breakfast was yummy, biscuits at 3pm were delicious. Overall, I would recommend staying here for sure.

This is a great hotel which I highly recommended. We booked directly with the hotel and got a great deal. Had a high floor room facing the quiet side street. Yes there's a slight noise issue with NYC traffic but this is only because of the fantastic location minutes from Times Square. The location is incredible, can get to Central Park in 10 minutes and to Times Square in 2 minutes.Pranay on reception was great, he gave us tips on restaurants and things to do off the beaten track.The breakfast was great and free coffee or tea throughout the day was perfect.

Great little lodge in Times Square, clean, staff very friendly & helpful, it's great value for money.Breakfast from 6am-9am is basic but lots of it, eggs, toast, coffee, tea, cereals etc.....Only slight downside is that it's a tad noisy but hey listen you are in Times Square & this didn't tarnish our enjoyable stay one bit. They do provide ear plugs for sleeping if you want them but we never needed them. Bed was so comfortable & rooms cleaned daily, free Wifi too. It really was a great stay & fully recommended, we would defo return to this place if back in Times Square again in the future as it was great value for money & very friendly staff always makes any stay enjoyable.

This was probably the smallest room I've ever stayed in and there were a few issues with my stay...room could have been a little cleaner and the window covering didn't actually cover the whole window, but all-in-all it was a good value and a successful stay.

Very central, a stones throw from Times Square and perfect for general holiday needs.Very friendly staff, always willing to help. Special shout out to Willie, the man is a star! He made our trip special, such a nice and lovely man! Hope you enjoy your gift, you lovely man! My only slight problem! They have a 24 hour hot beverage service but it's only powdered milk on offer for tea and coffee, real milk is needed! Rooms clean and tidy, a tad small but useable.Overall had an excellent stay, we will be back!!

The hotel is a budget hotel so these are not luxury accommodations. The room was clean and well situated. You have exactly what you need for a good night's sleep and really what more do you need.I was there for a Broadway show. It took us five minutes to walk to our show and ten minutes to walk home because we stopped at a 24 hour gelato shop on Broadway.When we are taking a quick trip to NYC we will definitely stay there again.

Reasonably priced hotel in a tremendous Times Square location, just a few minutes from Broadway. Very welcoming and friendly staff. Traffic noise at night due to being at the corner of 8th Avenue. Double glazed, but the sound comes through the air con unit in the window, so bring your own good ear plugs as the ones they supply are not great. Would defo still recommend it for the reasons stated.

A budget hotel near Times Square in New York. Very friendly, welcoming and efficient male receptionist when we arrived late at night. Very clean , tiny cramped room, comfortable bed, noisy air conditioner, but good sleep overall. Did not try the continental breakfast . Day time reception staff polite, less friendly, efficient. Generally good value for short stay

My wife and I decided to spend our 7th year wedding anniversary at this hotel based upon other guests reviews. Our room was really clean and just right for the both of us. The location was in the heart of Manhattan close to all amenities, pharmacies, clothing stores etc off 8th avenue. The hotel was clean and well presented. The staff were exceptional in every way. I would really like to give a warm thank you to Customer service agents William III (night staff) and Pranay (Day Staff). These agents were really thoughtful and gave us over 100% time, attention and service. A big thank you guys. Where to finish, if you want a relaxed stay, in a comfortable room, with everything close by and staff who work beyond and over there expectations to make guests feel as if they never left home, Econolodge is the place to be. PS A big thank you, huge to Marjit and Ada who kept our room spotless on a daily basis. Thank you ladies.

We had a wonderful 6 nights in this modest hotel with very good free WiFi.The staff are VERY nice, always, without exception, always, greeted you whether it be the reception staff, the housekeeping staff or others, smiled and greeted you.Yaw was wonderful. His friendly welcoming smile, his willingness to make sure you had all you needed and his genuine interest in you, certainly made you feel welcomeand certainly contributed to the comfort of our stay.The hotel is quite old and nothing fancy but very clean. The beds are comfortable though the rooms are not huge but this is New York.Though our room was on a floor on the street side we were not disturbed by traffic noise.To be able to walk out of the hotel door and be in Times Square and Broadway in a few minutes was wonderful. The tourist buses were almost on the doorstep.There were also LOTS of restaurants on the doorstep. You were spoiled for choice. The complementary breakfast was more than adequate. Coffee, iced water and an ice vending machine were available 24/7. Some of the bigger hotels do not offer this.We were genuinely sorry to leave and we would definitely stay again.

I stayed at this hotel because I was meeting someone staying at a hotel nearby and wanted an inexpensive place in the area. The desk was pleasant, but the room had some drawbacks. It's disconcerting to open the door to a badly patched wall with a hole in it -- maybe an extra door lock that got pulled out??? Then the roman blind on the single window didn't actually go up -- there wasn't much of a view, but a bit of light would have been nice. The worst was that I had booked a room with a tub, and the tub valve would not close. True, they sent someone up right away -- but he could no nothing, and it wasn't fixed during my stay. Overall I think there were places that were equivalent in price that would be in better shape.
user_name:
tilda54
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Really enjoyed my stay at Econo lodge!The staff took great care of us- offering free cookies at 5.30pm, free iced lemon water 24/7 and complimentary tea and coffee around the clock.Breakfast is basic but delicious, with packets of instant oats, fresh pastries/bagels and cereal. Our room was very small, with just enough width for a double bed and two suitcases, but the maids gave us fresh towels and made our bed really well every day.The hotel offers great wifi and an amazing location about a 2 minute walk from Times Square, with a handy ATM and iPad in the lobby.So pleased with our stay here and would very much recommend it to anyone!Thank you Willie!!

This was my first stay here and I'd do it again every time I go by myself. The room is small so I can't see 2 people with luggage for 3 days or more staying here.The room was in good condition but there's no place to put your stuff, just a tiny table and a tiny closet.There's free wifi and free continental breakfast (coffee, juice, pastries, granola bars) which is unusual on most hotels in the area so that's a great bonus.Location is perfect near Times Sq and several subway stations.Staff is friendly

The hotel mixed up our reservation and we were put in a room with a full size bed for 2 adults We were co-workers and asked for 2 beds since we didn't want to share a bed. They said the rooms with 2 beds were sold out, yet when we made the reservation we were guaranteed we'd have a room with 2 beds. We were unable to comfortably sleep 2 adults in a full size bed so we ended up having to get a 2nd hotel somewhere else for my coworker. Since we prepaid for the room, they had no interest in trying to resolve our situation or give us a refund.

stayed there for 2 nights. very good location. room is small, very clean, comfortable. offers free cookies, tea and coffee in the afternoon. we had interaction with Katie and Willie. They were both very good, especially Willie. On our second day, we planned to leave the hotel early to join the day tour to Washington DC. When we got down, we saw that the breakfast is ready but then Willie said the breakfast starts at 6am. I said, it's ok, we have to leave at 5:45 am as the assembly time of the Washington DC tour was at 6:30 am, we'll just grab anything we can see along the way. And then Willie said, in that case, you just go ahead and grab anything you want. It's just a simple breakfast but it meant a lot. The night before our departure, Willie made a car booking for us to transfer us from the hotel to the place where we're going. We really had a very good experience staying there and will not be ashamed to recommend it to friends and colleagues.

Arrived at 9pm to check in, only to be told the room had a leak and we were being relocated to another hotel near the Empire State Building. This was an awful, stressful start to our holiday as our plans for that night and the next morning were in the Times Square area. Also annoyed that the first I had to hear about it was from the receptionist despite them having my email address. We rejigged our itinerary and went up the ESB that evening instead of what we initially had planned. The hotel we were moved to, The Paul, more than made up for the trauma of being unexpectedly relocated: we had an awesome view of the ESB from our bedroom window, a spacious room with a big, modern bathroom and a sumptuous hot buffet breakfast. We were hesitant to leave to check into Econo Lodge the next morning for fear it wouldn't be on par. It wasn't, alas. No view to speak of from our room, the room was a bit too small for two of us and our luggage, and the street noise was very loud at night, despite being on the third floor and using the ear plugs provided. We were given 20% off our first night, which was appreciated. The breakfast area was too small and often hard to find a place to sit and eat. Breakfast was not the awesome bacon and scrambled eggs we were treated to at The Paul - another disappointment, but we were prepared for it knowing that it was only a continental breakfast included. Amusingly, this review would probably be a lot more positive if we weren't inconvenienced and sent off in a taxi to a more awesome hotel for our first night. After that, it's hard not to draw comparisons. On the plus side, some of the staff went out of their way to make us feel valued and it is in an excellent location. I might stay again, although I'd be worried about getting another surprise when I check in.

We stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed our stay. The rooms are pretty small, but the location (5 mins to times square), free drinks (tea and coffee in the foyer whenever you want), free breakfast (continental) and staff more than made up for the room size. We particularly enjoyed chatting to Willie who mans reception overnight. He stood out as someone who is eager to please and ensure customer satisfaction. We would have no hesitations in recommending this hotel to family and friends.

Hotel rooms are clean, locarltion is fantastic ...30 sec walk from times square (even faster if you cross on a red light)Breakfest is minimal but satisfyingThe rooms are pretty small and will not be convient to elders,

Small but very comfortable room in a great location. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Have to highlight that the shower was outstanding! Only had 1 small issue - the noise. I was on the 2nd floor so I had lots of street noise, though the hotel provided ear plugs which allowed me to get a good night's sleep. In brief, I'd stay there again!

3 nights stay while visiting NY. Amazing location!!! Very close to times square and yet not in the middle so you can actually sleep! Very clean and well maintained hotel, stuff awesome and accommodating. Rooms are super small, I mean it and the only elevator for 6 floors is slow.Parking is at separate location and extra fee $40/night but this is normal in New York.All in all very good for the price and I WILL STAY AGAIN!

This hotel is perfect for anyone on a budget who don't spent a lot of time in the room and don't need much. It's more than adequate for those who want a private/safe/comfortable place to sleep while in NYC, with a complimentary breakfast, helpful staff and a great location, this is definitely a steal for mid-town. I'd stay here 100 more times.

I stayed in this hotel because I was attending a 3-day workshop for work at the Lyric Theater on Broadway. Overall, we had a comfortable, safe and clean experience. This is definitely a budget-hotel with very few frills; however, it suited my needs perfectly. The hotel entrance is not directly on 8th and is on a quieter street, which I really appreciated. You can see they care for their property from the pretty plants outside and welcoming atmosphere. I arrived very early on my first day due to a red-eye from the West Coast. The receptionist was very friendly, and while she couldn't accommodate an early check-in, she did give us cold water bottles and invited us to have breakfast which was going on in the lobby at the time. She offered to hold our luggage, gave us directions for some places to explore in the area while we were waiting, and then even personally called me when our room was ready to let us know we could come check in. The room itself was comfortable, clean and QUIET. Our room was right on the end by the elevator and we never heard anything! (Of course, it is near Times Square in NYC, so the street can be a bit loud from the window, but that's Times Square, people.) If you looked too deeply, you can see where there had been places where the walls had been repaired or there were dirt smudges on the wall that had been cleaned. However - this is to be expected, and you can see that the hotel staff had worked to fully repair and clean the area. Very clean bathroom, which is important to me. We had a Queen Deluxe room, and it was incredibly small (as are all hotels in NYC, to be honest). The room comes with a mini-fridge, small desk, armoire, flat-screen TV and air-conditioning. No closet. The bathroom was spacious for a room of that size, too. Not too many towels, but we called down and asked for more and they brought some up right away. I felt very safe the entire time I was there as well.Very few amenities, however, they do offer breakfast in the morning. Pretty standard European-style breakfast - pastries, coffee, fruit, cereal, etc. They also have hard-boiled eggs and some ham and cheese. Right across the street on 8th is a great cafe with breakfast sandwiches, though, so just go there!TIPS:-There's a great grocery store on 8th Ave about 3 blocks up. Stock up on snacks and store in your mini-fridge to avoid NYC food-markup!-Wake up early and stroll through Times Square before everyone wakes up. Most stores open at 8am, and you can beat the crowds.-The concierge was really nice! Just ask for what you need and they'll help you.-The ice machine is downstairs in the lobby!-Only 1 elevator for the entire hotel, so make sure you leave some time for that (or just take the stairs)-They do offer WiFi and it was so strong that I was able to walk down to the corner of 8th and Facetime with my family to show them where I was!Honestly, it was perfect for what I wanted and needed (my fiance and I attending a conference together in Times Square) but I think a family or two friends would be really tight in these rooms. If it's your first time in NYC, it can be fun to be so close to the action, but you might also stay uptown for a bit more space and peace if you aren't used to the city and don't just want to be in Times Square.

The Econo Lodge in Times Square was a fantastic visit for our 45th Wedding Anniversary. The room is extremely clean, rather small but adequate. We are in NY for the cultural experience and not to stay in our room all day. The continental breakfast had a variety of fruits, bagels, muffins, cakes, cereal, coffee, tea and juice. This breakfast gave us fuel for the entire day. Willie, at the front desk gave us helpful tips for navigating NY. You can tell that he loves his job because of his attention to detail. The location of the hotel is ideal-we were right in the middle of the excitement of Times Square. This hotel is a precious gem that everyone needs to hear about. We plan on making this our hotel of preference every time we visit NY. You guys ROCK.Fort Myers FL visitors

So end 7 days at the Econo Lodge and as pointed out by many people , small rooms, but clean, tidy and the best staff going. Always a smile and very helpful with plenty of advice of what to do and where to go. Booking onto airlines and need your boarding pass, that's no problem as they will print for you in the lobby. No one person can be signalled out as all great but if you come say Hi to Willie on the front desk. Top man

This hotel is excellent. With brand name comes many amenities and I prefer this very much to the no name hotels found in the area with similar pricing. We got a really good rate deal on this hotel for 8 nights and our stay was wonderful. Yes the rooms are small but so is every other hotel in this area, and NY is for sightseeing not staying in all day anyway. Cleaning staff was very friendly and did an amazing job. Lobby always had water and breakfast was very good every morning. Best part was the very friendly staff, especially Willie Howard, who usually works the night shift. He is by far the best hotel staff I've ever come across all the times I've gotten a hotel. Very charming fellow who always took the time to ask how's everything going and very pleasant to chat with. Make sure to go by and see and talk with him, you won't be able to forget about him even after you leave :)

Indeed the room is small but you are in New York city one street away from Times Square so il is totally normal. The room was really clean and the bed is so comfortable! Everything we needed was there. The toilet and the sink blocked on our first day but we could use them without any problem. The service was really good, the breakfast simple but just right. The parking is not so expensive and near the hotel. Just to make sure you have the right parking adress because the employee gave us the wrong one, and it can be long looking for a parking in Times square with the trafic. The adress: 271 W 47th between 7th and 8th at the corner of the 8th. The wifi is excellent.I recommand the hotel!

I really liked this hotel! The location was awesome. It is close to times square and many shops and small restaurants. The room was small but very accommodating. It had a window with a view of the city which is what I really loved. Great things such as free Wifi and breakfast is a PLUS. I felt comfortable and welcomed by the staff especially one in particular: there is this guy named "Willie", and he is such an awesome person. If you need any info about anything, he is the guy to ask! His attitude was very welcoming and such a respectful person.

I booked a last minute trip to New York, and found a room available at the Econo Lodge Times Square only 3 days in advance in July. My 15 year old daughter and I stayed there for 4 nights for $122/night with a AAA rate. We arrived around 10am, and it was too early to check in, so we left our luggage with the front desk. We came back around 1:15pm to check in Room 410. The room is very small, but it's fine for 2 people for a short stay. There's a small closet with 2 shelves, which we didn't use. We kept our clothes in our small rollaway luggages that we lined up in the hallway. There's a small desk. There's an air conditioning unit. Other reviewers complained about the sound, but the sound for us was fine. It was more white noise that helped reduce the noise from the business outside. The room and bathroom were clean. The bathroom had basic toiletries – shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, as well as two sets of ear plugs. The TV was propped up on one of the corners of the room. The bed was very comfortable.What I love about the Econolodge is the location. It's central and close to everything. Just a block from the Richard Rogers Theatre, where we were seeing Hamilton, and it's just a few blocks from Times Square. I also love the free wifi and the free breakfast in the morning. Breakfast is served Monday – Friday 6 – 9am, and 7 – 10am on weekends. Breakfast included hard boiled eggs, yogurt, apples, deli meat and cheese, bread, bagels, pastries, donuts, mini muffins, cereal, instant oatmeal, coffee, tea, and orange juice. There are about 5 tables in the lobby, and we never had a problem finding a table.Just around the corner is a souvenir shop with reasonable prices. Nearby places to eat is Carve on 8th Ave open 24 hours, sandwiches & pizza, salads, and desserts. There's also Amorino Gelato on 8th Ave. Ippudo Westside for excellent ramen. And Patzeria Pizza on 46th Street.When we needed to print out our boarding passes, all I had to do was email them to the front desk, and they printed them for me free of charge.The lobby always had ice water with lemon, coffee, and fruit (usually apples), which was nice to have.Unfortunately, my daughter left her iphone charger plugged in the wall next to the bed, and the maid didn't see it. And it wasn't turned in to their lost and found.

The room is incredibly small.Window does not open.Breakfast was poor and had almost no diversity for a 7 day period.Very good position, near Times Square.Ok wi-fi connection.Kind enough to let us keep our baggage until late in the checkout day.

VERY expansive for this quality of services. In fact, the rooms for 2 with one bed is so little, it's impossible to sleep with an other people on this bed. The curtains were too short for the windows, and the light of the day coming directly in the room.No special room for breakfast, we had to take our trails in the room, and eat on the bed. Dispite of that, the location of the hotel is very interesting, and the staff is very nice and lovely.

Our hotel room was the smallest we've seen, but we were prepared for it from reading TripAdvisor reports before arriving, so it was manageable, with space to leave two large cases open. The room was clean. The television, clock radio and phone were not working on arrival but were fixed when requested. The included daily breakfast was most enjoyable and the staff were all friendly and helpful. We enjoyed a regular chat with Willie, who was on night duty and was always friendly and helpful. The location was excellent, being a minute's walk from the Gray Line Offices (where we took three tours), Times Square and all the theaters. It was also great to be in central Manhattan, as we walked to attractions north and south . There were shops, supermarkets and a myriad of eating options all around. The price per night was not cheap, compared with others hotels we visited across the US, but was good value for Manhattan.

We were so impressed with the Econo Lodge Times Square. The rooms were small, but spotlessly clean and the staff were so nice, friendly and helpful. We will definitely return to it - what a find. Included in the price was free wi-fi, continental breakfast which was more than adequate and also free calls to Canada and the U.S.

If you're looking for a no-frills hotel room 2 blocks from Times Square, this is it. The location is great for pretty much all NYC tourism. The front desk staff was nice and accommodating.But, as you can see in my photos, the rooms are SMALL. I was told we had a queen bed, but that was a full at best. The bed is so close to the wall that I had to turn to the side and shuffle my legs sideways to get away from the bed. The bed BTW, was actually pretty comfortable.Overall, it's a place to stay in NYC without busting your bank. And in NYC, you shouldn't be spending time in the hotel anyway.

As everyone has pointed out the location is excellent. Walking distance to major attractions, just off the beaten path and so close to the subway. The rooms are small but clean. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The breakfast included in the room rate is just right to get a long day sightseeing going I. The right foot. We will come back!

Over all the plus points for this hotel out weigh the negative ones.Clean hotel, great staff, great location and adequate breakfast fare, are positives.Negatives1 Noisy but this is New York so to be expected. 2. Small rooms but you are out all day exploring so no great problem3 we were not made aware that breakfast items could be warmed.One thing to consider for anyone using a wheelchair, the accessible rooms really are not that good.One of our party occasionally has to use a wheelchair and so we booked the appropriate room, the room we were allocated had rails in the bathroom etc but to negotiate around the room and bed to access the bathroom would have been impossible.We are from the Uk and this room would not have passed accessibility critera

It's close to time square and restaurant row. The rooms are small and very clean. The hotel staff are very friendly...only thing is it noisy at night outside, but it's not the hotel's fault...I thought something was up when they supply you with ear plugs, but it still a great place to stay .

We stayed there for about a week and booked it keeping the location in mind because we had our convention at Marriott Marquee. Rooms are pretty small though that's with every hotel in Manhattan but for the price it's not really worth it. There are several other hotels with a lot better services and ambience and at Same or lower price. So, this could be a good choice if you don't really find a better space.

Perfectly located. Very good price. Rooms are very clean. Deffinitely would stay again. Im not much into walking and this is very close from times square and train stations. Received an excellent service.

Econo Lodge management should give these guys a raise or at least a gold star. I’m a native Brooklynite transplanted to the south. When we visit NYC we often stay in Brooklyn and take the train to the city to save money. From now on I will stay at the EconoLodge Times Square. The location, price, efficiently arranged room and included continental breakfast made this a perfect choice to make best use of our sightseeing time. Arriving at Penn Station with friends unfamiliar with the city, it was an easy walk to the hotel where we were welcomed with a friendly smile, cold lemonade, fruit and cookies. I warned our friends that NY rooms were small – all of the economical ones anyway. However, this one was the best layout we have ever had anywhere near this location. A small wardrobe closet, suitcase rack, & functional desk and nightstand fit neatly into the space. AC worked fine. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Husband didn’t even snore.It was very clean, sparkling new tile, good towels, shampoo, hair dryer, iron & board, even bottles of water. WiFi was free and fast. Restaurant suggestions from the staff were perfect for our needs on different days. Street noise was minimal on 3 of our 4 nights. Sirens on Saturday night would have been heard from anywhere. It is Manhattan after all.

Yes, the rooms are tiny. Yes, the rates are higher than in many other locations. Yes, there is a lot of light and notice outside. BUT we found the location to be perfect - within walking distance of many sights that we wanted to see. The room was clean and smelled fresh. Breakfast was uninspired, but adequate to keep us going until lunch. We were extremely impressed with the helpful, friendly staff. If I were to return to NYC, we were consider staying here again.

This hotel had a really great location, that is indisputable. However my best friend and I were disappointed with most other aspects. Number one, the room was absolutely tiny. Tiny. My friend and I stayed for 5 nights and we could honestly hardly fit our 20kg cases in. One of us had to stand on the bed to get changed because there physically wasn't enough floor space for the 2 of us to dress. The hotel also failed to mention that a $100 safety deposit is required which took us by surprise on arrival as we had not budgeted for this, and being two young girls on an average wage, definitely felt the absence in our spending money, even though we did get it back on the last day.
