Another thing was our room was literally just across the road from the fire station and while earphones were provided, we were still awoken many times during the night with sirens going off practically next door. The staff were not rude or abrupt but were also not particularly friendly or helpful. Just neutral. My friend and I ate cold breakfast 4/5 mornings because your staff didn't mention there was an option to toast things behind the desk and only found out due to another customer requesting so. Overall it was abit of a disaster, although as mentioned it was very central and the room was clean.

We stayed for a week and there isn't anything negative that I can say about the hotel or staff. I was very impressed. The rooms are comfortable, clean and homely with air conditioning. The location is perfect! Central to everything you want to see. Staff are very helpful and approachable. Breakfast included in the price. Would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to family and friends,

The staff at this hotel are fantastic! It was hard to believe I was in a hotel. The location is centrally located to everything. The free breakfast, WIFI and gym are added benefits you can't beat. The rooms were small but immaculate and clean. I am definetely stsying here again. You can't beat it!

Our stay for 5 nights here has been flawless. It's an amazing location, 1 block from Times Square, not far from Central Park and also close to shopping spots. The staff here are 1st class and can not fault them at all. A special mention to the 3 staff on Wednesday evening who helped me out when I had a disaster with a clothes tag! They couldn't do enough to help me out. Service like this goes a long way. The rooms are very clean suitable for a stay in the city. Will definitely come back in the future.

Stayed at the hotel for 6 nights in May 2016, it was excellent. The reception staff were excellent and really helpful. Really good breakfast in the lobby before busy days. Room was small but clean and comfortable, all you need in NYC. Location was perfect for getting to everything, times square and beyond. There were so many good places to eat if you go around the streets near the hotel and stay away from times square. Excellent bar directly opposite as well. I'd stay again for sure.
user_name:
Steven322
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed here in a double room with my 3 kids while in NYC. The rooms are tiny. TINY! With 3 kids in such a small space Im not sure Im crazy enough to do that again but I would stay here again as a couple. The service was excellent. The breakfast was simple but filling. And the location was PERFECT. We were literally 3 blocks from the heart of Times Square. Thank you Econo Lodge staff.

This is probably one of the best hotels for tourists that are looking for a place to just get some rest. The reason it is so awesome is the location combined with the pricing. It is literally one block away from Times Square, which means it is pretty much a walking distance from almost all of the tourist spots in Manhattan. Also, it was about 60% of the price of other hotels we looked at in Manhattan. We were there for 3 days and 2 nights and ended up benefitting from the close proximity on all 3 days - each day we made a quick stop back at the hotel in the evening for a couple of hours of rest before heading back out at night; which I doubt we would have been able to do had we stayed in say, Brooklyn. It is also just a 10 minute walk away from the inter-state bus station (PATH).The staff was very courteous as well. They let us keep our bags at the front desk on the third day after our checkout, and even let us use the restroom of one of the unoccupied rooms after we finished sightseeing on the third day, before we had to catch our bus out of New York. This effectively ended up saving us an extra day of booking, since we were leaving New York in the evening and did not have to carry our bags with us on the last day's sightseeing, and since it was so close to the bus stop and most tourist spots, we didn't waste much time in going back to the hotel to pick up our bags.Like some other reviewers mentioned, the rooms are in fact small, but we didn't mind that one bit, since we just needed a place to rest, and the location, service and rates offered by this hotel allowed us to have a wonderful stay in New York.

We booked 2 queen rooms for two nights in May. We booked them, in person, at the hotel in Times Square in March, and the front desk woman assured us that we were getting the best AAA price! We looked forward very much to taking my Niece for her first trip into NYC. When we checked in they had me initial an sign that the rate is what we agreed to, and we went exploring. Well, it turns out that the rate we paid is $60 per room per night MORE than the highest rate on their website! When I voiced my objection to the desk the old guy assured us the manager would call me at 10 a.m. the next day. She didn't. It was not until we checked out that the manage spoke to me and basically said tough luck you sign for the rate! Horrendous customer service. They were apparently unaware that had she even mad an effort we were looking to book a further 3 trips to their location later this year! I am advising all of my family, friends and clients to avoid this place! In future we will spend our money where it is appreciated! Not good EL! Not good at all!

I loved the location of this hotel. Times square was 2 blocks, a Duane Reade and Starbucks across the street. I walked to all of the theaters I had tickets to. It is in a very safe area and in the heart of the theater district. They also had a small continental breakfast which consisted of hard boiled eggs, choice of cereals, bananas, apples, toast, baked goods. They even got me a cereal that was gluten free upon request. They always had ice water, coffee, and fruit out for your taking throughout the day. There is free wi-fi which is a bonus in Nyc. I arrived early and sat in the lobby for 3 hours. They did their best to get me a room as soon as one becomes available. Please note: there is no bathroom in the small lobby. Sometimes if they are not booked they have a room available for the bathroom. This was somewhat of an inconvenience but I just went across the street to Starbucks. The elevators are very slow. The rooms can be noisy (they provide earplugs). I wanted to take a nap before a show on the first day around 3 or 4, but it was too loud with trucks, sirens, etc. even with earplugs. I also asked for a room not facing 8th ave as that is the loudest. The other mornings were o.k. except when they were patching the street right in front of the hotel. I would suggest asking for a higher up room, not facing 8th. Just be prepared for a looong elevator wait. Oh, also there is only an ice machine in the lobby which was a pain for me. Now for the room. It was very clean. I was by myself or else I would have no idea how 2 ppl would fit. There was not enough room to even walk around the bed, you can do it but is VERY tight. Your legs would be touching wall and bed trying to squeeze by. I have stayed in small NYC hotel rooms, read reviews for this hotel, but never expected it to be this size. If you have a problem with small enclosed spaces, I would not recommend this hotel. I might stay here again if I get a good deal like I did last time. If there is a hotel within the same area and same price I wouldn't choose this one only based on some factors listed above.

Location of this hotel is fantastic. Our room was adequate but in need of decoration. Our daughter and her husbands room was very very small. Rooms was cleaned every day and fresh towels left. Breakfast was ok but not consistent in what was available. Majority of the staff were great. However there was one who I found rude when I asked to use the phone she wanted me to stretch the phone wire between three people having breakfast and couldn't understand why I wouldn't! There was one staff member who was exceptional from even before we left the UK! Prior to leaving the UK I had an issue with my booking and the emails from Willie were very courteous and helpful. Willie worked nights whilst we were there and it was a pleasure coming back to the hotel to be greeted by him. We would stop by each night and he was genuinely interested in our daily sightseeing. He was helpful, courteous, had excellent customer service skills and always went above and beyond. He was always cheerful, forever had a smile on his face and is a credit to your hotel. I am surprised he has not been snapped up by one of the larger hotels in New York. Well done Willie - do not change as you were great. If you are ever in Liverpool give us a shout!

Meh. That's all we can say. The location is great and the prices was acceptable, but the hotel offered nothing in terms of services or amenities. I might stay there again, but surely there must be other inexpensive hotels that offer more.

We had a great stay here, location was perfect. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Staff are all very friendly and very helpful. You get free tea and coffee all day. Breakfast was great I had a bagel everyday and kept us going till lunch. It's just a couple of blocks away from times square.

We stayed here for to attend the Broadway dance parade and festival. The staff at this hotel is amazingly helpful and nice. Although the rooms are small they are clean and comfortable. The breakfast was just what we needed to get something quick and be able to get going in the morning.

Found his place hotel "shopping" - excellent 2-night deal, clean, safe, nice staff. Room is very small but I am here for a theatre weekend so how much time am I in my room anyway! BUT, here's the key: location, location, location. No more than 4 blocks to any of my shows, a Starbucks on one corner, 24-hour drugstore on another. I will definitely come back.

Went to NYC this past weekend. Called late Friday night to ask what time our check in was. Explained we would be arriving early and were told we could leave our luggage at the front desk until check in at 3:00. Called early Saturday morning while on our way to double check that we were booked for a stay. Showed up and were greeted followed by "there's a bit of an issue". The issue was that we supposedly didn't CONFIRM our reservation before 8am. They booked our room for someone else. Yet, econo lodge took it upon themselves to book a room for us at a boutique hotel 20 minutes away. The entire reason we booked the time square location was for convenience. It does not make sense to me to use the excuse of we didn't think you were coming because you didn't confirm, yet we booked you a room with another hotel. Bottom line is that was an excuse. Nobody told or mentioned to us that a confirmation was needed the two times that we called only hours before we were expected. The front desk receptionist kept asking us "what would you like me to do". That was a bit irritating. Luckily we found a room at the Westin with a much better location, much better atmosphere and environment for only $60 more. We asked the front desk receptionist to cancel everything and release our holds for the security deposit, since we were going to stay elsewhere.  To top it all off on Sunday when we were getting ready to check out and pay I checked my bank account and Econo Lodge had charged me for the rooms that we didn't even stay in!!!!! I cannot express my full frustration with them through words. Thank goodness we were able to book at another hotel otherwise they would have ruined our entire trip and we would have had nowhere to go. Econo Lodge has definitely lost business from myself and the 3 others in my party.

We stayed 2 nights here prior to a more extended stay for a bonus trip with my company, and every staff member that worked in this hotel was incredibly friendly, courteous, and willing to assist. The breakfast was nice, the room was clean, the location is perfect, and the price was incredible. Econolodge TS, we will be back, and we will highly recommend to others. Kudos on living up to your other reviews, and keep delivering great value and service :)

If you've ever stayed in a premier inn/travel lodge in the UK, thats the size of room you'll get, small by American standards, perfectly adequate for anyone else. Staff were friendly and helpful when needed, rooms were clean and well cleaned every day. We paid for basic but good and got basic but good, what more can you ask for?

If you don't want to spend a lot of time in your room then the hotel makes an ideal choice. Our room was very clean. Although it was small there was still space for a wardrobe and safe. complimentary wi fi was good to. I thought the complimentary breakfast was perfectly adequate, cereals, yoghurt, bagels, bread, ham and cheese, pastries and juice. Tea and coffee are also available 24 hrs a day. I would stay here if I wanted to be near Times Square again

We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the theatre we were going to. The added benefit of being a block and a half from Times Square was a bonus. Sitting on the bleachers at night and people watching was the best!! This hotel has tiny but clean rooms, for a great price and in a perfect location. Staff was attentive and friendly. I would recommend this hotel and will definitely stay again.

Terrible hotel!Rooms are small and dirty, old shower . Almost every day we had a clogged toilet.Employees are not very nice, specially employee named Willow who shouted at us when we arrived late at night for check in ( because our flight was late).Stay away!!!!!

After reading all the reviews about this hotel on TripAdvisor I decided to book here for my stay in New York (7 nights). I wasn't disappointed. Yes the rooms are small, but cosy, my room was on the 6th floor. Wasn't in my room much, as I was out most of the day. The bed for me was very comfortable and room was very clean. I did use the ear plugs twice to block out the street noise, mainly sirens. The staff are very friendly and will help you anyway they can. Breakfast is included. It consisted of two choices of cereal, different pastries, cakes, cheeses, bread and fresh fruit, I am a really healthy eater, so didn't eat breakfast here. There is tea, coffee, water and fresh fruit available 24 hours a day. I was able to refill my water bottle and take some fresh fruit out with me each day. The hotel is very close to Times Square and other places of interest. I would recommend this hotel if staying in New York. I really enjoyed my stay here.

The econolodge hotel reasonably priced with rooms that are small, clean and cosy. The bed was very comfortable.The staff are friendly and helpful. There is some road noise but not excessive, afterall, it is New York, and the roads are packed most of the time. The hotel itself is quiet.The continental breakfast was ample and sustaining. A Coffee Machine was available in the foyer 24/7 and iced lemon water too. would I use this hotel again, the answer is without doubt a resounding YES.

Clean and comfortable. Hotel is in a great location.,close to Times Square and several Subway stations. Rooms are small, i was only in the room to sleep so the small size was not an issue. Staff where friendly and helpful. would stay there again.

This is a clean, fresh smelling budget hotel. Very well located. I booked through Hotwire and payed less than $150 for a night. Ended up upgrading to a room with 2 beds ($80) which put us on the front of the building looking out on bustling 8th Ave & up 57th to Times Sq. Noisy but the hotel supplies earplugs that worked well. The front entrance is very humble w/ 2 runty Charlie Brown Christmas trees flanking the doorway. Once inside the staff is very friendly. Fruitbowl in the lobby was full & fresh. Provided breakfast was simple (bagels, yogurt, juice & coffee etc.) and good. Starbucks is across the street, as is Carve sandwich/pizza/ bakery - which was also good. Small room & bath but comfortable, no in-room coffee, have to go to the lobby. Not romantic, not for honeymooners or stylish businessmen. Too small to bring the whole family. Perfect if you are heading out to Madison Sq. Garden for an event or catching a show and don't want to spend a fortune on a hotel.

I loved my stay at Econo Lodge. The room was cozy, the bed was SUPER COMFY! Everything was clean, the staff was helpful and I was in walking distance of everything from Times Square to the subway. I saved a lot of money by staying here, I recommend it to anyone looking to visit NYC.

just come back after a great time in York ,hotel was basic and small, but the bed was so comfy ,breakfast was good and 24 hr tea available,just one block from times square and other amenities ,but must not forget the excellent staff on reception JAGEED , ASKME (AGI) STEPHANIE, and the other employees always willing to help and advise which was great, loved staying here will definitely be back next year , I am still talking about fab time we had in general and the excellent staff well done to you all

The hotel is located in the heart of theater district. The rooms are clean. Nice breakfast served.The service of the hotel staff is excellent. The price is more than fare for the whole package. The only thing you should expect - very compact rooms....

I stayed here with my boyfriend for valentines in 2015, the staff were extremely polite and helpful. The room was small but we didn't mind as we just wanted a place to put our head down at night. Very reasonable price and complimentary breakfast every morning (tea, coffee, crossaint, ham, cheese, cereal etc.) I would definitely recommend this place to everyone, it's only a stones throw from times square

My wife and I were looking for a convenient place to stay near Times Square, and boy, was this convenient! Only one block away and a straight shot to the TKTS booth!I have read a lot of the reviews about how small, noisy, etc., etc., etc., the hotel is, so just let me say this up front... The name of the hotel has "ECONO" in it for a reason!!! If you are looking for a swank, spacious room that you are going to spend a lot of time in (though I never understand why anyone needs a huge room if you're not going to be spending a lot of time there!), then this is NOT the place for you!Our room was small, but the bed was comfortable, clean AND quiet, despite being near the corner intersection. The continental breakfast was just right. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and allowed us to leave our small luggage in the office after check-out, since we didn't have to leave for the airport until the early evening.I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for an affordable hotel room that is convenient to all that makes the city an exciting place to visit!

We stayed here for 5 nights last week and it is in the most amazing location. Minutes from Times Square which means 42nd st subway and its connecting lines along with port authority bus station are within 5 mins walk. Clean, tidy, friendly staff and a nice little contintenal breakfast. Rooms are very small but for the location and bargain of the price it's ideal. Would stay here again if doing NYC on a budget as more money for Bagels!!

Just stayed 3 nights at the Econolodge Times Square this week. In short, if you value a clean room, a hot shower, a comfortable bed, a New York-affordable price, and friendly, helpful staff, this is the place for you, If you need a standard sized hotel room with lots of room to move around or a dish network that is 100% reliable for your tv, then head elsewhere.We came to see a b'way show and go to NBC studios. No cab needed....wonderful location!! Excellent service from the staff.Would definitely stay here again!

Got a really good deal here by booking direct with the parent company - Choice Hotels - a year in advanceOnly a minute or two from Times SquareMore than happy with the facilities here - good range at breakfast considering the space they have to work with, bed was comfortable, everything was clean, everything worked, GREAT staff across the board.....what's not to like?The only quibble - not having a kettle in the room - is softened considerably by having 24 hour availability of coffee & hot water in the lobbyI will most certainly consider Econo Lodge Times Square for when I return to New York!
user_name:
David H
Broadstairs, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I am from Australia and have stayed at the Econolodge 6 times since 2011. My first stay for approx 18 months as I was disappointed with a booking dispute. I am glad I did return though. As everyone says, the location is great and rooms small etc. But staff from Assistant GM Kathy down will look after you. The Hotel has had some improvements such as increasing the eating area on ground floor which is a plus and breakfast menu has improved. We ran out of hot water a few times but manged ok. I will certainly look to Econolodge if I return to NYC

So handy to Times Square and not to far to walk to Central Park in the other direction. We arrived just before 2pm and our rooms were ready for us to go into. We had a few laughs with trying to fit the 3 suitcases and 2 cabin bags as well as two people into the room but it is what you make of it. I had stayed in New York in a budget hotel before so had an idea of what to expect. The rooms were made up every day and were very clean. The staff on reception were very good and knowledge of the surrounding area. One day i was heading out to hire a bike and my wife was going for a days shopping. When I headed off the reception staff gave her all sorts of places to go shopping at good pricesWould recommend and would stay here again

We booked this hotel for one night before leaving on a cruise. The price and location were great for what we needed. We booked a queen room, which was small. Did I say it was small? We could barely fit our carry-on luggage in the room. It would be a great room for one person, but two people made it really tight.The person at the front desk during the day was not very helpful or customer friendly, the the night person was.A great place to stay if all you need is a bed and bathroom in a this location.

I gave 5 stars and this is clearly not a 5 star hotel but hear me out...Everyone here was great. Yes, rooms were not HUGE. Yes, the TV's weren't the clearest. But, the staff was simply amazing. The beds were comfortable and the vibe was top notch. If you are on a budget and looking for a spot near Time Square, this place is perfect! We slept for 10 hours no problem.Ask for Kathy who I believe is the hotel manager. She is amazing! I'm on my honeymoon and my wife is pregnant. We have a long story but basically we made it late by a day to NY. We booked the hotel as non refundable and she set us up at a 4-star sister hotel at a discounted rate and applied our room credit over there. Kathy, thank you so much! Also, shout outs to her staff, a gentleman whose name started with a P. Also another lady who worked this morning 3/22. She was also extremely helpful with transportation and helping us out. We will definitely be back and can't thank Kathy and her staff enough.Look guys, it's not a 5-star hotel and resort. But if you are looking for a clean, safe and amazingly located hotel... Stop by here! The service is a 10-star.

I have stayed at this hotel perhaps 10 times in the last 10 years. I will never still here again. The breakfast has improved and the larger rooms are fine. The room was clean. The location is close to Times Square. However, the smoking policy needs enforcement. The guest must agree with the smoking policy at check-in, but I returned to my room at mogjt and smelled that strong skunky marijuana scent.. I had to keep the window propped open and the bathroom fan on. Smoke bothers my nose and throat. Then the next day I went to a performance at Lincoln Center and nearby audience members noticed that skunk smell which was emitted from my shirt as the room heated up. A little girl kept asking her mother about the horrible smell. I couldn't concentrate on the performance. I will not stay in a hotel which has any smoke.I also noticed that the Irish bar across the street had closed, but there is still a lot of noise. I can usually finally better rooms elsewhere in Manhattan, and the subway system is fine for getting around. Also, this is the only hotel that I have stayed in throughout the US that didn't have PBS access.

We stayed here for one Saturday night in February. The cost was great at less than $200 for the night and it was right off Times Square, excellent location! Room was clean and cozy but SMALL. By far the smallest hotel room I've ever seen. We could hardly squeeze between the end of the bed and the wall to get to the other side of the bed and we are small people. But hey, it's New York, there's not much space to work with. We did not experience any noise from within the hotel but the outside noise was quite loud (mostly sirens). The hotel provides earplugs in the room which are convenient and definitely needed. But again...it's New York, it's bound to be loud out there. I don't fault the hotel for that. Basically if you're just looking for a cheaply-priced hotel in a good location with a bed and shower, this works perfectly. Just use the earplugs! :)

Location Location Location. Rooms are small but adequate AND CLEAN with private facilities. A great deal for 7 nights and close to all you would like to see in Mid Town/Times Square. Walking distances to Columbus Circle Lincoln Square, Central Park and close to subway lines, especially TImes Square for transport to other attractions. Having been to NY before we knew what we wanted to catch on this trip and the locality was easy walking down to Hudson river Circle Line ferries and the High Line through to Chelsea. And the staff are cheery and extremely helpful.

didn't pay to much to stay here its in an excellent location right by times square,yes the room is small but we only slept in there and got ready in morning.very clean, tv with american channels, it is noisy sirens all night but its new york ! staff are friendly and helpful, felt very safe here 24 hr reception.

I stayed at the Econo Lodge for 6 days in February as part of a holiday package with British Airways. I knew it was not going to be 5 star as the price reflected that, it can be very expensive in some of the large chain hotels in NY. Firstly I want to say how clean this place is I am fussy about that sort of thing and found Econo Lodge spotless. The sheets and towels were clean and the bathroom spotless none of that mould around the grouting as you sometimes see. The Housekeepers made the room up daily and you could get clean towels or a change of sheets by leaving a card on the bed. The room is very small but adequate for me as I was travelling alone, there is a double bed but I did wonder how you get two suitcases in the room and two people would struggle to hang up clothes in the minute wardrobe. I was there to sightsee so lived out of my suitcase which fitted on the luggage rack supplied. I suppose two people would need to put the suitcases on top of each other. The room is a bit dated and tired looking but if you are only there to sleep this is not much of a problemThe facilities are good, free WiFi which is really unusual in NY and also a free buffet breakfast which is also rare in NY hotels. It consisted of the same stuff every day. eggs, cheese, ham, fruit, bagels, choice of cereals and pastries,and fruit juice, sometimes it was impossible to find somewhere to sit to eat it so I took it to the room probably at least three of the days I was there. Also very welcome was the constant supply of tea and coffee in the reception area, I found the de caff coffee ok and it saved me money on buying coffee. The staff are very helpful and answered my questions about directions and queries well, the maintenance man was also helpful, my telephone was not working so they offered me a late checkout as compensation which was nice. The shower had hot water every day and the room has a wall mounted TV with a limited amount of channels. There are points to charge, laptops and phones.Now the not so good bits - I know this is not the hotels fault but it is situated right on Times Square it is noisy all the time not only with traffic but people swearing and shouting, the location is fantastic and I was able to walk everywhere easily, but I did need the ear plugs which are in the room to sleep especially the first couple of nights, I did find leaving the TV on helped to block out some of the noise and made it easier to fall asleep. I realised just before I left that the hotel does have white noise machines which you can request. The problem is that the windows are not fully double glazed and I can see why as this leads me to the other issue - heating. There are no heating controls in the room - it is either on or off - when I arrived the room was like a sauna and I could not work out how to open the window and had a really bad nights sleep. The maintenance man opened the window for me and for reference you need to stand on the window ledge and pull the top section down (this is the bit that is not double glazed) Once I knew this it was much nicer in the room. If you ask at reception they do turn the heating off but then the room can get cold - its a difficult balance as you cant really control it. Secondly the curtains do not fit correctly and the gaps can let in some light this didn't really bother me but it could others.Overall I would stay here again, it was a good price for NY, the breakfast and great location all were important for me. Please don't expect luxury as you wont find that here but if you are going to be out and about all day and not in the room other than to sleep I would recommend it. I stayed in room 312.

The hotel is very well placed and it may explain the price. It is an expensive hotel, considering the standard. The room was clean but very worn. Also as small as it can get. Better heating of the room would have been nice during winter season. Cold!The service was good and the friendliness of the personel was very nice! I valued the complimentary breakfast.

Firstly I checked in late and was greeted by a lovely lady porcha. And made me feel right at home from the get go the room was small but its NYC so you kinda expect that there is free wifi throughout the hotel and great it was a little noisy but again its NYC so didn't really bother me the room was cleaned every day and to a great standard your housekeepers truly are an asset. mu bed was made everyday and bins emptied I think the room would of been more than suitable for a couple coming to new york as your there for the city the nights where very cold even for me living in south west england but the heating was great lovely and warm room another plus point for me was there was plenty and I mean plenty of plug sockets to charge my macbook and my camera battery and even usb charging ports in my room to charge my phone and tablet which I though was a great touch there was coffee and tea available downstairs at all times which was great coming in from the cold. On check out the lady on the front desk looked after my bags for the day so I didn't have to carry them around before being picked up from the hotel she let me use one of the rooms to get sorted for my flight home which was very helpful. overall I was expecting a corporate average which I would of been happy with but my experience was more than I could of expected and very helpful and people I met saying In another hotel told me they didn't even get wifi in there rooms. I was very happy with my room was very function and will defiantly stay there again when I can next come to NYC

Stayed here mid week in February when the price was about the same as the average roadside Econolodge price. At that price it was just about worth it: tiny, cramped room, portable AC left in the open window so every street noise went straight through - garbage trucks early in the morning etc, door slammers, but the clincher was getting up to find no hot water despite running the water for 10 minutes, so I ended up taking a freezing cold shower mid February. Lovely.I've seen prices in the two hundreds for this place at peak times of year. If you pay those prices for this place, you're just paying for the location and nothing else.
user_name:
MisterGulliver
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: OK, so we didn't want to spend a lot of money and it was close to Times Square and the Broadway Theaters. The room was tiny. I had to climb over my suitcase to get around the bed. There was only the smallest armoire, with 4 hangers and one tiny drawer. The curtains ended about 4 inches above the window air conditioner. The lights from the building across the street were blinding. We pinned a towel to the bottom of the drapes. There is no thermostat in the room. The first night it was so hot, we had the air conditioner on - in January. The third night it was freezing. We called the desk and they brought us a small heater. "The whole floor is on one system and it isn't working." The best part was the sparkling clean bathroom. The staff were very nice and breakfast was ok.

The front desk/reception area was great. We had gotten there too early to check in so the front desk attendant was very helpful in getting our bags checked while we wandered the city. We actually came back to grab a few things and she was nice enough to let my mother use a bathroom from a room who had been recently been vacated. We got through the check in process pretty quickly and upon stepping into the elevator that is when I knew we were in trouble. Run down and ridiculously slow. Got to the room and immediately regretted everything. The room was no more than 300 sq. feet. Bathroom was a an okay size but you can tell this was a renovated apartment building. But to the most important part: YOU CANNOT CONTROL THE THERMOSTAT. You are forced to call the front desk who wasn't helpful at that point since the heat was still somewhere in the 70s. So then we opened the window. To which we were met with a barrage of swear words and racist slurs; among the group not directed toward us. I'm not unaccustomed to such behavior however, when trying to nap after a red eye flight, I was beyond displeased. So we closed the window and turned on the air conditioner. MISTAKE. It was extremely loud and with how small the room was, it became freezing so at least that functioned just not the way we needed it to. Moreover, it was probably a fire hazard that the cord drapes over the heater but at that point we were over it.I understand cancellation policies but at the front desk we were met with, "My manager is on the phone and she'll be busy. I can't refund your second night." Excuse me? We're a customer with an issue that you can't solve, so get your manager. Ridiculous. The manager did refund our second night and at that point we were willing to pay to not stay at this hotel and opted for a $50/more room at the Marriott a few blocks up. 2 hours for $99. Awesome...not.Lesson learned. If you pay $99 at this place expect the service of $10 room.

Econo Lodge is a delightful small hotel in the Times Square area of NYC. We stay here whenever we come to NYC for a show. It is clean and the breakfast in the morning is plentiful. The rooms are small but cozy and clean.

Pros:1) Location - The location couldn't be beaten. It really doesn't get much more central than this - one block east to 7th Ave @ Times Square, 3 blocks to a small subway Station (50th St), and 5 blocks to one of the biggest stations in New York (42nd St). There's nowhere in the whole of the 5 boroughs that you can't easily connect to from Econo Lodge2) Cleanliness - the hotel was clean and well-presented throughout. Housekeeping was undertaken daily3) Staff - we didn't need their assistance much, but they were nevertheless friendly and helpful4) Wifi - free, fast and reliable5) Breakfast - very basic (we only ate it once), but FREE. Guests can also help themselves to tea and coffee 24/7Cons:1) Size of rooms - FAR too small, even by budget NYC standards. Even though we only used the room to shower and sleep, it was still uncomfortably small for two adults. For example, there was nowhere to store a suitcase without tripping over it (we had to place it on top of the wardrobe), and you can't walk around the bed without doing a little shuffle in the process. If you're planning on doing a lot of shopping in NYC, leave it until the end of your trip, because you'll have nowhere to store it in Econo Lodge!2) Heating - the rooms (including bathroom) are way too hot. Heating is controlled centrally, so you have no control over the heating in your own room, meaning that two radiators to heat one very small room and one small bathroom are almost always ON. This created a stuffy and dry atmosphere, even though it was very cold outdoors. The small aircon unit did very little to combat the intense heat from the radiators. I did ask for the heating to be turned down a little, but it wasn't done.3) Noise and light - I'm not a novice NYC visitor. I know that it's very noisy almost 24/7. However, I've stayed at other Times Square hotels which manage to cut out the noise a LOT better (i.e. by having decent windows). The old-fashioned features of Econo Lodge mean that the building is quite ill-equipped to filter out most street noise. Being only a few steps away from busy 8th Ave, be prepared to get very little sleep (the hotel provides earplugs for this reason, but they can't fully block out NYC sirens and car honks). As for light - the curtains aren't long enough, so leave a 6-inch gap between curtain and ledge, into which sunlight streams early every morning :(I'm a lover of budget and mid-range hotels. My basic criteria is 'bed, shower, toilet', and I don't expect much more than that. However, Econo Lodge was TOO small (coming from someone who only ever books small, basic rooms), and the heating issue made my stay quite uncomfortable.Unfortunately, I wouldn't stay again. Only the location and the good price saved the day.

Although the rooms were bijou they were all we needed to shower and sleep and be right in the heart of the square. Our rooms were clean with freshly laundered towels and bed linen. The decor a little tired and it was a little noisy with only single glazed windows the ear plugs helped. With the unseasonal warm weather the room was stifling so we had the air conditioning on the whole time we were there.The staff were very helpful even got us some dollars off our trips. The breakfast had something for everyone and the complimentary beverages were a real bonus. On checkout we were able to leave out luggage safely at reception while our party went out to take in a last look at this vibrant city and at no extra cost. Thank you Ecno lodge staff for helping to making our trip so enjoyable, keep up the good work.

The rooms are small, only just enough room to squeeze past the bottom of the bed, but they were very clean and the towels were changed daily. The staff were very helpful and friendly, even charging my Husband's phone for him when we realised we had no adapter plug. The breakfasts are the continental sort but there's a reasonable choice. You have to eat breakfast in the reception area which is only small. The Hotel is located about 100 metres from Times Square in a relatively quiet side street and there's a lovely Irish pub, with reasonable prices about 50 metres away.

After reading the reviews I expected it to be small but was ok with that. I was very happy with the staff they were very nice and helpful. The breakfast was amazing, way more options than I expected! The room was small but who cares. It was clean. For the great location it was an amazing deal. I will be going back.

Hotel is in a fab location but if your looking something special don't book it. .room was so small you couldn't walk around the bed..no room for suit cases. ..I mean tiny. ..plus in need of refurbishment big time. .breakfast was pathetic. ..so apart from the location there was nothing more to like. ..

My husband and I spent 10 days in NYC. We just got home today. The hotel is in the PERFECT location. Everything is so close by: subway stations, bus stops, theaters, restaurants, etc. The room is small but exactly what you need for a vacation if you're planning on spending a lot of time sightseeing and not much time at the hotel. It was also very clean. The breakfast and wifi were good and it's a plus that they were included with the room. Pranay checked us in and was so nice and helpful during all our stay. Thank you for everything! We are definitely planning on coming back soon!

I have made reservations in this hotel but I came to hotel around 3 pm, they said the room are not ready ! then I waited more an houre . Moreover the guy in information desk asked me to pay double charge and I tried to show the confirmation email details but the guy refused to acknowledge! and he tried to trick me by using some unacceptable way then I decided to call (Budget) travail agency and complained to them then they called the hotel informed the guy in information desk to follow the confirmation email details , they really first time I see kind of customer service like this and it was really a terrible experience !
user_location: Virgin Islands National Park, St. John
user_name:
AMER A
Virgin Islands National Park, St. John

review_body: The hotel is well situated for Times Square. I think the name of the hotel suggests what it's like but it was cheap, clean and the staff were brilliant. Nothing was too much trouble. There was a complimentary breakfast but as there were only three or four tables to sit at many guests took the food back to their rooms. Considering the location it wasn't too noisy even though we were given complimentary ear plugs!. I would definitely consider a return to the hotel if I go back to New York.

We enjoyed our stay here. It is small- like a botique hotel. There is a decent breakfast. I like that anyone entering the building has to pass the front desk. Thre are good a/c fans for quiet "white" noise. The heat is questionable. I think it is central for the building. In order to cool off room open the window if the heat is too hot! lol old school. Very nice staff. Excellent location. Parking nearby at a discount. Location overall is perfect, but a little noisy on street, staff provided earplugs!. We would come back.
user_name:
MRFRIENDLY
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The staff was awesome and they do offer baggage hold for check-in and check-out. Rooms are very small but managed to share with my 21 y/o daughter and all of her clothes just fine. Great location - I really recommend the New York Pass with Hop On Hop Off Bus ticket too. Breakfast was adequate, a toaster would have help but they have boiled eggs, oatmeal, bagels, pastries, fruit, cereal, coffee and juice. Some complained of noise but it didn't bother us. Great location close to shows, Times Square and there is a Walgreens right across the street, the Gray Line Tour office is also next door to that. If you head the opposite direction of Walgreens to the next block, turn left and you'll see Galaxy Diner - good breakfast there as well.

Great midtown location. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Rooms may be small but they are adequate for showering and sleeping. Continental breakfast provided. Would return. In the heart of the city, close to great food and fun.

This hotel was good for several reasons: located in walking distance from port authorithy train and bus station, times square, and macys herald square. Every morning there was a Free continental breakfast with toast bagels patries boiled eggs and coffee. The receptionist at front desk was knowledgable of area and able to refer good food options and directions. The room was small to mid size with view of other office buildings nice clean an comfortable. Overall hotel was clean yet very small an tight open areas as lobby. The hotel is convenient to local grocery, sandwich shops, and a gas station.As for pitfalls this area is located on a side street near a major express way so you had to pay close attention to crossing the street also it is hard to get a taxi in this area so be prepared to pre book taxi or use uber. While staying there i noticed the staff did not use gloves when handling food at continental breakfast which i mentioned to manager which was then corrected at that time.

My wife and I had stayed here on our vacation during the Thanksgiving holiday, the hotel employees were very friendly and helpful, When we had questions they answered them, we were greeted every time we entered or left the hotel. The hotel itself is located in a perfect location, We had purchased the New York pass and the bus stop for the New York pass was located on the corner of our street, the hotel is located a block from Times Square which is a bonus because there are tons of restaurants and attractions around. There is a Walgreens across the street from hotel. Our room was small but very clean. There were sirens and loud sounds throughout the night but that's anywhere you stay in the city. The negatives of our stay was that the elevator was broken part of our stay and that the phones didn't work during our whole stay. We really didn't need the phone during our trip because of cell phones. But the elevator was kinda an inconvenience when you are 5 floors up.The hotel could use some cleaning up from the outside. Besides that we had a good experience with this hotel.

Rated this hotel a 4 instead of a 3 because it really is a great location despite the tiny, simple rooms.Pros: Much cheaper then other hotels in the area;Ideal location near Times Square;Clean lobby and rooms;Bathroom is roomy compared to room size;Free cookies in lobby and water & chips in room;Friendly, helpful staff.Free breakfastCons: Smallest room I've ever seen.Noisy overnight, but they do provide earplugs in the bathroom (should have used them)Breakfast is extremely basic and they didn't have a toaster.We would stay here again for the value and location.

Great location. The rooms are very compact. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was good, fruit and pastries and cheese. Because of the location you will be aware of noise at night. I would stay here again price and location and staff make this hotel a great place to stay.
user_name:
Peter C
Thornton Cleveleys, United Kingdom

review_body: You couldn't wish for a better location: 5 mins to Times square. We enjoy walking and the hotel was convenient for both North and South Manhattan. The breakfast had a great selection and they have tea and coffee available all day. The staff were very helpful and the rooms despite being small were very clean. We would stay here again.

Wow, this has got to have the smallest rooms possible that can fit a double bed. Everything was clean and quiet enough with our sound machine running. There is no thermostat control; the room felt cool when we checked in just before 3pm, so we worried we might be cold at night. But they turn the heat up at night and if anything I was too warm; I am sensitive to the cold, so this isn't a complaint, but it could be an issue for some . Our room did have a window air conditioner with manual control, so you can cool the room of needed. Overall this is basic barebones accommodation, but perfectly fine if you don't plan on spending much time in your hotel room. The staff was courteous and friendly.

My wife and I were unable to stay at our usual 'CHOICE HOTEL" and so decided to give this location a try. The rooms are as to be expected very small and dated but the bathrooms have been updated and are as good as any I have experienced. Great water pressure and immaculately clean and bright. Unlike other hotels there is good light and so was able to read etc with no issues. The breakfast (included at CHOICE HOTELS) was well stocked. With limited space we were told to feel free to take our selections to our room, We had a few minor issues when we first arrived and they were handled quickly and to our complete satisfaction. The entire staff (especially Porsha) were outgoing and helpful and very friendly. And you can't beat the location. We spent 4 nights there and will go there again.

Great location to visit the city. Rooms are clean but really small and old furnished. The staff is nice. Breakfast is minimum, although you'll have free tea and coffee all day. For that location it would be difficult to find such a budget option (but at the same time expensive, but it is New York city!)

This hotel is OK if you stay for a couple of days cos the rooms are so small .I new this before we went but I didn't think they would be that small . but the hotel is in a great location and is very clean .breakfast was basic but done the job .the best thing about this hotel is the staff they were all so helpful and polite .if you told them what you was doing or where you was going they gave you a map and pinpoint where you are going I'd like to thank all the staff for making our stay enjoyable

The hotel seemed newly renovated and was a comfy and clean hotel itself. The staff is friendly and helpful, nothing but smilin faces. It's barely more than a block from Times Square and very conveniently placed by Port Authority. Across the street is a Duane Reade and a Starbucks. The hotel was a highlight on my trip and I will most definitely stay again.

I was extremely pleased with my stay. The highlight was how helpful and kind the staff were to me. My phone was stolen during my stay in New York and the staff did everything they could to help me. This included letting me call my family on their phone and showing me where to buy a new one etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York. It has a great location and very decently priced. The rooms are cosy and good for solo travellers. Overall, my stay was quite enjoyable.

like other travelers,we found the rooms to be incredibly- almost comically- small,even compared to other hotels in the same area,but that being said, it was spotlessly clean,had great water pressure, and all the staff were extremely friendly,helpful and courteous,but a special shout-out to Porsha-- she made every evening like coming home to an old friend! The breakfast area is also very small,but again, everyone is so pleasant,it makes it much easier to accept. Would consider staying again.

Decided to try this hotel out to be closer to where we were going and loved the location. Clean hotel, clean room and nice, helpful staff. The room IS tiny so don't expect to be able to move freely about. There was only my daughter and I and she had to climb over the bed just to get to her side. However, when all you want is a clean place to sleep and clean up, it's perfect...and lets be real, that's all you really need in the city. The only thing I didn't like was the hold for almost $400 put on my credit card prior to arrival after I asked when booking if that was their policy and told it was not. After calling and discussing it with them, they made it right when I checked in so kudos for that, just be aware of that policy when making a reservation. I would definitely stay here again but do feel like the rates are a tad bit higher than comparison hotels.

what a let down, the.room was tiny and the bath an absolute joke.had to hold my stomach inevery time i passed the bed to go to the toilet.had a great view of the local very noisyfire station.only one lift in the building.very small breakfast area and the food was below average.good location though not far from times square and central park.bookedthe holiday through a well known travel agent, will not do that again.definitely not going back there the hotel ruined a holiday to a great place.

Sure, the rooms are tiny! It's NYC (on a budget)! But this property was clearly recently renovated and is so clean... The staff are very friendly. We had the lovely Alejandra welcome us and was frequently there during the day to greet and guide us. Oscar was also so kind - helping wtih breakfast, getting luggage to the car and giving directions. In our short time there, they seemed like friends! The hotel location is ideal - a short walk to Times Square/ Broadway and then off-Broadway a short walk the other way. TKTS booth about 2 blocks away! Hotel is actually located in Hell's Kitchen - known for great food. The parking garage Econo Lodge has partnership with is maybe 1/2 block and at $30/night for our mid-sized car was a pretty good deal. Breakfast bar really small and not many tables to sit at (lots of competition), but they utilize this little space the best they can. Iced lemon-water and coffee always available. Breakfast bar contained the usual: toast, some pastries, granola bars, fruit. Sometimes yogurt. Love that they had protein: Meat & cheese and some days also had hard-boiled eggs. My mother and I shared a queen-sized bed for 4 nights without a problem. Fridge in the room was useful, not just for the obvious, but also for extra counter space. No, you can't dance in the room, but I didn't come to NYC for the fantastic views of the room!!  Definitely would stay here again. Clean, convenient, adequate breakfast and fabulous staff!! thank you so much!!!

When I first walked into our room, I could've cried - it was the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in! You struggled to move around the bed and there wasn't anywhere to put clothes or anything. However, we had everything we needed, room was clean and tidy, breakfast was fine and the location great. For three nights it was ok. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Try Patzeria Family and friends in the next street for a great meal at a decent price

This hotel really is in a great location, one block from Times Square and situated between 2 subway stations. The rooms are small but perfectly clean. Free breakfast is always a plus! The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Special shout out to Oscar, he was always happy and smiling. I would stay here again

Rooms are tiny not small, but clean, would have liked more storage space.Staff was kind and helpful. Breakfast was good. throughout day there is fruit available as well as water. I would have liked to have a restroom in the lobby. Extremely slow elevator.The price for our stay was rather high could have been because the Pope left the day we arrived and President Obama was in New York during our stay.

Your paying for the location that's really about it rooms are clean but small and simple your in Times Square so you really can't complain welcome to the craziness and excitement of New York !! I must mention that parking is pretty much a no go here but there is a parking garage close by so don't worry your not completely stuck

Stayed over Columbus weekend for NY Comic con and to see some shows etc. The location was great as was only a few blocks from Time Square and Broadway and 15 min walk from the convention centre. It was a small room but since it was only me for the price I did not mind as I was really only there to sleep. The only issue was there was no instruction book for the safe but I called down and they sent someone up within 5 minutes to show me. You do get some limited calls so I was even able to call home for a few minutes without being charged. Would recommend it for sure.

Brilliant hotel the staff are very helpful and friendly. Rooms are small but everything you need,wardrobe, desk, bedside cabinet, television, phone, comfortable bed ensuite all clean. There's even a free safe in the room. There was a good choice of buffet breakfast tea coffee and juice & fruit. Tea & coffee available all day in the lobby. Plates & cutlery were disposable but this is probably to keep prices low. The hotel is in an excellent position for sight seeing the tour buses are right across the road. Times Square 5 minute walk two streets from Broadway about 20 minute walk to Central Park. All in all excellent place to stay for sight seeing and great value for money. You could pay more to stay in a more upmarket hotel but why when you have all the comfort here and really how much time do you spend in an hotel when you have all that sightseeing & shopping to do.

If you are looking for a hotel minutes walk to Times Square,a few minutes walk to Hell's Kitchen,around the corner from the "Hop On,Hop Off " buses,extremely clean rooms,comfortable bed,tons of hot water for showers,excellent continental breakfasts ,reasonable prices for the area and amazing staff-this is your hotel!(no-we did not find it noisy at all.)If you want a 5 star at double-triple the price...keep looking!This is a great place! The basic room is small,but manageable. The slightly higher priced rooms on the higher floors are even better-if you can-get these.All rooms have an in-room safe.How rare-there are 2 bottles of FREE water and a bag of chips upon your arrival in the room(did I mention FREE?)The lobby has cold lemon water and granola bars and coffee/tea/hot chocolate all day.Continental breakfast has the usual pastries,but they also have boiled eggs,2 types of cheeses,deli meat,yogurt,fresh fruit ...it was great!The desk staff are always friendly and helpful with directions. Special notice of Oscar-amazing guy!We will definitely be back!!!!!

Ther are some pretty mixed reviews about this place. In short, you get what you pay for. Location wise the place is fantastic and the staff are extremely helpful and courteous. The size and general tired condition (of our room so presumably most other rooms) will likely not appeal to all guests... It was incredibly small but served its purpose as a place to sleep and shower.Although breakfast is included, dont get too excited as the choice is minimal and served in the narrow hotel lobby area with seating for just 12 people at a time. This was very dissapointing so we only opted for this on thenone occasion and chose to use other nearby cafes for breakfast ( there are several really good ones just a few steps away along 8th Avenue).

After dealing with the madness of Times Square, my boyfriend and I weren't left with the best impression of NYC. The staff here turned that experience around. Every member of the staff was friendly and had good advice about the city. I have not had service that good, or a hotel room that clean, since I lived in Orlando and worked for Disney. Kudos to everyone at the Econo Lodge Times Square!

As its name would suggest, the hotel is basic, with small rooms, but the location is excellent, and the staff were really helpful and friendly. It is 2 blocks from Times Square, and even closer to a number of theatres, and the upmarket bars and restaurants on 9th Avenue.The room was cleaned daily to a high standard, and despite its size, was a great base in a busy trip. The bathroom amenities were very good with a fairly powerful shower, and the room had a free safe and good quality WiFi.The hotel is only metres from 8th Avenue, close to a fire station, so it could get very loud, but earplugs are provided, and even without these, our sleep wasn't disrupted at all.We were usually out early in a morning and ate on the go, however the breakfast did not look all that appealing, and there did not appear to be a wide choice of items. Also, the lobby area looked very crowded at breakfast time as we were heading out, and I think we'd have struggled to sit anywhere had we been eating there.Overall though we were very pleased with our stay, and would definitely stay again. It is no frills, but it was great value for money given its location.

The room is very clean and the beds / pillows are very comfortable. The continental breakfast was good too. Sure the rooms are small but rooms in NY are small. Years ago I stayed at the Wellington, a higher end hotel, a few blocks from here and I would come back to this hotel. The location is great too a couple of blocks from Times Square and the Subway. The front desk people were very friendly and helpful. You can't go wrong staying here.

Me and my sister have just stayed here for 3 nights and we had no sleep at all you mite as well sleep on the street the noise from outside was terrible can hear everything the rooms are so small you can open the door while sitting on the bed we couldn't even get clothes out of case no were to put them its that little in the room's only good thing about it was ye right by times square would never stay here again

I stayed in this hotel back in January with some family for what we paid I couldn't complain really don't get me wrong the rooms are tiny but if your looking for a base to explore the city then it's great, they are clean and well presented the hotel is just a couple of minutes away from Times Square you couldn't ask for more we barely used public transport (not that we could if we wanted to everything was closed due to the snow storm) and was able to walk everywhere, the staff where amazing especially after getting stuck in the city overnight due to the travel ban in the snow they all still had a smile on there faces and was happy to help with anything, all in all an excellent hotel to explore my faviroute city would defiantly stay again

Stayed here for a week on our honeymoon, the hotel is in a ideal location as it is only a 2-3 minute walk to time square. Size of the room was small but we expected that but it had enough room to sleep and to put our luggage down on the floor. Was happy they offered a safe in the room which you can set your own code to. Breakfast was an okay selection but very limited seating. Only negative I would have to say is that they charge you to use the computer & to print documents so to just go on the airline website & to print our boarding passes it was about 6 bucks on my credit card.

Staff are friendly and helpful, rooms are cleaned daily but minute in size. We could not unpack properly had to leave cases intop of bed while gettin ready etc as floor space was tiny. Air con isn't that great - very noisy. As we expected to city to busy busy and noisy I hardly slept all 4 nights we was there windows don't shut properly so all noise leaks in. Did not use my credit card anywhere accept for a deposit hold during our stay at the hotel, was back 5 days in to UK and my credit card was cloned. Contacted the hotel to tell them and was ignored. Food at breakfast is average and you have to fight for a piece of fruit, no seating area unless you arrive at ridiculous hours.. Have to stand and eat cereal from a paper bowl. I know I have mainly been negative about the hotel but all in all was good value for money, staff couldn't do more for you, great location.Thank you :-)

What a great place to stay in NY, right in the middle of it, yes the rooms are small, but it's clean, the bed is comfy, breakfast is basic, but a good starter for your day. The hospitality of all staff here was brilliant, nothing was too much trouble for any of them, this was a pleasure to come back to at the end of our busy days, would stay here again, keep up the good work.

Awesome service at this little gem, so closely situated to Time Square! Well done to management and team. Staff were so helpful and accommodating. Facilities were awesome for the price and location. We will definitely return for a more extended stay in the near future!

Well what to say. We arrived at jfk airport and taxi's to the hotel cost $69 this is a fixed rate but please note they can only take 4 passengers. We went with another couple and a friend and we're staying in new York for 5 days.The trip to the hotel took 45 mins. Traffic is chaos. Please note driving in new York looks terrifying and you need to be very experienced if you want to take that on. To describe the hotel well I would compare it to a travel lodge in the U.K. Checkin was quick but please note there is a $100 deposit. PAY CASH (due to issues I had with my credit card) The rooms are very small and we had a room with 2 double beds in it but they are tidy and fit for purpose sleeping. The hotel do supply ear plugs you will need them. New York at any time of the day is busy and very noisy.. The room has air con and isn't controlled by the hotel it is very cold but noisy so if your a light sleeper this place will not be for you. The room has a safe and the hotel provided bottled water. Now to talk location well that for me wins it. The hotel is a 5 min walk into the heart of time squarely is close to subway stations and close to many of the big attractions. Very morning between 6am and 9am they do provide a continental breakfast pastries,fruit,coffee tea juice etc very nice little addition to the very good hotel.The hotel does look dated and the lift isn't the best but overall this is a great hotel. The wifi is poor if your on the top floor but the lower you are the better the signal is. It's very good in the lobby. Would I stay here again yes I would even with the issues I had the manager Kathy was excellent in helping us out.

Got back home yesterday after a great time in New York. Hotel was fantastic, yes, rooms were slightly small but for the time spent in them they were fine. Excellant postion, near subway and times square. Good to have the offer of a breakfast and time to spend talking to others staying there. Couldnt' fault the staff who were friendly and helpful. We will definately stay there again and recommend it to friends

My wife and I stayed here on a recent trip to the city. The location is great if you want to see a show in the theater district. We walked to many wonderful restaurants, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, and the Library. The room is slightly larger than a postage stamp. I truly believe that a patron 7' tall would span the room. The room had a small desk, a small armoire, a small night table and a bed. The bathroom was cramped as well. Still, I am not complaining, just want you to know what you are getting. The staff were very helpful - until I lost my phone headpiece in my room - then it couldn't be found. My bad for losing it in the first place. The complimentary breakfast was surprisingly substantial. Bottom line - I would gladly stay here again. If you are a traveler who likes to spend time lounging in your hotel room this is not the place for you.

We found this hotel to be in a great location and we were able to walk to almost everywhere we wanted to go. Just a block and a half or so from Times Square. Our room was very clean and the staff was nice and helpful. The rooms are very small, like you would find in Europe but we did not spend much time in the room, so it didn't matter to us. Cleanliness was most important. It can be a bit noisy in the area so if you are a light sleeper, this could be an issue but they do provide ear plugs. The only thing I didn't like was being charged $2 to print our boarding passes. Never had to pay before at any hotel. But that being said, we certainly would stay here again without a doubt.

I stayed one night on August 2, arriving around 9 p.m; I checked out the following morning after breakfast. The room was adequate for this purpose. My room was fine for a solo traveler, but if I were traveling with a companion I would pay for a larger room. This time it was ok for a comfortable bed and a shower for the night.The room had most of what a guest needs on a short stay, including a hairdryer and an iron for pressing clothes. Space is very limited, bu the furniture is equally compact to fit the space. The bed was very comfortable. My room had a window overlooking the street, instead of a brick wall. The room was clean enough (the sheets appeared clean, but I did see a couple of tiny stains of something). The bed was made without bedspreads, and that is always preferable to me because I strongly dislike hotel bedspreads that are never clean. The bathroom was tiny, but clean with excellent water pressure and temperature. Other guests who have stayed here have mentioned that it's noisy. The hotel provides foam earplugs, but I didn't need to use them and I slept undisturbed.There is a tiny reception area where a continental breakfast is served early in the morning. Hard boiled eggs, some cheese and salami cuts; sliced bread (no toaster), croissants, sweet pastries, butter and jam; coffee and juice. I had time to sit with a cup of coffee and a pastry and leisurely read the newspaper before I checked out before 8 a.m. Overall I will give this stay a Happy Face. I had a nice bed for the night, a private bathroom, and coffee and pastries for breakfast before checking out. Location in midtown Manhattan is great for easy subway transportation, and the price was right to fit my budget. And by the way, I appreciated having a bible in the dresser drawer. I rarely see this in a hotel room anymore and it made me feel blessed to read a passage from the Book before starting my day.

We booked a pre-paid deal direct from the hotel website by joining Choice hotels and it worked out at £90 a night, excellent value for a central New York hotel! Location is excellent. Yes it is small and somewhat scruffy and carpet is past its best. But the breakfast in the lobby was very appreciated as was tea and coffee whenever we returned exhausted! Staff were pleasant. There was also a safe in the room and free wifi - another bonus. It was also surprisingly quiet - we heard no street noise at all from our room.If you don't plan on spending much time in your room, this is one to consider.

We stayed 3 nights in July. I see many complaints about the room being small, it was but who goes to NYC to stay in their room? It was clean, had a good shower & comfortable bed, which was all we needed. Great location for Broadway & tour buses. The staff was great. They do need to work on the breakfast

Let me get the "negative" comment out first. The room we had was small. Other than that this hotel was very nice.The location is on the boarder of Times Square and Hell's Kitchen. TimesSquare with all those shops, the Theater District and all those sights within walking distance. Don't let the name "Hell's Kitchen" scare you away. There are some of the finest restaurants in this small area. Especially on "Restaurant Row".Back to the hotel: two names stand out as exceptional representatives for EconoLodge. Oscar and Piatai(sorry if misspelled) these two gentlemen are wonderful and very helpful. This hotel was clean and well maintained. The staff in general are very professional and friendly. We didn't do the Continental Breakfast but it did look good.A common complaint in other reviews was "street noise". We stayed on the second floor and were not bothered by the noise and never used the supplied earplugs. It was noisy with horns and sirens all hours of the night. But that make it NYC!We shall be back!!!

Stayed here in New York after coming from Getmany on the Queen Mary 2.Look i know New York is only 24 square miles but in this case it was tight with 6 bags (been away from OZ for 5 months).The corridors were like walking the decks at sea.The lift is slow,the windows not clean but hey this is New York! Staff very helpful,area for breakfast small,But when in these small places you check certifications.No worries as Fire station across the road...lot of fires in the City.But my wife and i liked it centre of the universe,and good area for Restaurants.Showers great.TV small only poor thing noted oh yes sir you have prestige room,i go get fridge and plug it in....6bottles of water it held.Gotta love it.

We stayed for two nights in the first week of July .The rooms were quite small . Some of the staff were not helpful .Their breakfast was okay .After we left the hotel, we found out that we left a camera bag with lens in the hotel. when we called up to enquire about the same, they told they will speak with house keeping & get back to us. But not even a word about it till now.The location is very central to times square & lot of souvenir shops around. That's about it.

My room was quite small - as expected in this price range - but super well maintained and organised. All required items for a smooth stay were available. Not much noise from the street being located on the 4th floor.Super friendly and helpful staff, OK breakfast, perfect location, what else to ask?

Stayed here 2 weeks ago .Before going was a bit worried by all the good reviews.Just would like to say that I agree with them all.Would have no problem recommending this hotel on all counts.If ever back in NY would love to stay here.

Our room was very small, not at allEnough space to move around. The carpet was dirty but everything else was fine. Their breakfast was good as they had cakes, eggs, yogurt, meat and then the regular cold selection. The staff were very nice and friendly. More likely not to come back to stay at this Place next time in town.

My husband and I were initially shocked when we entered our room and found how truly small it was (like many European hotel rooms). After our three day stay we agreed that it was really perfect for all our needs - thoughtful, helpful staff; exceptionally clean room; perfect mid-town NYC location; great breakfast with fresh coffee all day (and fresh baked cookies mid-afternoon); free WiFi; flat screen TV; and very comfortable bed. They even provided ear plugs to block out the city noises which can go pretty long into the evening. The cleaning staff was polite and efficient and the front desk kept a close vigil on all comings and goings which made us feel safe. We'd stay there again and will recommend it to friends who want a convenient Times Square hotel.

Stayed here for two nights at the very end of June 2015 and thought everything was great! Yes, the rooms are small, but you feel safe & happy with how clean they are! On top of cleanliness, you can walk to Times Square in just about 3 minutes! My sister & I wanted to go to M&Ms World one night and on our way there realized how great the location truly is! Also, the hotel is just a few streets down from Port Authority, which was great. Already anticipating to stay here again for my next NYC trip!

Visited in June 2015 the place is one block away from Time Square and major NY attractions are walking distance. Rooms were small but clean. Best location if you are looking for tour bus and office. Friendly and supportive staff, good breakfast for light eaters. Little expensive but acceptable as per NY standards. View from corner room give a view of NY nights and confirms that this city never sleeps

I almost don't want to write this review out of fear of more people discovering this hotel and taking away from the magic! The Econo Lodge feels like a hidden gem or an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and yet RIDICULOUSLY close to everything you ever want to see in NYC. Stay away from the overpriced Marriots of the world, and stay HERE! - Great, simple breakfast included (bagels, spreads, oatmeal, coffee, pastries, fruit)- Tiny rooms, but has everything you need- Very short walking distance to all the major attractions and subways connecting you to everything - Friendly and helpful staffI stay here each time I come to NYC, there's no comparison!

Visit in June 2015. Clean but very small room. Staff friendly, good breakfast, Time Square one block. Good valve no frills. Would stay again. Many bars and restaurants near by. Tour bus on corner. Visitors center on corner.
user_name:
Joanne J
Big Pine Key, Florida

review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend it! The location can't be beat, and it was very clean. The breakfast exceeded our expectations, and the iced water, coffee, tea, and cookies in the evening were a nice perk. The staff was very helpful and friendly, esp. the gentleman who helped keep the breakfast stocked every morning. The rooms were small, but that was expected. We will definitely stay here when we return to NYC!

The location of this hotel is fantastic one block from Time Square.The hop on hop off bus leaves from the end of the street. The hotel was clean, hot water, clean White towels clean bed. The hotel does complementry breakfast there is fresh fruit available tea coffee and ice water. The staff were ok maybe needed more experience. We did have to leave a $100 deposit and they checked the room when you checked out before they gave it back to you.I would stay again if I returned to New York. Tip there's a great deli on the corner fantastic pizza,salads cakes and of course the great New York Deli sandwiches,a little further down there's a place does food and has a bar 6 till 8 beers $3 great bar man.

We stayed here for 2 nights. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The room is extremely small and tight but we used it just to shower and sleep so that was no big deal. The location was perfect we walked everywhere we went. Had tickets to see both the Chew and the View and we walked to and from each show. I would stay again!

Everyone there was so polite! Yes it is New York so rooms are a bit tight. But we didn't spend much time there at all. So no biggy! Oscar went over and beyond his duties by helping us jump our vehicle because battery died while parked during our 4 day stay. Salamis? (On spelling) night guard. Super friendly and while I stayed outside at night he would stay out with me and offer to bring out a chair so I was more comfortable and then just sit and chat. All staff very very friendly! If travel back to New York I would definitely stay there again . Jodi woellner

The staff here was nothing short of amazing. We had a larger group of teenagers and adults and they were very accommodating. We had a problem when we went to check out, our car battery had died. Oscar from the hotel took time out of his morning (about an hour) to help us get on our way. He went above and beyond to help us and we will be forever grateful for his services. Thank you for the wonderful stay. Also, rooms were clean, there was fresh fruit in the lobby at all times, good breakfast choices, lemon ice water and coffee all day, and of course a perfect location.

The hotel is in a great location .Times square a few minutes way. The tour bus stops just outside.We stayed here for 7 nights and would defiantly stay here again. staff are very helpful. The breakfast was fresh and filling. Free tea and coffee all day and night. The room was just what you need and was clean and well presented. We had house keeping clean our room every day.The bed was so comfortable after a hard days sight seeing. The Air conditioning in room was great.The hotel had FREE wifi.We stayed on the 5th floor and we did NOT get disturbed by any traffic noise. When we checked out we could still leave our suit cases behind reception.Well done Econo lodge you made our holiday

Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for 5 nights. It's great location, if you want to be in the thick of Times Square in a 5 minute walk. Friendly service from all staff, The maid made a good job of refreshing our rooms for us, upon return from a busy day exploring NYC. The room is standard and small but you don't stay in your room all day when you're in NYC, right!? Quick Wifi in all rooms for free with wall mounted television, toiletries, iron and iron board. The breakfast was poor but then It wasn't that much of a bother as we preferred to get out early and try out all the different breakfast places NYC has to offer, Bagels and such for a few dollars! It's a great hotel if you just want a place to rest your head at night.
