Clean small rooms, but we knew that and in New York you only need a bed and bath, lovely staff , very helpful, great complimentary breakfast, only a short walk to metro, Times Square, buses, all in all i hope i can visit them again !!!

Well, it was $200 per night in Times Square. So what you get is the smallest hotel room that I ever saw. It fit a queen size bed with about 2 feet on each side. I would avoid the free breakfast too. But the location is good and a 2 block walk to the C,E subway trains at 8th and 50th.

This is a great place to stay for a traveler with a budget. The room was definitely small but it didn't bother us as we were out in the city most of the time we were in NYC. However, the bed was super small. Most hotels offer a queen sized bed as standard but it was a full sized bed and was cramped for 2 people. It got pretty loud outside sometimes being right near Times Square but we expected that and didn't even notice because we were so tired after sightseeing all day. The room was clean and they held our bags behind the desk before we checked in and even after we checked out so we could explore the city a little more before having to leave. It's no secret that the building is old and doesn't have the best amenities (small TV, small breakfast) but they did a great job keeping it clean and welcoming. We'd definitely stay here again. The location is unbeatable for the price!

Great spot for the price. Yes, the rooms are tiny. But we would rather spend our money on food and entertainment than on a room we are only going to be in while sleeping!Pros:1. Location: It would be impossible to be closer to Times Square for this price. Even some of the more expensive hotels aren't as conveniently located. At 47th and 8th, this hotel is one block west of Times Square. So while there is a lot of street noise, it's considerably less than it would be to be closer to 7th or Broadway. Access to a number of subway stations servicing a variety of lines is easy and convenient.2. Free breakfast: This was a huge pro for us. It was nice to be able to get up, grab our coffee and breakfast in the lobby, and bring it back up to our room where we could get ready and discuss our itinerary for the day while having a munch. It was nice not having to think about what to do/where to go for breakfast - we could just fuel up and get on our way. Even the breakfast food itself was better than expected - the boiled eggs, meat, and cheese were a pleasant surprise, in addition to the usual fruit/pastry/yogurt continental breakfast fare. They even changed the weekend breakfast hours after receiving feedback that the weekend hours were too early, and informed us of the change on Friday.3. Staff: The staff were super pleasant and helpful. When we arrived early (well before the check-in time), they got our paperwork started, took our bags, and encouraged us to go grab lunch and get our bearings. This is what we'd planned on doing anyway, but I guess they must get so many people doing this exact thing that they've really got the process streamlined. Checkout was also quick and easy.Cons:1. Wifi: The wifi wasn't really working while we were there. My husband and I were able to connect one device each (my phone, his tablet), but after that we were unable to get his and my tablet phone online, when we should have been able to connect up to 8 devices. I don't think it was *really* working properly on the devices we DID have - the two devices we were able to connect didn't even need the username/password we were provided. The next day, there was a notice posted in the hallway that the wifi was down but that they'd called a technician to address the issue. So while it was inconvenient, the hotel staff were very quick to act and to communicate the issue with guests. 2. Decor is dated: We have stayed in small hotels before, and even the smallest room can be improved by updated, tasteful decor. The lobby definitely gives a more updated impression, but the rooms could really use some love. Overall: We would absolutely stay here again. We are fairly low maintenance travelers who would prefer, when forced with the choice, to eat and drink in nice restaurant and bars, and stay in a budget hotel. This hotel was 100% comfortable and had everything we needed and more for a 4 night stay.

This is an OK hotel in a great location for theatre, Times Square, and midtown. Hotel was clean. Room was small but most are in NYC (online pictures make room look bigger than reality). Breakfast was good. Staff was friendly. A fair value based on room price. WiFi was out of order 2 of the 3 days of my stay.

Found this cozy and old NY hotel through AAA and it was perfect for the budget conscious gal who wants to spend her money on shopping, noshing, shows and cocktails. The triple A rate helped too. It is at the corner of W 47tg and 8th. The staff was very friendly and the hotel although old was clean. Not for the claustrophobic, the rooms are tiny, but if all you need is a place to shower and sleep, this is the place. Close to everything, Duane Reed and Starbucks across the street. Will be back.

Great stay for the price. The room was small but to be expected for a third of the price of any other Hotels in the area. This location puts you in walking distance to Times Square. The staff is some of the most friendly and helpful I ever dealt with

Wanted to be close to the theatre district and Times Square but didn't want to spend a crazy amount on room. That said traveling solo this room wasn't bad. It was small but I wouldn't have a problem staying there again. There are 2 things that I have negative to say, one funny and the other was annoying. The air conditioner in the room was not good. It was blowing cool air but the room was hot, not uncomfortable but hot. Even with the window open I could not make the room get cool. The second and funny thing was check in. They take your credit card and use the old paper slide imprint machine to get your number. Yeah it works but that it so last century get with the times. I felt like I was back in the 80's. That said if the room was able to be cooled it would be ideal for the solo traveler. 2 people in that room may have been uncomfortable. As I was sightseeing for the 2 days I was there, I spent little time in the room but the time I did was not bad and I would recommend it. $199 Saturday (used points) $109 Sunday.

The room and bathroom were very small(which we expected) but the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The staff was very friendly and the continental breakfast was an added plus. The location was absolutely fantastic.

This was our second visit to New York and having stayed at the Econo Lodge before in 2013 we decided this was the perfect place to return to.It hasn't changed at all ,still lovely ,friendly staff who couldn't do enough for us .This was from the reception to the people who serviced our room.Thank you all!The complimentary breakfast is a lovely start to the day and it is from 6am which suited us as we had a couple of days out with very early starts.The coffee /tea in the lobby at all times is also very welcome especially as a couple of days were very cold.The rooms are quite small but you dont notice this when you're asleep and you don't go to New York to sleep.The bed linen was changed every day and the bed was extremely comfy.Couldn't ask for more.The location also is perfect for sightseeing ,subway and shopping.The trip was for my 60th Birthday and when the staff found this out I received a lovely note and some chocolates in our room .Thank you all at the Econo Lodge for a great stay.

The property was unlike any I have stayed at and that is the difference in rooms where I am from and NYC. The rooms while small are perfect for sleeping, getting ready and going. We stayed here because we knew all we needed was a place to sleep and shower. This place was perfect. The location was the best part, being that you are just off of 8th Avenue you are just close enough to be in walking distance of everything but not right in the middle of all the Times Square chaos. The hotel also had breakfast everyday, which can add up and saves you money! When we go back to NYC we WILL stay here again!

Stayed here for 4 nights on our first trip to New York. The location is brilliant, right in the heart of the city. Yes the room was small but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff here really can not do enough for you, always pleasant and extremely helpful. The breakfast is an added bonus and sets you up for the day. Tea and coffee available 24/7 also. If we ever return to New York, which I sincerely hope we do one day, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

The Econolodge is what it says it is - low cost and somewhere to stay- right in the heart of Manhattan. It's friendly, not always the case in NY, and quite cosy. Yes the rooms are small, but the beds are comfortable. The breakfast is adequate and you can have free coffee and tea 24/7 and complementary crisps and water every day in your room. We didn't find the city noise a problem and loved seeing the iconic fire trucks leaving the station over the road.

My wife and I went here for a few days to see a show. The hotel location is really good...right down the street from Times Square. But, it is extremely small and somewhat old. You cannot even move around in the rooms. If you have problems in small confined spaces do not stay here. Also, very expensive - but then again, you are in New York. You will also be given a set of ear plugs when you arrive...that's right, I am not lying! The noise on the streets will keep you up all night if you are a light sleeper! I would not rule this place out, but just take note of what you will get for $300.00 per night.

Have just returned from staying here. Yes, the rooms are small and well used, but for location, value, cleanliness and helpful staff this was a great place to stay for my first visit to this great city. There were nice touches in the room, toiletries, bottles of water and crisps, and the much needed ear plugs! The noise outside is 24/7 but its part of New York, most nights was that tired didn't really notice it! The hotel itself is quiet, did not here noise from other rooms or floors. Continental breakfast was included but room to eat is very limited. Would stay here again only for the location and staff.

Don't expect much, and you will be pleasantly surprised. The hotel is exactly what it attempts to be - a economical option in a very expensive city. As a result, everything is very modest (such as room size with about 8" between the foot of the bed and the wall), but everything is also adequate. Clean if somewhat worn, comfortable bed, very friendly and accommodating staff both at the desk and tending the rooms, free safe in the room, decent & filling complementary breakfast. Free internet - the savings on breakfast & internet alone will give you money to spend on fun stuff! And location is the reason you're staying here - short walk away from Times square, theaters, restaurants, subway. The area seems very safe and the street the hotel is on is relatively quiet for the center of the city. One complaint I have is that there is no way to control the heat other than opening the window (very glad that was possible!) or turning on the AC. Not the most energy efficient way to cope, but worked.

This was our first stay in NYC, so we weren't familiar with how small the rooms were. It was ok for the price. A little annoying that the free continental breakfast only went from 6-9am (even on the weekends). That's probably convenient for business travelers, but since we were there for a mini vacation, we weren't interested in setting an alarm. So we missed out on that. The wifi was slow at best. There were 4 of us in the room and it was so small there was no place to put our luggage where we didn't have to trip over it to get around the beds. The "closet" was a very small armoire and not practical to hang our soaking wet jackets. We booked it based on the lower cost and it's proximity to the sites. Luckily we didn't spend much time in the room, but I can't say I'd stay there again.

Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for 6 nights during our visit to New York. The location is wonderful, just 3 blocks from a subway station and only 2 blocks away from Times Square. The room is small, but that didn't bother me at all, we had room enough and besides, what else do you need but a bed, a shower and a toilet on a citytrip. You don't come to NY to stay in your room. The staff was really helpfull, they answered every question we had. Also the breakfast is a plus, and it had everything we needed. We had only two things we said that could be better. The room was quite hot, even with freezing temperatures outside, and a small fridge on the room would be nice, but other than that i still find this hotel excellent. We had a wonderful stay here and would recommend this hotel to everybody.

Great location, great staff and great service! This is my favorite place to stay in NYC. Within walking distance of a lot of desirable destinations! Stay in the heart of Times Square where all of the action is!

We were in NYC to attend a show and found this bargain. I went solely on Tripadvisor's reviews of the hotel and information was spot on. The staff was super friendly, the location was unbelievable and the price was a steal. A small breakfast was available in the lobby for us to start our day. The room was tiny but two beds in Times Square for such a good price was perfect. I would stay here again!

Excellent location and the hotel was very good and great value for moneyThe staff were pleasant and very helpful, would highly recommend this hotel. I will stay here again when I visit New York in the future

We stayed at the ecolodge for 5 days fantastic location 5 mins from Times Square Central Park 15 mins we was on the 3rd floor room was good but it was noisy due to New your not sleeping so Saturday night no sleep, we spoke to the Reception and they said they can move us to a higher floor in which they did the same day same room but less noise,rooms are small but you have a queen size bed very comfy and the amount of time your in the room you don't worry about space breakfast included yum!!!! tea, coffee, hot chocolate fruit yogurts really good value wifi really fast they can sort your airport transfers out for you nothing too much trouble very friendly staff we fell in love with New York and will be taking a our granddaughter on our next planned visit at the same hotel well done all at ecolodge

I choose this hotel based on the location & after viewing other TripAdvisor reviews, we were not disappointed!!! So close to the center of the action! The road traffic was loud & constant but they provide you with ear plugs! The one elevator is pretty slow! The staff is friendly & very helpful! We will stay here again!

We found this hotel on 47th St. near 8th Ave. to be clean and close to Broadway theaters and restaurants. The rooms are small but prices are reasonable and offer tv, ironing boards, coffee, contenental breakfasts, etc.. Friendy staff. It offers AARP, AAA discounts.

Having read a number of reviews on this hotel before we arrived I knew what to expect. The staff were as good as expected and the location to Times Square was ideal for our trip. The included breakfast was good and wifi was included. We asked the staff about finding a pub which showed the 6 nations rugby and within about an hour they were knocking our room door with a 3 page print out of the pubs that might show it with descriptions and contacts for each around Manhattan. The room was clean and functional and if you arrange your luggage well the small size of the room can be managed. This is the only reason I have scored a 4 for room comfort. The location to Times Square means that your not going to get the quietest night sleep due to horns and sirens going through the night. For me this added to the experience of staying in New York and as the bed was so comfortable it was easy to drift in and out of sleep when I wasn't going to the window to see what was going on. For me this offered an ideal location and excellent service. If you can overlook the small room and live with the noise at night then you can't go wrong, particularly at the excellent rates they charge. We will be staying here on our next trip to New York.

Myself, my wife, and daughter satayed at the Econoo Lodge Times Square in mid-December. The location is the reason I choose it, but the incredable staff is what made the stay great. Oscar, Stephanie, and Linda were all awesome. We arrived at noon, and were going to leave our luggage, and head out to see our first sights, and they had our room ready! My wife and daughter were amazed too see Oscar standing in rush hour traffis to get us a cab on our first morning there.We were assisted with anything we needed. The entire staff made us feel welcome and at home. I will not hesitate to stay there again.

I spent over a week at the Econo Lodge and found the location fantastic, can't beat being so close to Times Square, restaurants etc if you like to be in the thick of it all. The staff were always pleasant, I was always greeted whilst exiting and entering the hotel. Typical New York sized rooms on level 5, basically a shoebox in a nutshell but I've come to expect nothing less in NYC on a budget however if I was traveling in a party of two, it would have been a challenge to store multiple cases etc. The room contained a desk which in my opinion was a space waster, I had to turn sideways to walk past the desk/chair to my bathroom. I was provided a mini fridge at no extra charge which was appreciated despite adding even less space to the room, small price to pay for the ability to store food etc. My only complaint would be the heating system, each floor is controlled by management and temperature regulation was a problem for me and caused some discomfort. At times my room was unbearably hot to the point of needing a cool shower in the middle of a NY winter night and other times it was too cold. I did not like this feature at all and would much prefer being able to regulate my own heating/cooling settings. I cannot imagine how there could be a happy medium for all guests using the current system. Other then that - location, location, location is the highlight, friendly and accommodating staff, comfortable bed, decent WIFI and affordable for someone traveling on a budget. Heating issues aside, I would return to this Econo Lodge.

All important issues were fantastic......very comfortable bed, great shower and hot water, clean, great breakfast in the price, free wifi. Unless you pay big prices you are not going to get big rooms. These were fine with enough floor space to move around even with our cases out. The staff were all really friendly and helpful. Could be noisy at night but earplugs are provided! Use them! I slept perfectly. The entertainment from the fire station up the road was fun! It's a very functional hotel in a perfect, central location. My only criticism is that there are not always enough tables and chairs for those requiring breakfast at certain times. Not sure how this could be rectified as space is limited where it is served in the lobby. But having said that, we managed fine and if there was a bit of a backlog, people didn't hang around.

Amazing location, free breakfast and coffee and wifi!! the rooms ARE absolutely tiny but who goes to NYC to stay in their room?!?? Location is absolutely amazing, noisy but after walking miles you'll fall asleep if you're tired!! would DEFINATELY stay again if we wanted to do NYC on a budget :) xx

Me and my best friend came to New York for the first time this week we're both young twenties and after shopping around we booked the Econolodge and were a bit concerned after reading some of these reviews... We both found not one issue with the hotel, in-fact we didn't want to leave. The hotel is located about 1 minute walk from Times Square which is unbeatable. Incredibly nice and welcoming staff (every single staff member infact) the hotel is clean and the WiFi worked all of the time with good signal. We were on the 6th (top) floor in room 610. We both found the room small but cosy we both had two suitcases and rucksacks and still had a bit of room. Typical NYC from what we hear. Always cleaned to perfection by the maids in the mornings. The shower was easy to use and the bathroom spotless everyday. The free continental breakfast was always varied and well stocked and gave us many a wonderful day in New York City off to a great start. Check out time is 12pm but our flight wasn't until late night and the staff were so helpful and let us leave our cases behind the desk in the lobby until later on so we could have a full day out before leaving. Thoroughly recommend this hotel to young travellers and older travellers. I know we'll definitely be staying again in the near future!

The staff is very friendly. Rooms are small but clean. Price is good. They validated our parking ,which is very close and cut the price way down. The only down side was the room was very hot ,we complained but they couldn't regulate it. It forced us out at 7am.

After having stayed for a too long night at a putrid hotel around the corner, we were fortunate to find the Econo Lodge Times Square. The hotel and staff, particularly Linda and Oscar were exemplary, and we could not have found better, more reasonably priced, cleaner, centrally located, accommodation anywhere. We were told the room we booked that morning would be ready at 3, but were able to check out of our other “hotel” and check in far earlier. When we checked out, they also allowed us to leave our bags in the hotel until it was time for us to leave for the airport. Oscar then arranged a cab for us which we thought at first was taking us on a creative route to LaGuardia, but actually got us there in good time and for less than a shuttle would have cost. The hotel itself is located a short walk from Times Square and the Theatre district, and convenient to everything. The room itself wasn’t luxury accommodation, but included all amenities, excellent value for the price, and did I mention that it was clean! Most of all, we were treated royally by the staff, who were sincerely friendly, helpful and personable. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. Bravo! A++++++

Rooms are super small, ours smelled like fecal matter. Really wish I had gone to Hampton Garden Inn 400 yards away. Hampton Garden Inn also has parking next to it. Econo Lodge failed to mention their parking is a mile away!!Room next door is also very loud

We stayed here over new year and was the perfect location. Literally a block from times sq. it's pretty basic but clean and comfortable. The breakfast is free and really good to keep you going all day. Free tea, coffee & hot choc all the time. The rooms are small but fine for 2 people and let's face it you don't spend much time in your room in New York! The only thing I would say is it is a little noisy as is so Central and a fire station close by and is only single glazed, they do provide ear plugs & hey it is New York. There is free wifi although we had some troubles with it not working in our room and we were only on the 2nd floor. The staff were really friendly and helpful though we Would stay here again

I've stayed here several times and am a big fan of this property. It's a 30 second walk from Broadway shows and a two minute walk from Times Square.Although rooms are compact, they are clean, everything works, and the staff are super friendly. The rates are extremely affordable and there's always hot coffee in the lobby.I recommend this hotel without reservation.

My husband, sister, and I stayed here the second week of December; and for the value, it's hard to beat. It's true, the rooms are very small (the smallest we've ever had), but we had a corner room and made out just fine. Our room was facing Eighth Avenue, so there was plenty of street noise; however, that didn't bother us at all, and the hotel supplies ear plugs, if you want them. The location is very close to Times Square, and Restaurant Row is just one street over. I also have to give a huge shout out to the staff, especially Oscar. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, but Oscar went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. If you're looking for a clean, inexpensive (for NYC) place to rest your head at night, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Poor quality at all, the towels were broken, the room was not that clean, since we found stuff left from other guest, for example a toothbrush cover. The air conditioner was not working properly in the room neither in the hallways. It seems that it was not cleaned. Also the one in the hallway, was filthy. I also did not like that we need to request a password daily for the internet. The room was super small, but that is normal in NY.On the other hand the people at the front desk and the one helping us with the luggage were very nice!!!!.

My mother and I were in NYC for 3 nights at Econo Lodge. Daisy the manager, Stephanie, and Salaam where so helpful in their own way! While the hotel it self isn't the newest and shiniest its in a great location...only a few blocks from time square and sooooo many restaurants surround it...They had an impressive continental restaurant with oatmeal, fruit, pop tarts, cereal, danish, bagels, coffee & tea (all day), cheese, hard boiled eggs, meats...substantial...Our rooms were impeccably cleaned each night and the rooms themselves were clean. We got a good deal and Daisy was so accommodating to my mother who is very particular and inquisitive. They were happy to bring us anything we needed. Salaam even lent my mother $1 with only a promise that he would be repaid. I didn't know that such kindness for strangers was in the city! Thank you for a great Christmas trip!

VERY helpful staff. Small room, but that's probably to be expected in NY. A couple blocks from the subway stop taking us to and from La Guardia Airport (LGA). GREAT location, a block away from Times Square, and at the lowest price in the area - we were not upset! We didn't use any of the amenities - not because of the hotel - but we can't comment on them.The room was fine. It's not a 5 star hotel but it was comfortable. We're the type of people who are there to be in the location we visit and not stay in the hotel except to wind down and sleep.

This hotel is a great value. It's very near Times Square at a really good price. The rooms are small but clean. The staff was very nice and accommodating. We felt very safe in the neighborhood. Breakfast runs until 9 am but if you miss it, there is a great food truck outside that sells good food at a reasonable price. It's definitely a place we would stay again.

The rooms are small and ear plugs are provided, but the price and location are certainly worth it. A block from Times Square though! One tip on the breakfast, make sure you get down to the lobby before 8:00 am as there is not much room and you may find yourself eating your breakfast standing up.
user_name:
Mike P
Urbana, Maryland, United States

review_body: Right in the heart of NYC, rooms are very small but very clean. Yes noisy but what do you expect when your so central. Great breakfast and very freindly staff. Would deffo stay at this hotel again.Very close to all the mid town attractions.

The place was nice, clean but rooms a little small regardless no big deal it was in the heart of the city, one of the best locations I've ever stayed at in Time Square, I would definitely stay there again due to the cleanliness, location and customer service.

The "Highly recommended" title I've given is based on the fact that myself and friends who've just returned from a stay in Econolodge would definitely stay there again.My overall rating of "average" is dragged down only by the size of the rooms and the noisy location. The rooms were very cramped and the noise from outside was pretty loud throughout the night. But then after all, this is the city that never sleeps and we did expect the noise.That's all I can say that's negative about the hotel.Great location for accessing Times Square, restaurants and bars, Central Park, Empire State Building and basically anything in Midtown Manhattan.Staff were very friendly and helpful.Breakfast, although only continental, was very good quality and made a great start to the day.All in all it serves as a fantastic base for a short break in the Big Apple.Tip - ask for room 700. Apparently it's the whole 7th floor for the same price.

Stayed at the Econo Lodge for three nights. Excellent location, close to Times Square, Rockefellar Center ( the Xmas tree),Radio City Music Hall (The Rockettes) and many restaurants within walking distance. The subway is also very close. This hotel was perfect, free wifi and yes the rooms are very small, the beds are comfy and the room was clean. The room was warm so we turned on the A/C and we were fine. The breakfast was enough for us and provided all we needed to start our day...cereal, pastries, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea and juice. Coffee,tea & hot cocoa are available 24/7 which is nice on a cold day. The front desk girl Stephanie made our trip extra special. She answered every question we had and was so helpful getting us to the right subway stops. Our first day we were late for the breakfast, Oscar who sets up the breakfast went and got us cereal, yogurt, juice & several other things. That was very much appreciated. He also does maintenance and if you have a problem in your room he will take care of it ASAP. We would definitely recommend this hotel for the cost & location, and the friendly staff.

This is my 5th trip to NYC and this is the worst hotel I have had. While the location is great just off 8th Street, the room is smaller than a cruise ship cabin. The hotel is older and sadly in need of some upgrades like paint. We haven't had the complementary breakfast yet, but I am not expecting much. The one pleasant surprise is the desk clerk Linda who is very nice and extremely helpful. We are on the 3rd floor and the street noise is considerable...ear plugs have been provided. While the room is clean I would not recommend this hotel. The wifi is extremely slow.

I stayed here for a couple of nights when passing through NYC and it was a good choice. Wireless Internet was available and free. It wasn't bad for browsing either. A lot of people have been complaining here about the noise but I didn't notice this, maybe because I was on a higher floor. I slept like a log both nights.The room was clean, but small. I didn't mind this as I was just sleeping there. If you're planning on hanging around in your room all day then maybe this isn't a good choice! The staff were friendly and helpful. Had a few questions and they were happy to assist.There's a little Irish bar right across the road - a perfect place to drop in and have a Guinness before going to bed.I don't think they serve food but there was free coffee down in the lobby which was a nice touch. The only thing that I wasn't keen on was the elevator as it seemed a bit old and the lights at the top didn't work to show which floor you're currently on. I do have a bit of an elevator-phobia though! I ended up going up and down the stairs to avoid using it. When it comes down to it, this place is great for sleeping and if you plan to be out most of the day. If you want room service and lots of space then go elsewhere.

This was our first visit to New York City and we really wanted to be based central to all the action. Our travel agent recommended the Econo Lodge because of its location. I checked Trip Advisor and was a little apprehensive about the room size but trusted the advice we were given. We stayed for 4 nights and I have to say for what can be described as a budget hotel it was perfect. Yes the room was tiny but we only wanted somewhere to sleep and the room was clean. Yes it was a little noisy at night but hey it's two streets from Times Square in the centre of Manhattan so what do people expect! The buffet continental breakfast in the mornings was a life and time saver. Tea, coffee, cereal, bagels, pastries, hard boiled eggs, bread and cheese and orange juice were all available..it really set us up every morning for the busy day ahead. Tea and coffee are available 24/7 in reception free of charge along with jugs of iced water. The coffee was really good! Very helpful at the reception desk and if you are a New York virgin I would strongly advise getting a copy of the New York attractions magazine in reception because it has everything in it that you need to know. Avoid taxis at all costs and learn the subway routes straight away..you can literally get anywhere you want in New York on the subway it's so handy. I highly recommend the Econo Lodge and believe me I am very particular and would be the first to point out problems..it really did exceed our expectations.

I had booked this room during the summer and had major problems with the booking (I was charged 5 separate times from my debit card ) so after an extremely long and difficult process the hotel offered me a 20% discount and a free night to?After a lot of searching for a hotel I decided to take them up on this offer as it meant id save a bit of money .I deeply regret this decision.As has been stated the room are tiny,I had to turn sideways to move at the end of the bed I was travelling on my own but even still I found the rooms small and couldn't fit 2 cases in the room (I had to put one over at the window ) When I arrived the lady at reception gave me my key for the room on the 2nd floor.the minute I walked in I knew it was extremely noisy so I rang down and asked for another room towards the back,she gave me a room 2 doors down.As I had a huge problem with contacting the manger of this hotel I didn't want to be seen as a serial complainer so I figured I'd get used to it and it'd be fine .I was so wrong .I felt I might as well have placed a mattress on eighth avenue as I was that close to the noise,I have visited nyc approx 16-17 times so it's not like I don't realise Nyc is noisy .As stated the towels are sized for children not adults and the bath would probably fit a 5 year old but certainly not an adult .This is compact to say the least .After the first night of not sleeping I awoke to the feeling my legs were on fire and instantly knew what the issue was ,Bed bugs .I had had this problem before so knew instantly .I knew that there was no point trying to speak with the manager as she doesn't seem to bothered in replying (had emailed her 7 times before I got a reply regarding the booking ) I decided I would try get another hotel but as I searched I found nothing in my budget nearby so decided I may as well just stay as the damage had already been done.The location of this hotel is excellent but I'd stay well away from here .They are not cheap by any means and I'm sure there are deals to be had for nearby hotels that you won't end up with a huge rash from bed bugs

The hotel is located two blocks away from Times Square, which is great. It is considerably cheaper than any other hotel in the area. But there's a reason for that. The rooms are unbelievably small - especially the ones for over 3 people. There was absolutely no place for our luggage. Wherever we put it, we would block a door or make it difficult for us to go to the bathroom or something. And the room was not well cleaned. Three days after our arrival, we found a bottle of beer under our bed – obviously not ours. We left it there to see if the maid would pick it up and throw it away. We stayed there for nine days. The bottle stayed longer. Upsides: breakfast is decent, front desk staff is helpful, and, of course, location, location, location. If you don't care for a spotlessly clean room or a spacious one, this hotel is a good option. If I had a little bit more money, I would stay somewhere else.

What can I say - this trip to NYC was supposed to be my 50th Birthday treat - the rooms was atrocious. I had read on Tripadvisor that the rooms were small but I did not expect them to be this small! We were on the 4th floor and the noise was not that bad really although we were provided with ear plugs - we were that tired I don't think we really paid that much attention to the traffic noise. The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept well. The towels in the bathroom were thin and don't go around you! The hotel itself is badly in need of renovation/decoration and looks gawdy! I think if they put a coat of paint over the place it would probably look a lot better. Breakfast was not that bad really although you were eating off polystyrene plates/bowls and cups and threw the lot away when you were finished. You eat in the lobby of the hotel and most mornings there were not enough tables for everyone to sit at and some guests took their breakfast up to their grim rooms. The staff were very helpful and you could not fault them. The best thing about this hotel is its location. Would I stay here again - probably not.

Everyone on staff we encountered was very friendly and helpful. I knew from reading other reviews that the rooms were small but I never thought the room would be quite as small as it was. We don't go to NYC for the size of the hotel room but for the experience that the Big Apple provides so this hotel provided a place to stay for a reasonable price in a great location and an overall good experience!

Great location for this hotel, friendly staff, rooms are abit small but they do the job that you need them for which is somewhere to sleep after exploring the city, loads of restaurants and shops close by. Rooms can be noisey due to the street but we are heavy sleepers so we were fine we were on third floor. Hotel provides earplugs for light sleepers. I would stay here again

Don't put yourself through this. We checked in last night after a long hectic drive. There was no bell service, not even a trolley to self serve in bringing your luggage in. We'd been in the states for a few weeks and had a fair load of luggage. Getting this out of our car on a busy street and into the lobby was challenging and took a few trips. Lady behind the desk was nice and gave us our keys. Eventually we got all our luggage loaded into the elevator and went up to the second floor. My husband went in first and pulled in one suitcase - I followed him in (or rather attempted to!) with the other suitcase. We couldn't both get in with a suitcase each!!!! It was that small!!! I couldn't believe it.. I mean you hear people complain about how small NY apartments can be but this was ridiculous! The bed was against 3 walls!!! We turned around and walked right out. I could barely breathe in there Absolutely no way I could stay there. There's small apartments - then there was that. Unless you enjoy sitting in a matchbox - Don't do it, it's not worth it.Spend the extra 80/90 dollars and get a decent hotel room close by or if you don't want to spend extra drop a few streets back, it's still amazing!!!!!!

Hotel is situated in a very central place, albeit somewhat noisy (on 8th avenue) - there were ear plugs waiting for us. Later we found that we were very close to a fire engine station. The room was very tiny but very clean. We liked the fact that we were asked when we would like to have cleaning service, so when we came back to the room it was always tidy and bed made. Breakfast is OK - I would have liked to see a toaster. Hot water, coffee and tea is always available and was much appreciated. Staff were extremely helpful and inviting. Location is great!! All in all we got more then we bargained for.

Returned last week from 6 nights at Econo Lodge and would very, very happily stay there again without hesitation! A warm and friendly welcome, functional and clean room with an exceptionally comfortable bed and an amazing location – what more could you ask for?! I’d emailed ahead a few weeks before our stay, asking if we could have a room with a view (for my young son’s first visit to NYC) and they duly obliged. I was down early for breakfast (served from 6am) each morning and there was always plenty of choice of lovely, fresh pastries, cereals, different types of tea (tea, coffee and water is available 24 hours a day, free of charge). Especially important for me was a good hairdryer, and the one in the room was excellent (and right in front of a mirror). I cannot emphasise enough what a good location this is – virtually on the corner of 47th and 8th, only one block (a couple of minutes walk) from the bright lights of Times Square! Nothing was too much trouble for the (very friendly and helpful) staff, and that means a lot as that’s not always the case. A really super little place!

in the middle of times squre the hotel team is very nice and kindgood morning breakfestwe been 7 days and anjoy it very mach ...all day long the tea and coffie are free book for this hotel i sure you be anjoy

Both the price and location of this hotel guided our choice for this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was small but that was no concern. The decor was very tired and the seal of the window was broken so the window was fogged up. But the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had difficulty getting a wifi signal and when I mentioned it upon check-out we realized that we should have said something earlier, as they may have been able to fix it for us. So that was our fault.

Price and location were the primary motivating factors behind my decision to stay at Econo Lodge Times and when "interior corridors" made their own shortlist of hotel amenities my expectations were low. I'm pleased to report my reservations were unfounded. The room was clean and everything was in working order which is the least one can expect. However, the service and attitude of the staff was exemplary. I felt welcome and was left with the impression the staff actually were interested in my well being. Jessica, thoroughly unprompted, solved a transport problem I didn't even foresee for which I was grateful. She asked questions and offered help as did all the staff I encountered.It's midtown location is ideal and the price was right. Even if I had a huge wedge of cash at my disposal I would return to Econo Lodge as they earned and will keep my custom.

Although the room was a little cramped, it was comfortable and clean, we are happy to recommend it.The staff were very friendly and helpful, and I'd like to give a special mention to Jessica who was always happy to got the extra mile to help, so all in all, if you want cheap clean accommodation you needn't look any further

Just returned from an 7 night stay. Agree with majority of reviews. Location perfect. Apart from the hop on hop.off bus tour we walked everywhere as so many attractions were within walking distance.Yes rooms are small. We stayed in a standard queen room. Very comfortable bed, air conditioning good. Free wifI with no connection problems, free local phone calls, daily housekeeping kept the room spotless clean towels daily. Very good breakfast - cereals bread meat cheese yoghurt fruit Danish pastries and cakes and fruit juice. Free hot drinks and iced water available 24/7. Friendly helpful reception. We went sightseeing every day so were up and out returning in the evening to shower and sleep. So glad we didn't pay more for a hotel with facilities that we would not have used. Would highly recommend. Would stay again. Thank you Econolodge.

If you're looking for a place to rest, the hotel won't suit you (neither would staying this close to Times Sq, I guess), but if you're looking to use the room more as HQ— as we did— it's awesome We left the hotel every morning and didn't come back until late at night for shower/sleep so it completely met our needs. Although reviewers are right in saying the rooms are small (I was told I was staying in one of the bigger ones and it couldn't fit more than 2 suitcases open), you can't beat the value of this hotel when you compare nearby prices and its location. Some also mentioned the noise: even on the 5th floor we could still hear some of it but as tired as we were from exploring the city all day, it was never a problem.The only downside for use was the internet connection: we often didn't have signal and when we did, it was pretty slow. In spite of that, I would totally come back on another visit to NY.

Great location just off Times Square very easy to find. Rooms are a little small but then we didn't stay in our rooms that much. Breakfast was served in the main lobby where you also checked in which I thought was a bit weird. Just like to say a massive thank you to oscar who helped us out a lot after our flight got cancelled and had to sort out a new one.

Last time we stayed at the Chelsea Hotel (now no more) in New York City. It cost us a fortune in cab rides (when you could get one) to go to the Theater and the Restaurants . We just returned from NYC staying at the Econo Lodge off Times Square. We didn't need to cab at all - just walk to just about every Broadway theater and nearby neighborhood and well known restaurants. The hotel is very well managed, with clean rooms and attentive desk and other staff. The room was small but what do you need a large one for? There was some noise from cop and fire vehicles - but it's hard to avoid that in any NYC hotel. I'd recommend it to any theater goer who wants a budget room.

My wife and I stayed four nights at the end of September; we choose this hotel based on both Location and Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. Others have commented that the rooms are small, but for the price and location they are not too bad. Our room on floor 2 was much quieter than we'd expected given the proximity to the busy streets and we didn't need to make use of the provided ear plugs. The room was clean, comfortable and the housekeeping service was great. The continental breakfast service was excellent with a good variety of food choices to enjoy while reading the complementary weekday newspaper. The front office staff were extremely courteous, and always working with a smile and welcoming comment. The included Wi-Fi Service was fast and presented no connectivity problems. This is a good value for money hotel and we'd certainly use it again. It is also only five blocks or so from the Port Authority Bus Terminal which is where arrived into Manhattan following a flight into Newark.
user_name:
David P
Island of Gozo, Malta

review_body: My wife and I stayed here on Sept. 16 and 17, 2014. This hotel was very conveniently located for our visit that included the 911 Memorial, the Today Show, Statue of Liberty and Central Park. We walked to the park and Today Show and took the subway to the Memorial and Statue of Liberty. We had never been to New York City but the nice young ladies at the front desk (Vanessa Rios and Linda Petrus) gave us maps and directions to our destinations, the subway and restaurants. The hotel accommodations and room rates were excellent for our needs. The hotel was clean and the complimentary breakfast was very good and much appreciated. The hotel parking deck is 1/2 block away and $30 per day. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for two nights in September 2014 and it was a pretty good, but not great, experience. For the price we paid though (under two hundred a night in Sept.) this was a very good find. Now on to the specifics...Pros: the hotel was an excellent price for the location (one block off of Times Square) and walking distance to many other major attractions plus it was about a block from the subway so you could get everywhere else, the room was clean and looks like it had been slightly refurbished at some point in the not too distant past, there was a free continental breakfast provided, the staff were very pleasant and helpful, and they stored our suitcase for us for free on our checkout date until it was time for us to leave the city. Con: the mattress was the most uncomfortable one that my husband and I have ever slept on. We woke up both days with a sore back (and we are only in our early 30's - this shouldn't be happening to us yet!). I don't know if it was just our room, or if all their mattresses are that uncomfortable, but it was bad enough for us to knock down the overall rating of this property to four stars (would have given it five - considering all that we got for the small price we paid - if we had a semi-comfortable mattress). Other people have noted cons re: the small room size and the noise of the traffic keeping them up at night. Since we only used our room to sleep and shower, the room size wasn't an issue for us. Additionally, since we live in a large city - okay a suburb of a large city - the noise wasn't bothersome at all. They provide complimentary ear plugs for those who do though, which is a nice touch.

Great location being 2 blocks off Broadway/Times Square. Super nice staff; Jessica and Stephanie and others. When we were there the card key system was down and several of the guys there would very happy to escort us to the room and unlock the doors in a timely manner and they were very friendly guys as well. Room was small, a little noisy (hey, right on 8th Street so what do you expect!!), breakfast was good.

We recently stayed at the Econo Lodge Times square and I have to say that as a negative the room was very small but it was clean. The staff were helpful and friendly and the included buffet breakfast was fresh with a good variety of baked goods. We would definetly stay there again.

My wife and I have just returned from a 10 day stay at the Econo Lodge Times Square. This was our third time in Manhattan and I can say with certainty that the hotel was the best we have ever stayed there. The location is outstanding (one block from Times Square), next to the Broadway theater area. Those who enjoy (and have fitness) can explore the island on foot. Or use one of several subway lines with stations nearby. The hotel is small (56 rooms), thus quieter than those which receive tourists groups. The rooms are really small, which certainly is a disadvantage to anyone going to NY to shop or having a lot of luggage. As it was not our case, and as I have made the reservation straight with the hotel by email, I could choose a larger room (DeLuxe) with fridge, ironing board and iron, plus amenities like hair dryer, flat screen TV and wi-fi with reasonable speed. We were on the fifth floor and had no problem with noise from the street, elevator or other rooms. Bed, mattress and pillows very good which, added to the fatigue of walking all day, ensured a perfect sleep.The cooled air worked perfectly. The bathroom has both tub and shower and the temperature as well as the water pressure is adequate for a good bath. Cleanliness is impeccable and bedding and bath, white and spotless. If you want your linens changed daily, just leave on the bed a tag that can be found in the room, on the information directory.The staff is top notch. I specially mention Linda, Vanessa, Jessica and Oscar, who we have talked most with, but all without exception are extremely kind, friendly and attentive. The breakfast also deserves praise, especially due to the difficulty in finding a hotel in NY with breakfast included in the rate. It is rich and varied (fruits, juices, yogurts, cereals, bagels, pastries and savory breads, cheeses and cold meats, boiled eggs) far better than we have had in other hotels we had ever stayed. It can be taken in the lobby (for this is advisable to go down early because there are only five tables) or grabbed it and get to take in the room. Throughout the day, coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the lobby are at guests' disposal. In 10 days we found nothing that discredit this hotel. The only "but" is the lack of a toilet in the lobby to serve guests who need to stick around prior to the check-in (15h) and after check-out (12h). To sum up, I regard the daily rate fully compatible with the hotel location and the standard of services offered.

We arrived around 12:30 PM, before the 3:00 PM check in time. Staff was friendly, and by the time I parked the car and walked back to the hotel (right across the street) they already had a room available, and got us right in. As others have stated, the rooms are a little small, but you're about a block away from the action in Times Square and close to everything - restaurants, shopping, metro, etc... We were on the 6th floor, great view, and it wasn't noisy at all. Clean, comfortable, fantastic staff, would recommend! A++++++

This location was good and the staff were very nice. The room was very small but it is NYC! We found ear plugs in our room and quickly realized when we went to bed that the noise was very loud al night. For the price it was a good value.

Fantastic location but it is very noisy, very overdue for double glazing. Stay are fantastic and very helpful and courteous. Rooms extremely small, would advise that 3 day stay is the most you would want.

The staff was great and very helpful. The hotel has a fantastic location in NYC.The room was very clean and comfortable but little olfaction. The breakfast was not luxurious but the food was decent.Overall it was comfortable stay in a clean hotel with very kind staff without many luxuries. A very nice experience

We arrived mid afternoon to find our room ready.Checked in within a few minutes very friendly staff.Our room was on the third floor(308).Very clean crisp white sheets changed every day with new bath towels also.Room is a bit small but having been to NY before threw are all like that.The best thing about the hotel is the location,it's central to everything in midtown in manhattan.Times Square is a 4 minute walk away along wither broadway and all the theatres just a couple minutes more.Also if you are needing a bus the main bus depot(Port Authority) is 5 minutes away down 7th Avenue.If you are going to Woodburry Common outlet that where you get the bus.the hotel has a breakfast in the lobby between 6am and 9am with coffee and pastry with cornflakes.Enough to get you going in the morning.Coffee on tap all day in the lobby when you want one.If I was to return I would ask for a room on a higher floor,it only has 6 floors.Most of the noise is from the Fire House just round the corner.On our first night is was out four times.You do get ear plugs which do help.

Stayed at this hotel for three nights. The location is excellent, just a few minutes from Times Square and close to everything. The rooms are small, but very clean and perfect when all you need is a place to sleep and shower. The staff was very friendly and always willing to help, I'd especially like to mention and thank Jessica, who was really great. Good breakfast and wifi. Will definitely go back and stay here again!

We stayed on 9/9/14 and had planned on staying a total of three nights. The room was too small for two adults as we could not pass each other in the room. The street noise was extremely loud and the ear plugs that were provided was of no help. We checked out the next morning and said we wanted to find another hotel and the staff did not refund our money. I feel their ads do not reflect just how small the rooms are. Location was great as it was close to Times Square.

Even though the room is very small, the great location compensates this drawback. The hotel is located within walking distance to NY Times Square. The staffs are nice and very helpful. I was desperately in need of a cab and couldn't manage to stop one after almost 30 minutes trying and the hotel staff (Steve, if I'm not mistaken) offered his help. He got one after his attempt to stop cab after cab in the middle of the road. Really appreciate his kind gesture. Not many hotel staffs would be willing to do extra miles to help their guests. The hotel also offers nice breakfast and drink is available all the time.

This is the smallest hotel room ever! Ever in the history of my life! ha! Yes, as you have read the room is tiny. I've been to NYC several times and this is the smallest I've stayed in. Now, who really cares about the size? I suppose if you are in NYC to hang out in your room this may not be an option but I can tell you I slept better and more comfortably in this room than any other time I've been to NYC. The room and tiny bathroom are the cleanest I've seen. The bed was extremely comfortable even though I shared it with my adult niece because of my own error in booking a room with 2 beds. But we both slept great with comfortable sheets, pillows and quilt. No yucky bedspreads to deal with either... just white lines and quilt. The walls are boring and for the most part bare (but too small for too much.. ha). But again, we didn't stay here to look at walls. We were on the second floor and directly across the street was a bar. There was some noise but the air conditioner was a little loud but steady which drowned out almost all street noise. Speaking of air conditioners... we turned ours on when we checked in and hit the streets to sight see. When we returned the room was still hot. Within a minute of calling the front desk someone was there to fix it. When it was discovered that the de-icing would take too long they immediately had key cards in hand for another room! (No such luck in getting lucky on a room with two beds). They offered to move us but it was right next door and easy enough for us to do in less than 5 minutes. So, the hotel staff are extremely courteous, always smiling and very helpful!!! There is a free breakfast, just fruit, cheese, yogurt, rolls with juice and coffee. Just easy grab and go stuff. Step outside the hotel and you are in walking distance (easy walking) to Broadway shows and Times Square. We walked everywhere even to Rockefeller Center and to Central Park. (Central Park may be considered too far for some but we walked everywhere!). Now, look left when you walk out the hotel door... you will see a row of apartments on a fairly quiet street which is nice. There are restaurants and bakeries, laundry facilities, Starbucks, Duncan Donut with a bit of a slower pace. With the great location, super friendly and helpful staff and a clean and comfortable room and quieter area I will never again book elsewhere when visiting NYC!

From 7/17/2014 through 7/26/2014, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Econo Lodge Times Square in NYC. Andrea, Daisy, Jessica, Kathy, Linda, Marsha, Stephanie, Vanessa, & Veronica are all extremely intelligent, professional, courteous, warm & friendly front desk lobby clerks. I always look forward to returning to this wonderful hotel whenever I visit NYC! :-)

Our family visited NYC in August and stayed at the Econo Lodge Times Square. The location was just a few blocks from the heart of Times Square and the room was clean. Front desk staff was extremely nice and helpful.The room we stayed in was small - so it's not conducive to hanging out but as a place to sleep and clean up, it worked well for us.

The rooms are incredibly small, but the queen bed was comfortable. Free "breakfast" was embarrassing to them. Service was fantastic - we had an air conditioner that was not working and a service man showed up literally minutes after my call to the front desk and we were changed to another room down the hall ten minutes later. Location, one block off of restaurant row and from most theaters cannot be beat.

I stayed at the Econo Lodge for seven days to watch the US Open Tennis and enjoy some sightseeing. The Location is just perfect, close to Times Square and you can walk to most other attractions.Yes the rooms are small and there is noise from the street at night but the real joy of this Hotel is the staff. I had a problem with my TV on the second night which Linda fixed at once and Vanessa was always very friendly and interested in your day.Great Hotel, would stay again.

Location excellent, minutes away from Times Square. Noise levels, well to be honest we were so tired by the time we got to bed our heads hit the pillow and that was us asleep. Hotel did provide ear plugs . Bedroom sizes way too small. We could not get from one side of our bed to the window easily. I am 5.8" and hubby over six foot. I had to shuffle along the end of the bed with my bottom touching the wall and my knees pressed against the edge of the mattress got nearer end of the manoeuvre then had to duck rom the wall mounted television. We asked to be moved which did not happen till day two. room slightly larger but had double not queen sized bed. Unusually (from what I can gather from other travellers to NY ) this Hotel did provide a buffet style continental breakfast. It was fine .I would say needed a bit of TLC and upgrading. Staff however could not be faulted, polite, helpful .and eager to please.

Econo Lodge Times Square is located perfectly for anyone who wants to have the convenience, excellent customer service and clean rooms. You can WALK North to Central Park, Lincoln Plaza and South to Macy's, East to Grand Central and West to the piers ( many great cruises are offered there) and see everything inside of this "square" with excellent eating places for any budget. You won't waste your time and money on any type of transportation. I loved to stay here! If you need to take a subway, all stations are located within 5-9 min. of pleasant walk.BUT YOU HAVE TO deal with the traffic noise inside of your SMALL room and the low water pressure in the shower ( the water sometimes stops coming and resumes after a few minutes). The hotel gives complimentary earplugs that give 100% noise reduction. I slept well with the earplugs and the rest of my family slept ok without them. The breakfast has enough choices ( fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, bagels, cream cheese, salami, cheese, tea, coffee, orange juice, instant oatmeal, sometimes hard boiled eggs,) to start your day and gives you about 4 hours of energy. I would come back here again!

the location is great. the staff members were friendly. we had complimentary breakfast (donuts, croissant, bars, coffee, tea, juice.etc...). the room is not very big but it had everything we could need.

We really enjoyed the friendly staff and how helpful they were about directions and attractions. The room was tiny but we were able to move around the bed witha. Squeeze. The breakfast buffet was adequate and again the staff very helpful and eager to please. I see NYC as a place to explore with the rom being more a place tor est your head as would stay there again when I return. The location is perfect.

The location is very good, just one block away from times square. The hotel provides good services, including a complimentary breakfast. The rooms are very small, some aspect could be renovated (windows, curtains, carpets...). The staff is friendly and helpful.

I stayed here January 2014 for a week for my 21st Birthday. Rooms were old fashioned and small but perfect for just sleeping in, and was very clean. The complimentary breakfast was very nice and filled a spot. Central to everything we walked from the hotel to Central Park, Empire State, grand central station and broadway. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again and recommend others to stay also!

The best thing about this hotel is that It's located on a quiet street in the middle of Manhattan. Rooms were tiny but clean. Skip the hotel breakfast and use the diner across the street. I thought the place was great value for money.

Location was great! Staff always friendly. Very tiny room,but only there to sleep. The bed was clean and comfortable. Free breakfast. Lobby clean. Could use an update in room, but didn't spend much time in it. We felt very safe. Only complaint was that the tub took forever to drain. Had to wait about 20 minutes for the next person to shower. Asked to have it looked at on 2nd day. Front desk made a note of it, and was very friendly, but we got the idea it wouldn't get fixed. It didn't. There are only six floors, so not a lot of guests. For the price and friendly front desk, we would stay here again.

We only stayed here for one night but the room was clean and the service excellent. Jessica lapidez was very friendly, personable, and accommodating. She greeted everyone who came in and extended herself beyond my expectation. She should be the model employee for the hotel. She knew everyone's name and you do. Ot get that type of service from a hotel.

Location is terrific. Close to Times Square and theaters. Steps from Hop on Hop Off bus . Rooms are really small but good bed and we only wanted the room to sleep in anyway.If you have a lot of luggage may be a problem (also small wardrobe).Bonus: they had a safe in the room.

Jessica helped us out trying to figure out how to get around the big apple. She printed baseball tickets for us and suggested restaurants and stuff to do the in the area. Every time we saw her she asked how our day was and how we're doing it, very personable. Thanks for sharing your town with us.

Considering it's location, i can oversee the small size of the room.The free breakfast was good and the free wifi much appreciated, as well as the free document printing and unlimited North American phone calls.

Small room - Yes. But, you're a block from Times Square in New York City. Unless you want to spend $400 or more a night, small rooms are what you get. And there was a nice Continental breakfast - FREE!!! FREE WI-FI, also!!Clean room - Yes. I wouldn't stay in anything less.Personnel - The personnel were friendly and helpful. Got up to shower and the tub wasn't draining so I immediately called the front desk. They asked if I wanted someone up there right away (it was 6:30 a.m.) and I said "yes." I figured that it would take someone half an hour or better to get there but in five minutes, someone was knocking and the door and, 5 minutes later, the problem was fixed! And, it didn't re-occur.Great price for the location - Absolutely! I was ready to use my AAA discount but got a better deal by dialing the hotel directly. We paid ~$510 for two night's stay. We were a block from Times Square and M&M's World; less than a mile from St. Patrick's Cathedral, Madame Tussands Museum, The Hard Rock Cafe, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Plaza; the high-end shopping district, and The Empire State Building; about a mile from Central Park; 3 blocks from a subway station; and a $10.50 cab ride from Penn Station and Madison Square Gardens. A pharmacy's on the corner, a Star Bucks is catty-corner across the street, and a great little pizza place is right in the same block. Several blocks behind the hotel is Hell's Kitchen and a couple streets of little shops and restaurants. PERFECT LOCATION!WOULD DEFINITELY GO THERE AGAIN.

Here for three nights. Steps away from over a dozen theatres and good food. Clean rooms. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast. Small rooms, but perfectly fine for our trip. Would definitely return here.

We took a quick overnight to New York City to take in a couple shows and wanted a hotel right in Times Square that didn't cost a fortune. The Econo Lodge on West 47th Street fit the bill. Though the room was small, we were only sleeping there, so we had plenty of space. Our room was clean; the bed was comfortable. The front desk was friendly and was able to check our bag in early. Continental breakfast was great. We will definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Brenda T
North Hampton, New Hampshire

review_body: The location is excellent just 4 blocks from our Broadway show, then the front desk was accommodating and held our bag before and after we checked out. Breakfast was free and that was a surprise. The room is very small but perfect, clean, flat screen TV, Desk and even a bathtub. With all of the expensive hotels in NYC you cannot go wrong with this spot. Would definitely stay again.

You just can't beat this place as far as location. You can walk to any Broadway show. Central Park less then a mile away. One block over on 9th Ave, any kind of restaurant you want. Close to subways, and Hop On Hop Off Bus pick up stops. The staff is great, very helpful and pleasant to chat with. The rooms are small, but perfect when all you need is a place to sleep and shower.You can grab breakfast and coffee in the morning and out the door you go.

Small, friendly hotel. Excellent location at an affordable price. OK the room was small but then we didn't intend to spend time in the room other than sleeping, so that was fine. Breakfast provision was more than adequate. All the staff were rally helpful but a particular mention to Jessica who went the extra mile.

We booked this Econo Lodge kind of last minute after deciding to stay in the city for a short trip instead of outside. The rate was affordable and the reviews are mostly positive so we decided to give it a chance.The staff at this location are all very friendly and eager to help with directions, advice on things to do, recommendations, or anything that you might need. We were greeted every time we came through the door.The location is amazing - especially given the rate. Only about 1 1/2 blocks from Times Square and of course tons of shops, restaurants, and things to do within easy walking distance. We only used the subway once our entire trip as we were able to walk to almost everything we wanted to do.Breakfast is small but definitely adequate. Based on the level of service provided here, I expect that there would be even more options if they had the space because they do seem to want to take care of their guests - they are just very limited on the space available for items. Even on just the two mornings we were there, there was at least a little variety in what was offered (though if you want something above just a continental breakfast, there are plenty of great places to eat nearby).The rooms were clean and well-kept. The only issue is, as many reviewers have noted, the size. That is obviously nothing that the hotel or the staff can do anything about and they make good use of what space they have available. However, I cannot imagine staying here for an entire week as I think I would become claustrophobic. Just a couple of days was great though. With two people in the room, one basically had to take turns sitting on the bed while the other moved around and then switch. It can also get a little loud as the rooms are street-side, but the hotel does provide ear plugs in the rooms if you need them.If you need somewhere clean, friendly, and excellently located and do not have hundreds of dollars to spend each night on the room, this Econo Lodge is a great option. I would definitely not hesitate to stay again.

Staff was friendly and polite. Room was very clean. Got a refrigerator requested. Breakfast could be bigger, but limited space. Only complaint is that high speed internet wasn't very "high speed". But I'll be back. Great location for my theater purposes. And they accepted my SED rate, not a lot of NYC places would. I could not afford the trip without it. Thanks. OOPS< down below, I should not have rated restaurant and pool, because they did not have, and I certainly did not need.

We stayed here from the 22nd of June until 28th This hotel is absolutely fantastic. The location is first rate. The breakfast was fantastic and 7/24 coffee at the lobby. The room was clean and comfortable.Upon leaving you can also leave your bags in secure storage for free. But the absolute best thing about the hotel are the staff specially Daisy Santiago and Jessica Lapidez. If you want the location without the price then this hotel is a must in my opinion. Should we every go back we'll be using this hotel

Perfect location, right in the heart of times square! The staff were really helpful and gave us a some lovely complimentary honeymoon treats too which my wife loved! The rooms are quite tight but then again, everywhere is in NY. They were clean and had working air-con which was really useful. The breakfasts were varied and really filling and the hotel offers complimentary hot drinks / water 24/7 which is perfect when you roll in after a day of sightseeing!

Perfect place to be in area wise, price wise really good and Linda petrus&jessica lapidez I found really good members of staff.id definitely would stay again,I hope to come back next year to stay again to enjoy New York

Stayed at the EconoLodge from June 22-25. The room was a little smaller than expected but for my budget sufficed for my needs. My requirements: inexpensive in a safe neighborhood with a close walk to the train station. I had to sign up for the choice rewards to get a discount on the room but I was able to book the room for 150ish per night which was better than my AAA discount.... The staff was friendly, the room (however very small like really small) was clean, and we are only a few blocks from pretty much anything. The only thing kind of rough other than the room size with the Hotel here is the Wifi speed is pretty slow but it is way better than internet speeds while roaming with my smartphone( kept cutting in an out on my MBpro)... The room came with a TV (19-24 inch didn't even turn it on). There is a lot to do in NYC and the Trip advisor app for your smart phone is kind of a must. The staff suggested a few things to do for us while my girlfriend and I stayed here as well. We were going to do the on and off bus tour but ended up just getting the metro card for a week (about 30 each and just made out own the tour ourselves) I would stay here again but like I said the wifi is pretty bad; I had to refresh the page here about 3 times before I could submit it. The bathroom was clean with fresh towels but the bathtub ( could be my imagination) seemed shorter than a normal bathtub(could have been my imagination). The breakfast got the job done for me with Bagels, cereal and boiled eggs peeled pop tarts and coffee and some cheese and meat slices was perfect for a light breakfast. With everything said and done I saved myself at least 400$ staying here rather than somewhere else. I got a 20% off discount for my next stay: (Thanks to the awesome staff at the front desk) I can deal with that. Next time I roll through NYC I'll stay here again.

My daughter inlaw and I stayed 5th June till 9th June hotel was great all the staff very friendly and helpful with street maps and booking sightseeing tours ,Times Square 5 min walk from hotel ,will be booking into econolodge again you made our holiday all the more enjoyable in the fascinating city of New York

Excellent location (passing through town for a night to see a show) and friendly/helpful staff, but I don't think we would have enjoyed a longer stay - just too cramped for us. To clarify what "cramped" means.... there was less than a foot bwt the bottom of the bed and the wall -- which required either walking sideways / or climbing over the bed - to get to the other side. Apparently, for more $$$ you can get a room where it is possible to walk around the bed, but we didn't want to spend more $ on that night's stay. Only other issue was a broken safe, which meant that we had to be moved to a different room.Otherwise we thought that the Econo Lodge was a clean & comfortable play to stay. We are used to NYC noise, so the street noise wasn't a big deal - although I guess that might bother some people (use the earplugs). Breakfast was fine / seating a problem so you might have to bring your breakfast back up to your room. $$$ in that area are exhorbitant; if you are looking to save $ - this is a good choice.

Small, hot and a wobly matrassWill I stay at the Econo Lodge Times square again ? For sure !Why? Good value for money, good location, friendly service and sufficient breakfast. The hotel deserves it current rating of 8.1 and it looks as if the staff is proud of and protecting that rating.

It has taken us a while to finally write a review for the Econo lodge but we could not avoid mentioning the great stay we had while in NYC. We spent in total 12 nights in town and all at the Econo lodge Times Square. Room are small but comfortable and expected for a central location. The bed is super comfortable and queen size (which is rare) bathroom with bathtub shower and everything that is needed. Safety box, tv, A/C or heating. The breakfast in the morning was great too. Coffee, bagels, croissants, cheese etc. it is a small lobby but if you time it right you find a table. Reception staff and floor staff was great. A big thank you to Jessica which smile and welcoming attitude was fantastic. Very professional and helpful. A block away from Times Square, Broadway, subway stops, restaurants etc. you couldn't choose better for the price and service. Thank you again from the two Australian that were really hoping to see snowing but only got Flurries ;)

Hotel was nice. Staff was amazing! They were ALL so very friendly and helpful. Don't get that often. Rooms were small but when your in New York how often are you in your room? Noisy? Yes... but what else do you expect in New York for a decent price? Room service was great! Will definitely recommend this hotel!

This specific location and relatively decent reviews prompted my reservation for 2 nights, made more than three months before our stay. When we arrived, two rooms (each with two beds, same as our reservation) were given to the walk-in customers just ahead of us in line. It took 2 people 20 minutes to deal with those people, then we were greeted with a pre-written apology letter claiming an "unexpected maintenance issue" meant we had to stay at a different hotel for one night. They offered discount coupons for attractions we could not visit, plus cab fare to the GEM Hotel which was nowhere near Times Square (at 449 W 36th St ... we liked the GEM very much despite its more remote location). The Econo Lodge offered 20 percent off the first night's stay. I didn't want a discount for one night; I wanted the room I reserved, and I didn't believe the story about a "maintenance issue." Overbooked, perhaps? Since we were only staying two nights, we had to change hotels each night at a hotel a long distance away from the area we needed to be in, causing extra wear and tear on my young niece who suffers from juvenile rheumatoid arthritis. The disruption was terribly inconvenient, a poor attempt at customer service, and the rattled front clerk (rattled perhaps because she knew the problem wasn't "maintenance issues?") was horribly inefficient in dealing with us and the earlier guests we saw checking in. Econo Lodge needs to improve its customer service training! Because our day started so early the second day (when we had to take a cab to drop off our bags at Econo Lodge) we had the decent breakfast buffet, served 6 to 9 a.m. We left our bags at the front desk, and they assured us the bags would be taken to our room when the room was ready. When we returned at about 5 p.m., the bags were still behind the desk. Econo Lodge: Don't make a promise if you're not going to deliver on it!Despite the convenient location, I will never return and cannot recommend this hotel.

TLDR: Good location, everything else: meh.Pros: Location; very convenient for sight seeing, cheap compared to other hotels, surprisingly comfy bed. Staff helpful.Cons: Really small rooms, noisy (ear plugs supplied in bathroom), furniture and hotel looks a bit tatty and dated.Probably wouldn't stay again unless I was on a budget.
