This was my first time in NY city and this hotel was in a perfect location,all the staff on reception are very friendly and polite,the breakfast is simple but good the only small problem was the small rooms but if you can get beyond that your ok

Want to experience the middle of NYC without a huge price tag? This is the ticket. Nothing flash but clean rooms, VERY friendly staff and is walking distance to things such as: Times Square where Good Morning America goes to air, many of the Broadway Theaters, Empire State Building, Flat Iron Building. If it is to far to walk, jump on the Hop On Hop Off bus: that is just across the road from the Hotel. Great place!!!

Just on the flame of the Hells kitchen, right at the Broadway stage. Perfect location. Price is pretty reasonable for Manhattan. Unbelievable small rooms – not for claustrophobe’s. They desperately need to change windows for soundproof ones – you feel like sleep right on the Times square (I mean try to fell sleep). Poor breakfast and just 3 tables to have it. And they forgot to buy a hoover for the cleaning ladies I guess.

What can I say? For travellers on a budget whose only concern is a base for seeing New York then this is for you. The four girls on reception are excellent, very helpful. The cleaners work well with what they have, room and bathroom spotless but hotel really, really needs major facelift in all areas. Breakfast was included and tea/coffee available 24/7. Location could not be bettered.

This Econo Lodge located in New York was a fine experience and left a good impression on me! The stay was pleasant, the night sleep was great, it was quiet so I wasn't disturbed, the food was fine, location was fantastic, and the service was superb. There are generally no complaints about this hotel that I could make; there was no one issue that stuck out to me at all! Great experience for a great price, 5 Stars!

after ready some reviews and seeing pictures i was sceptical about the econolodge however once i arrived it is a brilliant location, the room is lovely for one person with great amenities and being so close to times square i still slept well! very very happy with this hotel and would 100% choose this hotel when i return to new york. Thank you Econo Lodge!

Stayed here five nights with the family. The location just by Times Square is just perfect, and the place and staff is really nice. We started each day with the complimentary breakfast - yoghurt, croissants and bagels and tea/coffee made a good start for exploring a whole day.

Good location. Tiny rooms. Good breakfast. Best part of this hotel was Salim, and the Reception sStaff. Of special note was: Jessica.  Not only was she efficient, helpful, and knowledgable, but she also was very friendly, and had a great demeanour with her customers , even under pressure.She really made us feel "at home" with her big smile and her oft heard expession "Enjoy!"

A very basic hotel with a perfect location. Couldn't get a better deal with such premium location.Clean, tidy and offers all you need for a night or two in Manhattan.Recommended for singles or couples, not families with kids.Breakfast is very poor, but Starbucks is around the corner so no issues there...

What a great location. Just 200 ft from the Gray Line hop on hop off bus tour and just one block to Times Square. Yes the rooms are small, even by cruise line standards, but they were clean and the desk people were very helpful and cheerful. The breakfast was a welcome addition. We stayed here using our Choice reward points but from what I saw this is one of the better value hotels if you would be paying and you can not beat the location.

Econo Lodge Times Square - located at 47th and 8th - easy walking to Times Square, theaters, restaurants, and subway stations. The front desk staff were all very helpful and friendly. The lobby has a few tables, a computer & printer for guest use (for a fee, mind you), and the usual tourist brochures. There is ONE elevator that services all floors and also serves as the service elevator. It's slow and often has a mind of its own - push 1st floor button, for example, and you may find yourself on the 6th floor. Not a big deal, but if you're in a hurry, plan ahead.My room was very small, as is usually the case in NYC, pretty worn around the edges - but very clean. The room air freshener used is enough to make you puke - it's so incredibly strong and overpowering. I actually turned on the air conditioner's fan to try and dissipate the odor. The bed seemed fairly new and was comfortable. There was also a fridge in the room, a wee closet, a safe, and earplugs - good idea. iron & ironing board, alarm clock radio, curtains that didn't quite cover all of the lone window. Breakfast during my stay consisted of hard boiled eggs, pastries including fresh croissants, mini slices of 2 types of cheese and mini slices of a hard salami, bagels, yogurt, oranges & apples, orange juice, cold cereals, coffee & tea. There isn't enough seating in the lobby for all guests at breakfast - the front desk told me each room has a tray of some sort for people to bring breakfasts back to their room. (mine had an old plastic tray; i saw another guest with half of a cardboard box). The air conditioner's fan worked well for both white noise for sleeping and for getting rid of the awful air freshener odor. The shower was hot but not powerful, the wi-fi was pretty lame. Considering the rate for this hotel is often comparable to other properties in the same neighborhood, the quality of the room and stay doesn't justify the prices charged. I'm in NYC 4 to 5 times a year and this was my first stay at this property. I'm not sure I would stay again, although the 20% discount card offered to me upon my departure could be a nice incentive.

After I booked the Hilton for the wrong night, I needed to find a place to stay asap. Hotwire placed us here and we walked a few blocks in the pouring rain, with our luggage to the hotel. Lol When we got there, we were warmly greeted by the front desk staff and quickly checked in. What a relief. The room was on the 8th floor, and when we walked in, it seemed as if the maid had just sprayed 2 whole bottles of fabreeze in there. It was very thick. After about 5-10 minutes of light choking on the fabreeze, we unpacked all the stuff we needed. The room was tiny tiny tiny, but I guess that's to be expected in NYC. I mean, the wifey and I are not big people, but there were places that we needed to squeeze by each other, that's how small it was. After a night on the town in the rain, we got back and fell a sleep. We were woken at 3am by a loud knock at the door, by someone who was supposedly given our room number to stay in, in error. Luckily I had put on the door latch, when we go in, or he would've walked right in with me and my wife fast asleep! After going to the door and telling him we were there, we got a call from the front desk, asking for our name!? After I told them what they wanted, no explanation was given, and she hung up. I was not pleased at this point, and called them back to find out what was going on. It looks like there was a miscommunication with the day and night staff, and that they had given that guy out room to stay in. We eventually fell back asleep, and the next day when we checked out, they had a card for us apologizing for the mixup. All in all, even with that A.M. mishap, it wasn't that bad. Everyone there was friendly and cordial, and if I needed to, I would stay there again.

We Stayed in Econo lodge Times Square for six days in mid-April. The hotel is situated in in an excellent location, a short walk from 50th street subway station that takes you in a 40 minutes ride to JFK, and to most of Manhattan's attractions that are not walkable – though many are in a walking distance. Though it is located a five minutes' walk from busy Times Square, we felt very safe at nights. All of The staff members were extremely friendly and helpful and we felt very welcome. As for The room – it was clean and tidy, though very small, as one can expect from a Mid-town hotel. The complimentary breakfast was not fancy but it was a sufficient start for a walking day. The price that we've paid was quite modest, comparing the other equivalent Manhattan hotels. There were three tolerated downfalls: one was the shower, for the unstable flow of hot water. We've complained about it and the stuff did check it out twice, but with no results. We felt discomfort to complain again because we did not want to nag, but it will be for the benefit of this lovely hotel to tackle this problem in order to avoid such complaints from future guests.The second was the street noise, but the earplugs supplied by the hotel helped to ease that uncomforting a bit...The third was the tiny space for breakfast. Only five small tables in the narrow lobby, and sometimes it got a little crowded...Overall - a nice and pleasant stay, in a lovely little hotel!

The hotel was nice, a bit out dated. Breakfast was ok but I recommend to switch it up because it's the same breakfast every morning. The rooms are very tiny but comfortable. I will like to thank stephanie (front desk receptionist) for the early check in! She was nice and always willing to help. If I come back to NY I will stay here again

My husband and I are home from our 2 day visit to NYC. We were extremely happy with this hotel. It was very reasonably priced. It has small rooms but they are clean and comfortable. The front desk was very attentive and had great advice for things to do, places to see and how to save money on transportation to the airport. We didn't get a chance to take advantage of the breakfast each morning because of our schedule but there was always coffee available. And you couldn't ask for a better location!!!! We will definitely stay again and we have already recommended the hotel to friends thinking of visiting NYC.

Just got back from our 4 night stay. It's in a great location, really close to Times Square. The room was a bit small, but we were out for most of the day anyway, so just needed somewhere to sleep really. The staff were all incredibly helpful and friendly. Would stay again!

(Positive point) ロケーション良し、スタッフ良し、お値段も良し、朝食も良し！ チェックイン当日、冷蔵庫のリクエストをしたところ、部屋に小さな冷蔵庫を持ってきてくれました。 特にジェシカというレセプションの女の子はいつも気遣ってくれ、とっても気持ちの良い声掛けをしてくれ、また泊まりたい気持ちでいっぱいになりました。 ブロードウェイのチケットが安く買えるTKTSまで徒歩３分ほど。 スーパーも近くにあり。 Location is very good. I would like to say thank you especially to Jessica. She is one of reception lady who takes care of customers very nice and friendly. And also supporting staff are very nice too. (Negative point) タオルに汚れがあることもありましたが、たぶん言えばすぐに変えてもらえると思います。 他の書き込み通り、部屋は狭いです。 初日、私の部屋だけ暖房がきいていなかったようで、とっても寒い思いをしました。が、その件でもすぐに対応- してくれ、最終的にはオイルヒーターを持ってきてくれました。 大通りに近いので、夜はクラクションの音や消防車・警察車両の音でうるさいですが、部屋に耳栓もあり、欠点- は補おうとしている姿勢がとても好印象です。 I saw some towels were bit dirty. But I think if you tell them, then they will change. The room was very small. If you open your suit case half, then it works. The first day, my room was very cold, but they bring me a oil heating, so there was no problem. The night was noisy with the firefighter's car and police's car, but there are earplugs in the room. So, this is also no problem.

Location = out of this world!Staff = all were attentive, friendly and accomodating (esp when there was no hot water when we arrived and they paid for us to take a cab to their sister hotel a few blocks away)Breakfast = well stocked right up until the last minute along with tea and coffee available whenever you wanted!Hotel room = a squeeze but fresh and clean. Bed and pillows were comfortable. However, manager really needs to look into new shower heads! There must have been a water tank problem at the time as there were a few problems related to hot water and the toilet not flushing!!!!!!Other = the free WiFi code changed day to day so you have to keep on top of this if you want to make use of it. I feel a better selection of fruit should have been on offer for breakfast but the rest the food provided was great.My first visit to the USA and the location along with friendly staff has resulted in me considering this hotel again if I go back to NYC.

The service desk is simply amazing making every effort to satisfy your needs. It was my first trip to NY and my plans where not totally set. They made everything possible to help to define the best places and even helped on booking some places.The rooms are really small, so don't think you will be able to have many bags open (I had 4 and it was a HUGE job on keeping them out of the way).Location could not be better and havina a bathtube is really cool.

Working through a couple logistical difficulties, the staff remained attentive to the needs of the guests. The front desk personnel were always ready to assist the guest along with apologies for any inconveniences experienced. Great location for all things Broadway.

Perfect budget hotel! No luxury, but comfortable and clean. Location is superb and the personnel at the front desk is very helpful. You can go to Broadway theatres easily, all of them are within walking distance and on perfectly safe streets. Rooms are really small, but the bed was big and comfortable. Little space for clothes and the towels should be bigger. Toiletries and hair dryer were ok.It was nice to have coffee and tea and fresh fruits in the lobby the whole day round. The complimentary breakfast was ok, considering the rates that we have paid. Free wifi worked reasonably well.This place is a Very goog option! I would recommend strongly this hotel and I'm planning to return to it when I came back to New York.

A few problems when checking in due to maintenance issue with room requiring me to go to sister hotel for the night. Staff very apologetic but I was tired after a long flight and not impressed with the inconvenience, I think it was more a case of the room double booked. I was given discount vouchers and a bottle of wine which was a nice thought. When i did finally get my room, i was told lift was 'out of order' and i was on the 5th floor! Luckily the staff offered to take all my luggage up, but lift wasn't working for 2 days which made it very inconvenient, again staff very apologetic, it wasn't there fault.Wifi was also not working despite the front desk staff best attempts to reset it etc. Took 2 days for that to also be fixed. For a city that never sleeps wheels sure do turn very slowly or maybe its just this hotel.The rooms were functional, i booked the 'deluxe' room with refrigerator and it was very modest so wouldn't of booked the lesser category. House keeping was very efficient and punctual. Breakfast was ok, basic continental, same thing everything morning no changes, tea n coffee available 24hrs.All in all i am sure there are better hotels around but the location is good a block from times square, a grocery store on the corner, and beside that grays sightseeing office which operates the hop on off bus. You get what you pay for and i knew this was one of the cheapest hotels in the most expensive neighbourhood and aside from the problems mentioned id probably consider staying here again, after all who sits in their room in NYC anyway!!

room was very small, but clean and had all we needed for 3 nights. Bathroom also small but had toileteries which were renewed every day, also had a hairdryer, safe, iron and ironing board in room. Hot tea and coffee were available 24/7 also the free breakfast was great, set us up for the day. Staff were very good,booked us a taxi for return to airport and printed our boarding passes. Free wifi also in hotel. on the whole we had a fab time and the hotel was very good, also very warm and it was freezing in New York.

Finding affordable rooms in a good location in large cities (NY, London, Tokyo, etc.) is tricky. Last time I tried it in NY, the place was filthy and had bed bugs, so I was a bit worried about this. However, it was fine. The rooms were tiny, but about the same as many in that area I have stayed in, which are generally 1.5-2x the price. So I was happy for the location. We only planned to sleep there anyway. Unfortunately, the weather didn't cooperate, so we were stuck in the room a lot over the 3 days. Then I had a chance to use the internet. WIFI is free, but painfully slow. As is common, the windows don't open, so one cannot get fresh air. The room was very hot at one point. We could not control the temperature and called the front desk. They said they have to make the change, so it took a long time. In the meantime, we had to have the hall door propped open to get a little more comfortable. The room was clean and no sign of bed bugs! What a relief! The sink was cracked and did not drain well, but luckily the bath tub did drain normally. It is only a half tub - not sure how anyone could take a bath, but it was perfectly fine for a shower. The towels were adequate, but about half the size of regular hotels (you get what you pay for). It would be difficult to stay longer than a few days, since there is practically no storage. The limited space required a dance with another person, to get by each other. There was a tiny desk, tiny night stand and tiny armoire with a safe, that did not work for us (but I didn't bother asking to have it fixed). There were adequate outlets. The oddest thing for us was having to remember to get a new key card each day. There was a single, slow elevator, so if we forgot it was a long trip back to get a new key. Also, the WIFI code changes daily, although that is available by phone. We read complaints about the noise. Perhaps it's because we live in another city, but we found it all quite tolerable and did not have to use the earplugs provided by the hotel. The price (we paid about $160/night) included a free breakfast, which was better than I expected (some times hard boiled eggs, meats and cheeses along with fruit, cereal, pastries, bagels, juice and coffee). Coffee was available all day, too. I tried to describe it accurately. It was mostly about the location for us, so we will return. But besides that, we were pleasantly surprised by how wonderful all of the staff were - each one of them. That was another plus. They will hold your bags before check in and after check out, which is nice. The only bad thing is there is no public bathroom in the lobby, so we had to go to a restaurant before leaving for the long trip home.

Like that stylish glass gem shining in the jewelry counter at Walmart, it's the 'nicest thing in the case"...but you're at Walmart.The Econolodge is a nice budget hotel. That means it isn't awful because you expect a nyc budget hotel to be terrible. It is clean. Everything works. The bed is comfortable. The internet was good enough to stream some TV (better late at night). The bathroom was free of scary things. The door locked. The maids cleaned. It was cheap...even cheaper with points which is how I paid. If a friend put you up here you would 'unfriend them' tomorrow. It is the kind of place that you book for yourself...rather sell to yourself by saying things like "how much time will I spend in the room?" or "I do want to be close to Times Square". But really, there is NOTHING about the hotel that you would brag about and you won't be sharing photos of your "gem of a room" with your coworkers back home. As Joan Rivers once said "the room was so small that when I put my key in the door, I broke the window". The desk is for a child, the toilet is for a child and the closet is for a doll. You can sit at the desk and reach back and remove things from the closet. You can rest your foot on the bed while you type on your laptop at the desk. You have to close the door to use the sink in the bathroom. Get the picture? You can't 'walk around the bed' as it is all but wedged into the room. So, the hotel is safe and clean but you may want to cover your face as you leave so nobody gets a picture of you there. Get it? Lastly, if you're a couple than it's better to be newlyweds. That way one person can sleep on top while the other gets the bottom.

This is one of those reviews that takes me a while to write. i don't want to bash the hotel as i liked it here, but i had the worst night's sleep ever. Make sense? let me start by saying the hotel location ROCKS. we walked to the theater, we walked to dinner. we walked around. so simple to get to times square, 5th avenue, theater district and eats. it is also one of, if not THE most affordable hotels in the city, given the location. you'll still pay around $200 a night, but go hotel shopping and you'll see this is one of the best you'll get, for the area its in.as other reviewers have stated, the room is really tiny. however i have stayed in the more upscale hotel tiers in ny and they are around the same size. its a new york thing, and i am all for chillin' in my room, but in the city i really am only in the room to sleep.which brings me to the thing. SLEEPING. because of the location, u pay for it at night. i have no idea how such a large number of people have so much energy all night, and you can hear it all night long. i was definitely not super surprised, as when i flicked on the bathroom light upon arrival there were 2 packages of earplugs on the counter lol. they just didn't help. there is a party outside your window 24-7.anyhow, back to other good things. the room is super clean, comfy bed. the walls are paper thin, but you can't sleep here at night anyway.really loved the breakfast in the morning. yes the lobby is tight, but think of it as the same size of your room. they provided fresh donuts (cream filled too!), pastries, bagels, yogurt, juices and coffee. for free this was pretty great.beware there is no valet parking. u must park the next street over and its a garage at $48 a day. its tough....do u stay at a pricier hotel with parking or do you go cheaper but pay separate for parking? lastly, hotel staff was pretty pleasant. we were always greeted coming in and going out. all in all, if i was in town for a night, i would stay here. longer than that though...i mean, i dunno. a girl's gotta sleep:)

Location is fabulous; the staff is friendly and helpful, the bed and pillows very comfortable, sufficient breakfast. Bring a fan to help mask traffic noise. My daughter and I loved our cozy place and would certainly be happy to return for our second visit to NYC!

The location is just great. Only 2-3 minutes by walking to Times Square. Price is OK when compared with other hotels in the are. There is a market very close to hotel. However rooms are small. Breakfast is ok however there was only 2 tables for breakfast for all hotel customers.

I have stayed at this hotel twice. What brings me back is the great location. If you are in NYC to see Broadway shows, it is incredibly convenient. Also, pricing has been very good both times. Be advised that the rooms are VERY small. I was travelling as a single so it was OK. If you are travelling with someone, you will feel cramped. However, how much time do you spend in your room in NYC.Breakfast and the free WiFi are very nice touches and the staff is very friendly. Stephanie at the front desk was very helpful and the maid was very pleasant also.Bottom line - if you can get a good rate at this hotel, I highly recommend it.

New York service can be a mixed bag....from maddening to endearing. This hotel has succeeded in elevating their service to a very high level. And it's genuine.Congratulations to the leadership team at this hotel for finding a group of employees (and I include every staff member, didn't find a single exception) that is genuinely pleasant, eager to please, and downright genuinely friendly. To the details....I arrived at a ridiculously early time of 7am. Not expecting to check in, but the front desk associate tried - genuinely and graciously - to help. No room available right then, but she explained the cleaning staff came in at 9 so a room should be available shortly thereafter. She offered me some (free, and good) breakfast in the meantime. I cam back at 10am and voila, the room was ready to go.Every staff encounter went like that. Eager to please, smiling (all of them), and genuinely friendly. The room? Tiny. The location? Very convenient. The price? Reasonable.All of those details are secondary to the staff. I can't rave enough, and can't wait to come back. Well done, Econo Lodge Times Square. You've got a great asset here in your people. The hotel is OK too, but the people are the key.

really enjoyed our stay at the econolodge,Yes rooms are small but they are lovely and clean and nice and warm for this time of year, Staff are lovely and location is fantastic and i think both these make up for the size of room and when all said and done how long are you in your room after all you are in nyc we will definately be staying here again,

My partner and I recently stayed at the motel (Feb 14) and we loved our stay. Both of us were doing New York on a budget and accommodation can blow out that budget, we found this place due to it's affordable per night rate and also its close proximity to times square and other attractions in NYC. Once we got there the staff were helpful and polite, there is free Wi-Fi and a breakfast was included, what more could we ask for!!Both my partner and I had read that the rooms were too small and my response to this is you are only there to sleep and clean yourself, space is a commodity in a city like NYC and the more room you have the more you will spend.Overall the room was great the shower was great, the heating worked and it wasn't noisy. Times square is literally a 5 minutes walk from here, hell's kitchen is down the block and all the theatres are fairly close to. This place is the diamond in the rough for anyone looking to do New York cheaply. If I were to come back to NYC, I would stay here again.

Just returned after 5 night stay. Hotel was great. Stayed with friends and family all of whom enjoyed it. Rooms small but soon got use to it just needed to be organised .Very warm in our room, clean and comfortable bed. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful special thanks to Stephanie. Breakfast was a welcome bonus, as was the 24 hour hot drinks. Location could not be faulted ,a gem of a place for the price we paid .Will certainly return. Love New York . Thanks Econo Lodge for a memorable stay.

Stayed 5 wonderful nights in February and couldn't fault,excellent stay and not a bad word to say.Breakfast was ample and well fed for the day ahead.The 24 hour tea/coffee in reception was greatly appreciated after a long dayBedroom very warm considering the cold weather and hardly used except at night.Staff very helpful,friendly and always available if needed.Thank you econo lodge for a excellent stay which made our New York stay go great.Will definetnly return.One other tip to add about the subway,buy a weekly ticket if using a lot,great value.

I stayed one night on a Friday. I checked in late after a night out. It was very easy to just take a subwayfrom downtown and get to the Econo Lodge on 47th street. The bed was very comfortable bed and theroom was in excellent condition.
user_name:
Niels L
New York City, New York

review_body: Have been visiting NYC for many years. Staying at more expensive hotels. Our stay at this property was our most enjoyable experience, because of the outstanding staff. Their friendly accommodating attitudegave new meaning to the term hospitality. We will definitely be back.

I stayed in the Econo Lodge for two nights last week (Feb 2014). The hotel is really great- great location, very clean and comfortable room despite very small, friendly and responsive staff, nice breakfast, free WiFi, etc. The only issue I had was that the room was too warm (in fact it was very hot). The front desk staff has tried to help but it was not really fixed. I opened the window to let the cold air in (it was 26F outside), but the effect was limited and the city noise was brought in too. I should have given the hotel five stars if there were no heating issue. I guess that the heating system may be too strong to match the small room. Overall, this hotel is great, absolutely value for money. I would come back and recommend it to my friends.

I spent 9 nights at Econo Lodge with my family. It's location is wonderfull and the staff very friendly. However, to 4 persons, the room was not so big, but the bed was very confortable. The breakfast is good but we had to take it into the room because it was served at 3 tables in the Lobby. The problem was to take a shower....No always the water became hot.
user_name:
Sonia M
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: Just returned from a week in econo lodge. If you're looking for somewhere clean, friendly in a great location, then look no further. Now let's be realistic, it's not the new York Hilton, the rooms are quite small BUT the beds are super comfortable with housekeeping every day, rooms are very warm and clean. It's also nice to have the choice of a bath and a shower after a long day sightseeing. The hotel is approx 200mts from times square. Also breakfast is a great bonus, with tea and coffee facilities available 24hrs. What makes the econo lodge so special is the friendliness of the staff ! Everyone one of staff are polite, friendly, helpful and professional. We are looking forward to returning soon

We stayed here for about 10 nights Dec/Jan 2013 to 2014. We had stayed in 3 other New York hotels before this one ( we stayed in different parts of the city to get a feel for the city)Location was good & staff were great. Being right in the middle of times square for new years was great.The place its self is a little run down ( peeling wall paper, outdated furniture)The elevator is slow ( 1 elevator for the whole building) and it broke down with us inside it! but In saying that the staff were very helpful and apologetic about this happening.Breakfast was good & having a computer & printer in the lobby was handy to print out tickets to shows etc.Christmas they give you candy canes in your room & new years they give you happy new year hats- i liked that.All in all this place is pretty good but would be wonderful with an updated renovation.

Location is amazing, right in the Lap of times square. Stayed here for two nights in January 2013. Hotel Staff is amazing, particularly the reception staff. The hotel rooms and bathrooms are very tiny with hardly any space to move around. We were on 2nd level and could hear street noises late into the night. The location beats all the flaws one might find. In NYC no one spends much time in hotel rooms anyways so for our short 2 night stay it was an ideal place and easy on pocket too.

TINY but the awesome staff makes up for it and you can't beat the price. ALL of the employees were just great...the housekeeping went above and beyond & even the maintenance kid was polite! ( He probably thought I was stalking him because he looked just like a twin of someone I know lol- Hi!) They all deserve a raise & recognition from Choice Hotels. Nice free breakfast as well. I will return!

I 've stayed in Econo Lodge Times Square in January 2014 for two days. Goods;Location is perfect... Exactly at Times Square,Breakfast is perfect. Better than most hotels, there is a tray in rooms to have breakfast in your room. They restore all foods immediately.Stuff is very helpful. There are earplugs in rooms. Because times square is noisy.Bads;Window's isolation was terrible, especially air condition part. It was blowing all cold weather into room. But thanks to friendly stuff they provided an extra heater. But, you still should solve that problem.

the staff make the difference for this hotel. the hotel should be very thankful for having all of them! location is fantastic, and works for your first time there. size of rooms is a concern, as stated before. cleanliness is not an issue, however some upgrades on the painting would improve the condition of the rooms. I cannot overemphasize the staff quality in the hotel!

We just had eight great days and nights in NYC. We thank the staff at Econo Lodge, sweet and kind people, for making us feel welcomed and safe. Kathy, Linda, Jessica, Stephanie, Andrea, we love you! And Salam, the other guys and ladies too. Couldn't get all their names tho. My bad! =/ - Whenever we can go back to the States and NYC, Econo Lodge will be our first option.

We've stayed in this New York City Econo Lodge three times so far and are planning another visit in January 2014, which is what made me think about writing this review. It's not ritzy but everything makes this a great place to stay if you'd rather spend your money on Broadway shows and museums. First, the rooms are impeccably clean and the furniture is new. Size is small but who cares when all you use your room for is to sleep and shower -- but yes there is a tub to soak in if that's your thing. It's a short walk to the Broadway TCKTS booth. it's free breakfast is excellent -- it reminds me of breakfast in a French hotel -- except for the bagels, of course. In addition to the usual coffee, juice, danish, bagels and muffins, they have sliced sausages and cheeses, fruits and yogurt. I also love the mix you meet in their small lobby at breakfast -- people young and old from a variety of countries. It's a great place to stay. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it doesn't compete in size with the other expensive hotels. It is on a busy corner and the street traffic is a little noisy at night, so ask for a room on the top floor. I've never had trouble sleeping, but have sometimes heard noise. When I say sleep quality is average below, I'm referring to the street noise -- the bedding is very comfortable.

I just stayed here over the Christmas holidays and it was a great. The location is great, the staff was friendly and the room was pretty clean. The rooms are extremely small, as it has been said before. I've stayed in other hotels in NYC and this was by far the smallest (there is literally maybe a foot on each side of the bed - no real room of lots of luggage). But again, small rooms are normal for NYC. I'd stay here again and recommend this hotel!

First off I have to say all five young people at the front desk were professional, well-trained and able to mange multiple interactions with multiple guests simultaneously with expertise. And every one of them seemed genuinely friendly and bought into service culture. That's a BIG plus to me.The location, one block from Times Square and walking distance to our favorite NYC restaurant in Columbus Circle, is also a BIG plus.What's NOT so big is the room we had. I've had small rooms in Paris, Venice and New York before. I believe our room was 8 feet by 8 feet. There was no place to put our luggage except the windowsill and small cramped hallway - it would not fit on the floor between the bed and the wall on any side of the bed, and we only travel with luggage that meets airline overhead size restrictions. Now I have to admit the room was clean, and smelled nice, but it was beat up a bit (patchwork wallpaper) and the bed was comfortable on one side but not the other. Other observations about this hotel: The 19" tv had problems with over half the channels (a black window would appear in the middle with a bunch of code - see pic attached to review). Ironically, the screen size did not seem small, relative to the tiny room.The elevator worked off and on, and I felt sorry for the Italian guest who were lugging huge suitcases up the cramped, dimly lit staircase. There was a note posted on each floor apologizing for the telephones not working as well. We are generally loyal to Choice hotels but I don't think I could stand a room this small again, even though we only come back to the room to shower and sleep. And I can't imagine the problems with the tv, elevator, telephones was a symphony of anomalies. Oh, I forgot to mention the cracked sink in the bathroom (pic) and the fights, sirens and endless honking outside the hotel until 3am on Saturday.

Looking for an economic place to stay and visit New York then this Econo Lodge is it. Conveniently located within two miles of Times Square, the hotel is clean and affordable. Would definitely stay again.

Pros: Great location. Very helpful and friendly staff. The room was tiny, but that is expected and not needed since we spent our time in the city. The room was very clean and smelled nice. Cons: Please read the terms and conditions first. I booked online. Three days before our trip an authorization was on my bank account for the first night total. Then, when we checked in, the staff stated they would put the total for the stay plus an additonal $821.00 on my debit card. We ended up paying cash because It was a headache.

My daughter and I stayed for seven nights, ok the rooms were small but the beds were clean and comfortable and you are only there to sleep. There was a hair dryer, iron, ironing board and a safe in the room too.The location was perfect within walking distance of many tourist attractions and shopping, we only had to use the subway a couple of times to go down to the Battery Park area, because that is to far to walk !The staff were very friendly, helpful and made you feel very welcome, any requests were seen to right away. The coffee, tea, hot chocolate or iced water in the lobby at anytime was very convenient, in fact I don't think we ever passed on the way in, without helping ourselves to a cup, again the complimentary breakfast was enough to get you going for the day, if it was busy when we went down we just took it up to our room.If we were returning to New York, we would definitely stay at the Econo Lodge again.

When we arrived to the hotel we were greeted by a lovely girl at reception who we chatted away with, I had said I wanted to pay the few for the hotel by card and she advised me that if it is a debit card that the hotel can incur an extra authorisation hold on some money and not release the funds for 30-60 days, I immediately said no and decided to pay in cash which I did and that was fine.. Later that evening when I was checking myBank balance I seen that the money was also takenFrom my account!! I went downstairs to the same girl and told her, she advised that she contacted the bank and they said it was only a hold and be be returned straight away. I found it quite odd and off putting that she had chose not to give meA heads up about this when she first cancelled my card transaction, she just waited until I cameDownQuerying it, maybe she was hoping I wouldn't notice and it would go back in on time I'mNot sure, anyhow I was happy it was going straight back in and left it at that. However three days later and still no money returned, massive nuisance for me as my holiday was almost over and I was down 600 dollars!! I had to go back andForth 3/4 times about this and finally they did get it put back onto my card. After this happened I remembered that I had used a friends card to confirm and preauthorise the first nights stayBooking three days before I arrived and was told by email that it would return in 3-5 days, so I got onto him and of course the money still wasn't returned.. Still hasn't been returned!!! Again I was advised of this 30-60 day [--] , obviously I was very annoyed as it had now seemed like I was charged three times for one booking!!!! Another hour or two of nuisance caused by having to contact banks to get numbers etc so they could stop the hold on the money andStill nothing as of yet. I'mSure if this hotel was booked by credit card or cash it would have been a lot better but DO NOT pay by debit card as you will have to chase themFor the money back! A great location and decent rooms for the price but absolutely shocking in terms of messingYou about money wise... You need to make your customers aware of the termsAnd conditions and not just by having it on a sign in reception after you arrive!!!!

perfect location.got there late at night.my room was ready.staff was so kind.coffee was available 24h at the reception.room was very clean.i was expecting a bigger room, i was surprised but i did not spend time in there except at night.so it was ok being solo.just behind times square, location was perfect to walk or to find a bus.the only problem was the elevator.only one and very slow.i highly recommend this hotel.value for money was perfect.i will definitely check in again in the future.

We arrived early and a room was ready. There was an issue with my reservations and I ended up speaking with Daisy (manager) who was very polite and accommodating. She made the first impression of the hotel great. She worked with me to fix the problem to a reasonable degree. All prices of hotels in Manhattan was so expensive to me and the price of even the Econolodge for what I was getting seemed high but after the experience I believe it was worth the price. The room was small (expected it after reading reviews) but my boyfriend and I had to get used to it and we did. I do know how people who have a lot of luggage and are taller than 5'9" tall would fare in the room for long periods of time as we had to maneuevor around each other to get around the bed and to the bathroom. The bathroom toilet seat would not stay up but the hot water and water pressure were great. Having a hair dryer and iron in the room was also great. The room safe instructions did not match the room safe we had in the room so we did not end up using the safe. The room was clean enough (paint chips and older looking carpets) but we did have towels and bed sheets with noticeable stains a few nights. I did notice the room to be a little dusty for my boyfriend who is prone to allergies. I liked that after maid service we were left with two bottles of water each day and chips. All staff was very polite and helpful which was appreciated. The elevator is slow for having only 6 floors but not a big deal. The continental breakfast was a great thing to have each morning included in the hotel rate. They give you ear plugs which we had to use each night because we would not have been able to sleep without it due to the noise of honking taxis, sirens from ambulances/fire trucks but that is what I expected. The room temperature was perfect for our trip in the fall. The location was perfect. Close to subways stations on 49th and 50th street. Neighborhood is safe. Close to Penn Station if you take a train to NYC. For security, you needed to have your room key code changed each day which was a new experience for me. But I appreciated the security measures. Time square and the theaters are in walking distance and so is Bryant Park. I asked the front desk clerk to arrange a car service from hotel to JFK and they did. Did not realize the car service was "cash only" and didn't have change but luckily we had cash. Overall experience at this hotel was fine and I believe the staff made the hotel stay the best besides the location. Daisy...thank you again and please thank all of your staff for me.

My sister was visiting me from New Mexico and we took the train down to NYC for a few days. I wanted a central location and this hotel was perfect. Anyone who has been to NYC knows rooms can be small if you don't pay a premium and this place wasn't any different. I expected a small room (504) but I didn't expect the small space available for moving around. The desk is in the walk way to get to the bed and then to get to the other side of the bed nearest the window was also difficult. Having lived in NYC before I know that you can't always control the heat and our room was always too warm. We were able to open the window but the heat was still too high. We filly plugged in the AC and ran it to cool down the room. With these challenges our stay was fine. The staff always acknowledged us when we came in or out which is always nice. Having lived in NYC before I didn't required directions or recommendations but they were offered and many times I heard the staff giving directions and recommendations to other guest.

I have to say when you first arrive you think OH after passing the nice W hotels and Marriott from the outside and even when you first go in your room it's very cosy... HOWEVER location is ideal and the rooms are spotlessly clean which is much important that size.Being just behind Times Square there is noise however the hotel provide ear plugs and to be honest with these in and the amount of walking you are dead to the world. Would DEFINATELY stay again. Staff all very helpful

This hotel is located at the heart of NYC!!!! I was in room 314 room was very small but clean. At first the room size bothered me because I could barely get around. I loved the location. I walked and walked and walked some more. The receptionist are very nice. Stephanie was very attentive. She always had a smile and willing to help. I would recommend my friends and family especially with the 20 percent coupon they give at the end of your stay.

Have just returned from New York after staying 6 nights in this hotel, and as others gave said the rooms are very small, but to be honest you are only sleeping in them. The location could not have been better and the staff were always so helpful.We were able to walk to all districts as it is so centrally located. Breakfast in the reception could get a little cosy at times but very good value, fresh coffee on tap at all times, and the rooms cleaned to a high standard.We would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a good value for money centrally located base.

On arrival we were given a room on the first floor.After the initial shock on how small it was we soon realised what a superb hotel this was.Look past the size of the room ,the chipped paint on the door frame and see what a gem of a place this is.The location is fantastic, so near Times Square and within walking distance of Central Park ,rail stations, Maceys and much more.The staff were lovely ,very helpful and friendly,couldnt have asked for more.The room was clean as was the bathroom.Not a lot of room in the breakfast area if everyone came down at the same time but we took the tray from our room and took our breakfast back upstairs.The complimentary coffee in the reception area was more than welcome.We were really sorry to leave after our week there .We moved on to Miami for a futher week into a much larger hotel with more facilities but both my husband and myself thought the Econo Lodge was a much nicer place to stay and both of us said we wished we were still there.Would definitely stay there again .

We spent 2 nights here in May as part of a road trip holiday. When we arrived, the girl on the desk couldn't have helped us any more then, and throughout our stay. The room was very small, but all we needed it for was to sleep in, and for that, it was great. In the room, there was complimentary crisps and bottles of water. There was also 2 packets of earplugs - we didn't need them, but would be very useful if you were a light sleeper, as we were facing the street. Breakfast was simple and did the job. Simple, but it was all we needed for a quick grab and go so we could get out and see the city! The location was perfect. A less than 2 minute walk to Times Square one way, and only a couple of blocks from 5th Ave the other! Subway at Times Square was right there and so easy and quick to get to.At the end of the day, the location was PERFECT for what we wanted, it was very clean, and the staff were very friendly! well worth our money!

There are 3 reasons why I've stayed at EconoLodge Times Square twice in the past 3 years when I've visited NYC:1). Location is great. It's 2-3 blocks from Times Square and in the theater district, but it's off the main streets (between 8th and 9th) so you don't get the same street noise as from Times Square. There is great food on 9th Avenue as well. 2). The value for mid-town Manhattan is hard to beat (especially if you are a choice hotel privileges member). In my personal opinion, anyone visiting NYC for pleasure spends very little time in the hotel anyway and EconoLodge aren't trying to charge an arm and a leg knowing their patrons aren't spending much time in the rooms. 3). Even though the rooms are very small, they are clean and the staff are friendly, professional and helpful. The continental breakfast is good and they leave coffee out most of the day and fresh ice water. I've seen a few negative reviews on here about having to wait on the rooms, or the staff being not so friendly, but I've never encountered that in my stays. However, even if I did, I think I'd be willing to forgive because I know not everyone is perfect and everyone has an off day. I feel safe, secure and like I'm treated with respect here and that goes a long way for me.

We spent 2 nights here as part of our honeymoon and chose this hotel due to its location - just off Times Square. We had to wait over an hour for our room to be prepared when we checked in - even though we arrived in the afternoon and the receptionist told the cleaners straight away to get our room ready. It shoudn't have taken them more than 20 minutes - especially considering the small size of the room. Other than this, everything was ok with our stay. Rooms are tiny and hard to sleep in due to the noise that comes through the windows - although they do give you earplugs. Some people might like to hear the noise of the city. Breakfast is included and it is quite nice. It is good value for the location as prices are inflated in the area. If you are planning on spending all your time in the city and just go back to your hotel to sleep, this place is a very good choice.

My boyfriend and I stayed here last friday through sunday. We LOVED it. FREE BREAKFAST!!! Javits Center wasn't too far away (We were here for Comic Con) and neither was Rockefeller Center. The front desk lady was so nice. It felt homey to us. I would definitely stay here again.

Room was quite small but everything else was great. Very clean, good location for walking,catching bus or subway. Front desk people were very knowledgable and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Joan N
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at Econo Lodge for 6 nights in September. We selected it based on reviews - all turned out to be true. Yes, the rooms are very small but as we were out sightseeing most of the time this was not an issue. The breakfast is excellent. Don't get hung up about not finding a table in the lobby to eat at as they are limited .. take your food up to your room. The 24 hour tea / coffee in the lobby was an added bonus. The staff were outstanding - very helpful and friendly. We had an issue with our bath plug and the chap who attended to it was great. And the location is the best. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed for four nights at the above hotel. As with most travelers price , location. and reviews played a part on our selection. The hotel was everything said about it. Rooms are certainly small,but move a chair or something and all of a sudden much better. Really enjoyed the place,friendly clean and so handy and by N Y standards not to pricey. It is a little gem and will stay there again hopefully

Stayed here for three days in September before going on cruise. We chose this hotel for the price and location. Our room was small, but adequate. There was a mini-fridge, and the bathroom looked liked it had recently been remodeled. Friendly staff and a limited free continental breakfast and 24 hour coffee in the lobby. We walked as far as Central Park and Grand Central Station. Lots of food places nearby. The pharmacy across the street has groceries, soft drinks, beer, Ice cream. You can stock the mini fridge and save a lot on food. The elevator is a little slow,but it was clean and looked to be well maintained. We would definitely stay here again.

Really enjoyed the hotel! There are many good points I can list:- Good price in comparison to the other hotels;- Amazing location;- Great staff;- Breakfast included!! (It's not a brunch, but we must consider that it's hard to find a hotel that has breakfast included!!)- Great service;- Wifi included;- Unlimited calls to US and Canada;- Discount ticket given of 20% to be used in the next stay (the whole stay, not one night!! =D)One bad point is that it's necessary to reactivate the room key every day!! Nothing is perfect though!For sure I'll return the next time in NYC!!

I really enjoyed my stay! I was visiting New York for a few days and decided to stay here because I've heard great things. The room was a little small but it was well worth it due to its proximity to such great city attractions. It was super close to the subway so moving around was a breeze. The place was well kept and the staff was great. In fact, Steve was very friendly when helping me bring my luggage to my room. Later in the evening he helped me with directions. I'd definitely come back here!!

Stayed on (top floor) 7th floor "penthouse" - this top floor room is a flight of stairs after 6th floor elevator (which we didn't mind) on its own floor, was told it was larger room. The wifi would not connect but the staff tried their best to restart router each day to try to get it working for us. Staff was helpful, friendly...the place was clean and easy to get from subway (50th is closest) price was good.

Loved my stay. Seven days running around the most famous city in the world. After walking around all you need is a clean room, comfortable warm bed. The front desk staff was amazing, trinita and Nigel are a great combo at the desk. I will be returning in January for a conference. Thanks for the hospitality.

This was my first trip to New York. My wife and I were visiting her college friend from when they attended Cal State LA many years ago. My wife made the reservations and everything about our four-day visit (Friday through Monday) was perfect. The professionalism and helpfulness of the staff and the quality of the decor and furniture made me feel that I was staying at a hotel with a fancier name (going by California standards). The close proximity (two blocks) to Times Square and the tour bus station made for a memorable and fun experience. The room was a bit of close quarters by California standards, but my wife's sister-in-law had forewarned us of what to expect and it was just part of our NYC experience. The complimentary breakfast was one of the best I've experienced and they kept it well-stocked until the end of the breakfast period. When we come back to New York next year, this is where we're staying.My only somewhat negative experience involved the souvenir shop next door. The salesman gave us discounts and then asked for cash rather than take our credit card. He then didn't offer a receipt and I didn't press the issue. I was able to return a defective item the next morning with no problem, but I now realize he could have been pocketing the cash for himself. So I would recommend always saying I don't have the cash and paying with a credit card.

New York City….what an AMAZING PLACE!!! My husband and I arrived into LaGuardia late at night 9:30 p.m. due to a canceled flight in Chicago. However, our luggage was put on a later flight and did not arrive until after 10:00 p.m. We took a taxi from LaGuardia to the hotel. The fare was $34.83. I was a bit bummed because I really wanted to check out the city. I was not disappointed as NYC really does not ever sleep!!! We checked into Econolodge, a block from Times Square and walked around and had pizza at one of the MANY little pizza shops that must stay open til I don’t know when!!! There were lots of places open to eat within a block of the hotel…even after midnight. We ended up getting back to the hotel around 1:30 a.m. The Econolodge had a different vibe for me. Price was good by New York standards compared to the other hotels I researched. We had a Queen size room. However, the room was SOOOO SMALL!!!! I cruise as often as I can and a prior poster stated that this room prepared her for her cabin on the cruise she was about to go on. I kid you not, this room was smaller than any oceanview or balcony cabin I have ever stayed in on four different cruiselines. It is TINY!!!! The bathroom was probably about the size of a cruiseship bathroom. I am a small person and I had trouble walking around the bed in our room. Breakfast at the hotel was nothing to write home about unless you were venting. We ended up throwing it away it was so bad and going out for breakfast. Hotel staff was AWESOME!!!! Staff was very helpful and courteous. The hotel is situated at the corner of 47th Street and 8th Avenue. The location of the hotel is very noisy. There is a fire station within a few hundred feet. It seemed like sirens were going off all night long. There is also a travel tour company with the double decker buses a couple buildings away, GrayLine I believe is what it was called. We used City Sights New York and did the night tour of the city and the 1 ½ hour boat tour of the island and rode the buses as an “on / off” mode of transportation. There were other things thrown in with the ticket, but we didn’t use them as we had already been on those excursions. I believe our pass was $59 per person. On Sunday when we were there, at least 10 blocks by the hotel were blocked off for street vendors selling everything from Gyro’s; Funnel Cakes; BBQ; Lemonade; scarves; jewelry; t’shirts/sweatshirts; and notebook/phone covers, etc. The street vendors are there until 6:00 p.m. Ninth Avenue is loaded with tons of restaurants and nightclubs. While in New York City, we did the Statue of Liberty tour including the Crown; Rockefeller Tour with passes to the Top of the Rock; 9/11 Memorial Site; Top of the Empire State Building; NBC Studio Tour and went to see the Broadway Show Mamma Mia. We were very disappointed in the NBC Studio Tour. The tour starts out with a movie about the past shows from NBC that lasts about 7 minutes. You then go to studio where they tell you they film Saturday Night Live (Very Tiny). Then they take you to a “Simulated news/weather room” where two people from your group will pretend to be the weather person and newscaster. And that is pretty much the extent of it. Definitely not worth the $27.50 we paid for the tickets. When we left, we took a taxi from the hotel to Penn Station, to catch a train to Philadelphia. The taxi fare for that trip was around $12.00. Penn Station is an absolutely beautiful train station. Even if you are not taking a train anywhere, it is worth a look.

Hotels in manhattan are always very expensive but this econologe had a very good price (around 160 per night) and the best location.2 blocks from the subway and 3 blocks from times square!the hotel is very simple with breakfast in the lobby, but very convenience either!I had some packages delivered before arrival and the front desk were very nice to keep them all.the rooms are very small but again they are just for sleeping.bathroom clean and nice bed.

Great place to stay if you are visiting NYC on a budget! Walking distance from Times Square, Central Park, Circle Line Tours, Rockefeller Center, broadway shows, great dining and so much more. The rooms were small, breakfast is very simple, but the hotel was clean and the staff was very nice. Great experience, we will stay here again on our next trip to the city!!

Good stay. Free breakfast ok, toaster would make it great for pop tarts and bagels. Rooms small but good enough for sleep. Trenita at the front desk so polite and sweet made you feel as If you were part of the econo family. Will recommend this to anyone coming to see the city.

This without a doubt has become my go to place to stay, love the staff and they pretty much becoming like a second family to me. Andrea and Trinita are the absolute best, they do everything to make sure I'm comfortable and content on my business stays. Keep up the great hospitality!

I went on a mother and daughter vacation and chose to stay there due to location, price, and available breakfast. Although the room was small, it was very efficient, comfortable, and clean. You just can't beat this location...so close to all theaters, subways, and walkable to many attractions. Best of all was the friendly and helpful staff! They were always eager to give suggestions, directions, and helpful tips to make our stay enjoyable - always with a smile! Trinita was great!! We'll definitely stay there again on our next trip to NY! May I sugest Carves Deli on the corner across the street for affordable and delicious lunch, etc!

I stayed there for 1 night with a friend of mine after a search for an affordable place near times square. We need a clean safe place to sleep over night. If that's what you're looking for, look no further. Pros: 2 min. Walk from times square, clean rooms, free breakfast, free (but slow) wifi, affordable price (compared to times square area prices)Cons: tiny room

If your looking for a comfortable place to lay down your head at night, and still be close to everything New York has to offer at an affordable price than this place is for you. If your the type of person who enjoys high-end amenities and large rooms then probably not for you. Friendly helpful staff and clean.

Very pleased with location of the hotel & the low price...easy access to subway lines, tour bus was right on the corner, and very easy walk to Times Square! Hotel offered a nice continental breakfast that went beyond the usual donuts and coffee. Room was a bit on the small side, but it was clean and good enough to lay our weary heads! Would not hesitate to stay here again!

This Econo Lodge has a great location and a very friendly and helpful staff. Our room and bathroom were very small but clean and well kept (and with no bedbugs !!). I wish the price (about $300/night with taxes) had been lower, and less noisy (our room overlooked 8th Avenue), but all in all we were very satisfied.

We were extremely impressed with our hotel experience at Econo Lodge Times Square during our recent stay. The Hotel was extremely clean, breakfast was very good and the staff were very helpful and friendly. While the room was small it more then met our needs as we were there to see New York and not spend time in the room. The location was excellent and allowed us to walk to most of the destinations that we were interested in. We would highly recommend this hotel and would stay again on our next trip. We felt that it was very good value for the price.

Service, value, sleep quality, cleanliness, location, rooms...all excellent!! And SMOKE FREE!!! Trinita and the other ladies (Front Desk) were very friendly, helpful and professional. Anita (Housekeeping) kept our room well stocked and very clean and tide. She even loaned us an umbrella when we said we didn't have one. Maintenance (sorry we didn't catch your name) brought a fridge to our room on request. We were treated like family. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable. We will see you again next summer, if not sooner.

The hotel is at a very convenient location! It's at the corner of West 47th Street and 8th Avenue, just steps away from Times Square, the Theatre District, Hell's Kitchen, the subway, Port Authority, just to name a few.I arrived in the morning after a long 9+ hour flight and was able to check in. The lady at the front desk was nice and said to help myself to the free (continental) breakfast as it was almost over. I asked if I could get a mini refrigerator in my room, and she said if there was one available, they would bring it to my room. (That was the last I heard about it as they never contacted me either way, so I didn't know if one was available or not.)The room was very tiny, but I did expect that because I read the reviews before I booked it. Since I was going to be there only for two nights during the Memorial Day weekend, I'd be okay with it. However, it would've been hard for two people to stay longer with bigger luggage. Not much room to even walk around by the bed, let alone to have space to store your luggage. The bathroom was okay, fairly clean and small but enough for me to move around, but the closet was so very small! It could only fit my blouse. I had to hang my pants and dress by the lamp stand since they couldn't fit in the closet. Besides the free continental breakfast, the hotel also provided free wireless internet in the room, My room was on the top floor (only 6 floors), but I could hear a lot of noise from the outside, which made it hard for me to sleep. Not too sure if there was near a bar or something, but there a lot of people talking and yelling to the wee hours of the morning, not to mention all the cars honking.One other thing to note, you have to swipe your cardkey at the front desk after midnight every night.I will probably stay here again in the future because of the location and the price.

Stayed one night before a cruise, perfect to prepare you for the cruise room size. I didn't mind it and loved the location of this place. Breakfast was good Steve kept everything full, we appreciated that! Trinita reserved us a taxi and gave us directions to wtc to and from before going to the Brooklyn cruise terminal. Thanks guys we would stay here again.

Customer service at the front desk was excellent. The front desk clerk by the name of Trinita very very helpful. My bags were misplaced by the airline. Trinita went above and beyond by calling and locating my bags from the airline. She was very helpful attentive. I would come back just cause of Trinitas service.

Loved everything about this hotel. Breakfast was good even had boiled egg and yogurt! (A major plus for someone watching their figure and on a budget) I arrived to the hotel early and the front desk girl Trinita was very sweet held our bags and have us directions to start our trip even though our room wasn't ready. Rooms are small but just enough space for a few days and just two people. I recommend coming and staying here.

It's near a subway station, the Times Square, Broadway and offers breakfast, coffee an free wi-fi.The staff are very polite, friendly and helpful.The hotel and rooms are small, but no problem because it's clean, the beds are comfortable and the shower is ok.I definitely recommend it!

I was frankly terrified after hearing NYC cheap hotel horror stories but was more worried about taking the train home well after midnight so decided to try this hotel. Found a VERY good rate online and went with it. My teenaged daughter and I were having a girls weekend in the city and planned to spend the whole weekend right in the Times Square area being tourists and seeing shows. This hotel was walking distance from all the theaters, had good restaurants nearby and a drugstore on the corner for all those little things we forgot when we tried to pack light and for the bed picnic we had before bed. It felt very safe, the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was very clean and although small (which I totally expected in an NYC location) it made really good use of all the nooks and crannies. They even leave you earplugs to drown out the city noise if you aren't used to it. We didn't get up early enough for breakfast but it was nice to grab a cup of coffee in the lobby when I needed one. This hotel is perfect if all you need is a place to change your clothes and sleep.

One word to describe my stay amazing! From the begining I was very skeptical about econolodge but after reading the reviews I chose to stay here. Breakfast was ok, room was small but I figure its like that in all ny hotels. The hotels location and customer service is oustanding! Front desk agent trinita was excellent with setting up reservations and giving her opinion of different things to do in the city. She even convinced us to ride the subway which was not bad at all. The hotels itself is in a prime location was perfect just a hop skip and a jump to any attraction. I highly reccommend this hotel to anyone thinking about visiting ny on a budget.

The location of this hotel was great. It's only a block outside of Times Square - a quick walk right to the heart of it. We were able to walk to the Broadway shows we saw, as well as to many of the restaurants. We were also close to a subway station, so getting around the rest of the city was very easy. We had an amazing rate here, so it was an overall fantastic value for us.Yes, the rooms are very small. It was not uncomfortably small for the 2 of us, and we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. We managed to find places for our bags and souvenirs, and we could still make our way around the room just fine. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean.The staff were great!!! Trinita were very accommodating with our baggage when our room wasn't quite ready, and again when we had to check out before it was time to leave for the airport. Andrea C. was a big help in recommending good restaurants in the area. They were both very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay here again...
user_name:
WorldTravler0712
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel has everything you NEED. its not luxurious or fancy. But its modern and clean. the rooms are small but when in New York City you only need a place to sleep. Staff was friendly beds were very comfortable and theres always coffee on in the lobby. Not even 1 block to Times Square and Subway. Parking across the street. Absolutely recommend and will return on my Next trip to NYC!

This hotel is in an amazing location and while the rooms are small (like a cruise ship's), the service is amazing, far above what one would expect for an "Econolodge". My only criticism is that the one elevator moves at sloth-like speed. For the money, this hotel is very good - great service, great location.

We enjoyed our stay at Econo Lodge. Front desk staff was polite and helpful in answering typical tourist questions. Its location made it very easy to walk to central Times Square (we saw The Lion King), and its proximity to the subway also made it simple to get around the city that never sleeps. In any walking direction are a number of restaurants and cafés. Econo Lodge provides a continental breakfast--bagels, cereal, fruit, etc. Again, we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again. Thank You for a wonderful experience.

Rooms are ridiculously small, (you can reach the width of the room by putting your back to one wall an extending your arm to touch the other the wall) tiny bathroom, cheap towels. People over a certain height and weight should NOT reserve a room at this hotel. Managers are more interested in making $$$$$ than considering their customers needs.One of their managers listed the hotel on Google and over exaggerated the rooms and the rates. When we got to the hotel we were booked in a room with one full sized bed for 4 people!!! We had specifically requested a room with two beds to accommodate my family. Apparently the hotel only has one specific type of room. When we tried to cancel the reservation the hotel said, even though it was their fault, they were still going to charge us the entire amount of the room. If it had not been for our credit card company our vacation would have been ruined.This hotel is very expensive. Not worth your $$ or time. Go next door to the Hampton Inn

The location of this hotel just can't be beat. It's only a block outside of Times Square - a quick easy walk right to the heart of it. We were able to easily walk to the Broadway shows we saw, as well as to many of the restaurants we chose. We were also close to a subway station, so getting around the rest of the city was very easy. We had an amazing rate here, so it was an overall fantastic value for us.Yes, the rooms are very small. It was not uncomfortably small for the 2 of us, and we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. We managed to find places for our bags and souvenirs, and we could still make our way around the room just fine. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean.It was very noisy, but I doubt you'll find many rooms in NYC that are not noisy. It was just street traffic - sirens, horns, construction one morning. We were still able to fall asleep easily and sleep through the night. They do provide ear plugs though.The complimentary breakfast was very basic, but very good. I had a bagel and a yogurt each morning, with a cup of coffee - nothing wrong with that, especially for FREE!The staff were great. They were very accommodating with our baggage when our room wasn't quite ready, and again when we had to check out before it was time to leave for the airport. They also provided my husband with some heavy-duty tape for his bag when the zipper broke just before we left for the airport :) Very helpful and friendly people here. We would definitely stay here again. Not sure if I'd stay here when visiting with my kids, as that would be a bit tight in the rooms. But for 2 people, it was perfect.

I had the absolute pleasure of staying at the Econo Lodge July 9-13, 2013 on my first trip to NYC! The room was clean, the staff were so incredibly polite, accommodating and always had beautiful smiles on their faces! The location was perfect! It was literally a 5 minute walk to Times Square. Although you did hear a bit of city "noise" at night...after a long day of traveling around the city once my head hit the pillow I heard absolutely nothing! The continental breakfast was simple, and just enough to get you going and out the door in the morning! When I return ( and I certainly will)...I will be staying here again!Thank you so much!

We were pleased with all aspects of this hotel. Our train arrived early, and I called to see if any chance of early check in...our room was ready, so they let us come right over, very nice considering we had a lot of luggage for our cruise the next day. We walked from Penn station, easy to get to. Close to Times Square, nice to be able to go back to the room whenever we wanted to (to freshen up, drop off bags, etc). I did not think there was that much noise from outside, but they did provide ear plugs in the room. We were right next to the elevator, and we never heard any noise from it. Very friendly front deck staff! Very helpful with directions, etc!! Small room....yes, but that is NYC! For the price, your not going to find anything bigger or IMO, in a better location! When we checked out, they offered to hold our luggage behind the front desk, but we were going right to our ship (we walked to the pier), so no need, but I thought that was awesome if we would of had more time to explore NYC! This is for sure our new NYC hotel!!!

We recently stayed here, and all was good. The staff is hard working and friendly. Breakfast was adequate to get going for the day. Location is wonderful - and we personally did not find the room too noisy despite all the horn honking done in N.Y. (Ask for a room close to the elevator to be further from the street). Be prepared to pay quite a bit for parking though!

Had the pleasure of staying at the Econo Lodge this past week and I was so satisfied that I just had to review them! I'm on my way home and in a blissful mood simply because they made things so much easier for me! The staff did whatever they could to make both my stay there a pleasure, and my transition to the airport as smooth one. Great front desk staff! Trinita was a friendly, young, lady whom especially helpful with area restaurants and car service for me to get around and to the airport in my time. Stayed here by default when my initial reservations fell through at the W, but I'm pretty sure this is where I will be returning. What it lacks in convenience (Restaurant, Bar, etc. not in hotel), it definitely makes up for in its Customer service.

This is not the Ritz! It's the EconoLodge. So the room was JUST big enough for a queen bed. But I didnt come to NYC to stay in my hotel room, so it didnt really matter. The location is GREAT ... a block from the TKTS booth in Times Square. The front desk staff was tremendous: friendly, helpful, and attentive. All in all, a good value for the money if you're coming to NYC for a couple of days.

We recently stayed at this hotel during a brief trip to NYC. I made the reservation for 4 of us, 2 adults and our 2 children. When I attempted to make it online, the form indicated that children under the age of 18 are free. It gave me a price of $278. I called the hotel to verify the price and was told that I was mistaken and the price should be $350. I explained repeatedly that the site said 2A/2C was $278 plus tax totaling $322. The woman on the phone was adamant that it was $350 plus tax. When she asked the ages of the children, I told her 13 and 15 and I was immediately told that anyone over the age of 7 was considered an adult. I explained that the site said "18" and she again said that I was mistaken and anyone over the age of 7 was an adult. THis is absurd.I asked to speak with a manager and was told that SHE was mistaken but anyone over the age of 12 was an adult and the site was wrong. I was then told that the price should be $350 plus tax and again the site was wrong but he would give me a "special discount" which would bring it to $325 plus tax. I explained that I didn't want to make the reservation on the site because I have had those get messed up before and I wanted to speak with an actual person but that I felt they were playing games with the charges. Then he told me that although the site said the room would hold 4 adults, it 'really didn't and was very very small'. I asked if the room was still available and that we would have 2A/ 2C and I expected that the amount on the site be honored because I was at the point where I was going to call corporate since I was a Choice member. Immediately he told me that I was right all along and that the room would hold 4 people for the price of $278 plus tax. Sad that I had to threaten to call Choice hotel group to get that taken care of.Once we arrived, we rec'd a nice room. Actually the location was fairly nice -- the room was extremely small but it is NY so I didn't expect more. I can honestly say that we had to turn sideways to walk from the one end of the room to the other to get into the bed. The bathroom as well was tiny but it was probably one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed in. We had a pretty good view of Times Square (part of it) and it was convenient to lots of things to do and restaurants. I don't know if I would stay there again. I'm waiting to see what my credit card bill shows.

Friendly staff great location are the good points.... breakfast simple however it is free so wont complain. WIFI internet was acting up staff very helpful and reset it whenever needed. great safety feature (which some may complain about) room keys reset every day. Please note most rooms are SMALL. Our door hit luggage rack every day but no where else to place luggage rack. Rooms close together, hotel hallways narrow. Also elevator is SLLLLOOOOOW!!!!!!!! we used the stairs most of time quicker. The hotel is simple and basic but for the money and location it is worth it. Also again the staff was friendly and helpful.

We recently stayed at the Econo Lodge Time Square for a few days during the week of July 4th. We drove down from Upstate NY and found the Econo Lodge very easy. The staff was extremely helpful, the rooms were very clean (yet small) and the location with convenient to Times Square, restaurants and subway stations. The breakfast buffet was small, however you still had several choices that helped start your day in NYC. We stayed on the sixth floor and the noise that I had read about in other reviews did not bother us at all.
