The bed was comfortable, the shower water pressure great and the free WI FI very helpful to have. Plus if you walked further down the block (away from Times Square), you ended up in a quaint neighborhood with attractive apartment buildings and city parks. Will consider again for another trip to NYC.

Great value and location. The rooms were small as expected based on reviews. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Walking distance to many NYC spots, and the subways. The rooms were noisy, with the noise coming in through the AC. Maybe it wouldn't be as noisy in the fall/winter. The staff called us a taxi for our return the La Guardia. If you can go without sleep or can sleep through a lot of noise, I would book this hotel. If not stay elsewhere.

I was really worried about staying here after reading other peoples reviews on here, with them complaining about the size of the rooms and the noise. I had nothing to worry about though, the hotel is in a fantastic location, the room was small but big enough for a comfortable stay, bed was comfy, the room and bathroom was clean, nice shower, the breakfast was good and the staff was so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. Staying at this hotel really made my 1st visit to New York fantastic, knowing you had a clean and comfortable bed to go back to after a day’s walking around was great. There was noise, but when you are that tired from all the walking and excitement of being in the city, the noise doesn’t stop you from sleeping well! I would have thought it was hard to find a hotel which didn’t have noise outside, 24/7 in New York City!I will be 100% sure to be staying at this hotel next time I am in New York!!! :-).

Just one block west of Times Square, the Econolodge in Times Square is in a perfect location for your New York adventure. The staff were very helpful, and greeted us as we walked through the lobby. Although we didn't have any, a free breakfast is served in the lobby every morning with coffee available throughout the day. The staff were also happy to arrange a pre-booked car service for our trip to the airport upon checkout (and the price was the same as a taxi).The room was clean and comfortable, and was serviced daily. Although there wasn't a lot of spare floor space for storage of your luggage shopping etc, we managed (and for those who have stayed in New York hotels before, you would know that New York hotel rooms are smaller than in other cities).All in all, we got great value for our stay.

My girlfriend and I were told a room was $100 less then it turned out to be (we both heard that). When I argued about it and asked for a refund, I was told they dont know how to do that. Id have to "come back someday when a manager was in". What if I was leaving or just absolutely didn't want the inconvenience to make it back to such a place while on holiday to get a refund for a room I was misquoted about??? I was not returned the $ as we eneded up kinda being strong armed into having to stay. As the clerk said "you dont have to come back for your refund". She sctually said that, like now we have your cash so you can do whatever the hell you wanna do, we dont care at all". Total nonsense from the moment I walked into this place. The room was beyond terrible and seriously the service was so absurd it was actually amazing. DO NOT CHOOSE this hotel!!!! It ruined my time and was constantly on my mind. The next night we chose the Comfort inn one or two streets up for roughly the same price. The room was amazing, the service was excellent, the breakfast was restaurant quality and they even gave my girlfriend a free tooth brush because she forgot hers! The money was never the motivating factor here. I didn't mind the higher price, otherwise we would have booked in advance. It just snowballed into illogical nonsense so fast, I felt like I was talking to a ninth grader.

There are so many hotels to choose from in NY but for our trip all we wanted was a clean hotel/base. I'd read good reviews on trip advisor and bad so here's my experience. Yes you can hear noise from the road but this hotel is based one block from Times Square. If you want silence then maybe stay less central. In all honesty after the first night we were so exhausted we didn't hear the traffic but I guess it's how heavy a sleeper you are.  The hotel itself was probably the most quiet hotel I've ever stayed in. There was absolutely no noise from other guests, we didn't even hear neighbouring rooms. The hotel was spotless and although the rooms are small they are completely adequate. The bed was very comfy!! There was hot water all day and unlike many hotels I've stayed in the temperature in the room was perfect. Breakfast is perfectly adequate and plenty of choice. Tea/coffee is available all day. And here is where this hotel excels unlike any hotel I've ever stayed in including some top hotels in London. The staff are amazing. Absolutely nothing is too much trouble. They are polite, helpful, happy and completely make the experience. It's not pretentious helpfulness it's a happy to be able to help you. You never walk through reception and get ignored, staff always ask how you are and assist. Even the house keepers greet guests and say hello. If your looking for a clean hotel in a central location at a reasonable price with amazing staff then I highly recommend this hotel. Thank you econo lodge for a fabulous weekend.

Econo Lodge was just what we needed for our girls' trip to NYC. The location was perfect. So close to the shows, restaurants, subways, and Times Square. The staff at the front desk were so friendly and helpful with any questions we had or even some great ideas we had not thought about. The room was very small but we were expecting that. The location made up for it! If there is anything negative to say it would have to be that our room was next to the street on the second floor and it was extremely noisy. But again, I would not have stayed anywhere else given the chance. I will definitely book here again if I return!

We stayed at Econo Lodge for 5 days. The hotel is in a great location close to Times Square, Metro, Deli, Star Bucks & supermarket. The staff is very helpfull and friendly & the complimentary breakfast saves you money and there's free coffee 24hours. But be warned the rooms are really small and could do with some basic upgrading.

I found this hotel on the internet. We stayed for 5 nights. It was a great stay. The location is one block from Times Square. We walked the streets at night, within a 5 block radius, and felt very safe. During the day we rode the subway and there are several entrances within 1-3 blocks.As previously stated, the room was small but we were only there to sleep and take showers. Room 518 is a great room. It's the corner room, has 2 double beds, and windows facing 8th Avenue and 47th Street. If you're a light sleeper or used to the country, you will need ear plugs. And they supply these.The breakfast bar was sufficient. It had hard boiled eggs, pastry, bagels, cereal, bananas, instant oatmeal, and yogurt. Coffe, tea, and hot chocolate were available 24/7. The staff were excellent. Very helpful, patient, and friendly. They asked about our day each evening, gave great advice to tour the city, and offered coupons.If you would like a reasonably priced hotel, great service, breakfast, and close to Times Square, this is the hotel for you.

Very Small Hotel in Times Square. The staff is so friendly and remembers what you did during the day and ask you about it when you return. Very good service. Now remember this is NYC and the rooms are very small!! It is difficult for 2 people to be getting ready at the same time. When my daughter and I stay here,we are only in the room to sleep and dress. I love the location because it is very close to all the theatres and the half price ticket booth. Easy access for the subway too. The rooms are clean and no line for elevator as in some of the bigger chain hotels. I would stay here again because of the location!!

We've stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay, the staff is really friendly and helpfull.The hotel and the room were very clean and the free wifi and breakfast are great bonusses.With such an central location meaning your a very small walk away from Times and many other sights. The subway etrance is also very closeby is access to the lower or more uptown parts are easy accesible aswell.The only thing was the room size being a bit small with our 2 suitcases, however being in so central in Manhattan and all, all rooms are bound to be this size for this great price :-)

My boyfriend and I stayed here for for 3 nights while visiting NYC. We had done our research and knew that the room was not going to be glamourous and was going to be small. Yes it was small, but we barely spent anytime there.This is a great hotel considering the cost is low and the location is great. The continental breakfast is meh, but you should be eating some NY bagels at Ess-a anyway! The staff was very nice and the room was clean. The in room wifi was really helpful for us out-of-country travellers who don't want to use our data while roaming. There was lots of noise outside, but what do you expect? It's NYC. They supply ear plugs, should you need them.I would definitely stay here again.

Having grown up in Jersey, I never really had much of a reason to stay IN the city, until we decided to extend a recent working trip to the area and decided commuting for our adventures wouldn't be nearly as fun as getting the FULL NYC experience. So, not even I was quite sure on what to expect with our stay in the Econo Lodge in Times Square. Upon our arrival in NYC, we decided to make the 15 minute walk from Penn Station to Times Square, and into the Econo Lodge's doors. Sean and I pride ourselves - maybe even a bit too much - on being hospitality geeks of sorts; having both worked for the likes of Disney and Universal - we've come to crave a certain level of hospitality when traveling. And, yes. I may or may not have some "requirements" hotels have to meet before I even consider staying there! The Econo Lodge in Times Square did NOT disappoint. We were greeted with one of the FRIENDLIEST of staffs I've ever met -- honestly, EVERYONE we came in contact with treated us like family, and extended us the warmest of greetings every time we saw them. The rooms were clean and perfectly comfortable for the time that we were there (a note to mention: hotel rooms, in general, in NYC aren't exactly the size many of us are normally accustomed to -- but this didn't bother us a bit as we used the room for minimal downtime and the occasional sleeping when we weren't busy exploring) - and we had a great view of the streets and buildings around us.Another GREAT feature of the Econo Lodge in Times Square is, quite simply, it's LOCATION! Found on the corner of 47th and 7th -- you're a quick walk from nearby subway stations. Where we were able to have quick, easy access to the E train (for downtown travel - think World Trade Center Memorial, Battery Park, views of the Statue of Liberty, etc) -- and even the B and D trains where we were able to get an express train to The Bronx and Yankees Stadium. In the heart of the City, you'll also find that the Econo Lodge is an easy walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, and even The Empire State Building.I honestly could not say enough incredible things about this property -- and we will ABSOLUTELY be seeking the Econo Lodge out on our future trips into New York. A HUGE Thank You to The Econo Lodge in Times Square, for making us feel like we had a home within The City -- we would definitely recommend this property to anyone!

Me and the wife stayed here for 5nights end of May. We booked through a travel agent who reccomended Econo Lodge as our critia was somewhere in Time Square area which was reasonably priced, mainly because we felt TS gave the best locaiton and we were not going to spend much time in the hotel as we would be out and about all day. This hotel met our criteria fully!!! The rooms are small, fits a double bed and a bathroom, however it was just fine for what we required for our trip. There can be abit of noise at night, however this wasnt too much of an issue after the first night as we got used to it. The rooms and hotel are very clean and the staff are extremely helpful and polite. We would choose this hotel again if in NYC

Awesome location and great rates for a last minute trip to NYC. The rooms were clean and staff members were pleasant. Our front desk clerk, Trinita Meade was especially helpful with providing info on the city's best locations to visit, and the easiest ways to get around. I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed there for 3 day`s prior to heading to fort Lauderdale for a cruise. What a great location. Close to everything & spotless.Having been to New York 3 times before I can say the staff here were by far the nicest we have encountered. They were great, very rarely can you have a bit of a chat with receptionists at hotels, but here they very chatty & friendly. Also all staff were very nice. The breakfast was great fun sitting in reception with everyone talking to one another. A big difference to a hotel were the people have their own tables. The only problem is the outside noise during the night. But taking that into account, if ever in New York will be certain to go back to this place.

My husband and I stayed for one night during Memorial Day weekend. We had a great time. We were mostly looking for a room to sleep in since were gonna do a lot of walking around. The price was great for the location and having breakfast available was such a plus (this is very rare in Manhattan). The rooms were clean and he staff was helpful and kind. I saw some reviews of people complaining about the size of the room, and although they really are small, it is expected for that price in the city. We did not mind.Be aware that breakfast is served in the lobby and there is not much room to eat downstairs. However, my husband and I just took our food to our room and enjoyed it quietly upstairs.If you are looking for a place on a budget to just rest and shower, this is the place to stay. We will most likely be back and I would recommend to a friend.

Absolutely great location. Can't beat the price for the location. The staff were polite and friendly. The rooms are very very very small. It's also very loud. Please be aware that even with earplugs, the outside noise kept us awake at night.

Very good position,very near from Times Square and to a good price for the area.The staff is special: nice,helpful,friendly.Breakfast is the same every day but it's great and enough for a good start of the day. Room small,but for single travel was ok.Noise from street,but it's normal for the position and New York.
user_name:
Petroland
New York City, New York

review_body: Recently stayed here again while visiting NYC. The room was quite nice and the beds very comfortable. We usually get a view of 8th. Avenue, which I especially like, as u can see all the bright lights of Broadway and the theaters right from your windows. (which are many) The staff is great and just so helpful. Trinita at the front desk, is a gem. Always so friendly and accommadating for any need u might have. Nigel the manager really has a feel for treating his guests w/panazz and style. His big smile and willingness to help always makes our stay memorable. I definetly would stay there again, considering that I always get a rate that is within reason, for this so centrally located hotel.

This is my first review and our first time in New York.Any hotel choice is a comprised, cost, location, staff and facilities. So this hotel was recommended by our travel agent.CostExcellent value for moneyLocationPositives:3 blocks from Times Square, Walking distance of Rockefeller centre, Hells kitchen, and some of the theatres. Also the red hop on hop off bus tour nearby.Negatives: Small compact rooms. Ear Plugs are supplied so noise is a problem. Slow lift. Personally we got use to the noise by the third night. Note we did not need to have the air conditioning unit switched on.FacilitiesFree Wi-Fi, Free Hot drinks and cold water. Our rate included breakfast which was a good selection of cold light breakfast.( Excellent value). Free calls within USA.. StaffExcellent staff, friendly, knowledgeable, efficient and very helpful. They couldn't do enough to make our stay in the hotel and New York more memorable.

Just got back from my fourth visit from New York, i stayed at the Econo Lodge, and it was a superb stay, nice & friendly staff, nice & clean rooms, a nice complimentary breakfast, and ideally situated to Times Sq, i would certainly use this lodge again.

Recently I had the privilege of lodging at this lovely inn. Although it doesn't have many amenities, what it does have is a WONDERFULLY, HELPFUL Staff. From the moment I arrived a young lady by the name of Trinita was especially helpful during check-in. Not only did she make that smooth, but she helped to make the stay a delightful one, right along with the other staff. The lodge is also conveniently located a hop and skip away from Time Square. Close enough for you to get back to the hotel soon after a long day of sight-seeing and shopping and just farther enough to be away from the noise. From arrival to departure our stay was a pleasant one, especially thanks to a Lady named Trinita. You will most certainly enjoy your visit!

This is a truly great location for the price. It is located in the middle of the Theatre District and is within walking distance to all of the main tourist sites in Mid-Town Manhattan. The only negative is the size of the rooms. About 180 sq feet. In our room the wall from the head of the bed to the foot of the bed measured 8 ft. Really hard to get around the foot of the bed, especially for those late night visits to the potty. You have to walk sideways to get around the bed. The complimentary breakfast was the usual fare but well kept up. The bad part is that they have no tables and chairs to eat at. You either sit on benchs with your food in your lap or take it to your room and eat in bed. With all this said, it's still a great location for the price and the extra friendly staff make up for some of the inconveniences. I recommend that visitors go one block west (9th Ave.) to eat. It is more reasonable and more ethenic. A must is 5 Napkins Burgers (9th Ave and 44th st.)

I was worried about spending the nite in NYC after reading reviews of all hotels. Well couldn't afford 300 a nite, so we stayed at the Econo lodge, basically because of the price. Great location, and the staff were terrific, all of them. Now the room, we laughed when we opened the door, the room we had was very small, had to walk sideways around the bed. The room was very clean and well taken care of. If you have been on a cruise it was smaller then a cruise ship room, but I would stay here again in a heart beat. The price was good for the nyc area.........I guess if it was anywhere else I would never pay that price, I have stayed in a condo for a week for less. We paid 190.00 with tax. but again very good to the other places. The breakfast was bagels, oatmeal, donuts, crossisants, cheese, meat, and the best pastries I have ever had. also we didn't hear any noise outside like some other reviews had posted.

I am so happy to have Trip Advisor travelers' reviews. This hotel was exactly as I expected it to be based on the reviews I had scanned through first. I knew by the room number that I would be walking up one floor, since 700 is the only room on the 7th floor. Street noise existed in the form of sirens, but would have been worse closer to the street.When I saw that NYC water bagels were included in the continental breakfast on the hotel's website, I knew I would be delighted with breakfast. Breakfast also included mini muffins, mini danish, croissants, strudel, hard boiled eggs, several types of tea, coffee, instant oatmeal, 2 kinds of cold cereal and orange juice. I absolutely loved those bagels!! There was very limited space to put out the food or eat, but staff was busy re-filling everything as it disappeared. My only complaint with breakfast is this: why isn't there a later breakfast time on Saturday and Sunday AMs?Location, location, location! This hotel was a very short walk to Broadway shows, restaurants and Times Square. We also took a walk twice to Central Park, it was about 12 blocks. The parking lot was close by and a great reduction in the rate for being a guest at the hotel.The front desk staff was very helpful about all sorts of things, including looking up phone numbers and locations to wherever we needed. I suggested to the front desk staff that they put an additional chair in the room since there was space for it. There was only one chair in the Superior Queen and they liked my suggestion. My only other complaint: I like softer T.P. in the bathroom. :-)I will joke about the prices of hotels in NYC--we felt that the hotel was a 2 star hotel for a 4 star price, but in comparison with other hotels in this area, it is an extremely good value.

We we're kinda scared when we first saw the hotel. Wondering what we got ourselves into. The room was very small but it was clean. Your only there to shower and sleep anyways . Yes, it was noisy but earplugs were provided. The staff was super friendly and helpful. We were within walking distance of everything. A big Thank You to Trinita for making us feel so welcome. Much appreciated. Hope to see you again soon.

Yes the rooms are small and noisey, but you are right in the middle of NYC!! How much room do you need? You should be out there exploring. As for the noise, get earplugs. I loved Econo Lodge Times Square. The staff were so friendly and helpful. I work in a hotel and the reception staff at Econo Lodge were much more willing to help than ours. The receptionist offered to and eventually did check us in on our flight home and were very knowledgable on directions etc. The free continental breakfast was superb. The room was warm and clean. If I am lucky enough to return to NYC I will definately stay at this hotel again.

We booked this thinking it would be nice to stay in a hotel for only a little more than we would have payed for a hostel room, but we ended up paying more for a cramped and noisy room. While the breakfast was substantial and rooms were clean there was no sound proofing from outside which was bad especially as it is near a busy road and a fire station, there is noise all day and night. Room would be okay for a night close to everything, but not worth it for a week long stay.

It's all been said before. Yes, the room is not very big. But you're in NYC and you are only in the room to sleep, because the rest of the time you'll be doing things! Yes, it can be a little noisey. But you're right in the middle of NYC and NYC drivers can't drive unless they can blow their horn at least every other block. So if you're a light sleeper, bring earplugs!Yes, the elevator is slow. But hey, this is not the Empire State building. You could take the stairs!New Yorkers rude? Not in this hotel! Very kind, helpfull and sweet! This hotel has the nicest staff working for them in NYC.Loved the receptionists (all of them) and Steve!Clean? Spotless! Price? You're not paying normal NYC hotel prices. I'd say this is a good deal!Location? It's close to everything (bring comfortable walking shoes, you'll be doing a lot of walking!).Will I come back? YES!Should you book this hotel? YES!!!!!

We've stayed here three times last two years. Just wonderful staff! Great morning breakfast,fabulous location,most considerate and caring hotel workers we've ever encountered. We not only love NYC but we also love Econo Lodge Times Square!

If you are looking for a great spot in the heart of NYC, and you're on a budget, look no further. I can't say enough good things about our stay. The staff was friendly (Shetima at the desk helped us before we booked and when we arrived), the rooms were clean and well appointed, the bed was comfy and you could not possibly be in a better location. Times Square is a block away, Rockefeller Center is just a few blocks, and you are well within walking distance of just about every theater. The breakfast was substantial and there was coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the lobby all day. Carve (pizza) is right across the street, as well as the double decker tour bus stops for the downtown and uptown loops. The rooms are small and basic, but the friendly and helpful staff truly shine. Shout out to Kathy and Alex, too. Everyone on staff went out of their way to help with directions, recommendations, anything we needed. This is not an upscale 5-star hotel, but you're not paying those kind of prices, either. This place is worth every cent, and then some. Stay in this convenient, comfy and friendly spot and save your money for an extra show or two!

This is a wonderful little hotel in a superb location. Just 5 minutes walk to Times Square. The staff here are so friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, modern and with excellent facilities. Breakfast is varied and vast. I could not recommend this hotel highly enough, especially for the price we paid. Great value for money.

The most memorable thing about this hotel is how cordial, helpful and pleasant all the staff are. I have not encountered this level of friendliness in any other hotel -- and I travel a lot. The location was perfect for us since we were only 3 blocks from our conference. However, the room was amazingly small with nowhere to put anything that didn't block access to the bathroom or the door. It is also a little rundown. The location makes it VERY noisy due to all the street traffic, which goes on all night. Bring your headphones and some soothing sleeping music! The only reason I'd stay here again is because of the staff.

My experience at the EconoLodge Times Square was exceptional. Although the hotel is modest and the rooms are basic, it is clean and comfortable and well-maintained. For anyone interested in Broadway theatre, the location could not be better. The staff was amazingly friendly and competent. And, for the price, it is unbeatable. The best deal in NYC!

Ok! YES the rooms are teeny tiny (no more than 2 MAYBE 3 people can fit comfortably)! My husband bumped his head on the TV at least twice lol but whatever its NEW YORK we weren't there to sit in our room. We went to sleep, shower, and nap. For the location, cleanliness, & amazing customer service you cannot beat the price in Times Square. Every employee in the building, during our stay, were SO nice! They were accommodating and knowledgeable...Honestly it made all the difference! Needless to say I was very happy with my stay. My ONLY complaint was when we got back to our room one day around 4, our room was barely being cleaned and we were EXHAUSTED but that was it! Would definitely recommend this place.

Every time I go to NYC I stay here, the front desk lady Trinita is awesome, last Wednesday I arrived in NY around 8 am, as you know the check in time is @ 3 pm, i was very tired and went to the hotel to leave my luggage and walk until 3, to my surprise Trinita let me check in at 8 am that way I could sleep a little more.The hotel is small and clean, I always have a great experience there, and I will be back.
user_name:
CrlsM11
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The reviews said that the room was small.... Let's try tiny! There may be a foot between the wall and the end of the bed. The location says Times Square and being somewhat unfamiliar with the city it is a block over. The staff was great, just expect a really tiny room!

Ok. To start with I went with a friend. The location is A1. It is about 5 minutes walk from times square and the theatre district. We saw the phantom show and walked there in less than 7 minutes. The hotel itself was welcoming and the staff could not be more helpful. They booked cabs for us, recommended tourist locations and brought up bottled water to the room -free.The room itself was spotless and the sheets pristine. It had en suite toilet and shower and small bath and the water was hot! Fresh towels and sheets if you wished every day. Views over busy street in new York so yes it was at times noisy but what do you expect from the centre of new York? It was street noise and part of the city experience. We did not go there for a lie in! The size of the room was bijou / compact but again we did not go to dance in the room. Perfectly adequate for anyone!Breakfast was free from 6am every morning and again was clean and fresh. There was bagels and scones and cakes and cereal and milk and poptarts and cream cheese and meat and cheese and jam and I defy anyone to be dissapointed. No hot food but so what? Free tea and coffee and hot chocolate 24/7. Also free wifi and access to ice maker. Brilliant, simply brilliant. Would recommend to anyone.

Although the front desk staff were pleasant they did not make up for the fact that one morning the water was barely warm and another day the room had not been cleaned by the time we returned at 3:30pm. The room was literally 2 feet wider than the beds. It was not even big enough for two people to move past each other without one person hopping on the bed. For over $280 a night I expected more. When I reported the issue with the water the front desk person said that a manager would contact me. That took 2 days and they offered me a 10% discount. I have stayed all over the world but this was a low point. The only reason I did not give them a terrible rating was because of the location and the staff at the front desk.

We were originally booked into the New York Inn and when seeing this place I knew we would NOT be staying there I would not allow my dog to spend one moment there. We had come to New York to see a couple of Plays. We were ready to return home and just count the trip as wasted. We just happened to be parked in front of the econo lodge and I thought we give it a try since I had stayed at an econo lodge once before. We found the staff there to be very friendly and helpful they were very sympathetic to our deliema, gave us a discounted rate. Rooms were small but clean and we will stay there again since we do come to New York to the theatre district quite often and the location was great

This Hotel is ideally located for visiting the main heights and sights of New York, in the heart of the Times Square district i would say it is excellent value for money!! Breakfast was very good just missing hot toast, also a T.V room for departing guests wanting to kill time would be a great idea.The staff went out of their way to help you, only gripe was the maintenance man hoovering the landing outside our room every night between the hours of 9pm and 11pm!!Free internet access for all guests was a big bonus, the beds were very comfortable and we would definitely return both to New York and this Hotel!! If you want a slightly bigger room i would advise you ask for 400, 500 or 600 room numbers as they are considerably bigger than the others and quieter!!!!!!!!!

Sitting in the Times Square Econo Lodge writing this review. We chose this hotel based on its TA review. It is exactly what i expected, only smaller. The room is 2 ft bigger than the queen bed. I was once in a smaller bathroom in Paris, but everything is clean and works.I booked it based on price and location. Both excellent. Just dont expect big or roomy. Not.The free breakfast was free. You get what you pay for. No place to sit. Overall great if you spend all of your time and $ on Broadway shows, which are within a couple of short blocks. Just not the Ritz!

Absolute perfect Tourist location, 1 block to Times Square, Theatre district and Restaurant Row around the corner. Hop On Off Buses 20 metres. Anything you need within 3 minutes walk. Room is a little on the cramped style, BUT, no more so than most U.K./Paris hotel sizes. Has every service you may require, Iron/board, separate bathroom/Toilet. Free WiFi, Free Coffee/Tea 24/7 in the Lobby, along with Free Breakfast....it will surprise and satisfy the variety that is there in a concise area. There is a bit of traffic noise...where ear plugs or don't book accommodation so close to Times Square. The Hotel is clean, run very efficiently and the staff will jump through hoops with a smile to assist you. Absolute great value for money in New York. I would stay again over & over and would recommend highly. Thank you Econo Lodge Times Square for a great 5 days. :-)

Went with my significant other to NYC for a one night stay for a medical procedure. We chose this hotel based on reviews, the rate that we were able to get and its proximity to where we needed to be the next day. The rooms and hotel are small, which we expected given that it is right in Manhattan. In general it was clean, but the appliances and decor was quite outdated. The elevator up to our room was so old and creaky, we were concerned we were going to get stuck! The main issue that we experienced is that we went in the month of March, which was still quite chilly and windy in NY. The hotel leaves the air conditioning units in the windows year round, which led to the room being very cold and also incredibly noisy. I barely got a few hours of sleep as I could hear every little noise on the street (which is a LOT of noise in times square!) I feel that if the A/C unit was out of the window, and the window could be fully closed this would definitely cut down on the noise. There was no background fan that we could locate to help drown out the noise. If you decide to stay here, bring your ear plugs if you would like to get some sleep.Also, the continental breakfast in the morning left a lot to be desired. We were hopeful that we would be able to grab something and go, and were lucky to be able to split a small muffin as there was nothing left. We ended up just eating at a diner down the road, so don't decide on this place because of the free breakfast.It wasn't the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at, and the price was decent but I don't see any reason why we would ever return to stay here.

I was recently in New York to participate at an international conference. The hotel has a very good location very close to Times Square and Broadway theaters, the room was small, but very clean and the bed confortable. I enjoyed the free breakfast and wireless internet offered to the customers. The elevator was large, a good point. Unfortunately, the window in the room cannot be opened. During the night it was rather cold in the room, because the climatisation system had a malfunction one day after my arrival. During the night, I didn't used the small electric heater with fan provided to replace the main system, because I was afraid it that it could be unsafe and start a fire. In the lobby, for breakfast there was only one table! It is very unconfortable to have breakfast on chairs or sofas. The menu could include also some hot boiled and scrambled eggs and fresh fruits. The room access card had to be reactivated several times. The staff was very kind and helpful and I thank them.

The staff made our stay in N.Y. even more enjoyable ,they were informative, cheery ,& professional ! We remember Kathy ,she was great !!! We enjoyed the breakfast served in the lobby,perfect start for our 2 days we were in N.Y . The hotel wasn't fancy ,but clean ,& close to Times Square & cruise terminal .......which was an easy 4 block walk .....again Kathy at front desk advised us to just walk .....Thanks again for our 2 day stay ....

We were in NYC to leave on a cruise when Hurricane Sandy struck. The Manager, Nigel, immediately made arrangements to extend our reservations since the cruise ships could not come in, and did the same for other guests trapped by the closed airports. They managed to maintain their free breakfast inspite of no deliveries for a couple of days. They constatnly worked with us to make sure we had a place to stay until the cruise ship could come in. We met some other people who had to leave their hotel when their reservations ran out.The services and help extended by the staff was unbeatable.

We recently stayed here when we stayed over for two days when we flew from Spain to cincinnati Ohio . The room was quite small but the location was very close to many attractions. It was also very clean and the receptionist was of great help to us.

we booked to stay here at this place from the 5th march 2013 to 9th march as are base to stay for a 40th birthday in new york was a little bit disapointed on arriving with not getting the free upgrade to the superior room as a special treat for are stay here but never mind .we still loved it. the hotel is V clean tidy the staff on the front desk are only to - willing to help you with anything from information on places to go and how to get there 10/10 if you have never been to new york like are selves . this hotel is 5 mins from times square 30 mins walk to central park for us but also depeneds on how fast you walk this was perfect for what we wanted to do for are stay . the road outside was abit noiesy at times at night ! but your also in new york city the city that never sleeps. but we loved it . the fire station over the road offered some great photos at night. the rooms were a little small but your also not in the room much as its the city you wanna be in and not your room only to change or sleep and its enough for this. its a very nice place to stay if your also on a budget like areselves the free breakfeast continetail style was more than enough to start your morning off with a smile if you dont like this there are plenty of places to go for brekfeast .the free coffee free tea and hot chocolate all day and night is fantastic as a guessed if you find your passing passed this hotel pop in grab a coffee :) the free wifi was ok but a little slow at times but its free so no complaints from myself. overall this place for us from the uk was great warm freindly clean and we will be booking again soon as we can miss it already :) :)

We booked this hotel after reading alot of other reviews, and we weren't disappointed. The location, just off Times Square is brilliant as it's very central and there's lots of choice of bars and restaurants near by too. If you like fancy hotels with lots of extras this isn't for you, but we don't go to New York to stay in the hotel. The room was quite small, but very clean and comfortable which is all you need. The road was quite noisy outside, but that didn't bother us too much. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the breakfast available in the foyer was a great bonus too. Would definitely recommend it as a clean, comfortable and friendly base to explore the rest of the city.

I stayed here for one night for a girl's getaway weekend. I shared a deluxe double room, which was just large enough for two. Space was really limited. The room was clean, and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. We had a corner room on the 4 th floor and it was super noisy at night. We heard every honk, every siren, and every loud and rowdy person. I should have brought my white noise machine. The hotel staff were all very friendly and personable. The continental breakfast wasn't anything to write home about, but it was adequate. The location of this hotel is perfect, and for that reason, and the price, I would stay here again.

The room was super small, which was expected. However, the hotel is so old and not updated so there is no temperature control in the room! When I checked in, the room felt like a sauna. I couldn't figure no how to fix it, so I turned on the A/C to cool off (in Feb. right after the blizzard). I stopped by the front desk on my way out at 7:30pm and the clerk said that they would have to send someone up to make it cooler. When I returned at 11:30pm, i walked in and it was still ridiculously hot. I called the desk and they again said that they would send someone up. After waiting 1 hour and no show, i turned the a/c back on and went to sleep. Even with that, I had to sleep with no blanket and minimal clothing. Also, the WiFi was horrible. I could not even watch a video, I ended up using the 3G on my phone which worked fine when the WiFi kept crashing. It was a clean hotel and yes, this is in a great location near times square and the price is right. However, I would not return.

hotel is located very near to times square and metro/subway station. friendly staff and very helpful. got refunded for 1 night because of cancelled flight due to snowstorm. nice breakfast. the only complaint is room was too hot but manage to regulate the temp afterwards; room was to small and don't have enough space between the end of the bed and the wall; there was an internet problem after midnight during our stayed. overall great stayed. we will visit nyc again and stay at econo lodge.

Everything was great ! Affordablle, clean, neat and worthy. When you visit New York the time you stay at the hotel is usually limited and this one was the best choice! The location was ideal, it was really close to everything and Times Square in particular . We walked to the city and the location helped us do that ! The staff of the hotel was really kind, specially Trinita that was ready to help at any time! Breakfast was not much, same, usual things, however it was more than enough( both quality and quantity )and free coffee was offered during the day, perfect ! They should imorove the free wifi . The cleaning is great, everything was as neat.. The hotel was the best cheap choice, perfect location and the people that worked in the hotel made our staying really pleasant. If you are looking for a comfortable hotel that's the one! Definitely coming back !

Everything was great ! Affortable and worthy ,in the end when you visit a city like New York the time you stay at the hotel is usually limited and this one was the best choice! The location was ideal, it was really close to everything and Times Square in particular . We didnt even have to take the bus or even use the subway, walking is the best way to get to know the city and the location helped us do that ! The staff of the hotel was really kind, especially Kathy, and ready to help at any time! Breakfast was not much, same, usual things, however it was more than enough( both quality and quantity )and free coffee was offered during the day, perfect ! And there is also free wifi . When it comes to cleaning, everything was as it should be and the room was always clean and tidy. All in all , the hotel was honestly the best choice cheap, perfect location and the people that worked in the hotel made our staying really pleasant. If you are looking for a comfortable hotel that offers the basic,important things this is it ! Definitely coming back !

Good location, good value. Friendly staff, clean rooms. No extras except for internet and breakfast. Coffee and tea 24hrs too. My only complaint is that it was to hot in the room (in Feb). Would stay again.

I enjoyed my stay the staff was helpful, the location was excellent and the bed was comfortable. However our room was tiny, most of the numbers in the directory the general manager made were out of date, the breakfast was weird(who eats ham and cheese for breakfast)? We are used to staying in big hotels and this one was tiny. I think it should be $50.00 a night because the hotel doesn't offer any other services( pool, fitness center, etc.) But we got sleep so that's all that matters.

I just returned from a long weekend. My daughter and I had a girls' weekend in NYC. We stayed 3 nights in January, which is not the popular season. The location of this hotel is excellent. The room was small, but we'd had small before elsewhere in NYC. The breakfast was nothing fancy but was good, and even included some instant oatmeal which we love. There is nowhere really to eat it, but trays are in the rooms, so breakfast can be taken up to the room to eat. The room was very clean. The price was very low for NYC. I even hesitated writing such a good review because this hotel is sure to sell out during busy season. Don't be scared off by the 'EconoLodge' name!

This hotel is great for price, location and staff. Trinita and the rest of the staff are lovely and very helpful. I am travelling on my own and found the hotel and location safe for me! They also provide free coffe and tea all the time and free breakfast!
user_name:
Jackie1070
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Having visited the Econo Lodge Times Square before, we were looking forward to another visit. Apparently there are significant differences in the rooms. Our previous rooms were not large, but were fine. This room seems much smaller. The space between the desk and the wall is too small to pull out the chair and sit at the desk. And the space at the end of the bed is almost too small to get through with my big feet. It feels like you have to file a "flight plan" to move about the room.It is still clean and very convenient to both Times Square and the subway system, but, at least for the rooms on the fifth floor, the rooms are a bit smaller. I think next time I will request a room on the second or fourth floors, where we seemed to have more room.Also, when a problem occurred (internet was down) they attended to the problem right away.

This hotel is excellent for those who want to stay in Manhattan but don't want to pay an arm and a leg. Excellent service, the rooms might be a little small but is extremely close to all the big Broadway shows. This is the only hotel I stay at when I go to New York City.

My family and I stayed in two rooms on the 5th floor of this hotel in late December 2012 for 4 nights. The staff was excellent in all aspects, the breakfast was adequate, although there was no where to sit and eat (not a significant issue) and yes, as commented many times by others, the rooms are incredibly small - but we had visited the property prior to our visit and were already aware of the small room sizes. The location being one long block from Times Square simply can not be beat. The staff across the board was some of the most friendly and helpful we have had the pleasure of encountering in NYC.We did encounter one issue which was handled very satisfactorily by the staff - did I mention how wonderful the staff was and that is even with the lower then average prices they ask??

We recently spent 7 nights at the EconoLodge on 8th Ave. at 47th St. a block from Times Square in NYC. At first, we were taken back by the tiny room. It contained a queen-sized bed (VERY comfortable!) with about 18 inches to the wall on two sides. However, we decided to figure out how to "make do" with the small room and we discovered how well thought out the room actually was. There was a desk, a small wardrobe/armoire and a reasonably-sized bathroom with a small tub/shower. A very lovely breakfast that included hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, various pastries, etc, was provided in the lobby between 6-9 am each morning. The staff was very pleasant and helpful with the exception of the "fill in" housekeeper over the two days of Christmas. The location for anyone who plans to see Broadway theater is phenomenal! Our only real complaint during our stay was at the very end. We had to get up quite early to get to our train at Penn Station. During the night, someone had somehow ruined the one and only elevator in the building, and the staff failed to notify us or help us get our heavy luggage from the 5th floor to the lobby. We had to walk our luggage 5 floors down the stairwell! Although we sympathized with the problem, we wished the staff had dealt with it and helped us.

Great hotel. Location versus price is the best! Walk Manhattan and TimesSquare esay from here. Very good attention overall, clean and easy. Kathy at the desk was excellent help. I'll definitely be here again :)

We recently stayed here for 5 nights. Although the room was extremely small, the staff more than made up for the tight quarters. Trinita, Kathy and Nigel are the friendliest and most helpful desk staff that I have ever had the pleasure to meet. The location is perfect, a block away from Times Square.

I stayed with my friends for a week at this hotel.Trinita really helped us everything,we love her so much!Stuff is great,the best thing is wifi is free and you can drink tea and coffee whenever you want.Times Square is really near to hotel.Everything was really awesome,I think you wont regret to stay there.If you go to NY,you should stay in this hotel!

The rooms are really small, but who needs to stay there except to sleep? The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. We made a special connection with Trinita who was absolutely delightful. The location is so convenient to Times Square and Hell's Kitchen. We stayed for three nights and would not hesitate to go there again.

We stayed here in December 2012. The experience was great. The staff (receptionist, housekeeping,manager) were very helpful very fast very efficient and very friendly.Location is the best. We have stayed here several times.

Yes - the rooms are small. However, the room with 2 double beds was enough space for our family of 4 (Mom, Dad, 2 college-age boys). We actually got a kick out of how the furniture "just fit" the space available. We didn't want to spend a lot on lodging, preferring to spend our money on activities in NYC - this fit the bill perfectly. Very clean; extremely friendly and helpful staff. Rooms very reasonably priced. Breakfast basics were nice - bagels, danish, cheese/cold meat, yogurt, croissants, bananas, cereal and milk. We almost never heard noises from another room. We had a corner room - traffic noise not bad, though we were exhausted every night from sightseeing/activities. Location was great - close to subway stops, Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, food, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel and would plan to stay here again next time through the city. If you are looking for a large hotel room to spend lots of time in, you may want to avoid this one, but otherwise, not sure how you could do better for the price.

My sister an I stayed for 9 nights in Econo Lodge Times Square. Although we shared a double bed, the room was big enough for what we needed: a place to sleep after walking all day long on the streets of Manhattan. Loved the location, loved the staff, loved the breakfast and loved the price. It can't get any better than that, and I'm willing to stay here again!

I only needed a room for one night while i was in Manhattan. This was a nice small room but the price was a little much. The room was very clean and the staff was great and helpful. It was a few blocks from Times Square and close to a lot of shops and places to eat. The next time I come back to NY, I will book this place for sure.

After reading other reviews for this hotel, we wondered if we stayed at the same place. We had a room with 2 double bed in the "largest" room on each floor. You could not walk around the bed without walking sideways. There was no drawer space to unpack a suitcase and the "closet" was about 18 inches wide and 12 inched deep so it only had room for several shirts. The maintainence and cleanliness was poor. You touched the towel bar and it fell out of the wall, putting all the towels on the floor. We then found a large hairball/hair extension on the floor between the beds, so obviously the room had not been properly cleaned between guests. There were a lots of chips in the enamel of the sink and tub. So if this hotel was new in 2006, it has been a rough 6 years. The breakfast area is right in front of the check-in desk (within 5 feet) and there was only one small round table and 2 chairs, one wooden bench and 3 or 4 dirty black upholstered chairs, otherwise you had to just stand in the same floor space as people coming in or checking out with their luggage. I do have to say the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We had been scheduled to stay there 6 days but checked out after 1 day for a much nicer room for less money. I doubt that I will ever stay a another Econo Lodge or at least this one.

Hotel is right across the street from many broadway threatres, and time square is less than 5 minutes, dependent on how fast you walk.Rooms are small, but perfect for 1, bed, tv, desk/chair and bathroom w/shower. Prices are pricy depending on the time of year, but you can't beat the location!!Across the street is a drug store where you can get anything you need, food, etc

The location is fantastic. The rooms are small but not tiny. You can certainly walk around the bed but it is roomier if you move the desk and chair closer to the door. My friend and I both brought large suit cases that fit against the walls just fine.Trinita, at the front desk, is awesome! Very helpful and always nice!!!

This is an additional review to one I wrote at the beginning of this month, that I saw to my dismay, somehow was not posted.I was stuck in downtown NYC visiting friends when Hurricane Sandy struck and left the area below 39th St in Manhattan without power and in a truly apocolyptic state, Sensing that it would be many days before things would return to normal and needing to get out of my friends' nabe immediately, I went uptown seeking out temporary "shelter from the storm" and was fortunate enough to be able to book a room in Econo Lodge Times Square for a week until I was able to leave NY and book a flight to my family's house out of town to totally escape NYC.To say that the experience staying in this hotel was absolutely wonderful would be an understatement! The entire staff - from the charming management, darling and uber-professional concierge team of Natasha, Trinita, Sh'keema and Katherine, the two wonderfully accommodating and delightful housemen, Maurice and Alex, the very protective and caring overnight houseman and all of the superb and caring cleaning staff, all totally helped to totally relax me and banish thedire state of trauma I was in when I first registered at the hotel.Tucked away on a lovely quiet Clinton block, friendly, safe and utterly spotless with wonderful beds dressed with daily fresh linens, nice modern bathrooms with tons of towels, in-room cable TV with gratis Encore channel (!),,hearty free daily Continental breakfast (and also 24-hr. tea and coffee service) in the intimate lobby, daily newspaper, friendly hip fellow guests - a combo of others fleeing from the ravages of the hurricane downtown and an international regular tourist crowd, who use the hotel as their home-base after daily shop-'til-you-drop buying trips in the city - all add up to make this charming hotel the quintessential home-away-from-home and one that I highly recommend and will always return to on future trips to NYC.
user_name:
rubiablon
New York City, New York

review_body: I came in here one morning after a cancelled flight, the staff was soooo accommodating and gave me the best rate in the area! The room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. After taking a nap, I decided since I was stuck in the city that I would do some running around and a little tourist things. After getting directions from the front desk took pictures in times square, went to the top of the rock, and then to on a bus tour. I loved the connivence of it all! I can not stress that enough.After my eventful evening, I came straight to my room and knocked out. The breakfast that morning, before checking out, had many varieties of bagels, pastries, cereal, yogurt and fruit. I will definitely return to stay here and recommend this hotel!

Me and my partner stayed at this hotel in november for 5 nights, the hotel was great. Rooms were on the small side but you dont come to New York to stay in your room. Very clean and you could have fresh towels and bedding everyday if wanted. Location was fantastic, we were in a central location, times square was literally not even 5mins away. Staff were very helpfull and friendly with directions and always greeting you nicely when leaving or returning. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We stayed at this hotel recently and it was an amazing stay, they have a great staff (very polite, helpful and prepared), the room is confortable and very clean, the bed is excellent. The hotel offers free wi-fi, breakfast and coffee and it's 3 min from Times Square, which is awesome. We definitely recommend it to other people looking for a great stay in NY !! Andre and Ludimila
user_name:
AndreGobbi
Governador Valadares, Minas Gerais, Brazil

review_body: Spent 12 days at Econo Lodge Times Square superb location, great service from all Staff & although the room was a little on the small side it was clean - lets face it after all, you are only there to sleep following an exciting day in NYC. Will definitely stay here again. Would recommend to family & friends. If I had one critisim it would be that the lift was a little slow - so really nothing to complain about.

Room was tiny, but we expected that having stayed here many times over the years. Staff was great while we were there. Very helpful and courteous. We accidentally left an autographed Broadway poster and CD and some playbills in the room in a clear plastic bag on top of the armoire. Called the following morning to see if we could get them mailed to us. After being promised a call back, I had to call again myself only to be told that no one had seen the items we left behind. It's not like we left the stuff in a trash can or laying about the room. The 'lost and found' manager was very blase about it and basically told me it was too bad. Very disappointing end to an otherwise pleasant stay.

This hotel is in a great location. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but clean. We have stayed at this hotel several times and have never been disappointed. Check in time is 3PM. However we arrived at 11:30am and were able to check in right away because a room was clean and available.

The hotel location is brilliant and I guess that is what you are paying for. Staff are very helpful. Room was so small we were unable to walk round the bed, no sound insulation so it is like sleeping in the street. Breakfast was fine but served in the lobby with one table and chairs and two sofas which are so filthy they need a health warning on them, difficult to even take it to your room as you only have one chair. One lift which is very slow. Wouldn't stay here again

Stayed at this hotel for one night on 10/24. I stay in a lot of Manhattan hotels in this price range and this one is right up there. Great staff at the front desk, clean public areas, nice crisp white linens, and a clean bathroom. Pair that with a great central location, free bottled water and a nice TV selection and I'm a happy traveler.

Nice neighborhood, FREE BFAST, 7 minute walk to Time Square and very AFFORDABLE! My first impression after checking in then taking the elevator to our room was the SMELL..............it was CLEAN in the hallways!!! We stayed in Room 416; clean, clean and clean!! The room was small with a queen size bed, good for two people; but you don't go to NYC to stay in your room. The guest agent that we encountered (Trinita Meade) was AWESOME!!!!! She answered all our questions, provided us with directions, etc.; she went out of her way to welcome us and to make sure our stay was a good one. I took my daughter to see Taylor Swift at Good Morning America, she ended up camping outside for a good spot; she was exhausted and while helping me pack she made the mistake of taking a coverlet from the bottom of the bed with the blanket we brought and one that I purchased! OMG when I found it that night; I called the next day and spoke to Trinita and told her that I would mail it back to them on Friday as I didn't want to be charged for it; she was so nice and said not a problem just send it back. I am sooooooooooooooo going to stay at this hotel the next time we head back to NYC.

My wife and I go to New York about once a year to see a Broadway Show and spend lots of money. This was our fourth time staying at the Econo Lodge Times Square. Always very clean, with a wonderful staff. Rooms are small (but...you don't go to NYC to stay in your room!). Can't beat the location - 1 block from Times Square, easy walking distance to a multitude of subway lines, shops and restaurants. Rates are less than half the cost of a hotel just one block away.

Stayed four nights at this hotel and was so pleased with every aspect of our visit. Location, price, cleanliness and especially the the front desk employees. Natasha and Trinita were extremely friendly and helpful. I highly recommend the Econo Lodge.

Jim and I had a wonderful time in NYC and certainly the comfort and service that Econo Lodge provided made this first part of our trip fabulous. The breakfasts were very healthy and delicious. Trinita and her colleagues provided excellent service--above and beyond the call of duty. Always a smile from all the staff. This hotel is meant for people who enjoy comfort and down to earth pleasures.

The location of this hotel was perfect! Travelling as a single female, I felt safe no matter what time of day or night. The price included a continental breakfast that was not extensive, but quite sufficient. The breakfast was held in the reception/lobby area and not conducive, but they’ve done their best. The staff was at all times attentive, charming and helpful. The hotel and rooms were spotlessly clean - always a very important factor. When in New York you don't spend much time in your room so it being very small was not an issue for me. The street noise levels were quite high. For those light sleepers I'd suggest earplugs. :-) I found the Econo Lodge Times Square a welcome haven after a hectic day's sightseeing and walking. Lovely! Thank you all. You are stars!

We stayed here with my daughter and friends for two days of fun in Manhattan. I could not of picked a better spot. On one side Times Square and on the otherside 9th Ave with a wide range of great restaurants of varied price and cuisine, The staff was great and answered all of our many questions with a smile and enthusiasm. They let us leave our bags early and held our bags late to maximize our plans. The rooms were clean and the beds comortable. Will do it again on our next visit! Thanks again to the whole staff for the great experience and life long outstanding memories.:)
user_name:
Jonathan H
Plattsburgh, New York, United States

review_body: My husband and I stayed @ the EconoLodge September 25-28, 2012. Our room was on the 3rd floor. It was small, but very clean and quiet. The best part of this hotel was the front desk staff. We loved Trinita who was so friendly and helpful, but when she left for her own vacation, the replacement staff was equally eager to please! The location was convenient to the theatres and subway.This was our third stay at this hotel. We have stayed at larger more expensive NYC hotels, but will conitnue to stay at this EconoLodge on future trips!!

We had a wonderful stay at the Econo Lodge Time Square. This is our third time staying atthis hotel and we will be going back. The beds are great and location is great. Nice continental breakfast. Natasha and the other ladies at front desk was very kind and helpful.

I needed a room at the last minute during Labor Day weekend and almost everything was booked.I called the Econolodge quite randomly, and the wonderful front desk person, Jocelyn, went to a lot of effort to hold a room for me.I had a room on the second floor.It was clean, had everything I needed, and I was well pleased.The staff was very friendly, there was a little breakfast in the mornings, and coffee and tea.I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Lvstravel4000
New York City, New York

review_body: The room is tiny, the 'queen' size bed is a small double. They had an AC unit in the window and this prevented you from closing the window. SO noisy. I guess in the winter that wont be there so possibly a good location for the 'xmas shopping' kind of trip but not in the summer.Staff are excellent, so helpful and the only good thing about the hotel.

The hotel is so close to all that New York can offer, Time Square, The Top of the Rock, Empire State building. The hotel staff were superb, the room clean and breakfast just right to get you on your way for the day. As a traveller with mobility issues, I had booked an accessible room for my 9 day stay, I found the room comfortable, bathroom was fitted out with the correct rails and they even supplied a shower chair. I had booked a mobilty scooter and they arranged a recharge point close to my room, it really is a great hotel. I can't say enough about the staff, fantastic. I know when I get back to New York again, Econo Lodge Time Square is my preferred hotel. Also, bargin priced which helps the holiday dollars go further

We recently had a wonderful stay at Econo Lodge Times Square. We traveled as a young couple and wanted a "cheaper" alternative to discover New York. Econo Lodge was a great choice. The hotel's location is absolutely perfect, right next to Times Square and very close to supermarkets, restaurants, metro stations and sites such as Rockefeller Plaza, Fifth Avenue, Bryant Park, the Empire State Building, etc. The hotel staff were lovely: they were very friendly and always helpful (eg. for directions, transportation tips, ...), even when you didn't explicitly ask them for something.Like in most New York hotels, the room was indeed quite small. However, it was very clean and comfortable: all you need for a city break!Overall, lovely experience and great value for money. If you want a basic but correct place to stay when discovering New York, this is it.

The hotel is very close to Times Square you just walk two blocks and you're there. It has continental breakfast, the bedroom had comfortable bed but it was too small for the price per night but it's Manhattan so I think that's normal in the area. Very nice, kind and helpful the ladies at the front desk.

We've been in this hotel from 14th to 20th of Sep, 2012, for the second time. It is 3 minutes walking from Times Square and 49th St Subway station: there are also a Duane Reade and a Starbucks crossing the hotel street. Staff is very friendly and are always willing to help.The rooms are small, clean and organized. Considering how much it takes to be near Times Square, I don't consider this hotel expensive: it's the best option if you want to stay near Times Square.
user_name:
RomanoF
Sao Jose Dos Campos, SP

review_body: I just got back from NYC where I spent three nights in Econo Lodge on 47th street. Location is excellent, everything is just right there, just few steps from Times Square.The staff is very pleasant and helpful. Room is rather small, but very comfortable and clean. The queen bed in my room was the most comfortable bed ever! I will definitely go back, and I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Price is acceptable, fabulous location and in general, very pleasant place to be.
user_name:
Maja V
Banja Luka, Bosnia and Herzegovina

review_body: I've stayed in this hotel many times. As an older & solo traveler,I like to stay where I feel safe & secure. The location is most appreciated in inclement weather as most of the theaters are nearby, Restaurant Row, Hell's Kitchen & tons of eateries are all around & most deliver. WiFi, breakfast ,24 hr coffee & tea, phone calls including Canada are also included. The rooms are small but comparable to the other NYC hotels, and clean. In my last visit, I was in the upgraded room with new bed & beddings. It was so comfortable, I slept so well that I missed most of the breakfasts. It also had a small refrigerator. I highly recommend this room. For the seniors, the bathrooms don't have grab bars & the tub can be slippery, so be careful. I now get a "Welcome back" greeting by the very helpful staff, especially Nigel, Trinita & Natasha!

This hotel is only a block from Times Square which makes its location fantastic.The moment we walked into the hotel we felt so welcome and so at home that we immediately fell in love with it. This hotel offers a continental breakfast from 6 to 9 A.M. daily and free telephonecalls to anywhere in Canada and the continental U.S. The room we had was smallbut had a queen size bed and air conditioning,but for the price compared to the other hotels in the area,who stays in the room other than to sleep anyway.The air conditioning made it so comfortable. Natasha and all of the other staff made us feel so welcome from the firstday. that we feel that we will definitely stay here on our next vacation in New York.Great job to all the staff!

I had a pleasent Vacation in New York City the staff was very friendly especially Natasha and Joselyn real nice people, Breakfast was excellent and Location perfect only one block away from Broadway, hope to come soon.

Preparing for the trip and reading all sorts of reviews here on tripadvisor from all available hotels, I actually expected the worst, and got to be pleasantly surprised :) The hotel is in a very good location, everywhere you look there are taxis, and several subway lines 5min away, just around the corner from the Times Square (proves to be extremely convenient when going to see a broadway show - after having waited the whole afternoon for the tickets at the tkts office on duffy square, we still found enough time to jump around the corner to the hotel to freshen up and get back around the corner to the theater!).The rooms are nice and really clean and air conditioned with there's free wifi, maybe they're not the biggest or the most beautifully decorated ones, but then again, I guess no one comes to NY to stay in their room the whole day! :) The traffic outside can get a bit noisy, but after the whole day of NY, I'm sure nothing will stand between you and your sleep :)The lovely girls at the reception are very friendly and always ready to help - high five! The breakfast is a bingo for the sweet-toothed folks, with croissants and different kinds of pastry (my boyfriend loved it, I stuck to the bagels and pepped it up additionally with some cheese&ham from the shop around the corner). And you can get coffee, tea or hot chocolate at the reception not only during the breakfast, but throughout the whole day! Altogether I'm really glad I chose this place and if I ever go back I'll try to book them again!

I booked this hotel to be right in the middle of things for my 4 days in New York. It's a block away from Times Square, which is probably close enough!When I arrived, the receptionist tried to find me a room away from the road for a quieter night, which was appreciated, although the rooms all have aircon units which are quite noisy, so I would advise earplugs, but you will need those anywhere in NY!I booked a queen room, it was really tiny, so I wouldn't have wanted to share it with anyone, but for me it was fine. Let's face it, in a place like New York you're not to going to spend much time in your room!The breakfast is pretty poor, just a few mini pastries and coffee left out in the reception area (there's no breakfast room), but again with so many places to eat around the area, it's not really a problem.The staff are really nice and friendly and the hotel is very clean. It's a great location.Cost for the area was very competitive and I would recommend the Econo Lodge for a short stay in the city.

The rooms are small but in every other respect the same as any other hotel room in manhattan. Rooms are immaculately clean, and the location can't be beat, right in the heart of the theater district. This was a really great place to stay on a budget. Rooms are SMALL. No room 4 a 3rd person. If small is ok 4 U, you won't have any other complaints. Staff is super friendly.

The staff at the front desk were very accommodating, and made our stay wonderful! I would highly recommend the Econo Lodge Times Square for a place to stay. All staff is friendly, and very helpful. Trinita was wonderful, she took the time to make sure we had reservations for the 911 memorial. The only downside to the hotel was room size. I guess that's what we should expect in New York City. Prices were competitive for the location. I would definitely stay there again!Thanks,Chad

We stayed July 22-Aug.1,2012 rm 620. This is our 3rd times to New York. We are happy we chooce this hotel, its close to everything, from Times Square, theaters, tourbus.. Restaurants are close by. We even took a tour to Boston. Nice place We enjoy our vacation,The front clerks were very friendly and helpfull.The continental breakfast was oke.Our next trip will be with our kids and grandchildren.

I had to call this hotel at 2:00 am because the hotel I was staying at around the corner was definitely not what I expected at all, and I could not stay there for one night! So, Natasha answered the phone and when I told her what was going on, she had a room left and booked it for me for the 3 nights and 4 days that I was visiting NYC with my sister. I am very grateful for her courtesy and hospitality. She also helped us out with finding different tour sites on the maps that she gave us and which subway routes to take to the sites and places we wanted to see.The staff in general were all very helpful and friendly!I would suggest this hotel to others because of the great location (times square/ theatre district), the staff, the price of the hotel for being in Times Square, and the cleanliness of the hotel all around. :)

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel on our first trip to NYC. It was only a block from Times Square and very close to the broadway shows and subway stations. Best price in NYC!Our room was small but clean. We enjoyed the continental breakfast. We were extremley happy to here from Sh'keemma that the hotel provided us with free calling to the United States and Canada. All the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone visiting NYC.

My wife and I haved enjoyed several overnight trips to NYC. This is always our first choice of hotels for our trips. The price is always right. Excellent location. The staff is always cordial and helpful. Early check-in is not a problem if they have rooms available. Rooms are small but very clean. Breakfast is minimal but O.K. You can't go wrong with Econo Lodge Times Square.

My husband and I enjoyed staying here on our first trip to the city. For this location...just steps from times square, parking, and subway stations...the price was great. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. Trinita helped us with directions, restaurant recommendations and always asked how our trip was going when we arrived and left through the lobby. The room was small, but we realized that going in and didn't mind because it was clean and we weren't there much. The only real complaint was the elevator was slow and was broken for a short while during our stay. It wasn't too bad for us because we were only on the third floor, but for some it could be an issue. We would definitely stay here on our next visit.
user_name:
Amelia B
Phoenix, Arizona, United States

review_body: The third time is definitely a charm. This is my third vacation getaway to the Big Apple and finally I found the hotel that I really loved. VERY clean lobby, bathroom, rooms, linens, etc. Also the entire staff Nigel, Natasha, Trinita, and Miguel, and others are extremely helpful and friendly. I definitely will stay at this awesome place in the future.The staff treated me like family.Perfect location - seconds away from Times Square.For the awesome price, the rooms are the perfect size.After all you are not going to be doing aerobics in your room.There is one elevator and despite what people say - the wait is not long.I have never waited more than 30 seconds for it to arrived.Trust me, I have been to places where you wait and wait for an elevator.Excellent all the way around.Thank you... I will be back next July (maybe sooner - I hope)

This hotel is located very close to the Times Square and therefore a perfect start for all thinkable shopping and sightseeing activities in New York. It is also close to the subway and port authority resulting in good communications in every direction. The people working at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. I got several useful advice from the people working at the information desk.As the only drawback you might consider the size of the rooms, they are very small. But honestly, what is the point with having a fancy room in NYC? I'm sure you'll spend most of your time discovering the city, all you need for doing that is a bed and a shower. These two things, at a perfect location for a reasonable price, is what you get by choosing the Econo Lodge Times Square.

On a recent trip to NYC my daughter and I spent 8 nights at the Econo Lodge, Times Square. It was located 2 blocks from the heart of Times Square and was one block from a street filled with neighborhood restaurants and was in a very safe, quiet area. The price of the stay was extremely reasonable, especially compared to other hotels in the area. The staff was very accomodating and helpful. Saloom, the 3rd shift bellman, was wonderful. Whenever I was out in front of the hotel, he would stand outside, at the entrance, to make sure no one bothered me. That was way above and beyond the call of duty! A continental breakfast was included, but was very basic. The biggest downside was the room size, which was extremely small, but space is at a premium in Manhattan! I wasn't in NYC to sit in the room, so that wasn't a big deal. I would definitely recommend this hotel to those on a budget.

To say our room in this hotel was small is an understatement, but to be honest, it was cheap and central, and that's all we needed. If you are visiting NYC for pleasure and just want somewhere to keep your luggage and sleep in, this hotel is fine. It was clean enough, and the continental breaky (pastries etc) every morning was OK. Staff were very helpful and friendly.

I stayed at the Econo Lodge for 6 nights at the end of June. The staff were remarkably friendly and helpful. The rooms are not huge but are bigger than other NYC hotels I've stayed in before. The continental breakfast is enough to start your day with bagels, pastries, cereal and coffee.The location is perfect for anyone planning to see a few shows. We were only a few blocks away from any theatre we needed to walk to. I will stay here again on my next visit and certainly recommend it to anyone else!

In June 2012, My husband and I had tickets to a show. So we decided it would be more convenient to stay in the city since I am a paraplegic and in a wheelchair, and we didn't want to travel home so late. When I called to reserve a room, I spoke to Nigel at the front desk, and specifically requested a handicap accessible room. Also, I made sure there were elevators and handicap entrances/exits. Nigel reassured us that we would be staying in a wheelchair accessible room and the hotel was as well. When we got to our room, it wasn't AT ALL handicap accessible, let alone wheelchair accessible. We asked Nigel if he could switch us to a different room and he said "there were no more rooms available in the hotel...all booked up". He went on to say that the "girl" that reserved our room "made a mistake and he would give her a call and get back to us".
