When I told him I couldn't fit into the bathroom, shower, and could hardly move about the room, he said he would "gladly check us out of the hotel, free of charge and we could stay somewhere else". After an hour of Nigel blaming the "girl" that messed up our reservation, he finally credited a few dollars back on our card. I was hoping he would just apologize and take responsibility for his mistake. But he insisted that I "must not have told the girl that I was handicap". I have been a paraplegic for almost 10 years and spend about 90% of my time in my wheelchair. I am still offended beyond belief. But he denied that we ever spoke while making the reservation. I wasn't able to shower, I barely slept, and my husband had to pick me up and put me on and off of the toilet whenever necessary. I called Econo Lodge Headquarters to make a complaint and nobody will return my calls...It's been a month now. My family, friends and I take frequent trips, in and out of state. Whether it's to eat dinner, shop, see a show, or on business. We will never stay at an Econo Lodge/Choice Hotels again!
user_name:
Karyn G
Red Bank, New Jersey

review_body: The front desk staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. In particular Natasha who was there the day I arrived, and I believe her name was Serena, when I checked out. I arrived 3 hours prior to check in and the staff happily stored my luggage for me and offered me the continental breakfast even though I hadn't yet checked in. On top of that, they even let me store my luggage for 4 hours after I checked out the next day so I could continue my site seeing trip without finding a storage area for my bags. They even gave me tips for hailing a cab without making me feel stupid having never done it before. Yes, the rooms are small, but I was only there for a few hours to sleep, so no need to have a huge luxurious place to lay my head. The room was probably the cleanest I've ever stayed in, the bed was very comfortable, and as a woman travelling by herself I felt extremely safe. I even appreciated the healthy choices of fruit, yogurt and cereal for the continental breakfast. The location is perfect too . . . just 1 1/2 blocks from Times Square! What more could you ask for? If I ever come back to NYC I'll be staying at Econo Lodge Times Square and will recommend it to anyone I know travelling to NYC. Thanks for the great stay!

Got a free night's stay through Choice Hotels' Best Rate Guarantee program. The front desk staff was incredibly friendly, I was able to drop my bag off in the morning and then come back and check in about two hours early which was greatly appreciated. My room was clean but very small, and when I went in the desk was positioned in such a way that I basically had to climb over it to get to the bed; fortunately I was able to fit it neatly in front of the wardrobe. Can't comment on breakfast because I was up late and didn't wake up before it ended. Overall a satisfactory experience and I would certainly consider staying there again.

We are just back home after spending 9 glorious nights in NYC. We loved our stay at the Econo Lodge Times Square. The rooms are small, but clean and have everything you need. The front desk staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, especially Trinita! Thank you all for a wonderful holiday. We will be back!

My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights and were very pleased. The rooms were small, but very nice and clean. Breakfast was included, which was enough to satisfy us untill lunch. The staff, from the front desk workers to the housekeeping staff were very nice and friendly. There wasn't one time that we were in the lobby, that someone didn't speak to us. The location is great, just a few blocks from Broadway. As we were 2 woman traveling alone, we felt very safe in the neighborhood. One block over is restaurant row, which had a big variety of restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel for lacation and value.

First of all, I would DEFINITELY stay here again. I booked this room because the price was the best around and the location was great to the Theater/Times Square area. After I made my reservation, my sister asked if I checked BedBugRegistry.com to see if there were bedbugs reported at the hotel. I almost hesitated to look because it was a "budget" hotel, I had already paid in full (no refund rate), but was thrilled to see that there were NO reported incidents at all, which made me love it more before I even got there.The rooms are very small, but I expected that upon reserving the room. The room was clean and it was fine for the amount of time we actually spent there. The hotel staff was very friendly and I appreciated that when I would ask for directions, etc. I never felt like they were annoyed with my touristy questions they probably answered many times a day. The breakfast was simple, but adequate. There really isn't anywhere in the lobby to eat breakfast, so everyone just made due. Some variation in the cereal would be nice.
user_name:
Brady N
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Not too much of interest to say about the property.....very basic in all ways. Room was clean and in order, and as probably most have commented, very small. However,as most have also probably said....who cares? We were there to sleep only after spending the days in NYC! It served the purpose very well. The best thing about the Econo Lodge is LOCATION! It's 2 blocks from Times Square, and so close to everything else! Very central to walk just about anywhere you want to go. We got the room for 3 of us (myself, girlfriend and her daughter) with 2 double beds for $245 a night. Yeah, pricey by regular standards for an Econo Lodge, but again....worth it for the location. At Times Square and forgot your camera in the room?.....2 minute walk to get it. You get the picture. You can pay more for a nicer place, but what do you want to do, sit in your room watching TV or be in your own reality series and walk Manhattan? We've been twice and will use it again. Makes things very easy. Oh, the staff let us check out bags hours early, and were very friendly and helpful giving tips and directions. Great people.

The room was small, but it was clean, the receptionists were friendly and helpful. The free breakfast and 24hr tea & coffee was great and only a stones throw from times square. It is an excellent base and good value for money. I would definitely reccommend this hotel and go back.

My fiance stayed here for 6 nights in February of 2011. (The furthest back it would let me put is July 2011) It was small but we didn't really mind that. The staff was pleasant, the breakfast was nothing special, very clean but the design is nothing special. They are just a few blocks from time square, right across the street from and AWESOME pub. I was surprised how quiet the room actually was. We weren't kept up at all by the outside noise or by any other customers.Awesome stay at an awesome price!! Would definitely stay again.

I stayed at the econo lodge in times square with my family on june 1, 2012. the staffs there were great. I met a wonderful staff there by the name of Natasha who was sooo sweet, helpful and tried to accomidate my family by giving us extra pillows and blankets. When i asked her what kind of fun activities can i do with my kids. she quickly print out some kids activities that was going on and the directions on how to get there. she even made reservations for us to go see ground zero. Natasha always had a smile on her face and asked us if we needed anything else. Breakfast was FREE which helped us to save a little $$. I truely had a great time and i would def. stay at this hotel next time i visit NY. thank you to all of the staffs there, especially Natasha. Marie and family
Location of hotel is Great. Staff is very friendly. Rooms are the tiniest I have ever seen, plus the noise from the street is loud.

We just came back after a week in NYC staying at the EconoLodge Times Square, I would totally recommend this hotel for young travelers, the rooms are really small, but it has everything you'll need.The location is great, a couple of blocks away from times square and a couple of blocks from subway station (C,E).The staff is great and always with a smile on their faces.The only thing we didn't like was the noice from the street, sometimes it got too loud at night!And the elevator is the sloooooooooooooowest thing I've ever seen in my entire life, good luck we were on the second floor, we could use the stairs :)
very nice hotel but rooms are small at breakfast no where to sit down! but we slept good and had a great time and the staff was great and helpful!!!! I would come back again

Hated this place. It resembled a shabby block of dodgy flats.Got to the lodge and was greeted by a miserable receptionist who was clearly more interested in here mobile phone than her job.Got to the room to find a shabby, smelly, ridiculously small room. you had to breathe in to walk around the bed to get to one side of it. If you are claustrophobic then be warned.Whilst trying to get to sleep it was really cold and there were no heaters or extra blankets available. Obviously the noise levels can’t be helped but the tatty windows could be revamped to help this situation.In the morning I went down stairs to ask for help with the heating to find myself in a really embarrassing, awkward situation at reception. A really busy reception with people plonked on window sills, random chairs and standing up (as there was no more room or window sills) eating breakfast. There breakfast facilities were in the reception area!! Consisted off bagels and cake, where was the big cooked breakfasts?!? Nowhere, we had been ripped off. I have never even known a hotel to have a breakfast area in such bad manner; some people were leaning on the reception desk itself having breakfast. Shocked.On checking out at 4am, I was advised I would not be issued with a proper receipt as they were not prepared until later on in the morning. I advised that was not my problem and that paying customers obviously need receipts, she gave me one for half of our stay but not for the other half. Rubbish service, which hotel can’t issue a valid receipt. The answer being…the EconoLodge. Worst accommodation I have ever experienced.

We went to NYC for a long weekend and because of the time of year, the hotels were booked solid, so we tried here in order to get a price we could afford. The staff was friendly and efficient, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable. However, the room, even by NYC standards was TINY! There was litterally one foot (12 inches) between the bed and two of the walls. Trying to get out of bed to the bathroom was extremely difficult. The bathtub was not full size, so I'm not sure how an adult was supposed to take a bath. If you are a single, the rooms would be fine, but for two or more people, they are VERY cramped.

If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel only two blocks from Times Square, that is safe, clean and supported by a nice staff then the Econo Lodge on 47th Street might be a possibility. I stayed at this property March 10th and found it acceptable--with one exception; the rooms are claustrophobically small. If traveling alone, with minimal luggage you will get by, but I would not recommend this property for couples or persons staying longer than a few nights. If you needed to use the phone you had to crawl across the bed as the space between the foot of the bed and the wall was approximately 6 inches. Rooms do not have their own climate control, and mine was incredibly hot so you get what you get without anyway to adjust the temperature. I like some space in a hotel room, not a lot, but at least enough so two people aren't bumping into each other. I'll end by saying again--this property was clean, safe and a reasonably good value, however, because the rooms are incredibly small I would not stay at this property again.

This hotel is very nice being so close to times square. It was reasonably priced and clean. The breakfast was a little undesirable. The elevator was old and not safe. The front desk staff was very helpful and nice.

he hotel is very well located, for that price I could only find two other options: the Big Apple hostel, which is closed and even the private rooms have shared bathrooms, and the New York inn, which seemed horrible from outside even though it's next to this hotel.The elevator is really slow and the pillows were too soft, I had trouble sleeping with them. The wifi was very, slow almost unusable, it wasn't possible to make a Skype call.The room is very small and a bit noisy, but it wasn't a problem for me. That is because there is a fire department warehouse one block from it in the eighth avenue.The breakfast is great, I didn't expected that. Just in front of the hotel is a Duane Reade which is pharmacy that is open 24/7.I would definitely book this hotel again, there is no better cost/benefit relationship.

The Econo Lodge Times Square is a good option for those that are looking for basic lodging in an expensive city. It is well located relative to the subway system and only a block from Times Square. The room (queen bed) was not nearly as small as some we have experienced and even had a desk and chair. The room was clean and the bathroom appeared to have been recently updated. Breakfast was minimal, with little room to sit. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We had one minor problem with the TV and it was taken care of quickly. All in all, convenient, good value, with minimal extras. There was a bit of street noise, as the pub across the street closed about 3 AM.

Econo Lodge, a simple but cosy hotel, was our best (and cheapest) option to feel and live Times Square! No, you won't be treated exclusively, but, for its price, you'll feel like a VIP in an easy ambiance with friendly and helpfull staff! We'll be back: that's for sure!Ourtravelingwithoutmoving.wordpress.com
user_location: Vila Real de Santo Antonio, Portugal
user_name:
MartaFerrer
Vila Real de Santo Antonio, Portugal

review_body: The location of the hotel was great as you are right at the center of Times Square, Manhattan. When you make your first step from hotel to outside you find 47st and 8t Av. The hotel staff (specially Trinita) was as good as the location. They were very helpful. I'll be back.
Small room, with a good queen bed.Free 24 hours chocolate/cofee.Excelent location.
user_location: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
user_name:
Alexander J
Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

review_body: The location of the hotel was great as you are right at the center of Manhattan when you make your first step from hotel to outside. However hotel staff was not as good as the location. As they were just average not very helpful i can't praise them..Rooms are quite tiny but clean . I would surely reccomend this place for the travellers who are looking for a budget and central place to stay in NY City..

Great little hotel in a great location. The rooms are TINY, but extremely clean. The location was about 2 blocks from Times Square, right in the heart of the theater district. If you want to be right in the middle of things, and are planning on seeing a show, this hotel is perfect. You're in New York - do you plan on spending a bunch of time in your room? So the size should not matter. Free wi-fi in the room was great, because the computer downstairs charges out of the wazoo to use. Would definitely stay here again.

Location of the hotel is great and for the price it's really not too bad. The rooms are pretty clean, but they are very small (it is New York though). We didn't spend much time in the room at all so that didn't matter too much. The room was pretty warm, so it was a little uncomfortable at night. You can call the front desk and they will come open your window but being that it was 30 degrees outside, I dealt with the heat. Overall, it's a nice hotel and the location can't be beat.

The rooms are small but perfect for one person or a couple who doesn't plan on spending much time in their room. The staff are helpful, although the cleaners sometimes didn't come until 6pm at night.The free internet access was great and fast! The breakfast was bagels, coffee and yoghurt but enough to get you going for a big day of sightseeing. Such a great location 2mins walk from the heart of Times Square and 5mins walk from the subway!

Given the proximity to Times Square, I was pleasantly surprised by the almost 'out of the way' nature of this hotel. It's just two blocks from Times Square, but seems far removed from the noise, for the most part.Our room was quite small, but at that price and that location, it is to be expected. The hotel was nicely maintained and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The elevator was unbelievably slow, but it's just an elevator ride -- nothing on which to base a review about a hotel.Apparently the hotel does not have central A/C, because there was a window unit in our room. We visited in December, so this was not an issue for us. But since the window had an A/C unit it, it let in more noise than the window would have if the glass had been closed all the way. This was not an issue most of the time, but during the time (a Saturday night), we could hear folks laughing and otherwise noisily making their way down the street after what must have been a night of partying. It was the weekend of SantaCon, so we figured there were a bunch of drunk Santas going down the street.The location was great for play-goers. Also, only two blocks to Times Square and a 10 minute walk to Rockefeller Center. All-in-all a very convenient location.

Stayed for 3 nights at beginning of December 2011. The room was basic but adequate, as not a lot of time was spent in it. The location was superb and the staff on the front desk were very helpful. For a cheap short break in New York it was a great find.

A real find in midtown New York. On top of Times Square and Broadway. Staff were so helpful and effecient.Rooms small but clean.A bit noisy cos the City never sleeps they say. Breakfast not fantastic.could do with a few more tables and chairs in lobby.Very good price for an excellent location.would recommend

My husband and I spent one night at this hotel. We were attending a wedding and did not plan to spend much time in the hotel. The room was more than adequate, although postage stamp size. The amenities were very adequate with a hair dryer, in room safe, iron and ironing board, decent size closet housed in a armoire. The bed was queen size and very comfortable. Continental breakfast was ample with scones, mini danish, bagels and cream cheese, cereal, milk, coffee, tea, orange juice, oranges and bananas.The only down side of our visit was that our room was on the 2nd floor in the front of the hotel. The street noise was very loud and we could hear the people on the street having a joyous time along with the clip clop of the horse drawn carriages. This hotel was very reasonably priced as compared to others in the immediate area.

The best thing about the Econolodge Times Square is its location in the theatre district. Given its location, the price was reasonable. The room was clean but tiny. The staff was pleasant and competent. Econolodge serves a continental breakfast but could use a few more tables to eat at. Noise from traffic did penetrate the room. The hotel was a sellout when I was there so book early.Arthur A.

Small room, but the best staff and stay in NY. Really, really clean and comfortable!This hotel is just one block from Times Square, the center of everything. Near the subway station and the Theater District.I'll come back soon! Highly recommended!Nothing bad to say about this hotel.
user_name:
Beatriz M
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: Third stay there. A block from Times Sq. Lots of carry outs near by. Rooms very small. Bathroom small too, but well done. Breakfast basic with ceral and rolls. Coffee all day. Will stay there again because it's a good value.

This was an excellent place to stay. Super close to everything, walking distance. Clean. Yes small, but everything in New York is. The front desk staff was very helpful and very friendly every time that we came or went from the hotel. For the money, this is the place to stay.

I'll start with the good: location is 2 blocks from Times Square, the front desk staff was polite and helpful. Unfortunately, the bad was really bad. The entire hotel was shabby. The carpets were worn and frayed. Walls were scarred. The non-smoking room smelled strongly of stale cigarette smoke; probably years of it imbedded into the wall paper, carpet, and curtains. We had just returned from a cruise and the room was smaller and more cramped than our cabin on the ship. The window air conditioner was very noisy. If we had been staying more than one night, we definitely would have looked for other accomodations. My advise: pass this one by; don't be hooked in by the lower price and great location.

From it's location, is pretty obvious that this will probably the most expensive Econo Lodge you'll ever stay in! It's slap bang in the theatre District of NYC, so it's pretty conveniently located for all of mid-town and with good transit links elsewhere (subways, buses etc). The rooms were small, and so-so furnished (2 small pillows per double bed, very thin linens, scratchy towels) but functional. I thought the toiletries were awful,and smelt of urinal cakes. In fact they were really unpleasant - I've never used lotion that left my skin stinging!Free internet and phone calls were a nice touch. The basic breakfast in the morning was ok, but you often had no where to eat it due to a lack of space. It could also do with being available later on the weekends - 6am to 9am is a little early on Saturday/Sunday.Staff were generally friendly, and apart from the one that checked me in, who appeared to want to be anywhere but there, they all seemed happy to help. Street noise (which seeps in via the air conditioner) is an issue, so invest in some good ear plugs!Would I return? No, probably not. It's too expensive for what's on offer. I'd rather pay a little more and get more bang for my buck.

It may seem pricey but this is Times Square where everything is pricey and it is the best deal for the location. The location is incredible and safe, the room was very clean and comfortable, and the staff was extremely nice and helpful. It is only a block away from Times Square, one block from restaurant row (on 46th St.), walking distance to all of the Broadway theaters, and three blocks to the nearest subway station. There are tons of restaurants and bars in the area and it is safe to walk everywhere. My wife and I just stayed here for our first visit to NYC and we would recommend it to anyone who wants to see NYC and who doesn't plan on staying in their room except to sleep. We have a 4 and 6 year-old and we will stay at this hotel with our family when we go back to NYC.We stayed in room 700, which is the only room on the 7th floor and it is the biggest room in the hotel with a queen bed. The room was big and comfortable; there was plenty of room for luggage; it had a small desk, a small armoire to hang some clothes in, and a small fridge; we had plenty of room to walk around the room we didn't have to crawl over the bed to get around the room or answer the phone; free internet via ethernet cable; since it was on the 7th floor it was quiet and we could not hear the ambient street noise. The only drawbacks with this room are: you have to get off at the 6th floor and take the stairs to the 7th floor, which was not a big deal for me and my wife, but it could be for some with disabilities; the water/shower pressure is poor during certain high-use times being on the 7th floor; and there is only one bed if you are looking for a room for a family and need two beds, but there is enough room for small inflatable beds for kids. We didn't eat breakfast here but it looked like your average continental breakfast and they always had coffee ready. There is a Starbucks (1 of 1,500 in Manhattan) across the street and there is a great little bakery called Amy's Bread one block away on 9th Ave. between 47th and 46th St. that we ate at several of times. There is a pharmacy across the street and several small markets within a block or two. Go the The Blarney Stone Pub across the street to have a cold one with locals who are super friendly and they will give you pointers on where to go and good places to eat.I would definitely stay here again.

This is by far the most I have paid and the smallest room I have ever stayed in! However for the location I understand it is normal. It was only me in the room (which was a good thing) I had to crawl across the bed to answer the phone. And I must say I did not know that bath tubs came in half lengths!! But there were no bed bugs and it was nice and clean. The staff were always friendly and the coffee always on. They do include a small breakfast but there is no room to eat it.Be patient if you want the elevator, it's painfully slow. This hotel has free (yes free) Canada and USA calling- neat! and of course wifi but only in the lobby. The location is great and I would stay again (If I can afford it!!) I don't know if they had bigger rooms, but two plus people would be tight.

Good location in the centre of the theatre district of NYC. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and although small were comfortable. However the road noise was a drawback.

This hotel is very well located just a couple of blocks from Times Square. The room was clean howbeit small. We were on the 6th floor and read these are larger than lower floors so I think we were blessed. I have pictures that I will post later. A couple of drawbacks - breakfast was very continental, nothing hot except for the oatmeal and bitter coffee. Being on the 6th floor, room service came after we got back to our room, so we told them to give us towels. I don't know how they would have cleaned such a small room with all our luggage sitting around. We were there for 3 nights so sleeping on the same sheets were okay. There was only room for one to walk at the end of the bed. Being across from fire station, there was some noise, but we wore ear plugs. The staff was very helpful. Fast check in and check out - they even said they would hold our luggage if need be. I would stay at this hotel again.

After our first 4 days we stayed in Mid Town, then we moved to this hotel, only 5 blocks from times square! It was fantastic location.Great service, the staff were very friendly everytime we came or went we got a smile and a hello or a have a good day. Check in was smooth.Our room was pretty modern but extremely small but as most are in NYC. We were on the 3rd floor and i think a little to close to the ground as at night it was very noisy, perhaps higher up would be less noisy? the small room and the noise at night were the only down falls. the room was clean, the bed (only a large double as id say thats all that fits in their rooms) was very comfortable. the bathroom also tiny but modern and great water pressure.i would stay here again, for sure but i think there is defintiely bigger hotels for the same price (around $200 US per night) but for the location, friendliness and cleanliness it was a great stay.

Located in 47th street in the corner of 8th avenue, the hotel has a great location because it is in the heart of the area of the theaters and only a block from Times Square (the soul of New York for Tourists).In the other hand we have a hotel with a poor breakfast (if you want to eat something you have to drive in the lobby of the hotel early in the morning because after 8:00 AM it will be difficult to find something to eat). But don't worry, you have a Starbuck in the other side of the street if you want to pay for it.The rooms were exactly what I expected, not so big but clean and quiet.If you ask me if I will return to the same hotel, I say YES.If you are planning to go to New York with your family, this is a good choice for you to stay.

The location is excellent, the staff really friendly and helpful, the room very clean, and one of the few in New York that offers breakfast and free wi-fi in the rooms.Otherwise the room is tiny, more than two suitcases is impossible to circulate through the room. Breakfast is served in the lobby and there are no tables to sit. It is best to take it to the room. The air conditioning is too noisy.But for those who need the room only to sleep, that's fine. After all, you're in NY!

The only negative aspect is the tiny room. Perfect location, Clean, breakfast included, reasonable price and good staff. Perfect for a single or a couple without kids. Walking distance from all major attractions.

I believe if you pay a little bit more for a hotel you will get "better bang for your buck." I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my husband, although the location was awesome the room on the other hand, could have been better.As previously mentioned in the reviews the room is very tiny and cramped. I would not recommend this hotel if you are travelling with a family, the room is ok for 2 people at most. There is little space to walk in the room, I would have to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom or door. Breakfast was non-existent it was just a shelf of juice, coffee, possibly toast, not much to choose from. The hotel room could use some updating: - The bathroom: Although the sink looked updated, the showerhead/tub could use some renos and spots of rust were noticed. The shower curtains had stains and looked "old". The overall space in the bathroom was small, the toilet was right near the door, so you had to "squeeze in" before closing the door.- The carpet floor was just average and dirty.- The room : Air condition was the one where you put on the window sill, I noticed stains on the walls and cracks.- The hallway is narrow and quite humid cause the aircondition does not flow though the whole hallway.- One day the cleaing staff failed to clean our room, and when asked, reminded us that they could not clean it since they were leaving at 5 o'clock. Even though we had been out of the room most of the day and it was still not cleaned. - Be careful with your valuables because our camera came up missing and the last time we saw it was in the room. When we discovered the camera was missing we had to call the hotel several times before getting a response that they didn't find the camera.I would ONLY recommend this hotel, just for the location. It is walking distance to most things and does not take long to get to your destination, but if you are looking for comfort, this would not be the hotel to book at. For me, I would have spent a little bit extra to be comfortable and have space to put my luggage. I guess it was just a place to sleep, but the bed wasn't that comfortable either.

The rooms are extremely small! Now yes, if you've ever stayed in NYC you know ALL of the hotels generally have much smaller rooms, but this hotel is even smaller than average. However, this hotel is one of the cleanest hotels I've stayed in. They take pride in being a small hotel that provides its guests with the utmost in cleanliness. Overall its an excellent location close to a lot of theaters and restaurants. If you don't mind a small space definitely book it. Also- absolutely NO signs of bed bugs which is a huge plus in NYC.

The rooms were awfully small, but just as clean as could be - the bathroom was sparkling and not a stray hair or dustball in sight! Didn't spend much time in the room anyway, so I thought this was a great value. Staff was friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast was a nice touch. Not the best a/c which was probably made a bit worse by the fact that I as on the top floor in July!

You can't beat the price and location of this place. It is up from Time Square enough to be quieter but still in easy walking distance to everything you want to see. Gray Line tours is right next door and stops are right on the corner for their hop on hop off service. The rooms are small but very clean and have everything you need. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Only bad part is elevator is slow and one day was broken.

We decided to celebrate my birthday by going to the "Big City" and taking in the "sights and sounds". When we arrived at the hotel we were pleasantly surprise to be greeted by two very friendly and knowledgeable front desk individuals. They were up-beat and were able to check us in early because my transportation got us to the city earlier than expected. The room, although a bit small, was exceptionally clean and had everything the description indicated. In fact, the whole hotel is very clean and quiet except for the occasional sirens from the "outside" world .... but remember, this is the city of the world....you must expect activity outside. The next day, you are treated to a free continental breakfast which isn't the greatest but does offer bagels, yogurt, coffee, juice, and cereal, You are better off going a few steps away and have a "real" breakfast but it will cost you. They also held our luggage because our transportation wouldn't be ready until 8:00pm. This is a great service so you can get an extra day in the city and not worry about dragging your luggage with you. We would definitely stay here again.

I was in NYC for 4th of July weekend and I was catching a show on Broadway and going to the Harry Potter Exhibition at Discovery Times Square. This hotel was a 2/10 of a mile walk from both. Obviously - the location of this place is top notch. It's exactly where I wanted and needed to be since I was traveling alone. The hotel is perfectly fine. Nothing special. The rooms are exactly the size you'd expect for NYC.  I only had one problem. I called down for an extra pillow and was delivered one with long black curly hairs all over it. As if it was just taken off a used bed and handed to me.I called down and told them and there was no apology - just a promise for a clean pillow. I would still stay here again. I got the clean pillow. All was well.

The Econo Lodge Times Square, 302 W. 47th, New York, is located next to attractions, restaurants, theaters, and subway stations. Our room was exceptionally clean and smelled good. The continential breakfast featured quality items like yogurt, pastries, hard cooked eggs, and bagels. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

When we come to NYC and stay here, we are always more than satisfied with our stay. Rooms are small, but perfect for a weekend away. We don't stay in our room much anyway. The free wifi is great. Things we like: Coffee in the lobby, friendly woman at the desk, flat screen tv, and the location can't be beat. Will stay here again!

We booked this hotel because of it's location and we're really pleased that it was so close to Times Square, Broadway theaters, and my husband's work conference. POSITIVES**Location! Only a 5 min. walk to Times Square and an easy walk to all the Broadway theaters.**Cleanliness - Our room was very clean. We did the usual bedbug test, especially since it's New York. We also checked the bedbug registry and they have no reports so far.**Continental breakfast - Not a huge selection, but they had bagels, coffee, pastries, cereal, etc.**Shower pressure - I hate when I go to a hotel and the water trickles out of the shower head. Great pressure here.NEGATIVES**We could not adjust the heat and it was quite warm in our room and really hot in the hallways.**Noise - We could hear street conversations, honking, and outside noise all night. There are window air conditioning units in the windows and the sound just goes right through the vents.**Room size. Our room was TINY. Only one of us could walk to the bed at a time. The other person had to duck in the bathroom. It was hard to find a place for both of our suitcases. My husband left his by the door to the room. We did see inside another room while it was being cleaned and it was larger and the furniture layout was better than ours.**There was some problem with their key card reader and they could not re-set our key so we had to wait for someone to walk us to our room and let us in. Minor issue and it was fixed later in the day.**Our tv reception would come and go. It was perfect the first day and fuzzy after that. I checked to make sure the cables were secure and they were.We were not in our room much since there is so much to do in NY so it was perfect for us. If you are planning on staying in your room a lot, I would not recommend it unless you are alone. It is cramped and hot. For sleeping purposes, it was fine. I was so tired from exploring NY all day that I could tune out the street noise and get a good night's sleep.

This hotel was not bad overall. The location is good, it was pretty clean, and the staff was friendly enough. The huge problem was the heating system. There are no thermostats in the rooms, and no way to control the temperature. I asked the woman at the front desk, and was told It is "centralized". Despite being around 30 degrees outside, the rooms were around 85 degrees...it was miserable and impossible to sleep, and impossible to adjust the temperature as the A/C was off. Stay somewhere else unless you like sleeping in an oven.

This is the third time I’ve stayed at the EconoLodge Times Square. The location is fantastic. Less than five minutes walk to Times Square. Numerous Subway lines are also within easy walking distance. There is a drug store on the other side of 47th street which provides all kinds of groceries, an ATM, pharmacy services, etc. There area also a few great take out joints nearby on 8th Avenue. There aren’t too many frills on offer at the EconoLodge. Breakfast is provided and consists of cereals, bagels, some fruit, coffee and OJ. There is only one elevator and it’s quite slow. If, for some reason, you’re looking for a room to do some aerobics, you may be disappointed because you’re going to struggle finding enough space to set up the ironing board, let alone do much else other than stow your luggage and lie down. 8th Avenue is a popular route for fire fighters, so you may find yourself disturbed at 3 AM by the sound of a fire engine. There isn't much insulation from the noise of the city that never sleeps (but if you're looking for some place quiet, why are you visiting NYC?).Having said that, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The place is clean. Who wants to spend time in their hotel room when they’re in New York City, anyway?! The EconoLodge provides a good place to lay your weary head. I’ve compared prices a few times and I’ve never been able to beat the price on offer for a comparable hotel nearby.

I arrived at this hotel on Monday 29th November 2010 with my friend, where we were booked in for five nights. The lady at the reception was very friendly and quickly booked us in to our room on the top floor looking out on to 47th Street. The room I found was extremely small, yet adequate for what we needed realistically. We just about had enough room to throw our suitcases in two corners, but for two people that were planning on being up early every morning, room space wasn't really a priority. We had expected it, especially at the competitive price we got the room for. The room was clean and tidy as was the bathroom however small it was too (I also found that after we'd showered the room got very warm, mainly from the steam in the bathroom), but again adequate. If you want a cheap room, expect a room along this lines. The big plus for me was the fact that the hotel was only literally a 2 minutes walk from Times Square. I did find that at night the location in general was very very noisy (horns blowing, trucks moving around, etc) but as it was only a block or two from Times Square, that was also to be expected, and as far as I'm aware all the rooms face the one way. There was breakfast served in the lobby every morning (coffee, orange juice, small selection of teas, croissants, bagels, etc - ps the orange juice was delicious!!!) but my problem with this was that it seemed to be cleared away shortly after 9am. I don't think it would have hurt to leave it out a little longer. Check out was quick and efficient too with the same girl that checked us in. She kindly took our luggage into the office as we still had time after check out to wander around, and booked us a taxi to the airport. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a place to lie down for about 6 hours sleep, nothing fancy but a nice clean room where you can get a few hours rest to get up early again and get out for the day. Great location!
the staff at the econo lodge hotel was very friendly and helpful room was very small but very clean cant complain for the price

The location of Econo Lodge is great; there's no denying that. But if you're looking for a nice hotel, this is not it. It was clean and safe, but the positives stop there. The bed was very hard. The water did not work well in the shower. We stayed in the "penthouse suite" on the seventh floor. It was hardly bigger than the average dorm room, and the elevator stopped at the sixth floor.If you're looking for a place to crash at night after you're out sightseeing or show-going during the day, this place if perfect. But if you're looking for a romantic or plush evening, upgrade.

Arrived from cruise ship and was given a room by mid morning. This was a great surprise and was greatly appreciated. The room was very small, but was quite clean. My only complaint was the noise from the Irish Pub across the street at 3am. Also, the continental breakfast ends too early. Great location!!!!!

When we arrived in NY at 9:00 we checked our bags at the counter and told them we'd be back at 3:00 for check-in time. When we got back, we were told that we had been bumped. We had booked the hotel 4 months in advance and booked all theater tickets and dinner reservations based on this hotel location. They moved us 10 blocks south to another hotel that was shabby, unclean and out of the way (the Pennsylvania). By the time we got all the way down to the other hotel and waited in another line to check in, we missed our reservations for that night. The Econo Lodge staff was unhelpful, unapologetic, and uncaring. Had we been told at 9:00am that we were bumped, we could have made arrangements to find a better location and made our dinner and theatre reservations,Don't let them do it to you.

Awesome location, friendly, friendly, staff. Small, but, comfortable rooms. Who goes to NY to sit in a hotel room? You are so close to theatre, restaurants, subways, Times Square and so many other neat places. The 24 hour Duane Reade drugstore right across the street is very convenient. Best of all, reasonably priced, GREAT value for your money. I highly recommend this hotel.

They own me money but never put it on my credit card. If you want to do whats right feel free tto give me my money econo lodge. the manager is the same as when i stayed there in 2008. Thet told me me they were lower the price of the room but never can up with the money. the head office offered me 100 buck to shut me up but i will never ever stay at an econo lodge again.

I believe if you pay a little bit more for a hotel you will get "better bang for your buck." I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with a girlfriend, although the location was awesome the room on the other hand, could have been better.As previously mentioned in the reviews the room is very tiny and cramped. I would not recommend this hotel if you are travelling with a family, the room is ideal for 2 people at most. There is little space to walk in the room, I would have to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom or door. One thing about this hotel is you would have to "recharge" your hotel room key every day before leaving. I tried getting back into the room late at night and my "key" would not work. When I went to the desk they said you have to recharge it every day when you leave and its could for that day only. I guess for security reasons that was good but annoying cause before going back to the room you have to "recharge it". Breakfast was non-existent it was just a shelf of juice, coffee, possibly toast, not much to choose from. And the Wi-fi would not load even with their password and login ID, just plain slow. If, you wanted to use the common area for the internet you would have to pay for usage and printer usage.The hotel room could use some updating: - The bathroom: Although the sink looked updated, the showerhead/tub could use some renos and spots of rust were noticed. The shower curtains had stains and looked "old". The overall space in the bathroom was small, the toilet was right near the door, so you had to "squeeze in" before closing the door.- The carpet floor was just average and dirty.- The room : Air condition was the one where you put on the window sill, I noticed stains on the walls and cracks.- The hallway is narrow and quite humid cause the aircondition does not flow though the whole hallway.I would ONLY recommend this hotel, just for the location. It is walking distance to most things and does not take long to get to your destination, but if you are looking for comfort, this would not be the hotel to book at. For me, I would have spent a little bit extra to be comfortable and have space to put my luggage. I guess it was just a place to sleep, but the bed wasn't that comfortable either. Still had a great time in NY!Sorry to those reading this long review, hope this was helpful and you enjoy your trip to the Big Apple!

Great location, close to Times Square and so many other things. Tried to find a "deal" nearby, for 3 nights. The room was small, which I am used to in NYC, but it was unclean and smelled moldy. They offered breakfast, which was minimal but of course, better than nothing. The staff was not very friendly, and had more social time than business time.

There was only ONE good thing about the hotel; the location. Everything else was very poor. The rooms are TINY and I mean TINY. The smallest rooms I have ever stayed in. Really basic - not even a tea or coffee maker in the room. Bathroom was also very small. The customer service was terrible. I made a call to reception and it took them 2 hours to respond to my simple request. The TV reception was extremely bad.Also be warned - they charge $3 PER ITEM to store your luggage - and they do not waive this under any circumstances. So if you arrive before 3pm - they will charge to store your bags. The same again on the day you leave. They do not do early check-ins. I was unable to speak to the manager - even though the manager was there - they pretended she wasn't. The customer service is rated 0/10. The worst customer service ever. They really don't care to make your stay pleasurable and if you are unhappy - they don't care in the slightest. Two ladies who checked in before us said they would never stay there again because of the $3 per bag charge (they had 4 bags). The hotel staff offered no discount on the $12 bag storage charge in order to make the customer happy. ICE is only at reception. The lift is VERY SLOW and only ONE lift in the building. If you are unhappy for any reason - do not expect the staff to take any action. I think they get bonuses for giving guests the worst customer service - otherwise I cannot understand how they can run a hotel this way.

My best friend and I stayed here for a weekend visit. Check in was easy, one thing I did not care for was the authorization hold on my check card 3-4 times but it did not effect my account. Room was super small, we tripped over each other. But it was clean. Bathroom is nice. Staff was super friendly. I left my iphone charger in the wall after checkout and front desk called housekeeping and they found it. thank you.Location was great. Housekeeping service came late - about 5 pm and we only needed towels at the time.I would stay again.

The only reasons to stay here are the location and the price. Just a few minutes walk to Times Square. The room is actually the smallest I have ever been in and I am a traveler of age 65. But if you want just a bed, a rather ratty look room and lobby and a breakfast of semi stale food then stay. We paid $150 a night plus another 20% in taxes.

Loved this hotel. Yes the rooms are small but they are perfect for one or two persons. Hotel was quiet (even with some traffic noise from the outside --- but I enjoyed hearing it), the staff was excellent, the room was very clean and the bath was perfect. After staying at the YMCA for years and years and seeing it get less and less nice, this place was a perfect alternative. I would stay at Econo Lodge Times Square in a minute. I really enjoyed my stay there.

If you're looking for clean, reasonably priced accommodation in NYC, this is it. The location was really good (5 mins walk from times square) and the rooms although TINY were really clean and modern. Bad points are that you cannot control the heating temperatures in your room as they are centrally controlled, the free wifi is pretty bad but there are lots of neighbours to sponge off! Also, it's across the road from a fire station, so your sleep will be disturbed until you get used to the loudness of the city! Good points, very clean, modern, good free breakfast in the morning and free tea and coffee 24/7 Feels pretty safe and secure too.

You do not get what you book. The air condition did not work. It would not turn down below 76 degrees. A remote was supplied to us after they could not find out why the controls would not work. The hair dryer broke. When we called the front desk one was at our door in about 15 minents. The only problem is that it was wall mounted and I had to uninstall the old one and install the new one. The breakfest is a joke. Every night around midnight a gallone of milk was put out on the counter. That same gallon of mile stayed out each night (WE STAYED 5 NIGHTS) untill 6 in the moring when they poured it into another container. The staff is very rude. Do not try to save a few bucks by staying here. You will be disapointed!

Stayed here at the end of March, '10. The place is OK, but a little shabby, and the room was pretty small. But, hey, this is NYC where shabby and small are the norm! Trust me, I've seen worse! I got a Queen bed, but the room was made for a double (at most), which is what I would order if I stayed there again. There was less than a foot of space between the wall and the end of the bed (the same applies to the space at the far/window side of the bed).-The bathroom wasn't huge, but was decently roomy when compared with other bathrooms in older, renovated hotels in NYC... and larger than most in Europe. Yes, some paint had peeled fromthe ceiling above the shower, but it was only a paint adhesion problem. Otherwise, the bathroom was clean & shiny with newer tile on both the walls & floor. There was plenty of hot water.- We found the bed comfy enough and supportive... And my back can be very fussy! The linens were clean, and the bottom sheet was fitted-- which isn't always true in budget hotels. Overall, the room was nice and clean.-The only problem was the air conditioner. It worked, but didn't cool too well. This would have been a major issue for me in the summer, but was passable in March. I reported it the next morning, and they had it repaired for our second night. It was better, but still barely sufficient. It was an old unit.-Still, keep in mind the excellent location... Close to everything in the theater district, and only 2 blocks from the subway. The neighborhood is NOT bad, and I don't know what that one reviewer was complaining about. Yes, I did hear fire trucks once. That 30 seconds didn't ruin my night.-Look... If you want the Hyatt or Mariott and can afford it, then go for it! However, if you don't mind sacrificing some room and/orsome minor creature comforts, then this place is OK. If the savings in $$ will make the difference in whether or not you you visit New York, and you plan to spend most of your time OUT of the room, then don't hesitate to stay there.-Oh, by the way... I never tried the continental breakfast in the smallish area one person griped about, but I've never based my judgment of any hotel on that, anyhow. You're in New York, for Pete's sake! The best bagels in the country are all around you in NYC, so why waste your time on the crummy "continental" breakfast in ANY HOTEL?

It's so hard to think of anything that was positive about this experience. We were charged upon check in even though the room was prepaid, so had to spend a lot of time correcting the error. There was no hot water for shower. Room really small and tight. Across street from fire and EMT station. Constant noise from emergency vehicles all night. Elevator was very slow. Breakfast that they use as a selling feature served on a counter in the check in area (very very small) where you sit on the ledge in the front window and hold food in your lap. People actually came in off the street to grab food. Neighborhood very shakey. Businesses and people we would not normally associate with. Oh, yes, and the bed was bottom of the line and very uncomfortable. Might have saved $20 but definitely not worth it. Good feature was that it was very close to Broadway shows.

I have stayed at many places in NYC and this is a nice find. After reading reviews for many hours I picked Econo Lodge. The location is great, the rooms are clean and the price couldn't be beat. I usually travel with friends or children and look for safety, cleanliness, comfy bed and decent location. Sure the room/bathroom is small, but how much are you really in the room and I have seen just as small of rooms in NYC for a lot more money. We sleep in it and get ready in it, so it was just what we were looking for. I have stayed in four star hotels in NYC, but wouldn't hesitate to stay in this two star again. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. We only took advantage of the breakfast once, it was small (grab and go), but a nice jump start to the day, and besides there aren't many hotels in NYC that have anything set out for breakfast. I was pleasantly surprised by our entire experience at Econo Lodge. We are big walkers and we walked all over from this location at all hours and felt safe, and I was with my teenage daughter. I don't make a point of nit picking small things at the places I have stayed at, I find the same problems in high or low end hotels; I think it's all in what you are looking for. Thanks for making our trip safe, comfortable and enjoyable:>)

Nice hotel!It has a yummy breakfast with croissants, jelly, chocolate, milk and all that good stuff!!The rooms were clean, had a very good bathroom (good conditions) and most of all is really well located.

The hotel is in a perfect location for theatres etc. The rooms are extremely small, but very clean. The staff is helpful. Call direct and ask for the Manager's Specials.Breakfast..bagel,cake & coffee free in the lobby until 9:30. For a cheap clean room and a place to sleep in a perfect location for all sights etc. Shops and restaurants all around the block. Walking to all sights.

What we liked best: Great location for broadway theatres and Times Square. What we liked least: Tiny Room. We arrived about noon, and they allowed us an early check-in without any fuss. The hotel location is great - broadway theatres just a block away - Times Square is just two blocks - subway stations two to five blocks distant. The room was clean, but awfully small (the queen bed was about a foot from two walls). The bed was comfortable. The bath was small but serviceable. everything was clean and in good repair. The continental breakfast was nothing special. The hotel website pictures show fruit on the breakfast bar, but we never saw any fruit. The high speed internet worked fine, except for an outage that lasted a few hours. If you want to use the internet, be sure to ask about it when you check in, since our experience was that they didn't volunteer that information. The staff were all friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable.

We stayed at the Econolodge hotel NY if you call it that,we were tired a friendly face would have been nice ,no such luck, the staff at reception were unhelpful and useless.Got our key after about half hour went to the room we were given ,it was a double not a twin so off we go back into the lift i knew it was going to be fun when we got downstairs we explained it wasnt the room we had booked the receptionest said did you book in yesterday ,no half a hour ago through gritted teeth .We ended up paying another $139 .To be fare the young man at reception was very helpful.Starving hungry next day came down for breakfast which takes place in the reception area only one word inedible,the room was cold and very small but clean .The cleaners were brilliant i think they should get the reception job.!

We banked on the reviews here and stayed 2 nights while seeing shows in NYC. The review were right. This is somewhat of a hidden gem. The value ($169.99) was very good. The locaiton is fantastic - within 1-2 blocks of most theaters, short walk to Times Square, and 1 "long block" to 9th Avenue where there are tons of restaurants (and more on 8th Avenue too). The room we had was exceptionally small -- really little more than a bed, desk and bathroom. There was literally one foot on one side of the bed and one foot space at the foot of the bed. Other than that, there was very little room to maneuver around. Yet the room was very clean and fresh. The place has clearly been renovated from top to bottom. There is a small chest/wardrobe, and I mean small. It has a safe in it and it's not much wider than the safe. The safe was nice to have but too small for my laptop. There is a small desk which is good but if the chair is used you can't walk past it. The bathroom is clean and small but usable. Essentially it's like being on a cruise ship where there is no a spare square foot around. But since we went sightseeing all day, came back to get changed, went to theater and then late dinner and did not get back until midnight, we basically only used it for the bathroom, changing and sleeping. A good find and good value in an otherwise expensive part of town.

I've read reviews on this hotel before I booked but when I stay in a hotel I only use it for sleeping in. So the size of the rooms does not matter.The location was great a few yards from Times Square so close enough but far enough to be away from the bustle. The lift did make a bit of a racket when we 1st arrived but it was soon fixed. The room was very small for example, there was a flat screen TV on the wall and I still had to lean back as I passed between it and the bed. But that's the only complaint I could make if I wanted to. We stayed 3 nights and found the bagels, muffins, fruit & coffee enough for breakfast but at time did have to stand to have it as it was served in the foyer.

If you were expecting a large room, you are quite mistaken. My girl firend and I went here over a year ago and I still remember the look of the place. The hotel is within a few blocks of time square, but the hotel itself is a bit dated. You receive a continental breakfast in the morning of whatever bagels or muffins they have. They do offer coffee and tea for those who are interested. Not a satisfactory full meal, but good enough to start your day. The hotel room we got was one with a queen bed. With two girls and two full sized luggages, it was a bit cramped. We had to maneuver our luggage so we had access to it. The bed took up most of the room. The bathroom was on the small side as well. The room itself was old. The room had a weird smell without the air conditioner on and you definitely needed air conditioning in August. The hotel did manage to squeeze in a table into the room. This room is great for if you are going with just one other person and you aren't planning to spend too much time in the room. It's definitely nothing fancy, but if you just need a place to stay it's a good price for NY.

I found this hotel after doing tons of research. It was the best deal I could find (at least for a place that I felt comfortable staying in!). For $240.00 per night it was still pretty steep - but compared to the other hotels in the times square area for the dates I was traveling, this was was nice a bargain. When we got to the hotel, we had had TERRIBLE service from SuperShuttle, so I was not in a particularly good mood checking in. The desk clerk (who I am sure hear me yelling at the shuttle driver) was not super welcoming but she also wasn't unpleasant to deal with either. Then they told me I had to pay up-front; which is not the typical operation of a hotel. So my vacation did not get off to a good start. It was hot (our vacation happened to coincide with the 3 hottest days of the summer...over 100 every day!) and I was cranky and irratable after the flight and the horrible experience getting there. Then...we get to the room and holy smallville batman! there wasn't even room to walk around the bed - it was weged from wall to wall. But I had found in my travel research that hotel rooms in NYC were small. So okay - we will tolerate it. and Viola...finally a good vacation ensues! We headed downstairs to engulf ourselves in the wonders of NYC and find the nearest restraunt because we were starving. We stopped in the lobby to ask what they recommended nearby and the bellman was kind and most helpful. We were greeted when we returned by the nice bellman and a different desk clerk - and she was wearing a smile! Morning came and ...out we went into the great wide city. Passing thru the lobby we asked for extra towels for the rest of the week, and a wonderfully nice desk agent assured we would have them. We were also greeted by the kind bellman again, and there was a very nice continental breakfast to be had. Well...we got our extra towels. We got the extra blanket we asked for. There was fresh water bottles left for us every day, fresh soaps in the bathroom, and fresh linens. Every day we were joyfully greeted by the desk clerk and the bellman; and we had a splendid time! The service was good. The room was small but functional. The in-room safe didn't work and we were told the batteries needed to be changed; and I don't know if they changed them when we were out of the room; but we were never able to get it to work. It could have been the safe...it could have been us not being clever enough how to figure it out. All in all this was a good place; good price comparitively; and I would stay again in a New York minute!

This is an Econo Lodge, not the Four Seasons, but it does have the backing of a national chain. It is located not even 2 blocks from Times Square, on the north end near Central Park. The rooms are small, but from my experience, most rooms are in Midtown Manhattan. But when you're in NYC, you're not spending much time in the room anyway. I've seen the reviews on similarly priced hotels, and if you even get a private bathroom, you may see rodents. But at the Econo Lodge, the rooms were fairly clean and you get your own decent-sized bathroom. I actually stay at this hotel every time I go to NYC, because working for a non-profit, you can't beat the price for a decent hotel in that location. During my last stay, I came back from a day out working and almost cried with joy when I saw how much care the maid service took with my belongings when cleaning the room. It was immaculate and organized. The accommodations are nothing fancy by any means, but you're not going to find a better location with nicer staff for under $150 a night in Midtown.

We stayed in this hotel because it was close to Times Square and was about $120 a night. A good price for the area. We were not disappointed. The rooms are small, but they were clean and the location was great!

This place is miserable! It took us two hrs just to get checked in after spending a 6 hr ride to get here. There was some internet issues... We went out for dinner hoping the issues would be resolved by then...they were not! We were not offered anything for our inconvenience, not even a water and just said " there is nothing we can do" even though their motto is " where great customer service doesn't cost extra", but this place has no customer service at all. When we got back the elevator was broken and there was nobody in the lobby for any help at all. So what are you paying for...please spend the extra 200 bucks for a much better place, this place is an insult. The next night we tried to get back into our hotel room and had to go back down to the lobby with the most unfriendly employee ever because nieiher of our keys would let us into our room, it was then that she informed us that you had to get new keys every freaking day! Imagine that. No reason what so ever for another inconvience, not to mention they dont even have vending machines!

We booked 2 rooms to stay at the Econo Lodge over the September long weekend. We were greated by a please lady that was working the front desk and we thought we were off to having a great stay. We could not have been so wrong...The next morning we go to have a shower and we find out there is no hot water... I phoned the front desk and they said the hot water was not working in the entire area. We did not get frustrated as maybe that was the case and that was out of the control of the hotel. We check later on that night and they say the hot water is now working but when we get back to our room we discover that it is not working yet again. We phone down to the front desk to discover they know it is still a problem and don't know when it will be fixed.The next morning we try to have a showever to our disappointment to find out the hot water is not working again which means that we are forced to have cold showers. This was clearly not fun since I have very long hair!When we talked to the front desk there was no manager to express our concerns to and our compensation for a bad stay was 10% off our room. We are in New York.... having hot water is a basic necessity not a luxury item... telling us you could not get someone to come an fix it until Tuesday after the long weekend is just unacceptable!There is one thing to have someone go wrong for a customer during their stay but the moment of truth for your organization is how you resolve the problem... this differentiates whether or not the client will ever come back! Econo Lodge you missed the boat and there were 4 ladies from 4 families in those 2 rooms and we live in difference Cities. Do the math to figuer out how many people we have told about our experience and how many people will NEVER visit your hotel since you did not compensate for this problem in an appropriate mannor! The lost business along from the four of us is much greater than it would have cost you to discount our rooms appropriately!

I heard about this property through friends and it is a great find! I will def recommend to others who are looking for accomodations esp in times square - there should be more hotels like this one! we didnt pay for anything except our room charge. EVERYTHING was free! Breakfast, Coffee, Tea, Internet, Faxing - the savings added up - we would have easily spent an additional $30 anywhere else for all of this. The rates are the cheapest in the area. The folks at the front desk were great.

I stayed with a couple of friends at the Econo lodge for the labour day weekend and the hotel had no hot water for the weekend. The staff didn't apologize and the toilet in one of the rooms overflowed twice.

The only good thing at the hotel is it's location. The rooms are tinny - you almost have to choose between you or your luggage - and the staff (exception made for Andrew) is very unfriendly. Even though they say there's free wi-fi connection in the room, I've been staying there for an entire week and couldn't get online!!!!!! And when I look to the front desk so they can get it fixed, they give a shi***** about it!!! NOT RECOMMENDED!!!

Stayed at the Econo Lodge for 3 nights whilst visiting New York.Never been to New York before, then this is a good place to stay!The rooms are very small i mean very small BUT it's clean and some where to sleep and freshen up, grab a coffee on your way out in the morning what more do you want for the price?Location is EXCELLENT you walk out the door turn right and just 1 block your on Times Square right in the centre of everything. I would highly recommend the Your buses for seeing New York, it's cheap and a great way to see New York and all it's Famous Land marks. You just hop and off as many times as you like throughout the day.I would stay at Econolodge again and recommend it to anyone if anything for it's Location, the staff were very friendly and helpful.

We satyed in Econo lodge in April 2008. Having been to New york before I was looking forward to taking my children (teenagers) and mother. We has booked 3 rooms and requested a twin for the children. When we arrived there was no twin room and ended up paying an extra $400. The receptionis was rude and unhelpful. The hotel is small the rooms even smaller. There was little room for 2 people and if 1 person was getting ready the other had to stay in hte bathroom or sit on the bed. It was very noisy as you would expect near times square, however there is a Firestation nearby and sirens going all night. The only plus was the free breakfast of mainly bagels and coffee/tea the latter being available all day and night.Would I stay again ? no.

This was located near many restaurants, the Broadway district, and several other NYC attractions such as Radio City and Rockefeller Plaza. We arrived about an hour or so before check-in time, and although our room wasn't ready, they had a room that was, according to the clerk, "larger" than the room we had and that she was going to upgrade us to that. I can't imagine what the original room looked like---there was barely enough room to turn around in. The bathroom, however, was large, and the room was very clean, which is our primary concern. Lighting in the room was excellent. In so many hotels one can't read after dark because of the limited lighting, but that was not the case. The window air conditioner was plenty to cool the room down. The bed was comfortable. We did hit a snag, however. When we prepared to go downstairs for the continental breakfast, the elevator was out of service, so we had to walk down from the 6th floor. It wasn't terribly inconvenient for us because we are walkers and in good physical condition, although I must admit the hike back upstairs had us both pausing for a moment at the 4th floor. Our last hike down was with overnight bags, too. When we checked out, not a word of apology for the inconvenience was offered. Granted, I would prefer walking to riding an elevator that is unsafe, but some recognition of the added effort on the guests' part would have been appreciated. There are some who couldn't have done the stairs, and I wonder what accommodations were made for them. We actually did opt out of the continental breakfast--it was sparser than most, however by the time we did return from breakfast, more items had been added. Despite the situation with the elevator, I would stay in this hotel again because of its location and value.

After reading the review about how small the rooms were, I guess seeing is believing! My husband who is is 6'3 and I were in a room on the 4th floor. The bed was more a double than a queen size that we were expecting. The room is extremely small for two people. Getting out of bed was challenging as there was about a 1' space between the foot of the bed and the wall. It was either walk sideways or roll over my husband to get up, lol.Getting ready for our day was comical as only one person could fit in the bathroom and then to get dress was also a challenge too as there was a desk in the room so there wasn't much space between the desk, bed and the walls. At night we did hear a lot of noise but we had the window air conditioning running all the time so that muted out some of the sounds. The linen and the bathroom have seen better days and we actually had to ask for extra towels as they were down to the last threads. The breakfast was ok for what it was worth. Bagels are always good to start off the day with your coffee.Overall it is definitely your low-budget hotel. The location was excellent as it was close by to Times Square and if you want to the the Hop on Hop Off Bus Tours the pick up is across the street.

We stayed here for 3 nights in September 2007. The room we stayed in was very small, no room for a wardrobe just a small cupboard. The staff where very good and the room was fairly clean, location is excellent. Because of the excellent location it can be a bit noisy at night, but at the end of the day you're in New York there arent many quiet areas it really is a 24 hour city.

My daughter and I stayed here june 17 checked in at 12:30pm our room was not ready at the time they offered us the penthouse suite(HA HA HA) on the 7th floor the only room on the 7th floor but larger free upgrade no extra charge. First thing I did was pull down the bed to check for bed bugs thank goodness no bugs the sheets were clean and no stains on them flat screen tv,safe in the room also a FREE small breakfast 7-10am it got us going in the morning. There was alot of traffic noise and fire station is around the conner but hey is New York you will here traffic any place you stay in NY near times square. I would stay here again in a NY minute it was CLEAN and close to almost everything.

I am a frequent NYC traveler, so I know about how big apartments & such in the city are. The EconoLodge is NOT in Times Square, more like 4-5 blocks away, but still a good location. It's not much to look at from the outside, but inside it is well maintained & clean. Now, the rooms are SMALL, but any New Yorker will tell you that if you want space, you pay for it. The room fit one king size bed and a small bathroom, and you had to wait for each other to stay still to get around. But, everything was clean and the room came with shamppos & soaps, etc. There was breakfast the next morning (donuts, coffee, bagels, etc.) If you want a luxury hotel, then you will pay for it, for the price we couldn't have asked for much more. I mean, in NYC, how much time do you really want to spend in the room anyway? This hotel is located fairly close to the subway and there is a nice breakfast/diner place near by for some good cheap eats.

I had to stay en extra day in New York last month, and I didn't want to spend a lot of money as I would not be there except to sleep.this hotel is quite fone for that, but would not be good if it was 2 people who had lots of stuff. Like most rooms in Manhattan, it is just a bed and a small bureau in lieu of a closet, and a rack that will fit one suitcase.But it is clean and convenient, and a block from Times Square, the Broadway theatres, 20 minutes walk to central park, close to subways, and the Port Authority bus Terminal.It is right off of restaurant row, so you need not look far for great little restaurants.Staff were friendly and nice. The room and bathroom were clean.The street below was a little noisy due to a window airconditioner being in the window permanently for the summertime, but all in all, I couldn't complain. And for what I needed, it was safe and fine.there is a little help-yourself breakfast in the morning down in the lobby - O.J., coffee/tea, bagels, donuts, croissants, cereal, etc.My room was ready when I checked in at noon, and they were able to let me have a late check out (by 2 hours) when I asked the next day.A great little place for a night or two!
Cozy? I mean small, but the amenities were great. Desk folks were knowledgeable. Breakfasts were great. Centrally located. Near subway. Theater right next door. What more could you ask? Nice place.

I have stayed there multiple times for business, it is centrally located for everything I need. I am also planning on staying there for personal trips as well. The best price in Manhattan, very knowledgeable people. 5 minutes to Times Square by foot!

We stayed there for a whole week and would stay there again. Yes, it's small, but who cares, you are hardly in as you are too busy checking the wonderful NYC. For us what mattered the most was its cleanliness and location. We walked everywhere till late as it was central and safe. The breakfast was average, but it fed us for the morning, so I can't complain! Many hotels don't provide breakfast. I have recommended this hotel to my friends who will visit NYC in 2010. Great value for money, stay there!!!

Me & my boyfriend have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Econo Lodge..here is my opinion... rooms are REALLY small there was barely enough room for us to put our clothes into the drawers as there were about 3 and even they were small, so i wouldnt reccommend this hotel for a group of people or if your staying for a long period of time and it got quite stuffy in there most of the time but there is a fan thats excellent it lets out alot of air. Very clean, rooms were cleaned everyday and towels changed everyday. Safe is in the wardrobe which is free, we used this all the time. It did suit us it was great value for money it's close by to everything, times square is right around the corner. There is a continental breakfast every morning which is just coffee and donuts/croissants etc..and you can take them back to your room. Staff seemed friendly enough but we never had much contact with them. Overall it's a nice place i just dont think there is enough rom for 2 people or more but great value for money. New York is an amazing place and i think we will definetly be returning, there is so much to do and see! we had an amazing time here.

This hotel suited my needs perfectly. I wanted to stay close to Times Square and this hotel is only about 5 blocks away. The room was quite small, but it was clean and comfortable. We didn't bring a lot of luggage so everything fit just fine. I always wanted to stay in Manhattan but was never able to afford it until I found this hotel. The free breakfast was an added plus, saving us time and money in the mornings. The only downside to this hotel was the noise in the wee hours of the morning of horns honking, sirens, and loud people, but that's what I expected staying so close to Times Square, there is a reason why they call it the "city that never sleeps". Overall, this was a good hotel for the money and I definitely would stay again.

This location, only a few hundred metres away from Times Square is perfect, if you are up for some 24h action. There are lots of good cheap eats just around the corner in Hells Kitchen, specially the Five Napkins Burger on the corner of 45th and 9. ave are worth a visit if you are in for some juicy meat..The rooms are small, so if you are two persons planning to bring loads of luggage or do massive shopping, rent an ekstra room for the luggage :-).Being one person in the room was just perfect. I have lived in smaller and more expensive rooms in London, so value is great for the money. The room was real clean an tidy. Location are a bit noisy, so if you are a light sleeper bring earplugs!There was an in-room safe, but be aware that Laptops bigger than 13" won´t fit in!Hotel is perfect for young travellers on a budget or if you are travelling alone.
