A small continental breakfest and 24h coffee are included in the room rate. There is no restaurant but you can bring the breakfest to your room.

The clue here is in the title - if you want luxury then you'll have to pay for it! I stayed here for five nights and found it perfect for my needs - close enough to the action to be able to walk around, and clean/comfortable. Both these needs were met. My room was a bit 'wee', and if there had been two of me with cases (and shopping) the size of mine then it might have been a squash. However, if your only luggage is a weekend case then it's fine for two. My first room was spotless, but unfortunately the safe didn't work. I called down to reception, was seen to immediately, then was found another room as the safe had had it. (A blessing perhaps as the wireless connection was very slow on sixth floor - but better on fourth!)As mentioned in previous reviews, the proximity to Times Square is great - as a single white female I felt perfectly safe walking around in the evening after a show or meal. The Grey Line tour buses leave at the end of the street - I really enjoyed the tours I did - and just further up on 8th Ave is the fire station that lost the most firefighters on 9/11 - a sobering reminder of the tragedy to befall this great city. I would certainly stay here again - the staff (when I had cause to need them) were friendly and helpful, and being so central was perfect.

Simply put this hotel is probably the best value for the location. It as clean, there was a safe in the room and although the room was tiny it didn't feel uncomfortable. If you have more than two people I'd suggest paying for a bigger room.Don't be put off by the fact that it's an Econo Lodge, it was well kept and felt fresh. There is a breakfast and the staff are all friendly. And of course there is the location.The only issue i had was checking in. I had to wait and there was no where to leave the luggage since the hotel had no extra room. The elevator was insanely slow as well.The area was clean and true to form, the world is at your feet once you step out of the hotel and into the City. I had a wonderful stay and this is where I'll stay the next time I'm in NYC!

After seeing some scary reviews of other cheap hotels in NY, (including pics of rats, bugs & mold), I was apprehensive about booking a cheap hotel. All we needed was basically somewhere to sleep, so we didn't want to pay for anything fancy or big. But I did NOT want a dirty, run-down, rodent infested place either! This place was perfect for what we wanted. It was definitely small and simple, but it was CLEAN and well maintained (it doesn't seem to be an old building, or at least it's been redone inside). The best parts:-great location, just around the corner from Times Square (1block west & a couple blocks north of it)-free wireless-room safe (set your own password)-clean bathroom, hot water, fresh soft towels, hair dryer-comfy bed, clean sheets-air conditioner-flat screen TV (some channels were fuzzy, but you don't come to NY to watch TV!)-free daily newspaper (during the week)-free coffee/tea all day in lobby-free 'breakfast' til 10am in lobby (fruit, cereal, tasty pastries, oatmeal, bagels) -free local calls-smoke-free hotel-price (paid $160+$30 tax CAN/night)Like most NY hotels it seems, the rooms are small and it can get noisy outside (you are downtown near TS after all!). But it wasn't that bad. After walking around all day we were tired enough to sleep through any noise. They'll hold your bags for $3 each after check-out (which is noon). Also, check in is 3pm, but we got there in the morning and got our room right away.

We had a great experience! The hotel was super clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful and we got the most bang for our buck. Are the rooms tiny? Heck yeah--but we didn't care. We wanted a safe, clean place to sleep at night as it was not our intention to spend a lot of time in the hotel when there was so much to do and see in the city. I will definitely go back if ever visiting NYC again.

I read many reviews about this hotel and it is the main reason I booked it. I wanted something close to Times Square and something that was somewhat affordable. We were warned about the small rooms... and everyone was right... wow... they are small. My hubbie and I managed though. We got in each others way a lot, but it was a clean hotel and perfect ammenities. We landed up reorganizing the furniture a bit so that we could get around a little better. The bathroom was a good size and the bed was comfortable and clean. We had free internet in the room and we used it a lot. We were also informed that they had free long distance phone calls. That came in very handy. I have never been to a hotel that had free long distance phone calls. The continental breakfast was also good. They had coffee all the time in the lobby. The people at the check in counter were always pleasant and friendly. I would definetly recommend this hotel and will probably use it again. We also got a 60 plus rate (my parents) which wasn't advertised.

I viewed all the reviews on this hotel before I booked. I stayed from 6th nov - 10th Nov. Yes the rooms are very small but also very clean. The shower pressure was great after spending hours walking around the city.The staff were always very helpful and pleasant. The hotel is only 1 block away from Times Square and just around the corner from where the NY Sightseeing bus tours leave from. There is also a 24 hr cafe just round the corner which serves great food. If I am lucky enough to go back to this fantastic city I will be using the Econo Lodge Hotel again. NY CITY Fan from Scotland UK

WHile most NY hotel rooms are small (and this is no exception), the hotel was immaculately clean, location was first rate and the staff was friendly and helpful. I will have no problem staying here again.

We wanted to be close to Times Square and the Theater district. This Econ Lodge was perfect. The room was small - about 2 feet around a queen bed, a small desk & chair, a small wardrobe, tv, ironing board, and a bathroom. Free continental breakfast. Coffee was available all day. The hotel had been renovated in 2006, so it was clean and well-kept. The elevator was quick (unlike some previous reviews had stated) and the hotel was only about 5 floors high, so I'm not sure what the big deal was. I watched the rates and booked one night in advance to get a rate under $200 including taxes. You can leave your luggage in a secured room for $3/day after you check out. Less than 10 minute walk from the Port Authority.

This hotel has a great location @ 47th & 8th and is an easy walk to all the theatres and restaurants around Time Square. You can even walk to Central Park pretty easily. The room was clean, the staff were helpful and friendly, but the room is TEENY TINY. I mean, really, really small. I know hotel rooms in NYC are small normally, but I've been to NYC numerous times and this was the smallest room I've ever seen. The two of us had a hard time finding space to open 2 suitcases. Since we didn't spend much time in the room, the size really didn't bother me too much. I'd definitely go back. However, I wouldn't recommend it if you're claustrophobic, spend a lot of time in your room, or are a larger than average person.

We spent 11 nights here and were very pleased. Our room was clean and everything in it appeared to be new. We were on the top floor, so the street noise wasn't too bad, especially with the fan or air conditioner on. We didn't have any trouble with noise coming from inside the motel. We never heard our neighbors talking or their TV. There was also no problem with the slamming of doors in the hallway that is often a problem. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast consisted of wonderful bagels, crossiants, 2 kinds of pastry, 2 kinds of cold cereal, oatmeal, fruit, coffee, tea, and juice. It was important to us to have a room with it's own bathroom, not shared. This motel had the best rate of any I looked at in Manhattan. The room was small, but adequate for two people. We had four bags total and there was a space for everything. I was pleasantly surprised with how nice it was, considering our rate was $179 per night. You won't find a better location. Especially nice was the fact that if you go to 9th and 10th avenues, there are all kinds of restaurants, bakeries, delis and diners, in all price ranges. If you get tired of the free breakfast, give the Galaxy Diner on 9th avenue a try, they have a great breakfast. I highly recommend the Econo Lodge Times Square!

Do you like staff being unbelievably rude 3 times out of five? Do you want your sheets to get changed every day? Do you like shabby ceilings and a falling off shower head? Do you prefer having your breakfast standing in the lobby? Do you like sharing your bed with BED BUGS? Do you appreciate staying in a hotel next to Times Sq. and pay $300/night? Then this place is for you

This place a rip off compared to the money they charge. Rooms are tiny, Lift works at snail pace, Staff is highly unfriendly, reception and lobby is dirty, i can go on and on... Bottom line is that you can find a much better Lodge or a Hotel at Time square at the same price. I will never stay at this place ever again..

The Only good thing about this hotel was the location. The rooms are incredibly small- so small in fact that the TV has to be mounted to the corner of a wall as there is no room for a tv stand. All that is in the room is a bed and a small cupboard for your clothes (couldn't fit much in it).When we arrived our door was open (sketchy) there was blood on the sheets and our phone cord had been cut out of the wall (these all should have been signs to LEAVE). The bathroom was disgusting. There was no vanity to put your toiletries so they all had to go on the floor- which was not clean and had a dirty towel on the floor. Breakfast was- donuts. I think there may have also been cereal and some fruit. The walls are VERY thin- we heard everything that was going on both inside and outside the hotel. When i travel- i want my hotel to be some place to come and unwind at the end of the day and this hotel did not provide that. I will not be staying here again.

This is a GEM! Yes, the room is small, BUT CLEAN!Best Location, Nice FREE Continental Breakfast, Friendly Staff,$30 a day to park your car 400 feet away, Excellent Freshbagels and danish, Good Coffee, Tropicana PremiumOrange Juice, FREE chips and bottled water in room, GreatLG flat screen TV ....Why would you stay anywhere else!

OK, OK, I knew what I was getting into: Earlier reviewers did mention the room was extremely small. But you can't really appreciate just how small it is until you've tried to squeeze between the edge of the bed and the wall and make your way to the other side of a room no bigger than a closet. Actually, it's pretty hilarious -- almost as funny as the water that leaked on our heads from the bathroom ceiling. To the hotel's credit, they switched our room immediately. It was just as small. On the plus side: the location is excellent, smack in the middle of the theater district. You get a real feel for New York as fire trucks, police cars and ambulances race past your window, sirens blaring. The hotel and room are very clean, the bed is comfortable, the front desk people smile and there's a complimentary continental breakfast -- although the bagels run out very quickly and the coffee is undrinkable. So, if you're not claustrophobic and want to save more than a few bucks, the Econo Lodge is the place for you.

I believe in Tripadvisor and almost without exception use it to plan any of my vacations abroad. So when the hotel we used on our previous vacation to NYC closed, we obviously turned to Tripadvisor to select a new place to stay. All the positive things said about this hotel are true - the water pressure and hot water are just fine and for the noise complaints - I can recommend a great place in Alaska (this is NYC after all). But let's start at the beginning. We arrived early at the hotel after a 23 hour flight (yeah no kidding) and could obviously not check in but they offered to keep our luggage at no cost. After roaming the streets in our "not so fresh" state we got our room just after 12:30. Now use your imagination and imagine the smallest a room can be in a hotel. Take half of that and you have the Econo Lodge! These rooms are TINY but they are clean and the bed is comfortable. What more do you need really? So unless you are a little bigger than the average size this hotel is more than adequate to have a good night's sleep and a place to clean up. You will not spend your days in the hotel with the streets of New York calling outside. The breakfasts consisted of a few pastries, bagels, a choice of two cereals, juice, fresh fruit and good enough coffee. No room really to sit downstairs to enjoy the breakfast so most use the tray in the room to carry it back to the room. The hotel staff was in general friendly enough by New York standards. We had a problem with our toilet and this was dealt with promptly. Most people rave about the location and we must also throw our penny's worth in. It is absolutely true that you'll be hard pressed to find a better location for the price. In the heart of the theatre district, one block from restaurant row and Times Square. Across the street is a Duane Reade pharmacy for convenience shopping 24 hours a day. Another little gem is the Food Emporium two blocks north at 49th and 8th. We can really recommend them for a late night snack. Will we stay there again? Absolutely!! And in my opinion this is the measure of how great a hotel really was.

This place is a great deal for NY. The location is great; a few blocks from Times Square, right in the heart of the Theater District. Even better, head one block over to 9th Ave and experience "restaurant row", block after block of small moderately priced restaurants of every hue from burger joints to Turkish to Italian to Thai to whatever else you might want. Right across the street is a friendly, laid-back Irish pub where we had a cool glass of Guiness each evening. Walk around the neighborhood (Hell's Kitchen) and see real New York devoid of tourist traps where people live. The rooms are small by any standard; it was hard to fit around the side the of bed and the bathroom was claustrophobic for my 6' husband. We only were given two pillow and two towels despite their being two of us. The hotel is far from fancy and as for the "free continental breakfast" - well - we hit the Starbucks in the next block instead. That's it for negatives - the staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean when we arrived and kept that way for the whole 6 days we stayed. All in all, a real deal. We'd stay again.

This hotel is totally adequate but not luxurious in any way. As noted in prior postings, the rooms are SMALL, even by European standards. We had to squeeze by each other just to get to the bed. My husband hit his head on the low TV. But, everything worked fine, the bed was comfortable, the breakfast was fine as long as you took it up to your room to eat...........no seating in the lobby. And the location makes up for any deficiencies. Funny little things there, like you have to recode your room keys every day, and the elevator is, as mentioned before, quite slow. But so what.......the room was clean and comfortable and what more do you need in New York City.We stayed four nights and would return.

We spent one night in NYC and the hotel was very good. The staff was friendly, the location is good, the room and hallways were clean (but very small) and the price was reasonable for NYC. We paid about $160 plus tax.

I stayed on a Saturday night with my teenage daughter and her girlfriend. The room was small but we actually had the room we needed to iron and store shopping bags. The room was clean, nice tv, bathroom was very small but very clean. We appreciated the bottled water and chips and also the coffee/fruit in the lobby and the breakfast in the a.m.My only complaint is that we were in a corner room over 8th ave and heard all of the noise. Sirens, horns, voices well into the night - I would highly recommend ear plugs then I think you would be all set. For the price, this was a great place to stay - I really don't think you could do better. I paid under 200.00 with tax for a weekend stay.

Yes the room was small, yes there was nowhere to sit for breakfast and yes the lift was slow - overall though, the price and location far outweighed those negatives.The room was always clean, the showers powerful and hot, and 24hr coffee too!You couldn't have asked for a better location either - slap bang in the middle of the Theatre district and within walking distance of MoMA, Central Park, Empire State, Rockefeller Centre and Times Square. Recommended.

The Hotel Personnel damaged my saxophone. I had to check the horn because I was being relocated to another room and that room was not available. I tip the counter person and the bellhop who physically took the horm from me. Alos, I explained the contents of the case and asked for special care. When I returned, the case was behind the counter on the floor where staff members were walking. The bell of the sax was bent. I reported this event to Choice Hotels Customer Service Department. The Hotel issued a statement to the Service Department that "proper care" was taken in handling the sax and that they were not responsible. Customer Service called me and stated that the hotels statement was final. I have stayed at hundreds of hotels with this saxophone and have not had this type of problem. This is irresponsible on the hotels part. Also, the hotel in independent of the Customer Service Department. Therefore, the department is useless in this matter.

Yes, this was the tiniest room that we have ever stayed in (couldn't fit pass the desk and chair to get to the bed unless we removed the chair and stored it beside the desk and even then it was a tight squeeze. There was an ironing board and iron but I don't know if there would have been room to set it up. Now to the positives....the room was very clean...gleaming bathroom with great water pressure and temperature (unlike what others have described). The air conditioner worked fine. The flat screen tv had good reception and ample channels (couldn't get HBO to work though). There was a complimentary bottle of spring water and two bags of chips. The free continental breakfast included cereal, danish, croissants, bagels, juice and coffee. It was fresh and plentiful. We asked for extra towels and pillows and they were immediately brought up to our room. The staff was helpful and very, very friendly and of course the location was perfect. We were within walking distance of Port Authority and right in the middle of the theater district. The price for our midweek stay was under $200 night and booked directly through the hotel. If you can handle the small size of the room then this is the place to stay.

Stayed here for a week with my girlfriend in April.On the plus side:The location was fanastic - you're a 3 minute walk from Times Square, right by the Subway and generally right in the heart of the tourist zone. The place is completely safe and clean. Breakfast was really good. I was at first disappointed not to see a toaster for the bagels, but it turned out they were so good you could just eat them untoasted. Despite reading about complaints on here, the lift was perfectly ok (by British standards).On the down side was the NOISE. Oh-my-god was it loud. We arrived on a Saturday night and the sound from the street in our 3rd floor room (people shouting, car horns honking every 2 minutes, and then of course the fire department...) was pretty much unbearable for the first hour or so trying to get to sleep. Luckily we had some earplugs which we used from that moment on throughout our stay which meant we slept absolutely fine after that, but i wouldnt recommend this place to a light sleeper.Apart from that it was fine. The bed was comfy, and the pillows were fine, the shower was hot and the TV worked.Of course the room was laughably small as described by everyone else on here but we were ready for that so it didnt bother us at all.Overall for the price of the room (and some earplugs), given the amazing location it was a bargain and I'd probably stay again.

If location is your only prerogative then yes, this hotel will meet your expectations, however if you are also interested in things like you know hot water, a chair to sit down on at breakfast, a quiet night's sleep - DO NOT book at Econo Lodge Times Square. During our short stay there we have heard so many people complaining about the water temperature (one guy was actually yelling at the concierge, that's how frustrated he was). The rooms are tiny, tiny - two people cannot pass by the beds when walking side by side. There were many front desk people that we've encountered during our stay there - some better than others. The good ones gave us tips on where to go to eat, brought more food when the continental breakfast area started emptying. In any case, if you have time to spare look around some more for other options before booking with this hotel.

If you're not looking for anything fancy, this really is a great hotel at a great price. My 13-year old daughter and I stayed for 3 nights, and I'd highly recommend it. The location couldn't be better - close to everything. We always felt safe, even though it was just the two of us, even while walking back to the hotel at night from a nearby Broadway show one night and from Top of the Rock another. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was really good, and two of the three mornings we stayed, there was someone in the lobby standing by to make sure everything was stocked and that guests had everything they needed. Sure, the place is small, but so are most NYC hotels, and how much are you in the room other than when you're sleeping? The room was very clean, with ample space for the two of us and our luggage. A computer with internet access and printer was available in the lobby for a small fee, which was helpful since we were able to print our boarding passes for our return flight. The only negatives I can think of are that it's a bit noisy (lots of sirens since there's a nearby fire station), but hey, it's New York, right? Also, the elevator is old and not the fastest thing around, but was perfectly functional. Overall, a real value. We definitely would stay again

I booked this hotel because it was at such a great deal. I knew it would be small but I was OK with that because of the price. The room was just big enough to walk around the bed and became a bit cramped with two people. There wasn't really anywhere to store luggage and if you sat at the desk, your guest could not fit to walk by to the bathroom. I would recommend this room to someone who does not plan to stay in the room very much. The biggest problem that I had, is that I never got to take a warm shower. The boiler broke and they had sent people there every day to fix it. It would work at night but when you woke up, the shower would be ice cold. After 4 nights of dealing with the shower, I had to cancel the final 3 nights of the reservation. There were a couple of other issues that are notable. The TV only had about 20 channels and three of those were Bravo, some did not have sound and a couple of the channels like HBO were on the same freeze frame. Also, the room did not have a thermostat so you could not control the heat. There was a widow AC unit. Also, if you plan on sleeping in late, I would not recommend this hotel because the windows are not sound proofed. The traffic noise begins around 7 AM each day. On a positive note, the room was very clean and the staff was nice. The check in and checkout process was not very long. On this trip, I changed my reservation to Hilton Garden Inn, which is about a block and a half away and I would recommend this hotel instead of the Econo Lodge. The room is at least 2 1/2 times larger, the widows are sound proofed, the room has a fridge and microwave and there's more furniture and closets to store your clothes and luggage. There's an ice machine on each floor and they have several fast elevators unlike the Econo Lodge. The staff let us check in before 11 AM even though the reservation was at 3PM. I got this room cheaper than the Econo Lodge on CheapTickets only because we booked it the day of. When researching this trip, the Hilton was about $30 more expensive a night but worth it.

My daughter and I just got back and will stay here when we go back to NYC! Inexpensive (got it for $159 on the hotel website), near everything, friendly staff, free breakfast, free USA Today at your door in the morning, room service response in 2 minutes, nice hard water pressure in shower, free chips and water in the room.........I could go on. The hotel is about 2 blocks off the bright lights and bustle of Times Square, but it was actually a quiet little residential area without a lot of outside noise. Breakfast was great : coffee, juice, tea, cocoa, oatmeal, croissants, bagels with cream cheese or jellies, danishes, muffins, cereals -- lots to pick from. No, there are not tables to eat at, we just brought the stuff back up to our room. They give you discount coupons for a great restaurant around the corner on Restaurant Row when you check in. The bed was comfortable. Yes, the room is tiny, but my daughter and I walked around in it just fine. What are you doing in your hotel room anyway, cartwheels?? Subway is a couple of blocks up and there are tons of restaurants all around. 24-hr Pharmacy right next door, just in case. The only thing negative that happened to us was no hot water one morning. We went out and about and did a few touristy things, came back 2 hours later and it was all fixed. Plus, there are many reviews that mention a slow elevator - we did not think so at all. Clean, comfy, good area (felt totally safe walking at night), good price. Thanks Econolodge!!

My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights at the Econo Lodge and it was by far the most for our money - and in NYC, you will need the extra money! The room was SMALL (10x10!) but the bed was big and very comfortable, and they made good use of the space. There was a small desk where we were able to store snacks that we brought. The TV was mounted on the wall, but easily viewed from the bed. There was a small armoire (we stored our luggage on top of it) with a few hangers and 2 drawers, and the safe was digital and free to use. There was a shelf above the sink in the bathroom to store cosmetics, and the shower was average-sized. The hotel was VERY clean! Our bed was made and our bathroom was cleaned and restocked every day. The free breakfast was also great - bagels, pastries, coffee, juice, oatmeal, hot chocolate, and fruit. However, there was no microwave or toaster. The staff was extremely pleasant. When we arrived, we found out that they charge to hold luggage - $3 per bag. They told us our room would probably be ready in an hour - so we decided to wait in the lobby - and our room was ready in 20 minutes! The elevator was slow, but they were doing maintenance on it when we left! The location couldn't be better! The only semi-negative thing I can say is that there is an Irish Pub/Bar directly across from the hotel and you can hear people all night (as well as traffic and sirens from the busy street around the corner) -- but, that's all part of the true NYC experience! I felt very safe and will definitely stay here again - the value can't be beat (AND you get breakfast!). However, I would recommend that only 1-2 people share a room. Have fun!

We booked this hotel based on the positive Trip Advisor contributions.Everyone says that the location is FAB - and it is. It's only 2 blocks from Times Square; across the road you book Gray Line tours; it's just uptown from the Port Authority Bus Terminal. It's local to all theatres which was important to us as we were 2 women who wanted to see some shows and feel safe walking back to our hotel. It's in a safe area.Everyone says that the rooms are small - and they are. We took the advice of a previous contributor and booked a disabled room. I think it was a little larger but not by much.The hotel staff are helpful and friendly and the breakfast was always well supplied and topped up. We left one morning for a tour at 6am and breakfast was already available - although they did inform us the it opened at 7am.We were able to leave our luggage with them - $3 a bag - on the day of our departure as we had an evening flight.On the downside, we did find it to be in a noisy location. There were sirens all through the night; the pub opposite seemed to have a lot of very noisy patrons who always left in a loud manner; people came up the street with their stereo on full volume all night long. There was no way of blocking the sound as we were there when it was cold so putting on the noisy air con was not an option. I suggest ear plugs if you want a good nights sleep. By night 4, we were so tired that sleeping was easy even with the noise.We were very impressed with New Yorkers who we found to be approachable and helpful - not what we expected at all. The subways were very clean and we always felt safe. Unlike London subways which are hot and dirty all day long.I'd recommend this because it's a safe location for a reasonable price.

The staff were friendly and the location fab!Although the rooms are on the smaller side the bed was very comfortable and it was exceptionally clean and tidy. The maids came in every day.If you are looking for a budget place to stay in NYC then this is it....I mean why pay hundreds for your hotel room when there is so much to do in NY!Leone & Ryan - London

First off we want to say that the reviews were wonderful and instrumental in our choosing these accommodations. As a result, there were no negative "surprises". We were only in the city for one night and the accommodations were not our primary focus. We attended two Broadway shows and wanted a place that was convenient to the Theater district, the Port Authority (since we were coming in from the Poconos by bus) and reasonably priced.Hotels and Discounts also offered a special discount which was an added plus! We arrived in the city about 1pm-----------the check-in was for 3pm. Fully expecting to just check our bag before the show---we stopped by the Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised that the gracious staff allowed us to check-in early (avoiding the customary bag check fee)!! Had enough time to stash our things in the room and proceed to the show. The room was TINY, but we fully expected that (do not stay here if you are claustrophobic!). It was comfortable and clean-----loved the magnifying mirror in the bathroom!!!! Perfect for applying makeup.The following morning we had to be at a TV studio----left around 5:45am and were surprised to see that the continental breakfast was already available----------we thought for sure we'd miss it! We would recommend this hotel and would stay there again on a short term basis. Color us Happy Campers!!!

Just returned from a two night stay at Econo Lodge Times Square. Most of the reviews you read here are dead on. The hotel is really clean and the location is perfect for exploring NY. The hotel offers free bottled water and the continental breakfast has an above-average selection (bagels, muffins, danish, cereal, coffee, juice, etc.). The cons are a VERY small room and a VERY slow elevator. Hey, it is the ECONO lodge, what do you expect? For us, the hotel was well worth the $145 a night and the pros far outweighed the cons.

Econo Lodge is in a fantastic location for exploring New York. Just 2 blocks from Times Square and a short walk from Rockerfeller Centre with hundreds of great restaurants within easy reach - you couldn't ask for a better location.However, the rooms are very small - the double bed all but filled it - so not much room for luggage, etc. Nevertheless, the bed was comfortable, there was a small wardrobe and desk in each room and a compact but functional bathroom with a good shower. Despite the location, noise wasn't a problem for us. We just kept the window shut and turned on the air con unit when the room got too hot at night (being March, this was as a result of the heating from the hotel, rather than the weather!)The rooms and corridors are kept clean and tidy, and a range of bagels, croissants, fruit, etc are served as the complementary breakfast, although there's no breakfast room, as such - just a few chairs in the lobby area. Having said that, there was always somewhere to sit while we were there.The staff was helpful and friendly and available round the clock. There's also internet access available in the lobby and somewhere to store your luggage for a few dollars on the day you check out.The only problem was that the lift is very slow, and occasionally ground to a halt with more than 4 passengers. Not good for those prone to claustrophobia! All in all a good little hotel in a fabulous location...and, after all, you won't be spending much time in your hotel room, will you?For the price, you'll struggle to find better in such a prime location.

We have spend a lovely holliday in the lodge. The people were very nice. The breakfast ok and we enjoyed the coffeemaker in the lounge. The room was small, But it was very clean and everything we needed was there.Thanks a lot for a very nice holliday.Greetings from the Netherlands.

We just returned back to Scandinavia from this hotel. We stayed 5 nights in this adorable hotel. The hotels is average quality for Europeans and was a lot of better than I expected. The room is not that small as I expected, it is bigger than a cruise ship room. We had a room from the fourth floor. The hotel included free wireless internet (which worked pretty good), bag of snacks and local paper. The hotel has a great location, specially for tourists. The hotel was super clean.Only bad thing in this hotel was that sometimes in breakfeast table, there was nothing left anymore (eveh there should have been) and also the firestation across the street.(which can be pretty loud). We at least woke up at 5 am couple of times, because the firetrucks tend to use their loud horns instead of sirens, but hey, that is New York - bring your earplugs or headphones! Also that it got a bit cold sometimes in this hotel in March and they did not really have a "real blanket" so you have to sleep in a bit warmer clothes. Don't understand me wrong, those are only little things. When you want to visit New York and pay less for the hotel, you should book the hotel from Econo Lodge. Almost every hotel with 50-100 USD / fare / per day are around the same quality than this hotel. So don't bother to look better one :) I did that already for you.

We stayed for three days before leaving on a cruise. The room was small, but very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is great. We were able to walk or take a bus/subway to anywhere we wanted to go. The breakfast was good with enough of everything to get you started on your day.

ABSOLUTELY LOVED THIS HOTEL!! If you are having any doubts about staying here, dont have. It is a really good hotel for the price, excellent staff and fantastic location. Only one block from times square, and your on the street right next to all the major broadway shows!! starbucks is just across the street, 24hr pharmacy beside where you can get anything you need. Cant beat the location. I had to check into this hotel because the accomodation i had previously booked wasnt suitable. Although this hotel was very popular and almost all full, the staff found me a room and even gave me a room on the top floor (floor 6) when i requested it. They were all incredibly helpful and friendly. The hotel is very clean and beautifully decorated. There is 24hr complimentary tea and coffee at reception, and a gorgeous continential breakfast in the morning. 24hr internet access also available. The only negative side would be that the rooms are very tight, but u get what u pay for, and they were very clean!! The bathrooms are the same. There is also a safe in your room and a T.V. which shows around 30 channels, and you get complimentary crisps and bottled water in your room when you arrive. Also, in your room information book you get a 10% discount voucher for the gift shop right next door, which is great as the prices are already very good! As a young, single traveller i felt very safe here, and would definately stay again.

Yes I did. Or so I thought. Well I'm here to give you the stright up truth. No candy coating here.We arrived on a Friday night around midnight and had no trouble getting checked in to room 508. But, thre was one problem at check in. They couldn't give us our room key! The card reader was down and was supposed to be fixed the next day. OK, no problem. Got to our room. Yes, the elevator takes forever like everyone has stated. You could honestly walk up faster. The room is postage stamp size. Actually a similar size to a small cruise ship room. Barely enough room to go around the bed sideways. I'm not kidding. Oh well, knew that coming in too. Friend of mine in NY said that if your door doesn't hit your bed when you come in the room then you have a big room. LOL! But here's where I draw the line. So, it's around 1am and the wife & I turn down the sheets only to find the most horrible stains ever! Disgusting. So we had to sleep on top of the bed sheets since we were really tired and already showered.Next AM, told front desk and they changed them right away for us and gave us a discount card to a restaurant (we never went). Still no keys available. Also, window unit sounded like it was powered by hamsters. Too loud, had to shut off.Saturday night keys became available! But when we came back to the room Sunday we were locked out. Oh yeah, they forgot to tell us that everyday you have to have the room card rekeyed. No big deal if not for the turtle of an elevator they have.And then Sunday night got into the elevator with 3 other couples and got stuck in there for 10 minutes. Won't go up and won't open. Had to use emergency button and then it opened. Funniest thing was girl at counter who said "Oh you're all back down". LOL! No we never left! Hey for the $129 a night we paid I got what I expected. A bagel and coffee in the AM, a room I'd be livid with anywhere else but NYC, a great location, & a friendly staff. So I give it mixed reviews.Don't come expecting the Ritz. But if you just need a place to lay your head, take a shower, etc. then it's great. By the way, don't plan on bringing a lot of luggage. You won't have room to put it anywhere. Dos - Try Brazil Brazil restaurant, Beer House, go to Top of the Rock at night, see Wicked Don'ts - eat at Roxy Deli - very overrated, $47 for meat loaf sandwich and small pizza only, worry about safety - cops everywhere all the time, worry if you left something at home - drug store on the cornerHave fun in NYC!

I stayed here for 5 nights while in NY with friends. I was the only one who chose to stay here and I think I made the wisest choice. We all stayed in the Times Square area and the EconoLodge was one of the least expensive hotels. I found it to be clean, adequate, well located, and a good deal. Although the room was very small it was very clean; the TV and wireless worked well. I liked that there was a safe in the room. The continental breakfast was mostly grocery store bought pastries but the coffee, tea and fruit were good for getting out and about in the morning. I found the staff to be friendly and informative. Cabs were easy to get. I saw some other hotels rooms priced about the same and although they were larger the amenities I wanted (wireless, safe, breakfast) were missing. There was something funky going on with the hallwasy while I was there- wires and pipes sticking out in odd places.

Nothing new to add on the size - rooms are minuscule. Nothing in Times Square comes close to this value, however. Be aware it is not plush at all - it's the kind of place with worn wallpaper, where hallway door slams reach your room and you hear sirens and street noise all night long (get as high a floor as possible). That said, who goes to NYC to stay in their room, so we will stay again. Bring earplugs and enjoy the city while saving money.

I spent 5 nights at the Econolodge during a busy Canada day/4th of July week, and was left with a good impression all-around for what the hotel was. Given that it's in New York and rooms are typically small and over-priced, this hotel was quite impressive and most certainly a good value. Small room?......yes, but passable. Definitely not over priced (I recall paying $171 plus tax). And very much clean and well-maintained.The staff were friendly and efficient during check-in/out, the hotel was in excellent repair and well presented.The elevator was slow....but given the age of the building and that it's in NY, it was passable.Aside from being small, the room was good...... clean, nice beds, plasma TV, good A/C, well-lit, etc.The continental breakfast consisted of muffins, cereal, toast, and juice (which was good, but in short supply....so I'd recommend going down to the lobby early).All in all, the hotel was an excellent value and had a great location. It's no Ritz Carleton or Crowne Plaza, but certainly above-average for the price and location. We are actually going to be staying there again for 5 or 6 nights this June, in fact.

My sister and I took a spur of the moment trip to NYC in May and stayed here. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to transportation, Times Square and restaurants and shops. The staff was friendly and helpful, continental breakfast was great, the room was clean. The only downside was the tiny, tiny room. But, you can't beat the price.

The econolodge provides free wi-fi internet access, free continental breakfast. The room was very clean. The only downside was that the room was only about 8ft. by 8ft. so it mad it difficult with the luggage, however there was a luggage stand that made it more convenient. The shower worked perfectly and had very good pressure, i actually liked it better than my shower at home. The hotel is only a minute away from time square if you walk. There is a subway station only 5 minutes walk. I nice hotel especially for the price. Maybe the only hotel this cheap that offers continental breakfast and a clean private room with bathroom.

My sister and I visited New York last week to see all the Christmas Decorations. After much research we chose this hotel basically because of the price, but it turned out to be the best location and the friendliest staff. The room was a bit small but very clean. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Room looked exactly as seen on this site, so don't be suprised by how TINY the room is, it is very, very small. It was myself and my mom, and we both could not walk in the room at the same time, despite the tiny space, the room and bathroom was immaculate, we even noticed our sheets were changed daily, you don't find that too often. The staff from the young lady that checked us in, to the housekeepers, to the young man that retrieved our bags on our last day, to the security man were all very pleasant, and all voiced their willingness to do what they could to make our stay special. The location is AWSOME! You are in walking distance to all of Times Square, 15 minute walk to Central Park, 10 minute walk to Rockerfellar Center, and 5th Ave, and subway station 5 minute walk. The only draw back was we visited with temps outside around 28 degrees, even colder with wind chill, and although we welcomed a warm room, being a small space, it became too hot and stuffy most nights, as we were unable to control our own heat. Would definitely stay again.

This was our first time in New York and I was quiet happy with the choice of Econo Lodge. We stayed in a handicap room so we had alittle more room but a double bed. Location, staff and cleaniness of the room was all great just as previous reviews. The elevator was alittle slow. Only problem was outside noise when trying to sleep but if want the location you will have to put up with it. Will stay again

We had a wonderful weekend in NYC and enjoyed our stay at Econo Lodge very much. We arrived earlier than expected and hoped they would just hold our bags for us, but they told us that if we could wait 15 minutes they would have our room ready and they did. The staff was very helpful with our many tourist questions and directions. The location was fine for walking to our Broadway Show (we saw The Color Purple and it was GREAT!) There are good places to eat and buy souveniers right next door. We really liked Carve (across the street on 8th) they have good pizza, sandwiches and desserts at really good prices. I'm not a big fan of continental breakfasts and Carve had a great breakfast sandwich for around $3. We knew about the small rooms from the reviews on this website, so we were prepared for that and it wasn't a big deal. We had 3 people in our room and it was tight, but we were only there to sleep and shower. We are very grateful to the staff for holding our luggage for us on our last day. We checked out on a Saturday morning to go to Connecticut to visit family and when we came back to the city the next day we had nowhere to store our bags. One quick call to the Econo Lodge and our problem was solved. They held the bags for us all day for $3 per bag. We will definitely be back!

Very small room, but 1 block from Time Square. Very, very clean and the shower pressure was great. For a 1 or two night stay with no more then two people, I would do it again. Staff was very nice. Just a perfect location!

I've read reviews of this hotel before and the overall comment was that they are small rooms....let me say they are VERY small rooms. But they are clean, and the water pressure is great. The elevators are slow though. The breakfast is adequate. The location is AWESOME! And the staff is super friendly. It's right near a drug store too! And not far from the subway - and across the street from Greyline. Honestly, although the rooms are VERY small (no closet - but a dresser where you can hang things, and an ironing board), the beds are comfy. Oh, there are window air conditioning units. And the street noises can be a bit loud at times. Here's the deal....if you are looking for a reasonable hotel rate in NYC and don't plan on hanging in your room, this is the place for you! (and I'm a picky hotel person!)

Stayed there on Oct. 4th:Pros:Very Nice StaffLocation, location, location, locationNice PriceClean roomsGood continental breakfastCoffee 24 hours per daycomfortable bedsCons:Postage stamp size roomsvery slow elevator
user_name:
Kayak126
North of Block Island Sound

review_body: Having stayed close to Times Square last year this was a perfect choice in terms of location, just 2 blocks from Times Square. I found the hotel to be modern, clean and comfortable. The room facilities were in good working order. Not denying the rooms are small - but your never in. Breakfast was a bonus with a good selection including cereals, pastries, bagels - cream cheese or jams, fruit juices. Coffee and tea was also available all day. The best thing about this hotel was the service received from the staff on reception. They were so friendly and helpful, nothing was a problem. They enquired various times on line to answer our queries and suggested various eateries, bars and ways to get around. I would and have recommended this hotel to many people. Value for money was superb compaired to alot in NYC also. Location location location.......Thanks for a superb stay - Lynda and Diane

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Econolodge Times Square last September for 3 nights. We loved the location ... it was less than a 5 minute walk to everything. (i.e Times Square, TKTS, broadway theatres, Restaurant row) .. the subway is a short walk away ... the hotel is located on 47th st. just north of 8th Ave ... times square is on 7th ave.. so the location is PERFECT. It isnt too loud at all ... the rooms are quite small .. very tight and no room to walk around, just enough for the bed, a small desk, and the washroom .. but it didnt matter .. cuz we werent there for the room ... its clean and upgraded so its great. The free continental breakfast was really good and really saved us some money ... which helped with the more expensive dinners and bar (Blue Fin in Times Square) we went to. We watched Hairspray and Beauty and the Beast ... both wonderful!). Shopping is great and subway pretty easy to use. I also went to NYC a few months earlier and stayed somewhere else (on 10th Ave.) and the room was alot bigger, but further away from the action. Anyway, we love it there and are going again this October for 2 nights and we staying at the Econolodge again. I will post photos on my next review. I can't wait. I love NYC!

Unbelievably loud because of bad window/AC design. The window is open to accommodate the AC unit, and cardboards are placed around the AC unit so wind doesn't blow into the room. Needless to say, cardboards do not filter noise, so the experience is as if you were literally on the street. This is pretty outrageous considering the hotel is located on Times Square, which is pretty noisy day in, day out. It is even more outrageous considering that there is a bar right across the street that plays jazz till 4AM. I called the hotel staff to complain, and they told me that it was normal, and that I should live with it. If I didn't have earplugs, I wouldn't have slept at all.Secondly, the bed sheets had big black stains on them, which I realized when I was about to go to sleep. When I complained about this to the hotel staff, they sent someone that handed me new sheets. The new sheets had the same stains, and that person told me that there was no housecleaning service at night and that I was supposed to replace the bedding myself. He left, and while replacing the bedding I realized that the new sheets he gave me were in fact small for my bed! I was too tired to complain again.In summary, I went there because of the good reviews, only to be very disappointed. I will not go there again.

We'd seen the reviews which mentioned the small rooms, and small our room was. However we had everything we needed! and as somebody else said, we hadn't gone to New York to stay in our room. The room was clean and tidy and everything worked. Breakfast was better than we anticipated, held in the small lobby. Staff were very helpful and friendly, and the location of the hotel is excellent. We would happily stay there again, and the next time we visit New York we probably will. Good value for money!

Thanks to everyone for posting the prior information. Here is my information to help future guests:A 24-Hour Drug store is across the street (get a store card for extra savings). Try the fresh fruit cart stand on the corner. We enjoyed having fruit for snacks.We had two rooms for our family of four but I still had to go to the lobby to enjoy my laptop since the rooms are so small – Tiny Rooms! But, the staff was very helpful.We saw 2 plays (Color Purple & Forbidden Broadway). The Theater that showed Forbidden Broadway was right next door to our hotel. I talked to a theater employee just before the show and got discount tickets. We decided not to pay $600 for the four of us to see the Lion King. Our only regret was that we did not eat at any of the restaurants at restaurant row on 46th Street (directly around the corner). We eat at the major restaurants with the higher NYC prices for same food that we could have had at home. Again, we should have tried something different since we were already paying higher prices for food in NYC.
A great location! A very small hotel, with very small rooms, but you don't go to NYC to spend time in your room!

We really enjoyed out stay at the Econo Lodge. It was the perfect location to do all of the tourist-y type things in NYC. Yes, the room was small - but it was cozy, clean, cool and comfortable. We were literally only there to sleep and we zonked out each night! Great water pressure in the shower, the breakfast was a great way to start off the day and the front desk service was fast, courteous and knowledgeable. Don't miss all of the great restaurants on 46th - known as Restaurant Row. Much better than the chains you find in Times Square. If I were going to do all of the tourist-y things again in NYC - I would stay here again in a HEARTBEAT. However, if you are looking for more of a true NYC living experience - spend more for a place in SoHo or Greenwich.

Yes, rooms are small but cozy for 2 people. Clean comfortable and updated. The 'white' noise of the air conditioner drowns out most of the street noise, so I didn't find that a problem. Temperature was easily controlled. And the best part, close to theatres. Easily within walking distances of many attractions and restaurants. Suffice to say, how nice is it to be able to walk back to your hotel room and rest for a bit before continuing the day. The staff friendly, and helpful. Breakfast was nice but with so many unique eateries close by, why bother? But it's nice to be able to grab a coffee/orange juice though. Coffee 24/7. Starbucks in right across the street. Free Wi-Fi is a nice touch also, daily charges for wifi add up quickly. There is 1 stand for a suitcase, so my suitcase had to stay on the floor. Really, there's not room for 2 suitcases. But I didn't mind, better the wife to be happy and for all you couples you know what I mean. Flat screen TV is nice, tucked above and out of the way. But if you travel to NYC, who watches TV anyway (oh wait, weather channel). Armoire is small, so make sure most of your clothes are folded as not to wrinkled. But there is an abbreviated ironing board and iron, nice touch. Overall, I would stay here again. Good price, great location, friendly staff. Easy to access subways, buses, bicycle taxis, taxis. Elevator, bring a book to read. Slow. I was on the 5th floor. But walking stairs is great exercise so not a problem. Bathroom is akin to an average house hallway full bath, not large but not overty tiny.

Yes, this room was small, but you are not in the room very much. We had an excellent stay here. The room and hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly. Just one block away from Time Square,which makes it very convenient. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we would have no problem staying here again.

I quite liked my stay at the Econo Lodge Times Square, especially since affordable rooms were hard to find for the week I was in NYC. But I wouldn't stay here with someone else. The rooms are tiny -- perfect for a solo traveler who's not planning to spend oodles of time in the hotel, but it seems to me it would be unbearable with two people in the room.My room was spotless, the bed was comfy, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect for a tourist -- close to subways, a 24-hour Duane Reade, and of course, a Starbucks.  And blessedly, the air conditioning worked perfectly!I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, unless I was looking for a room for two.

Stayed here during this past Memorial Day Weekend. Hotel is well characterized in previous reviews. The staff is very friendly and courteous. Location is excellent, especially for the price. Well within walking distance of Times Square and subway stations. Did not see anything wrong with the particular block on which the hotel is located. Fire station adjacent to the property was a little noisy, but not terrible.Room was very small, but this was expected after reading previous reviews. Likewise, the elevator is painfully slow. Notwithstanding, the hotel appeared clean, as did our room. Staff responded quickly to requests i.e. for extra towels. Free breakfast was minimal, but decent enough to where it seemed a better option than going out and spending $20 at the nearby bakery on 8th Avenue.Liked the analogy of the room being a bit larger than that found on a cruise ship. However, like a cruise ship, when in New York you really spend minimal time in your hotel room anyway. Therefore, for the price, this hotel offers a great way for budget travelers to experience the sights and sounds of Uptown Manhattan.

If you look at a photo of a room online, remember: the camera always adds ten pounds! This room is literally the size of the bed plus a foot on each side and nine inches at the foot of the bed. There is no closet, only a cupboard barely large enough for children's clothes. No room for large luggage. You have to stand right by the door to get dressed because it's the only spot where you can actually turn around while standing. My husband and I had to take turns stepping away to let the other pass to move anywhere. Yes, it's clean. Yes, the staff is nice. Yes, it's a block from Times Square. But, unless you're 1) alone, 2) with no hanging clothes or sizeable luggage, and 3) VERY thin, this may not be the place for you!

I have stayed at the Econo Lodge twice in the last couple of months.It offers clean, safe lodging, in a location central to the theatre district and many NYC sights. Several subway lines are within easy walking distance. The rooms indeed are very tiny, even by New York standards. However, the rooms I've had have been very clean, and the furnishings and TV were newer and in good repair. The front desk staff have been super friendly and helpful. Both times I was able to get an early check-in with only a short wait. Water and snacks (smallbags of chips) are provided in the rooms and I was offered free replacements upon request. The continental breakfast is served in a small area in the small lobby, but the selections covered all the basics and included some really good pastries. Wireless internet is free, generally available, but sometimes very low speed. All in all, a good choice for those wanting safe, clean, central accomodations at a reasonable price for New York.

I just returned from 2 nights at the Econolodge Times Square and read all of the comments about this hotel (good and bad). I must say they are all pretty accurate from the small rooms to slow elevator to friendly desk staff, etc. The comments about the scary bar across the street and bad area at night are not true. Both were perfectly fine.I stayed here for the price and that is what you'll need to keep in mind during your stay. The bed and the bathroom were clean (the carpet wasn't so nice), but they weren't luxurious by any means.This is truly a room you sleep and shower in and then leave (especially if there are two of you).And yes, Times Square and most of the theaters are only a block away. The hotel is at 47th and there are subway stops at 50th and 42nd.Lastly, we didn't know it till the last day of our stay, but 46th street one block down is called "Restaurant Row" (on the street sign). It's filled with the most amazing restaurants--if you like food you should go there. Go to --- to check it out!!I'd stay here again, but only for the price. If I could get something better for the same rate I take it.

This hotel is situated only 1 1/2 blocks from Times Square...what a perfect location. ...and close to the subways in two directions. Please note that all hotel rooms (sans the $500.00 ones) in New York City are small and this is no exception. Nevertheless, the room was spotlessly clean (only 2 years old we think), had a plasma TV, USA Today paper delivered daily, and included a free breakfast. The breakfast was a stepped up continental: cereal, local fresh made bagels and butter croissants (not the stale packaged ones), other pastry delights, hot cereal, and fruit. PLus, the fruit (nice afternoon snack), coffee, & tea were there 24 hrs a day. What distinguished this property from other NYC hotels is that the hotel staff went overboard to assist: bottled water whenever we needed it at no charge, directions, etc. All in all, we enjoyed our stay due to the friendliness and price of this hotel. We recommend it without reservations after reading about other NYC hotels with rats, bedbugs, etc. We didn't even see one bug!

I stayed at this hotel March 2nd-9th 2007. This hotel is a really great location to stay at if you are going to NYC to see Broadway shows and want to be close to the stores and action of Times Square. The area by this hotel is filled with convenient deli's, drugstores, gift shops and restaurants. True, there were a few peep show/adult video type stores in the area, but there were police always around and I never felt unsafe walking around at night alone. All in all, this area had a very "tourist friendly" feel to it, and there were always tons of people walking around. I saw several Broadway shows and enjoyed being able to easilly walk to each venue without needing a taxi. There was some construction work being done on a building across the street, but the noise was mostly during the day and was not obtrusive in any way. This hotel is located near to a fire station and the sirens, in a great "short blips" kind of siren way, were always a part of the sound ambience at all times. I slept great every night and the car and street noise was never a problem. The beds were very comfortable. About the rooms, true they are small. So, prepare yourself for a little laugh when you walk in, but you will see that these rooms are very well planned out, and they are very functional. The room I had was absolutely perfect for one, and would be a little tight for 2 people, but still very manageable. There is not much room for a lot of suitcases! There was one nice freestanding closet with a room safe in it. The bed took up most of the room but was very comfortable. The pillows were soo nice and very soft! The decor is upscale and the room was very, very clean. The flat screen tv, which is moveable and can be adjusted to be at just the right angle while flipping channels in bed, was a delight. There are many lamp options in the room too, so good lighting was a plus as well. The bathroom, although really small, had great water pressure and even the upscale amenity of a little vanity kit with cotton balls, q-tips and an emery board. The shampoo/conditioner and lotion were very nice Herbal Essence brand. The towels were very soft and smelled like fresh laundry. The only negative note I have about the bathroom was that if you like nice lathering or scented soap, bring your own! The bars they provide are wafer thin, not very scented, and so dry they break in half if you drop them. There was a nice adjustable and reversible magnifying and regular mirror. The snack bag of chips, two mints, and bottled water provided every day were perfect for a snack on the go. The breakfast is very nice and I recommend using the tray from your room to carry items back to your room to eat. The croissants were huge and the muffins delicious. This was a really nice bonus to have breakfast provided since everything is really pricey in NYC. Breakfast was available from 7am til 10am. It was a nice security feature that they re-keyed the door keys every day too. There was an atm in the (small) lobby and a computer for online access (for a fee). The Duane-Reade drugstore right across the street has everything you could ever want in case you forget anything. The was a bit of a downside not having a mini fridge in the room, that would have been convenient. Anyway, this hotel was the perfect location for seeing Broadway plays and for roaming very reasonable walking distances to Times Square and Midtown Manhattan. It feels safe, is in a good area surrounded by gift shops, bars, restaurants and cafes. I would definately stay here again.

After reading other reviews, I braced myself for the small room and it was as I expected it! However, the two of us quickly got over that and enjoyed our stay here. The room was very clean and was laid out well. The staff was efficient and friendly. One of the front desk staff even offered to walk over to 8th avenue to hail us a taxi after we told her of the problems we had getting one. During our 4 day & 3 night stay we never had a problem with the elevator as it came promptly. The complimentary breakfast was awesome with nice and ample choices of bagels, pound cake, fruit, juices, coffee & tea. I highly recommend this hotel for up to 2 people per room who will be doing a bunch of out-of-room activities! You won't be disappointed.

this place was great. Whether you're a tourist looking to see the whole city or just there for a night in manhattan, it's a great hotel to stay at. the rooms are really small, but very tidy. The location is amazing, centrally located and right next to times square! the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. i would definitely stay there again.

This place was wonderful! The staff went out of the way to help us. My Father is in a wheelchair and its hard for him to get around, but the staff was so considerate and helpful for us. Anything we needed they did. We stayed 4 nights, and not one night do I have anything negative to say!I've been all over the United States and have never felt so pleased. Yes, the rooms were small, but what are you looking for?? your home?? not going to happen. It's located near everything you could ever want to see or need. Thank You to the staff!!

This hotel was wonderful.... great location great location and clean clean clean.. the staff were more than helpful with directions etc. I would highly recommend this hotel, price is great and the hotel is very clean.. I don't think you'll find a better bargain in this city... I will be back.. only drawback the rooms are very small as stated..not much room to move, however, we spent all out time on the streets, it was perfect for us..

Great location, fantastic staff, tons of amenities....I hope it stays like this at the same great rate! If so, we will definitely stay at this hotel whenever we go to Manhattan. The room was small and cozy, there was always a Free bottled water and bag of chips waiting in our room, Free wi-fi (although the connection is a bit weak, but it costs nothing so what can you say). We arrived on a Saturday and stayed until Monday. We saw different staff and they were all extremely friendly and helpful. The FREE continental breakfast was fresh and very tasty...which is rare for most continental breakfasts. The room was very neat and clean, maids were nice....the hotel has been completely renovated and is in wonderful condition.

I used to read the stories about other people’s nightmarish travel experiences with a certain amount of indifference, but after my recent stay at the Econo Lodge at Time Square in NYC, I’ve definitely developed a lot more compassion for those individuals.Through all of my travels and stays at hotels, I have never experienced such a complete disregard for customers and their needs, and the worse part it was that although I’d tried to reach the manager of the hotel, Ronica, throughout my stay, each time, I was given a response that she hadn’t arrived at work (this being 10:00am on Friday morning) or that she’d already left (at 4:30pm on the same day), and when I’d asked whether she would be in during the weekend, the receptionist only responded by telling me that “She doesn’t really have a fixed schedule.”

Stayed for 2 nights in queen room on 2nd floor. Very tiny but tolerable. Half the size of a cruise ship cabin and then add a bathroom. Location is awesome, price was great ($115 per night). Property is super clean. Breakfast is grab and go but fresh and free. Downside- the room was like a sauna. We had the window open and the air conditioner on. Asked front desk to turn down heat (you cannot control it from your room) never seemed to happen. You would think in March "too hot" wouldn't be an issue. Friends had corner room with 2 doubles, a bit more room and cooler due to three windows. Not recommended for menopausal women!!!! Everyone else should do ok.

This is one of the best values in New York for the budget conscious. You can't beat the location, and the staff is unusually friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean, but the rooms are laughably small. The queen size bed took up my entire room. The staff seems to be quite security conscious, which is a good thing in NYC. I regularly travel to New York to see theater, and this is my new favorite hotel.

This is a great place for someone visiting New York and just looking for a bed and shower (because that is basically all it is). As many reviews pointed out the rooms are VERY small. My husband and I wanted to stretch after a jog and had to take turns due to lack of space. However, we paid $116 per night with AAA discount and were very happy with what we got. The room was clean (including the bathroom), looked recently updated, and functional. There was a free continental breakfast which was sparse, but we were able to save time by grabbing some oatmeal in the lobby in the morning. Very quick walk to Times Square, Broadway theaters, and loads of restaurants. Highly recommended for New York travelers on a budget.

This hotel was recently gutted and re-done from top to bottom, including granite check-in desk. Every piece of furniture, etc. is brand new. Our room was tiny but beautifully appointed. It is located one block from Times Square with a theater right next door (not connected, construction wise). They serve a fresh continental breakfast and coffee daily (7 days). When your room is cleaned, etc., they leave you bottled water and a little snack. The employees were very nice and couldn't do enough for us. We will definitely return to this hotel!

This hotel is excellent value for money with a continental buffet style breakfast included in the price - great for starting out in the morning. Tea, fresh coffee and hot drinks are provided in reception 24 hours a day.Reception staff at the hotel were excellent, extremely friendly and helpful. As pointed out in other reviews the hotel rooms really are TINY! This isn't too much of a problem on a short stay as we spent very little time in our room. We stayed four nights and as we acquired goodies from various shopping trips space became a bit tight , but we managed.The bathroom is again small, if you are of large stature you will struggle! Nevertheless it was very clean with fresh towels and toiletries provided daily. The shower was powerful with plenty of hot water available. The location of the hotel is fantastic and we found we could walk to most places of interest , Times Square, Rockerfeller Centre, Theatre District, Maceys, Empire State, Madison Square Gardens, Central Park. As others have mentioned this location comes at a price! It is very noisy at night with sirens and car horns being sounded well into the small hours so bring your earplugs or make sure you have a large night cap! There are a few negatives with this hotel however it is all about compromise. Yes it is noisy at night, yes the rooms are very small, however, the staff are friendly and helpful, the location is fantastic, for a hotel in the centre of everything the rates are very good! If you don't mind a bit of noise, can cope with a small room, want to be in the centre of everything but not pay a fortune this is the place for you. We had a great time and would stay here again.

My friend and I stayed here in October for two nights. Pros:- Cheap, by NYC standards- Location is good- Continental breakfast in the lobby is great for grabbing and running- Front desk staff were very nice- No bad experiences to report- Small armoire to hang clothes and small shelf in the bathroom for toiletries- Flat screen TV on wall works well to save space- A/C worked wellCons:- Room is the size of a shoebox. It's so tiny you just have to laugh- No room to walk around in room. Had to climb over the bed- Elevators slow and small- Had to pay to store bags for the afternoon upon checkoutI suppose I'd stay here again if it was just for the weekend.

Good budget hotel, compact & clean room with reasonable bathroom. Continental breakfast was included in the price.Location on corner of 8th Avenue and 47th Street is excellent for restaurants (can recommend Da Rosina - Italian, in 46th Street) and close to Broadway/Times Square etc.Just one thing - take your ear plugs, as rooms are noisy due to the traffic on 8th and New Yorkers love of their car horns.
Great Hotel! great location, rooms were clean, location was great, and the price was good taking into account the location.

I pride myself on finding values and i thought these reviews really showed that I can have a great stay on a budget. But unfortunately, the reality is that these reviews are okay but not the greatest, my experience was that although the space was fairly new, the place was SMALL, even for NYC hotels based on some other rooms I saw (I actually went to other area hotels, like the holiday inn and asked to see the rooms) I am not a big person, average at best, but it was like alice in wonderland, the beds must have been shortened or something, it was like they were a cross between twin and full size, also, there is no closet, no place to hang your stuff, the elevator could not fit my bags in one trip! The bathroom was okay, but no place to put my stuff. the maid service was okay although rushed and they dont do anything to floors, but l actually needed to walk over the bed to get to the other side since there was no room between the bed and the wall. The air conditioner was like spitting in the wind it was so small. location is okay, a little scary at night though, weird bar across the street and people always hounding you as you walk to the hotel entrance.

Okay, so i finally figured it - this place is a scam - I called the hotel up directly to book a weekend for my wife and I - we are huge econo lodge fans for staying in expensive places like the big apple - but this one needs to be checked out by the franchise - when i called to book the room they said they had a room for the weekend and quoted me a price - when i said i would check on-line - the price immediately dropped - so i checked while still on the phone and sure enough they had a room for about $85 less per night - when I kept on hounding the desk clerk - she said it was the same room but the owners told her to keep rooms a side so that they dont have to pay any franchise tax to the franchise - she offered to book me at the lower rate and told me that when i got their to even ask for a lower price if I paid cash - WHAT KINDA PLACE DOES THAT?

For our three-day vacation, my friend and I chose the Econo Lodge for its location near theaters. It was also convenient to the Port Authority Bus Terminal, one of the drop-off spots used by the Airport Shuttle from JFK (which I would highly recommend if you want to save $ by not getting a cab.) Pros of this hotel include:-A fair price for the theater area. We paid ~180 for a room with two doubles. This included a continental breakfast.-Location near theaters, the overrated restaurant row, and a block from a subway line-Pleasant, helpful desk staff- Clean accommodations with sufficient air conditioning-Breakfast with big NYC bagels, juices, coffee, pastries, and fruit that we took along in our daybags.Cons include:-A small room. I've seen worse, though. For two women, the bathroom storage was inconvenient. Hard to find a place to hang our towels.-A charge for baggage storage. I know this is common, but it would be a nice touch if it were included. When we arrived early afternoon - some rooms were ready, and some weren't. Because our double wasn't, we had to pay for bag storage, and we had to pay for it again on check out day, adding $12 to our bill. More inconvenient than the cost is the lack of a changing space or restroom for waiting guests. We felt a little uncomfortable unzipping our suitcases in the small lobby to get our necessities for sightseeing.-8th Avenue Atmosphere. I you haven't been to the Times Square vicinity before, know that 8th Avenue isn't as polished as Broadway. 8th is full of trinket shops and newsstands and lacks charm. We felt safe, and even went to a few bars near the hotel, but I would be a bit uncomfortable walking the area at night if I were traveling solo.-The Elevator! We took the stairs. Thankfully, we were on the 2nd floor.Consensus: Might be worth it if "Times Square on a budget" is your agenda. But also check into the Holiday Inn Express, Comfort Inn, Super 8, Hotel Edison, and Radio City Apartments. Next time, I I'll try staying in a upper or lower Manhattan and taking the train to see the shows.

We recently stayed at the Econo Lodge Times Square during the US Open. This is a bare bones kind of place, but nonetheless rooms were clean, staff was helpful and the hotel is just around the corner from a lot of good restaurants on 46th Street and also on 9th Ave. Also very closeby to the subway. Only drawback was the room was VERY tiny (the bathtub was about 3/4 the size of your standard tub), but you come to expect this with the budget hotels in Times Square. Fortunately, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, so this wasn't a problem for us.

We booked at this hotel because of the good reviews, but...when we arrived at 10:00 pm, we found the world's biggest cockroach (about 3") walking around the bathroom. The front desk sent someone up to remove it but there were no other rooms and it was too late to find another hotel so we spent the night but obviously didn't sleep. The hotel didn't offer a discount or even an apology. Also, the internet cables were too short to allow us to use the computer at the desk and the bed wasn't very comfortable. All this for $225/night. We moved to the Hilton Times Squarefor the rest of our vacation for only $50 more and couldn't be happier.

This hotel has a great central location, right near the heart of midtown Manhattan/Theater District. Many of the most significant tourist sites in NYC are within a 10-20 minute walk. Given the location, it would be very difficult to find anything less expensive with such accessability to so many places. I paid $125 per night (AAA rate), and that seems like a good deal, especially considering the other big-name hotels nearby charge 2 to 4 times more per night. The staff was friendly and helpful; they even let me use their computer to print out my airplane boarding pass. The continental breakfast was modest but tolerable (large muffins, 2 kinds of cereal, packets of instant oatmeal, bananas, apples, bagles, and juice). The room was tiny. I estimate that the room was not much larger than 100 square feet. The king-sized bed took up nearly all of the floor space. Even by NYC standards, this is quite small; however, I suppose that most people who stay here aren't coming to NY to spend a lot of time in a hotel room, so I will gladly sacrifice a little floor space for extra cash to spend out on the town. There was a nice LG flatscreen TV mounted to the wall; however, the lack of remote control made it inconvenient (had to climb across the bed and reach up to change the channel or volume). I did not notice the slowness of the elevator that others have complained about in other postings here; I even counted. From the time I pushed the button for my floor (2nd floor) to the time it reached the floor and opened the door was 9 seconds; perhaps it takes longer for the upper floors, but it wasn't bad at all for the 2nd floor.
